No. 18 is a carefully preserved anachronism, with colonialpaned windows, a heavy paneled door shutters, and the vestiges of an old Dutch roof, the sort of building you know was once a commercial countinghouse presided over by a Randolph or Smithers. The carefully hung sign over the firstfloor windows is in keeping with the building  embossed golden Roman block on flat blackthough the words jar slightly. Off Track Betting, they read. Howie goes inside.

title: PerAcre Value of Farmland Pondered
description: ALBANYIs an acre of farmland with apple trees more valuable than an acre cornfield?

title: In Washington, Avon's Calling In a Masculine Voice
description: WASHINGTON  That Avon representative is no lady. In Southeast Washington, that is, it could be Ralph P. Jones ringing the doorbell, a cheerful man with a jaunty cap who carries a blue plaid satchel.

title: Bill on Health Services Gaining
description: TRENTONWhen the bill was approved by the Assembly two weeks ago, it hardly stirred a ripple. There was no debate, no controversy, hardly any interest at all. And yet the measure, is one of the first important legislative sleepers to achieve initial approval in this year's session.

title: He's Still the Public's Best Enemy
description: ORDINARILY a museum retrospective devoted to the work of a movie actor is about as jolly as a monthlong browse through a lot of back issues of Silver Screen. No movie actor ever made'consistentl good films, and few actors were in any interesting degree better than their rotten films. At best retrospectives are sentimental tributes. At worst they're invitations to relive moments of a lost youth by associating with what might be described as adjacent dreams.

title: U.S. Youth Will Be Served
description: Two sailing projects have been announced that should interest youngsters greatly. One is the establishment the United States Youth Championship Regatta, and the other is the American Sail Training Association. The aim of the youth regatta is to stimulate interest in American youth in sailing competition, with the objective of selecting a representative for this year's world youth championships in Portugal, Aug. 1117. The sail training program would prepare young men and women for sailing vessels of all rigs and sizes, with the emphasis on classical schooners.

title: Carl Jakubecy Jr. to Wed Judith Miller
description: RUMSON, N. J., March 31 Mrs. Helen Miller has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Judith Katherine Miller, to Carl J. Jakubecy Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Jakubecy of Fairhaven.

title: Community of Indians Vanishes From China as Last 2 Men Leave
description: HONG KONG, March (Reuters)The Indian conurn nity's centuriesold presence China has come to an end wit the departure of the last two Indian nationals.

title: 7 LongFaced Panelists at the New School Talk About Social Change Through Humor
description: Social Change Through Humor sounds like a course at the New School for Social Research, but when seven panelists discussed it there last week, was it a laughing matter?

title: Butz Says Ceiling On Price of Meat May End This Fall
description: WASHINGTON, March, 31 (AP) The ceiling on meat prices imposed by President Nikon will probably be abolished by late summer or early fall and is not expected to be extended to cover other food products, the Secretary. of Agriculture, Dr. Earl L. Butz, said today.

title: Theater in Los An Ides
description: Los ANGELES.

title: What's Yet To Come
Norton, a 51 Underdog, Breaks Ali's Jaw, Wins Split Decision
J. T. Reed Fiance Of Dena Meadow
description: Mr. and Mrs. Cyril Zachary Meadow of. New York and Boston have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Dena Currie Meadow, to James Templeton Reed: He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Kenneth L. Reed of Kenosha and Lake Camelot, Wis. A June wedding is planned.

title: Pigeon Fanciers Off to the Races
description: MIDDLETOWN After another winter of breeding, planning and dreaming, the racing season is here once again for thousands of New Jersey homingpiegeon fanciers.

title: TALKS ARE BEGUN ON WOUNDED KNEE
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S. D., March 31  Sitting on black buffalo rugs and blessed by Indian prayers to the great spirit, Government and Indian negotiators began today what they hope is a series of talks that will end in the surrender of Wounded Knee.

title: West Germany
description: In some ways, wives in West Germany have less rights under the law than in other advanced countries. The husband, for instance, may insist that the wife stay at home and run the household. But the wind of women's liberation is eroding the traditions of kuche, kirche and kinder (kitchen, church and children), and last week the Bonn Cabinet approved the draft of a marriage reform bill.

title: Conflict Of Loyalties
description: WASHINGTON, March 31Every once in a while somebody gets up in the House or Senate of the United States, usually when nobody is listening, and raises a fundamental question about the integrity of American political life.

title: New Books on Philately
description: WITH the help of many authorities and the cooperation of Robson Lowe, publisher of a vast, fivevolume encyclopedia of British postal history, R. M. Wilicocks has produced the first of a new series, The Postal History of Great Britain and Ireland. Subtitled A Summarized Catalogue to 1840, it draws from Volume I of the Lowe encyclopedia of more than 20 years ago, updating pricings and amending portions of the text.

title: SHAM IS VICTOR AT SANTA ANITA
description: ARCADIA, Calif., March 31Sigmond Sommer's Sham won the $124,400 Santa Anita Derby today, defeating the oddson favorite, Linda's Chief, by 21/2 lengths with a strong assist from a stablemate, Knightly Dawn.

title: NETS TOP COUGARS TO EVEN PLAYOFFS
Vote on Government Change Is Postponed in Long Beach
description: LONG BEACH, L. LCity residents here almost got a chance to vote on a longpromised change in their form of government this week. A lastminute court decision closed the voting booths after opponents argues that the proposition on the ballot was not the promised change after ail.

title: East Germany Seeking to Limit Contact Between Its People and Western Visitors
description: BERLIN, March 24.  The Conununist Government of East Germany is seeking increasingly to limit contacts between its own citizens and people from Western countries.

title: Music
Lumber Keeps Lifting Home Costs
description: Lumber prices are continuing their sharp upward climb, showing an apparent immunity to Phase 3 of the Government's economic stabilization program, just as they did to the previous priceControl efforts.

title: State Gives Advice on Restoring Old Homes
description: TRENTON  The state's Historic Sites office, a branch of the Bureau of Parks that oversees New Jersey's landmark properties, is offering a free advisory service to those homeowners restoring old houses.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Federal and state wildlife biologists hope that a disease known as the Dutch duck plague, which at one point had been killing about 1,000 mallards a day at the Lake Andes National Wildlife Refuge in southeastern South Dakota has been controlled.

title: Women Get SelfDefense Tips
description: FREEHOLD  A Middletown homemaker said that her life had changed after her church group had played host to Attack, How to Protect Yourself, a program staged by the office of the Monmouth County Sheriff.making people aware of these problems.

title: Lindsay's Political Organization Is Falling Apart as Workers Help Others
description: While Mayor Lindsay remains studiously aloof from the scramble for Mayor, the political organization he assembled over eight years from the Republican, Democratic and Liberal parties, and assorted independent factions, is falling apart.

title: United Jewish Appeal Kicks Off 1973 Drive With 8 Dinners Here
description: Mrs. Golda Meir, Israel's Premier, in a taped telephone message to 3,000 people who attended eight simultaneous dinners in the greater metropolitan area, played the leading role last night in opening the 1973 campaign of the United Jewish Appeal of Greater New York.

title: FLYERS TROUNCE ISLANDERS BY 102
Stamps
description: NICOLAUS COPERNICUS, with had the larger vision to affirm that man's earth was not at the center of his universe, but a little planet circling the sun, and thus became the founder or modern astronomy and one of.the greatest influences of the modern scientific outlook, is appearing on a new United States commemorative for

title: NEW HOUSING AIDS THE POOR IN INDIA;But Poverty and No Work Plague Madras Residents
description: MADRAS, India, March 22Each morning the muddy courtyard at the newest housing project here throbs with activity.

title: Children's Hunter Class Is Growing Up
description: Almost unnoticed, the children's working hunter division was added to more and more horse shows this winter. At last count seven events in the metropolitan area had offered children's working hunter classes. Mrs. Eleanor Estes of Cos Cob, Conn., who manages a long list of shows, first added the division to The Hill fixture in North Salem, N.Y. It proved to be very popular, said Mrs. Estes, whose daughter, Page, rode Dinkie to the American Horse Shows Association's national highpoint championship in the small pony hunter division in 1971. We've had a lot of favorable comment from exhibitors.

title: Gardiner's Island To Exclude Tourists
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.Gardiner's Island will be closed to large groups of tourists this year.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: Alaskan Malamute Association of Long Island match, for malamutes, Siberian huskies and Samoyedes, American Legion all, Park Avenue, Amityville, L.I., entries from 10 A.M.; judging 1 P.M.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: BrooklynJoint exhibition, Homage to Marco Tricca, at the Brooklyn Center, Long Island University, Humanities Gallery (Hours: Monday to Friday, 10 A.M. to 10 P.M.) and the Brownstone Gallery, 76 Seventh Avenue (reception Tuesday, 6 P.M. to 9 RM., hours: Wednesday to Saturday, 11 A.M. to 6 P.M.)

title: Applebet Story; By Byron Barton. Illustrated by the author. Unpaged. New York: The Viking Press. $3.95. (Ages 3 to 5)
description: Another ABC book? There will always be another ABC book. As spring will always inspire poets to write another spring song, the alphabet will always entice artists to compose another ABC. From C. B. Falls's ABC Book in 1922 to Leonard Baskin's Hosie's Alphabet in 1972, the list of excellent ones could stretch from Alabama to Zanzibar. Byron Barton, who last year created, Where's Al?, a bright, exuberant picture book, has now produced Applebet Story, the pictorial journal of a red apple through 26 gray, frenetic situations, that, sad to report, is neither bright nor exuberant, but contrived and dreary. The kindest thing we can do for Mr. Barton's artistic reputation is to remember his prizewinning Where's Al? and forget his Applebet Story ever happened.

title: Parley on Young Set in Paterson
description: PATERSONMrs. Evelyn Moore, director of the Black Child Institute in Washington, will lead off The Week of the Young Child, a sevenday conference on earlychildhood education that begins here today.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Both Sides In Canarsie Dispute To Meet Today to Plan Actions
description: Black parents from Brownsville and white parents from Canarsie scheduled meetings today to plan their actions following the Board of Education's decision to phase, out Brownsville children from the CanarsieEast Flatbush schools over the next eight years.

title: Carolina Curb on Female Pages Lifte
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., March 31 Restrictions the South Carolina Senate has imposed female pages are unconstitutional, the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit has declared.

title: Taipei Is Changing Status Of Central News Agency
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, March 31The Central News Agency, enterprise of the governing Nationalist Party, or Kuomintang, is being reorganized as a separate corporation. The move appears intended to improve the chances of its correspondents to regain accreditation at the United Nations and decrease the agency's problems in operating in countries with which the Government on Taiwan no longer has diplomatic relations.

title: Miss Roulhac Fiancee Of James Horton Jr.
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 31  Christopher M. Roulhac Jr., director of admissions at Cheyney State College, and Mrs. Roulhac of Mount Airy have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Yvonne Agnes Roulhac, to James Horton Jr., newly named executive director of the Chicago Opportunities Industrialization Center. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Horton of Winter Park, Fla. The wedding is planned for April 21.

title: Anne Parker Will Be Wed
description: BEVERLY FARMS, Mass., March 31  Mr. and Mrs. Edward Pickering Parker have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Pickering Parker, to John Eric Pollack, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome M. Pollack of Ridgewood, N. J. The wedding is planned for this spring.

title: Students Shoplift
description: AMHERST, Mass., March 31 (AP)The public safety director at the University of Massachusetts here said he had conducted a recent survey of 100 students at the university and had found that 77 per cent of them had said they shoplift.

title: LostandFound Office Busy In Peking Railway Station
description: PEKING, March 31 (Agence FrancePresse)  The lostandfound department of the Peking railway station receives 600 to 700 objects a month, ranging from children's socks to the complete luggage of travelers, the Communist party daily, Jenmin Jih Pao, reports,

title: A Different Coffeehouse
description: BERGENFIELD  Every Saturday evening, some 25 to 30 high school girls and boys gather in a renovated former railroad station here to listen to a rock band or a couple of Israeli folksingers and to munch on a bagel or two.

title: Union Ratifies Con Ed Pact
description: Michael C. Takvor, chief negotiator for the Staten IslandCon Edison division of Local 3 of the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, said yesterday that the local's members ratified by 5 to 1 a new twoyear contract with thaw Consolidated Edison Company.

title: Parent and Child: Catch 22 for mothers (cont.); And Catch 23, 24 25, 26...
description: Catch 22 for mothers by Dr. Sally E. Shaywitz, which ran in this Magazine March 4, provoked an unusual outpouring of letters from women. (As we went to press, there had been no letters from men.) Dr. Shaywitz, pediatrician and mother of three young sons, described the agonizing choice many educated women have to make between the careers they were trained for and the children they yearn for.

title: 17,304 See Globetrotters
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 31 (AP)  The Harlem Globetrotters attracted the largest crowd ever to watch a basketball game here last night when 17,304 jammed the Spectrum to watch the Globetrotters play the Boston Shamrocks.

title: HOUSING AND RACE STIR COURT FIGHT
description: ST. LOUIS, March 31Testimony in the Federal Government's first legal challenge of a suburb's use of its zoning power to exclude federally subsidized lowincome housing has ended with both sides still at odds over whether residents of the town acted with racial motivations.

title: Who's on First?
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., V1arch 31 (UPI)  The Atlanta braves have sent back to the ninors three candidates for first baseAndy Thorton, Jack Pierce and Mike Fiore.

title: Mat Coach Moves Up
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., March 31 (AP)Tom Porter, who built prep wrestling powerhouse at Arlington Heights (Ill.) High School, has been named head wrestling coach at the University of Illinois.

title: The Horrors Of Captivity
description: WASHINGTON  The scene was a recreation hall at Andrews Air Force Base in suburban Virginia. In almost casual tones, tinged with the twang of his native Oklahoma, Col. Robinson Risner told about life In a North Viet, namese prison camp.

title: MEISILIE COOPER ACTOR, DIES AT 76
description: LOS ANGELES, March 31Melville Cooper, the characte actor, whose roles during hi, 50year career ranged fron butler to king, died Thursda in the Motion Picture Countrl House and Hospital in Wood land Hills. His age was 76.

title: A New Highway Irks Morristown
description: MORRISTOWN  The changes taking place within Morristown are troubling many of its 17,700 residents, most of whom have become accustomed to the slow suburban pace, open spaces and neighborlinese that have prevailed here for decades. The changes affect many areasgovernment, traffic, shopping and the police  and quite possibly will be extremely beneficial in the long run. But the temporary disruption they are causing is leading to some dissatisfaction with the way of life. And growth, too, is made evident by the changes, one of which begins today, when The Morristown Daily Record will start a Sunday edition.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Some years back, April Fool's Day became so popular in America that the one day was not enough to satisfy people.

title: Cooley
description: Denton A. Cooley is a notoriously industrious Houston heart surgeon and realestate speculator who, when he rather hastily implanted an artificial heart in Mr. Haskel Karp on Good Friday, 1969, without having secured authorization from his chiefofservice and without having tested the device in the accepted manner prior to implantation, found to his dismay that he had, like Hemingway's Old Man of the Sea, gone too far. The profession which had nurtured him and bestowed upon him not little (but apparently not enough) international acclaim, now slapped his dextrous hands. The same hands which, as we learn from Harry Minetree's adoring chronicle, had held thousands of exposed and beating hearts. The same hands which had in fact been kissed under Minetree's gaze by a buxom Greek lady whose little boy was recovering after a difficult time. This lady drew Cooley's fingers to her breasts. Your hands, said. god.

title: MADIOSN AVE
description: Probably no public issue since the end of World War II has generated as much corporate advertising as the energy crisis.

title: Dulles Airport Braces for Expansion
description: CHANTILLY, Va., March 31  Dulles International Airport, like its neighbor, the Washington Redskins, has discovered the future is now  as Coach George Allen puts it.

title: Soviet Curbs Smokers
description: MOSCOW, March 31.  Smoking has been banned on Soviet airline flights of less than three hours. This was done because of numerous requests of nonsmokers, the magazine Zdoropo reported yesterday.

title: The Gun Business
description: To the Financial Editor:In an article on March 11 (Government Is the Real Monopoly"], Lee Loevinger urged that in environmental and similar public interest matters, there could be less governmental regulation of business if only we would realize two things.

title: Kathleen Sehn, John Lehmann Plan Wedding
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich., March 31Mr. and Mrs. Francis J. Sehn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathleen Frances Sehn, to John Winser Lehmann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Emil W. Lehmann of Princeton, N. J.

title: SHOP TALK
description: SOUTH ORANGEInstead of rather ordinary clothes at high prices, Au Bon MarcM offers some of the most beautiful clothes in the world at low prices. It's a nice change.

title: More P.O.W.'s Fly Back
description: Fortyeight more American prisoners of war were flown home yesterday to be followed by a final group of 69 today, when the last prisoner held in South Vietnam will also be freed.

title: Rap Brown
description: After three years of trials in courts across the country, the pattern seemed set: the black militant leader would be charged with a heinous crime, often involving murder; the prosecution would present a notably weak case; the jury would return a quick acquittal or sometimes the judge himself would dismiss the case.

title: Defiance was in his blood
description: Since Milovan Djilas was in 1954 ousted from the Yugoslav Communist party, of which he had been one of the outstanding leaders, he has written 10 books of political comment, of fiction and autobiography. The present volume is the second part of his autobiography; the story of Djilas's childhood in his native Montenegro (Land Without Justice) was published in the 1950's. Memoir of Revolutionary covers the years from 1929, when Djilas left his home town to study in Belgrade, to the German invasion of 1941.

title: Columbia Names Gerber Associate Football Coach
description: Norm Gerber, defensive coordinator of the Columbia football team for the last two years, has been named to the newly created position of associate head football coach.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Gas on Coast Is Rationed By Texaco
description: LOS ANGELES, March 27 (AP) Gasoline rationing by Texaco distributors will go into effect at 200 service stations here tomorrow because Texaco is restricting the amount of fuel its distributors can buy, the Los Angeles Times reported today.

title: JIMMY IS UPSET IN CHICAGO SHOW
description: CHICAGO, March 31  The top winning terrier of 1972, Mrs. Jane Esther Henderson's Ch. Littleway Haranwal Barrister, from Stockton, N. J., made an unsuccessful invasion of the Midwest today.

title: WALL STREET; Stock Market's Problem: Not Enough Buyers
description: The research department at Bache & Co. felt the stock market was ripe for an upturn a few weeks ago so Joseph Cucuzza Bache's chief technical analyst, flashed an intermediateterm buy signal over the firm's wire system.

title: Home Improvement
description: ULTRASONIC security devices that sound an alarm when an intruder enters a protected area inside a home or apartment have become increasingly popular in the past few years as more and more people search for ways to provide added protection against burglars and vandals. Although the concept is not really new, early units were quite bulky and expensive, and they required careful installation and adjustments by experts. However, numerous manufacturers have now developed compact, selfcontained units that are specifically designed and priced to meet the needs of the homeowner or apartment dweller.

title: Strictly Classified
Red Rum Overtakes Crisp to Capture $98,600 Grand National at Aintree
description: AINTREE, England, March 31 (Reuters)With a sudden spurt over the last 100 yards, Red Rum scored a superb victory today in the $98,600 Grand National Steeplechase.

title: the traveler's world
description: MIAMI  Having dipped a toe, literally, into the waters of Everglades National Park via the sevenmile drive into its northern reaches of the Tamiami Trail, we set out one sunny morning to plunge deep into the park at its southernmost and most developed sector, around Flamingo. Fastmoving tourists can do it comfortably in a day if they start early enough on the 31 miles of trafficridden U.S. 1 from Miami down to Homestead and Florida City and thence on the clear, fast, 12mile run to the park entrance and visitor center at the Royal Palm

title: CHILES POOR GET. MORE EDNA AID
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 31 There has been a dramatic expansion of medical services for the poor under Chile's Marxist Government.

title: Art Notes
description: ON the third floor of the Whitney Museum, Bruce Nauman has let his soma all hang out (if you look, you'll catch his psyche, as well). Among the 117 works in his show (a joint venture of the Whitney and the Los Angeles County Museum of Art). are Neon Template of the Left Half of my Body Taken at 10Inch Intervals"; a fiberglass piece entitled Six Inches of My I Knee Extended to Six Feet"; and Making Faces, a hologram series of gruesome mouth grimaces. Seldom has any artistexcept maybe Giacometti, put more of his physical self into his art.

title: Numismaties
description: OF the many specialized branches of exonumia (tokens, medals, etc.), the specialty that seems to be growing fastest right now is the collecting of coal mine scripthe tokens used in the private company stores operated in the old robber baron days by coal mining companies.

title: Nixon Says He Dislikes Vodka and Champagne
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (Reuters) President Nixon has disclosed some of his dislikes in alcoholic drinks, and they include vodka and champagne.

title: Louise Potts Engaged to Paul Thibodaux
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I. March 31  Mr. and Mrs. Walter B. Potts of Lattingown and Quogue have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Louise Ruprecht Botts, to Paul Thomas Thibodaux, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Robert Thibodaux of Thibodaux, La. A June 23 wedding is planned.

title: Airfield Gunman Sentenced
description: FORT WAYNE, Ind., March 31 (UPI)James Allen Messer, 29 years old, who tried to shoot his way into the control tower at the city's Baer Field last summer, was sentenced yesterday to 1 to 10 years in prison.

title: Swedish Academy Charges Ads Defile Michelangelo Art
description: STOCKHOLM, March 31 The Royal Swedish Art Academy has appealed to King Gustaf VI Adolf to ban billboard advertisements in Sweden that it says defile Michelangelo's revered fresco, The.Creation.

title: I.T.U. and El Diario Reach 1Year Contract Settlement
description: A oneday printers strike against El DiarioLa Prensa was ended last night when the newspaper and Local 6 of the International Typographical Union agreed on a oneyear contract.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: His Mahavishnu Orchestra attains music which IS

title: A Travelers Account of the State
description: As a provincial New Yorker for whom the Midwest begins in Jersey City and who always, parochially, thought of New Jersey as a pavedover approach to The City, a place in which the population seemed to live only in toll, booths, it comes as a surprise to learn that travelers over the yearsthe last 450 years, in facttook time to savor the Garden State.

title: Irritatingly omnivorous, buoyantly cocksure, abrasively infallibleat least he seemed;Macaulay
description: The first of these volumes is great and good book, about a great and good man. It seems fitting to salute John Clive's achievement in language akin to that in which his subject was wont to enter the favorable judgments in the Edinburgh Review. The work is limited to study of Macaulay's first 38 years. Mr. Clive is niggardly as to hints respecting whether he will write second volume to cover the last 21. As to that, one recalls Carlyle on Margaret Fuller's acceptance of the universe: By God, he'd better!

title: LEVITT ESTIMATES SURPLUS OF STATE
description: ALBANY, March 31State Controller Arthur Levitt said today that the state's muchdisputed revenue surplus for the 197273 fiscal year ending today was realistically $200million to $300million,

title: Muffel; And Plums; By Lilo Fromm. Illustrated. 64 pp. New York: The Macmillan Company. $3.95. (Ages 3 to 7)
description: A child is supposed to read the sequential linedrawings in this wordless book, like a comic strip without one balloon or Thwock! But while a comic leads the eye from frame to frame, this book has such muddled layout that the eye flounders. Do the pictures read uptodown, or lefttoright? pagebypage, or across a spread? (The clue is a tiny numeral under each squarehard to see without a magnifying aid, meaningless to a kid who can't read them.) More visual confusion is wrought by the endpaper drawings, arranged boustrophedonstyle (that's the Greek method; where lines read alternately righttoleft, lefttoright, riverlike), and by inconsistent ways of showing rapid motion.

title: Volunteers Begin Drive
description: The Volunteers of America yesterday opened its 77th annual salvage drive designed to aid the needy, help provide jobs and combat pollution.

title: April
description: How fortunate it was that the first English settlers here chose a thrush to mistake for their cherished robin redbreast at home. That is how it happens that we have this familiar songster and dooryard bird to call by that English familiar name, robin, affectionate term for Little Robert. They might have chosen the redbreasted nuthatch, whose musical vocabulary is limited to YarkYark.

title: Arthur Daley
description: This is the time of year when a spring fever of sorts normally sweeps across the country. Maybe it isn't as virulent as was in the old days, but it still hangs in there with dogged persistence. The baseball season begins this week and thereby signals that the time, has come for experts and inexperbs to succumb to the irresistible urge to, make their pennant picks.

title: Opening Day
description: Last season's wonlost record In parentheses All Times Eastern Standard

title: Why Turn Clock Back To 1914?
description: No one maintains that the abuse of drugs is a good thing, and no one denies that it has some relationship to crime. But the report of the National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse, just handed to President Nixon, and much testimony before the New York legislative committees studying Governor Rockefeller's hardline proposals suggest that there is no real cause for panic about drug abuse and its effect on crime.

title: North Sea Wins Aqueduct Mile
description: With Robyn Smith contributing a flawless performance as his rider, North Sea carried the colors of Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt to victory in the $56,650 Westchester Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Prospect Park Area Reports Crime Drop
description: The recent merger of two police precincts in Brooklyn has resulted in additional manpower for Prospect Park and its surrodading residential communities.

title: The Dukeof HandIton Diesat 70; Scots Peer Was Host to Hess
description: LONDON, March 31  The Duke of Hamilton, premier peer of Scotland who was drawn unwittingly into a bizarre attempt by Rudolf Hess, World War II Nazi leader, to make peace between Britain and Germany, died today, following a heart attack, in a private hospital in Edinburgh. His age was 70.

title: Royal and Regal Scores by Three Lengths in. Florida Derby, Returns $15.20
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., March 31Today's $130,200 Florida Derby at Gulfstream Park did not produce any serious challenges for mighty Secretariat, but the race following the Derby might have.

title: Concert Disrupted Here
description: A performance of the Balalaika Symphony Orchestra at Town Hall was disrupted last night when several stink bombs were discharged in the theater at 123 West.43d Street. According to a witness, several hundred people were evacuated, delaying the second half of the performance by the orchestra.

title: South Bend Judge Upholds Press Club On MenOnly Show
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., March 31 A Circuit Court judge here has reversed a ruling by the Indiana Civil Rights Commission that required the South Bend Press Club to open its traditionally male gridiron show to women.

title: A guide to the good parts of Jacqueline Susann.
description: Once is more than enough, as this book, and all of Jacqueline Su sann's books prove. But by midsummer every beach, poolside, back yard and bedroom in America will be littered with copies waiting to be picked up and opened at random. That is the way Jacqueline Susann is read, by skipping back and forth from chunk to chunk looking for the good parts, turning the whole thing into a puzzle to be put together later when there is time to settle down.

title: California Bill Would Bar Amateurs From Pro Rings
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 31 (UPI)  Assemblyman Vincent Thomas, a former boxer, has introduced legislation prohibiting amateur fighters from appearing on the same card with professionals.

title: The HitandRun Play Is a Modified Success
description: WINTER HAVEN, Fla., March 31 (AP)Ever hear of a double play on a successful hitandrun play? It happened to the Boston Red Sox yesterday in an exhibition game with the Chicago White Sox.

title: PAYOFF IS $109.80 FOR LEO'S PISCES
description: NEW ORLEANS, March 31 (AP)Leo's Pisces, who barely earned the price of his oats last year, stormed past the favored Angle Light in the stretch to win the $75,000 Louisiana Derby today. The brown 3yearold paid $109.80, $27 and $8.60 for $2 across the board.

title: Man Is Charged in Siaying Of an Infant Girl in Harlem
description: A 26yearold man was arrested and charged with the slaying of a 14monthold girl in Harlem after the infant's mother had found her dead in her crib with four broken ribs Land a punctured liver early yesterday, the police reported.

title: PACERS TROUNCE ROCKETS, 11491
Legal Age of 18 Poses Problems for High Schools
description: BUTLERThe new 18yearold legal age of majority has created confusion for some high school educators who now must deal with the adult student rather than with his parents or guardians.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
An ExAdman Makes Toys
description: CHESTER  At 39, Norbert Wood, then in a lucrative job with an advertising agency, decided to quit and try, something he really wanted to do: make handcrafted children's toys.

title: Burnet Sumner Is Betrothed
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 31  Mrs. Cyril Sumner of Cambridge and South Harwich, Mass., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Burnet Barnes Sumner, to Dr. Joseph Floyd Lipinski Jr., son of Dr, and Mrs. Lipinski of New Kensington, Pa.

title: Miss Gulielma Rogers Affianced To Cadet William E. Rosenberg
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., March 31  Mr. and Mrs. Philip Ashley Rogers of Old Westbury have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gulielma Rogers to Cadet William Edward Rosenberg, a first classman at the Air Force Academy in Colorado Springs.

title: Miss Patricia Kavanagh Betrothed
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 Mr. and Mrs. John Carroll Kavanagh have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Kavanagh, to James Douglas Grant of Baltimore.

title: Bridge By Alan Truscott
description: Most beginners regard a sevencontract as the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow. And if one day the fates deal them 17 laydown tricks, and they surmount the bidding problems with the help of Blackwood, their pride is unbounded: We bid and made a grand slam, they shout triumphantly to the few who will listen and the many who would rather not.

title: Westchester Women Testify on Employment Bias
description: WHITE PLAINS, March 31 A series of public hearings designed to document cases of discrimination against women in Westchester has begun with several dozen women testifying about their experiences with employers and in the courts.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock and bond markets scored strong gains last week for reasons that were alternately technical and fundamental.

title: Florida Boom:Big Money Big Sports
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 31 Seventeen baseball teams, including the New York Mets and Yankees, are pulling up stakes in Florida this weekend. But as they head north for the regular season, they are leaving behind a booming economy and sports landscape that will be even busier when they return next winter.

title: The Ballet
description: The Robert Jeffrey Ballet, which today ends its season at the City Center 55th Street Theater, has enjoyed one of the biggest successes ever. This has not been due merely to the sensational success of Twyla Tharp's marvelously sprightly and dazzling Deuce Coupe (al though this intricate memorial to the nineteensixties is justifiably proving an enor mous crowdpleaser) nor for that matter the new productions of Eliot Feld's Jive and MassinePicasso Parade, but at least in part to the wonderful way the company is dancing this season.

title: SPASSKY'S DEFEAT PRODUCES CHANGE
description: MOSCOW, March 31 Boris Spassky's loss of the world chess championship to Bobby Fischer last September has brought a definite shakeup in the Soviet chess world that is clearly aimed at recapturing the title in 1975.

title: HighWire Clown Falls Into Lions' Cage HighWire Clown Falls Into Lions Cage HighWire Clown Falls Into Lions Cage Continued From Page 1, Col. 7
description: A highwire circus clown fell 19 feet into a cage containing 17 lions yesterday morning at Madison Square Garden but escaped serious injury after the lion tamer first broke his fall and then fended off a lion that lunged at the fallen clown.

title: Rodney Aspinwall Weds Laurie Lidz
description: Miss Laurie Lidz, daughter of Mrs. Harry Linenthal of New York and the late Sidney M. Lid; also of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Rodney Wilson Aspinwall, son of Mr. and Mrs. George F. Aspinwall of Milford, Pa. The Rev. Terence J. Finlay performed the ceremony in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church.

title: Volunteers Begin Drive
description: The Volunteers of America yesterday opened its 77th annual salvage drive designed to aid the needy, help provide jobs and combat pollution.

title: India Stresses Educational TV To Fight RuralArea Illiteracy.
description: NEW DELHI, March 31  In India, where communication with the illiterate masses in the villages remains a frustrating problem, television is now favored as the best means of educating them.

title: Pirates, Reds Choice
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates, Cincinnati Reds and Baltimore Orioles are picked to win their division titles but the world champion Oakland Athletics are rated only even with the Chicago White Sox in the American League West by United Press International's board of baseball experts.

title: Nol Coward 18991973
description: IT all looked so easy on the stage. Noel Coward, who died last Monday, wrote fast and expertly because he was a total theater man. He exploded on New York in 1925 where he was unknown to most theatergoers. Within three months, three plays by him appeared on Broadway stages The Vortex, in which he acted a leading part, Hay Fever and Easy Virtue.

title: 3 Museums In Nassau Win Official Standing
description: Three Long Island cultural organizations have won accreditation from the American Association of Museums.

title: CORRECTION
description: Ada Louise Huxtable's article on industrial architecture on this page last Sunday stated that a news story had announced the obsolescence and eventual closing of the Ford River Rouge plant. According to the Ford Motor Company, only the Dearborn Iron Foundry within the Rouge manufacturing complex is scheduled to be closed. The Rouge continues in active production.

title: If You Want Them To Love the Classics...
description: ISN'T it time that critics, composers and administrators of our musical institutions stop discussing the younger generation as if it were a known quantity, easily measured and transparently predictable? They keep telling us young people no longer go to concerts and opera in great numbers. Any journalist who covered the McGovern campaign could tell them they generalize about youth at their peril, yet they continue presuming that broad, meaningful statements can be made about how millions of individuals who just happen to be under 30 are reacting to great music. Such fervent concentration on the moot, the dubious and the unknowable could well distract these custodians and creators of our musical life from their chief task of keeping stand

title: GEORGIA TORNADOES KIEL 1, HURT SCORES
description: ATLANTA, Ga., March 31 (AP)At least one person was killed and scores were injured today when tornadoes cut across portions of central Georgia.

title: Sports Today
description: The Atlanta 500 stock car race, at International Raceway, Atlanta. (TelevisionChannel 7, 4:30 P.M.

title: Australia Delaying Link to U.S. Navigational System
description: SYDNEY, Australia, March 31The Labor party Government has put off carrying out the commitment made by its conservative predecessor for the establishment of an Australian link for an advanced American navigational guidance system.

title: Study in Contrast: Rinaldo, Maraziti
description: WASHINGTON  New Jersey's two new Represent. atives, after three months in office, are proving to be as different as the districts they represent.

title: just off Fifth
description: A floorthrough apartment in a brownstone is the housing dream of many New Yorkers. And architect Steve Kiviat, who moved into the masterbedroom floor of a 19thcentury townhouse just off Fifth Avenue, is one of them. The apartment had high ceilings crowned by dentil moldings, French doors that opened onto small balconies and two handsome marble fireplaces that worked. Whenever possible I kept the old, says the architect, but put it in keeping with the new. To do this, Kiviat and interior designer Susan Kimber gave the old rooms a face lift by putting in a lighting track system, hanging overscaled modern art and installing an indoor forest in the living room (by planting dried birch trees in enormous baskets). The living room was furnished with flexible modular seating and carpeted with cocoa matting, the same material that covers diving boards.

title: Israel
description: TEL AVIVThere have been instances in the past of Israeli Jews condemned for spying for the Arabs, but they all had acted for money or out of intimidation. What made the convection of six Israelis last week different was that the defendants had acted out of ideological motives to aid an Arab country.

title: MRS. CHARLES ADELSON
description: Mrs. Jane Levinson Adelson, an artist and the widow of Charles R. Adelson, a candy manufacturer, died Thursday. She was 81 years old and lived at 40 Fifth Avenue.

title: PLEA BARGAINING A CAMPAIGN ISSUE
description: Manhattan District Attorney Frank S. Hogan and William vanden Heuvel, who is challenging his bid for reelection is opposing him in the Democratic primary clashed yesterday on the question of bargaining in their first appearance of the campaign.

title: Indian Terms Words Hers, Not Brando's
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 31 (AP) The young Indian woman who reported Marlon Brando's rejection of his Academy Award Oscar says she used her own words instead of a long statement by the actor.

title: Back From Hanoi
description: CORONADO, Calif.Ten years ago, I toured the old Yuma Territorial Prison with my two eldest sons. Then aged 12 and 8, they had come on the bus from San Diego the previous day to visit me. Our visits together were not frequent. I was the commanding officer of a Navy fighter squadron and much of my time was spent away from home either at sea or on the gunnery ranges in Arizona.

title: The Lawless Seas
description: An Icelandic cutter fires on a British trawler fishing on traditional grounds outside the 12mile limit but within a new 50mile fishing zone claimed by the Government in Reykjavik.

title: After two years. OTB's in the money
Building Ban in Parsippany Reflects Growth in the State
description: PARSIPPANY  This Morris County community, one of the fastestgrowing municipalities in New Jersey in the last decade, has imposed a ban on all residential and commercial construction because of serious overloading of its sewagetreatment plant.

title: War Resisters Enter 2d Half Century
description: We are like the munitions makers: we boom in war and slump in peace, said James D. Peck, one of the staff members of the War Resisters League celebrating the pacifist group's 50th anniversary this year.

title: Fortnight of Irish Culture
description: WEST ORANGEIrishmen from New Jersey and New York State have been learning a great deal about their cultural heritage during the last two weeks.

title: Munn Wrestling Captain
description: Robin Munn of Sayre, Pa., has been named captain of the Lafayette College wrestling team.

title: Goldwater Quits as Counsel Of State Democratic Panel
description: Monroe Goldwater, long leading figure in New York state Democratic politics, announced his resignation as chief counsel of the Democratic State Committee and chairman of its law committee.

title: BOTTOMLESS BARS TARGET ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, March 31 Doda continues to disrobe for audiences at the Condor Club in this city's North Beach nightclub area but perhaps she won't much longer.

title: Basketball Coach Quits
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa. (AP) Dick Walker, head basketball coach the last two years at the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown, has resigned.

title: Zelenka Chamber Ensemble Offers Ingratiating Concert
description: The great number of talented, welltrained young instrumentalists around town wants nothing more than to play. They band together in ensembles such as the Zelenka Chamber Orchestra, which played in Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Faced with recent rises in the price of nonferrous metals, metal fabricators have had to decide whether to pass these increases along to their customers.

title: Cubs LaRoche Sidelined
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., March 31 (AP)  The Chicago Cubs said today that a lefthanded relief pitcher, Dave, LaRoche, was being treated for tendonitis and has been placed on the 3Iday disabled list.

title: Music Center Plans Antiques Show
description: SOUTH RIVERFinal preparations are under way for the second annual Imperial Music Center Antiques Show, a distinctly nonmusical event that will be held next Friday and Saturday at this distinctly musical institution.

title: Dr. Immanuel Estermann, Physics Professor, Is Dead
description: Dr. Immanuel Estermann, a physicist who had worked at the Office of Naval Research in Washington and in London, died, apparently of a heart attack, in Haifa, Israel, on Friday. He was 73 years old.

title: What's :New in Theater?
description: AN EVENING WITH THE POETSENATOR, a play by Leslie Weiner, got one favorable review (Gottfried, Womens Wear), three mixed (Barnes, Times; Gayer, UPI; Bookspan WPIXTV) and four unfavorable reviews (Watt, News; Watts, Post; Wallach, Newsday; Glover, AP).

title: His Trainer Says Ali's Future Depends on Doctor's Decision
description: SAN DIEGO, March 31 (AP)  He was very fast with his hands but afoot he wasn't. He didn't have punch at all, said Ken Norton today after upsetting the former champion.

title: A REVIVAL OF UNIONS UNDERWAY IN CHINA
description: SHANGHAI, March 31 (Reuters)Trade unions, discredited in China during the Cultural Revolution, are being revived in a modified form, newsmen were told here today.

title: Prefontaine Sets Field Mark Of 8:31.8 in TwoMile Run
description: EUGENE, Ore., March 31 (UPI)Oregon's Steve Prefontaine set a Hayward Field twomile mark today in a highlight of the Oregon Invitation meet. He was timed in 8 minutes 31.8 seconds on a windy, rainy and chilly afternoon, breaking the previous field mark of 8:33.2 he shared with Arne Kvalheim.

title: BLUES WIN:. 72, MAKE PLAYOFFS
Clemente a Big Part of Pirates Opener
description: The No. 21 uniform of the late Roberto Clemente will lie formally retired by the Pittsburgh Pirates in one of the openingday ceremonies next Friday at Three Rivers Stadium. Clemente, the Pirates outfielder, was killed last Dec. 31 in an air crash off Puerto Rico.

title: DR. BERNATH WEISS
description: Dr. Bernath Weiss, a physician and surgeon in Ridgewood, Queens, for 50 years, died yesterday at his home, 10856 70th Avenue Forest Hills, Queens. His age was 86.

title: Knicks Try for 20 Lead Today
34 Olympic Winners in A.A.U. Swim
description: CINCINNATI March 31 (AP)  Mark Spitz and Shane Gould, the show stealers in 1972 Olympic swimming, gather under the same roof again this week in the Amateur Athletic Union national shortcourse championships here.

title: First Easter;The True and Unfamiliar Story By Paul L. Maier. Illustrated. 128 pp. New York Harper & Row.$4.95.
description: Easter was the first Christian holy day to be observed by the early church, and it is the most significant. The Gospel story of Holy Weekfrom Jesus's going up to Jerusalem, through the Last Supper, His trial, crucifixion and resurrectionis, as Paul L. Maier says in First Easter, probably the most familiar story in the history of Western civilization. It is certainly most central to the faith of the 800 million people who today call themselves Christian.

title: DayCare Center Endangered
description: GREAT NECK, L.I.  The proposed cut in Federal support for social services, result of Congress's putting a $2.5billion limit on such spending, has created a crisis in the maintenance of daycare centers in the suburbs, according to the official responsible for the Child Development Center here.

title: Miss Carol Polk Is Future Bride Of Jon Barrett
description: DORSET, Vt., March 31In the United Church of DOrset this afternoon Miss Carol Elizabeth Polk, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul William Polk of Londonderry, Vt., and East Falmouth, Mass., became the bride of Jon Sherwood Barrett, son of Mr. and Mrs. C. Waller Barrett of Charlottesville, Pa.

title: Atlanta Soccer Team Prepares for a Liftoff
description: ATLANTA, March 31 (UPI) Atlanta's new entry in the North American Soccer League will be named the Apollos, a name associated with success, Bill Putnam, president of the Omni Group, has announced.

title: THE OPENINGS
description: NO HARD FEELINGS  Tonight, Martin Beck, 7. A comedy by Sam. Bobriok and Ron Clark.

title: 3 PAKISTANIS BARRED FROM FIELD HOCKEY
description: KARACHI, India, March 31 (AP)Three officials of Pakistan's field hockey team, which won the silver medal at the 1972 Olympics, were barred for 10 years today for misconduct at the Munich Games. A Karachi journalist was given a similar penalty.

title: A Vet Thrives on Bluegrass
description: EAST BRUNSWICK  An appointment with Dr. Maxwell T. Mandel at Edgebrook Veterinary Hospital on Route 18 could result in either medical ministrations to, say a dog, cat, rabbit or other animal or a booking for a bluegrass band, Dr. Mandel, a silm, pipesmoking man in his 20's, is so devoted to both his veterinary practice and country music, including bluegrass, that he cannot bear the idea of ever giving up either one.

title: Crime Without Victims;The law is a busybody
Watergate Management Advertises'Advantages
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI)'Watergate has become something of a household word, and those who operate the luxurious office and apartment complex in Washington are trying to make a good thing out of it.

title: DOCTORS TO STUDY IN SOCIAL SCIENCES
description: The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation has begun a $5.9million program that will take young doctors in residency training and teach them social sciences and law in addition to their clinical specialties.

title: Levitt Homes in New Jersey Under Attack
description: FREEHOLD TOWNSHIP, N. J.Levitt and Sons, Inc., the dean of suburban developers, is under fire here because of construction defects in a subdivision called Contempra at Monmouth Heights.

title: Sports Week
description: BASEBALL FridayMets vs. Philadelphia, season opener, at Shea Stadium, 2 P.M. SaturdayMats vs. Philadelphia, at Shea Stadium, 2:15 P.M.

title: MANILA SAYS REBELS SUFFER BIG LOSSES
description: MANILA, March 31 (AP)Moslem rebels suffered heavy casualties in a daylong gun battle with Government troops yesterday in Zamboanga Province, 500 miles south of Manila, a military report said today.,

title: Nassau To Begin TakeOver Of Buses
description: MINEOLA, L.I. County this week will over four of the 10 Private bus lines in the county the first step in improving service.

title: Ice Test Is Ended By Insufficient Ice
description: SAULT SAINTE MARIE, Mich., March 31The United States Coast Guard cutter Sundew gave up one last test Thursday of a bubbler system attached to her hull because there was no longer enough ice for a valid test. However, the officers in charge of the experiment believe it has proved that the system will reduce ice resistance by 10 per cent.

title: Nancy Tindale Plans Nuptials
description: SPARTANBURG, S. C., March 31Miss Nancy Revell Tindale, a prospective May graduate of Denison University in Granville, Ohio, plans to be married June 16 to Kenneth Barnhart 3d, a Denison graduate, class of 71.

title: City's Parks Chief Scores State's Use Of Jobs Patronage
description: New York City's Commissioner of Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs, Richard M Clunnan, said yesterday that he admired the candor of State Park Commissioner Alexander Aldrich in stating that Republicans would get preference in hiring temporary state park employes, but that he deplored the system.

title: RAIN POSTPONES GREENSBORO GOLF
description: GREENSBORO, N.C. March 31Steady rain throughout the night and morning forced postponement today of the third round of the $210,000 Greater Greensboro open golf tournament. The schedule now calls for 36 holes tomorrow  the third round to start at 6:22 A.M., the fourth at 11:22 A.M.

title: U.S./Europe Old Friends Drifting Apart
description: AMSTERDAMThe signs of slippage along the EuropeanAmerican seam had become uncomfortably visible a year ago. It was no longer the old theme, echoed as often as the mischievous shepherd boy's wolf, that the alliance was in disarray.

title: Article 1  No Title
Finality in Vietnam
description: The air of finality with which President Nixon heralded the American withdrawal from Vietnam Thursday night has been welcomed with gratitude and relief across the country. The nation and its elected representatives Congress now have the right to insist that this finality be reflected in the Administration's actions.

title: A Lid on Meat Prices
description: WASHINGTON President Nixon's decision to put a lid on the nation's soaring meat prices has left the public with important questions: How will the ceilings work? Will they have the perverse effect of preventing prices from going down? Could they cause shortages and black markets?

title: COMMUNISTS FIND TRUCESABOTAGED BY U.S AND SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, March 31  The chief North Vietnamese and American delegates to the FourParty Joint Military Commission left Saigon today, and the Communists accused the United States and South Vietnam of having systematically and very seriously sabotaged major provisions of the Paris peace agreement.

title: SELKIRK IS FIRST
description: CAMDEN, S. C., March 3 (AP)Selkirk, a locallytrainee gray gelding owned by Iri Daf fin, pulled away with a quartet of a mile to go today to wir the Carolina Cup ,steeplechase and its $10,000 purse.

title: City Council Committees To Hold Open Hearings
description: Tuesday  The Committee on State Legislation will meet at 11 A.M.

title: Dale Levine Engaged
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., March 31Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Levine have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Dale Laurie Levine, to Robert H. Soloff Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Soloff of Kings Point. Miss Levine expects to be graduated in June from Finch College. Her fiance, an alumnus of Purdue University, attends the George Washington University School of Medicine.

title: Italians Are Seeking a New Role in the Mediterranean Re ion
description: ROME, March 31A visit to Israel by Foreign Minister Giuseppe Medici and fournation diplomatic talks in Malta this week reflected Italy's search for a new role in the Mediterranean region.

title: Capital Punishment
description: LONDONIt is as well not to take blanket view of President Nixon's proposal to make capital punishment the mandatory sentence for certain crimes: assassination, treason, kidnapping and the murder of law enforcement officers and prison guards.

title: Richard Robert Saulig Fiance Of Mary Christine Gerstenberg
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich., March 31  Mr. and Mrs. Richard C. Gerstenberg of Bloomfield Hills and New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Christine Gerstenberg, to Richard Robert Saulig of Milwaukee.

title: Frank Sherer Jr. to Marry Miss Saydah
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward Khaleel Saydah of Brooklyn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss MarieLouise Saydah, to Frank Audemars Sherer Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Sherer of New York and Pawling. The wedding is planned for May 5.

title: R. J. Stein to Marry Joan Lerner
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., March 31Dr. and Mrs. Martin E. Lerner of Bronxville have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joan Berg Lerner, to Robert Jonathon Stein. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. William H. Stein of New York and Woodbury, Conn. A wedding in May is planned.

title: GOLF LEAD RAISED BY BETSY CULLEN
Rutgers Aide Is Named To Coach Detroit Five
description: DETROIT, March 31 (AP) Dick Vitale, an assistant coach at Rutgers University, was named head basketball coach at the University of Detroit today. He will replace Jim Harding, who resigned three weeks ago.

title: Legislators Looking To June 5 Primary
description: TRENTON  The State Legislature has apparently concluded that no news is good news, especially in an election year. With an earlyMay adjournment date in mind, the lawmakers appear to be dawdling along, simply counting the days before campaigns for all 120 legislative seats get under way.

title: Show and Courses
description: HOUSE plants will be everywhere at the Horticultural Society of New York, 128 West 58th Street, on Friday, Saturday and Sunday at a mini flower show devoted, entirely to plants that can be grown in pots. Seven house plant societies will take part including those interested in begonias, gloxinias and gesneriads, African violets, bromeliads, bonsai, cacti and succulents, and light gardening.

title: Mary L. Holton, Writer, Is Wed
description: Miss Mary Louise Holton, a writer for financial magazines, was married here yesterday afternoon to Howard C. E. Johnson, director of publications for Dominick & Dominick, investment bankers. The Rev. Thomas W. Bauer performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd, assisted by the Rev. Charles U. Quinn, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: RUTGERS 70 POINTS WINS TRACK MEET
TORTURE DETAILED BY 3 PILOTS HERE
description: Three Navy pilots released after six years in prison in North Vietnam yesterday detailed the torture they said they received at the hands of their captors.

title: German Gas Blast Kills 5
description: LORRACH, West Germany, March 31  Five construction workers werekilled and a sixth was missing and presumed dead when a gas pipeline exploded late last night near this town in the Black Forest, the police reported.

title: AntiLitter Ban Threatens Suffolk Paper
description: PATCHOGUE, L.I.  Suf folk Life, one of Long Island's most widely circulated ant controversial weekly news papers, may be in serious jeopardy as a result of ar anti litter ordinance ap proved recently by the Brook. haven Town Board and designed, town officials and the newspaper's publisher say, to put the newspaper out of existence.

title: They Must Mean Something
Senior Ambassador
description: As the burden of Vietnam duty is lifted from a generation of American youth, an American of another age now granted leave to lay down his responsibilities in that land of frustration and despair. Six weeks short of his 79th birthday, Ellsworth Bunker has been allowed resign as United States Ambassador in Saigon.

title: On Deck in A.L.dh
description: There will be something new under the sunor the lights in 1973 baseball.

title: There's a New Dimension at Center, Named Cowens
description: Some pro basketball people are saying Dave Cowens plays the center position differently from any other pivotman; bringing to the game a new dimension. Tom Heinsohn, his Boston Celtics coach, believes Cowens may revolutionize the pro game. Nate Thurmond ,of the Golden State Warriors calls him a new breed of center.

title: Candid Custom Clothier
description: As the president and sole owner of The Custom Shop Shirtmakers, a chain of 38 stores throughout the country that have an estimated annual volume or $10million, he is a multimillionaire. As a heavy real estate investor with sites ranging from Manhattan's Fifth Avenue to extensive acreage outside San Francisco, he has huge assets outside of his business. As a theater an motion picture buff, a music lover, an art ,aficionado and a concerned citizen, he has a world of interests beyond his commercial ventures.

title: Soaring Defense Costs...
description: When President Nixon set up the Blue Ribbon Defense Panel to study the nation's defense establishment 1969, a wide variety of talent was assembled. Discussions among the panel staff often ranged far afield.

title: The Good Word: There Is No (Irish) Mafia
description: The Irish drinking season is upon us (as usual) so it might be wise to heed a few words from the Rev. Andrew Greeley before things get completely out of hand.

title: ... Despite Washington
description: WASHINGTONLumber prices have been a headache for the Nixon Administration all through Phases 2 and of its economic control program.

title: Tokyo Is Urged to Fight Image of Ugly Japanese
description: TOKYO, March 31  A highlevel committee here has recommended a wideranging public relations effort to counteract what critics say is the image of the ugly Japanese.

title: Norton Simon Art, With 2 Cezannes, Will Be Sold Here
description: Two major paintings by Cezanne and a celebrated ballet scene by Degas, all from the private collection of Norton Simon, the West Coast industrialist, will be auctioned May 2 at Sotheby Parke Bernet, as the opening event of a week of sales of impressionist and modern works. The weekactually three evening and two day sessions through May 5  will bring to public sale 354 paintings, drawings and sculptures estimated to bring close to $7million.

title: CELTICS'
description: BOSTON, March. 31  After enjoying the most successful regular, season in their 27year history; the Boston Celtics fin ished preparations today for the National Basketball Association playoffs, which begin for them tomorrow night al Boston Garden against the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Sara Shillman Married
description: Miss Sara Toby Shillman and Andrew Harold Feinstein were married here last evening at the St. RegisSheraton by Rabbi Saul Teplitz. The bride is the daughter of Irving Shillman of Woodmere, L. I., and the late Mrs. Shillman. Her husband is the son of Leonard Feinstein of New York and the late Mrs. Feinstein.

title: A Revolt of The Masses
description: What turned President Nixon around causing him to join the faction that Agriculture Secretary Earl Butz had called damn fools for wanting to put a lid on food prices? It was literally a revolt of the massesmasses of housewives, workers and politicians.

title: SOUTH AMERICANS EATING LESS BEEF;Official Trade Policies as Well as Prices Are Factors
description: BUENOS AIRES, March 31 (AP)Like North Americans hurt by runaway meat prices, growing numbers of South Ainericans are facing slimmer beef diets and beefless days.

title: Let's Be Flexible, But Let's Not Be Flabby
description: SOFT as Art is a fairly deplorable grab bag of an exhibition of art works in soft materials that is currently at the New York Cultural Center. Destined to make the rounds of museums in three other New York City boroughs, it is the second such touring show sponsored by the city's Department of Cultural Affairs. The first one, called Outsized Drawings, was a grabbag, too, and inferior in overall quality to Soft as Art, but maybe its theme was sufficiently casual, a mere pretext for a show, its unevenness was tolerable. Not so in the present

title: ACROSTIC PUZZLE
Child to the Silvermans
description: DURHAM, N. C., March 31 A daughter was born March 12 to Dr. and Mrs. Norman A. Silverman at the Duke.Medical Center, here. Mrs. Silverman is the former Miss Penelope Bedingfield of New York, whose husband is a physician. The child has been named Leah Rebecca.

title: 48,000 Women to Bowl for a $706,431 Jackpot
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev. March 30 (AP)The largest, richest and longest tournament in women's bowling history opens here Thursday when the first 240 of more than 48,000 contestants begin the Women's International Bowling Congress tournament.

title: Dr. Haidak Weds Deborah L. Walsh
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn, March 31Miss Deborah Lesley Walsh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Church Walsh of Weekapaug and Hartford, was married here this evening to Dr. Paul Michael Haidak, son of Dr. and Mrs. Gerald Lewis Haidak of Pittsfield, Mass., and Block Island. Rabbi Harold Silver, assisted by Rabbi Harold Salzmann, performed the ceremony in the chapel of Temple Beth Israel.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, March 31 (UPI)A State Department advance group started for Peking today to prepare for the opening there in May of a highlevel United States liaison mission.

title: RICK NELSON SINGS NEW SONGS AND OLD
description: In his hit recording Garden Party, Rick Nelson reveals his feelings folloWing a Madison Square Garden rockrevival show and also says something about the plight of singers like Nelson who were teen idols long ago. The audience refuses to let him perform new material, preferring reruns of Ricky Nelson hits, frozen in time.

title: Even a Meeting
description: UNLIKE a political convention, the convention of the Modern Language Association brings together 10,000 certifiably intelligent people. Almost all are Ph.D.'s; those who aren't are usually what are calked A.B.D.'s, which means all but dissertation"scholars who have M.A.'s and are waiting for the final, and usually assured, stamp of approval of their Ph.D.'s.

title: Antisubversive Bill Offered
description: WASHINGTON Mar ch 31 (UPI)Members of the House Internal Security Committee introduced a bill this week that is intended to keep off the Federal Payroll any person who ever belonged to a subversive organization.

title: Chess: Tale of the Lonesome Pine A Happy One for Bisguier
description: Arthur Bisguier topped 48 entrants to capture first place in the recent Lone Pine Masters and Experts Tournament. The Rock Hill, N. Y., grandmaster ran up five victories and two draws to post a 61 score in the sevenround event, which had the highest average strength for any open Swiss system competition in the United States.

title: What's Opened at the Movies?
description: GODSPELL, directed by David Greene from a screenplay by Greene and JohnMichaeI Tebelak, got 7 favorable reviews (Archer Winsten, Post; Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Leonard Harris, WCBSTV; Gene Shalit, NBC; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; William Wolf, Cue; Arthur Knight, Saturday Review), 4 mixed (Vincent Canby, Times; Kathleen Carroll, News; Bernard Drew, Gannett News Service; Judith Crist, New York) and 7 negative (Howard Kissel, Women's Wear; Rex Reed, News; Martin Levine, Newsday; Andrew Sarris, Village Voice; Paul D. Zimmerman, Newsweek; John Simon, New Leader; Richard Schickel, Time).

title: He couldn't help being profound and original
description: The publication of a volume of essays by a recently deceased scholar is usually an act of eulogistic piety, or perhaps of belated compensation, inspired in the first instance by the publisher's love or respect, in the second by a guilty conscience. The immediate practical value of such works is not often large, since specialists are already familiar with the contents, and the subjects covered are in most cases either too narrow or too disconnected in theme to hold much interest for ordinary readers. History and American Society, fortunately, is an exception to the above generalities; it merits publication without regard for its memorial function. Society

title: Dog With Contact Lens Killed by Auto in Spain
description: GUECHO, Spain, March 31 (UPI)Stan, the dog that was fitted with contact lenses last year, was hit by a car Wednesday and killed.

title: Exotic Pets a Growing Domestic Problem
description: CHICAGO, March 31An eightfoot python emerged from, under a car in downtown Peoria, Ill., recently, then went into the basement of a post office, creating panic among the postal workers.

title: The Inscrutable Alex Johnson
description: The topic of conversation was Alex Johnson.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: Face the Nation: Guest is Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. of Connecticut, member of the Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities, which is investigating the Watergate affair, Channel 2, 11:30 A.M.

title: SPASSKY'S DEFEAT PRODUCES CHANGE
description: MOSCOW, March 31 Boris Spassky's loss of the world chess championship to Bobby Fischer last September has brought a definite shakeup in the Soviet chess world that is clearly aimed at recapturing the title in 1975.

title: SENATORS QUERY HALDEMAN'S ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, March 31Senate investigators of the Watergate conspiracy said today that they wanted elaboration on James W. McCord Jr.'s testimony dealing with H. R. Haldeman, the White House chief of staff.

title: Auf Wiedersehn to Berlin's Sportpalast
description: BERLIN, March 31  The young Berliners at least 3,000 of them, roared and trampled, whistled, yelled or booded the other night at a concert of Dublin folksingers in the Sportpalast.

title: Norton Upsets Ali
description: Ken Norton, an unheralded heavyweight, broke Muhammad Ali's jaw early in their 12round fight yesterday and went on to win by a split decision over the former world boxing champion. Section 5.

title: In matters mental or emotional
description: For one peculiar week, back there in July of 1972, the entire country seemed preoccupied with a topic formerly reserved for New York intellectuals and Washington cognoscenti. Thomas Eagleton had made the mental health of a public figure Kiwanis Club conversation. Some were substantively concerned about the safety of elevating to high office a man with a history of serious mental illness, but many were interested in the more specifically political question: Is such a history too great a burden for a political candidate to carry?

title: Methodism and MacNabs: An Enclave in the Bay of Honduras
description: IN the heart of Central America are some small islands where you find dories rather than donkeys, clapboard houses instead of adobe huts, Methodist prayer meetings instead of Catholic masses and fairskinned, blueeyed people named MacNab and Cooper who speak English instead of Spanish. Tb understand why, you need to know a little history. And to begin at the beginning, you have to go back to Christopher Columbus.

title: Royals Reach Player Limit
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., March 31 (UPI)The Kansas City Royals got down to the 25man player limit today when they optioned two pitchers, Al Fitzmorris and Tom Murphy, and a nonroster infielder, Frank White, to their minor league camp at Sarasota for reassignment. Earlier, the Royals sent out Doug Bird and Monty Montgomery, pitchers; catcher, Buck Martinez; an infielder, Jose Arcia, and an outfielder, Jim Wohlford,

title: Marcia Meehan of Saks Is Betrothed
description: Miss Marcia Meehan and Bayard George Schaeffer of New York will be married May 11.

title: U.S. Gets $265,000 in Cash Seized in Moriarty's Home
description: PHILADELPHIA, March 31 (AP)More.than $265,000 in cash seized in an apartment occupied by the reputed numbers king Joseph Moriarty has been awarded to the Federal Government for back taxes Moriarty has owed since 1955.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  H. R. Haldeman, John N. Mitchell, John W. Dean 3d, Jeb Stuart Magruder, Charles W. Colsonthe names of these past and present close advisers to President Nixon were reeled off last week in virtually nonstop testimony by James W. McCord Jr., convicted in January of conspiracy, burglary and wiretapping in the celebrated Watergate affair. He seemed to indicate that they were linked to the bugging incident, a link which if it is established, could shatter their careers and rend the Administration with a scandal of historic and possibly fatal proportions.

title: Bald Eagle Survey Slated in California To Help Save Bird
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., March 31 (UPI)State wildlife experts will soon start an intensive survey of California's bald eagle population that they hope will show a halt to the bird's decline toward extinction.

title: A Challenge To Congress
description: LAGUNA BEACH, CalifNo subject In the national dialogue better lends itself to oversimplification than economics. Legend to the contrary notwithstanding, the family budget and the Federal budget are not directly comparable; nor is there any valid means of comparing the intricacies of international trade to the commerce of the momandpop store. So it is with the current discussion of inflation.

title: GOVERNOR BYES ON ENVIRONMENT
description: ALBANY, March 31 Governor Rockefeller sent to the legislature today two bills that would appropriate a total of $426.4 million from the $1.15billion environmental bond issue approved by the voters for 180 waterpollutionabatement projects and for programs to improve the quality of the state's air and land resources.

title: Police Station Will Be Auctioned Here
description: Anyone who wants to, make a home in a police station or firehouse or who has a yen for a tenement in a slum or a home in Delaware Countywith garage and quonset hutcan make bids at a city auction.

title: Vietcong Names Envoy To Be Observer at U.N.
description: PARIS, March 31The Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government has named Nguyen Van Tien, head of its diplomatic mission in Hanoi, as permanent observer at the United Nations in New York, the delegation here announced today.

title: 650 Large Companies Face Survey on Pay and Price
description: WASHINGTON, March 31The Cost of Living Council announced today that it would survey 650 large corporations to make sure that they were developing internal procedures for compliance with wageprice standards.

title: Quake Rattles Managua 14 Weeks After Big One
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, March 31 (UPI)  Another earthquake shook Managua today, sending residents into the streets 14 weeks after the devastating earthquake of Dec. 23 that almost destroyed the city.

title: Hyndman Is 2and1 Victor In Final of Seniors Golf
description: MIAMI, March 31Bill Hyndman 3d, the lanky former Walker Cup captain from Huntingdon Valley, Pa., won the American seniors championship today at the Doral Country Club by beating John McCue of (Winter Park, Fla., 2 and 1. This was Hyndman's first American matchplay title. He previously won the American senior medal play title for two straight years.

title: Radical Runs for Mayor in Madison, but Scene Has Mellowed
description: MADISON, Wis., March 31 The scene is State Street in Madisona 10blocklong corridor stretching west from the gray dome of the State Capitol to the University of Wisconsin campus; a narrow, almost cozy avenue chockablock with everything from from book stores and music shops to taco huts and health food spots; for years, a caldron of political frenzy, both violent and nonviolent, in this perenially most political, perhaps, of all college towns.

title: Norton Rejected Ali Bout 2 Years Ago
U. of Massachusetts Aide
description: BOSTON, March 31 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent has appointed Frederick S. Troy. of Boston to be a trustee member of the University of Massachusetts Building Authority.

title: Korea's Chejudo Wind, Rocks and Women
description: T'HE plane from Seoul, South Korea's capital, dipped through the clouds to reveal a bright yellow and green checkerboard, just above the sea, from which a few whimsical barren hills abruptly jumped. The green was intense. and flourishing, but the yellow was amazing. Safflower was in full bloom. The fields were neatly separated by dark lavarock walls, which also surrounded low burial mounds. Far off a slope began; beyond was the volcano Hallasan (Mt. Halla).

title: Last P. O. W. Feared a Vietcong Trick to the End
description: CLARK AIR BASE, Philippines, April 1 (AP)Gaunt and chalkfaced, the last known United States war prisoner in Indochina ate his first American dinner in nearly three and a half years tonight after a release that until the last minute he feared might be a trick.

title: Full PATH Strike Impact Expected to Be FeltToday
description: Port Authority TransHudson service was halted yesterday as railroad carmen went on strike, but the walkout was not expected to start hurting in earnest until this morning, when thousands of New Jersey commuters have to find alternative routes into Manhattan.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on the Peaceful Uses of the Seabed, subcommittee on conference on law of the sea 3 P.M., and working group of subcommittee10 A.M.; subcommittee on marine resources and scientific research3 P.M.

title: Towboat Rams a Pier
description: VICKSBURG, Miss., April 1 (AP)One man was killed today and one missing after the towboat Lady Ree struck a pier of an old bridge over the Mississippi River here. The police said that four men were injured and at least six others pulled from the river unharmed.

title: C. A. LEJEUNE DIES; BRITISH FILM CRITIC
description: LONDON, April 1 (AP)Mrs. Caroline Lejeune Thompson, who as C. A. Lejeune was one of Britain's most respected film critics, died today. She was 76 years old.

title: Miss Reed Gains Title
description: HOUSTON, April 1 (UPI)Unseeded Nancy Reed of Winter Park, Fla., defeated thirdseeded Margaret Livingston of Birmingham, Ala., 67, 64, 62, today to win the national 35andover clay court championship. Topseeded Barbara Weigandt of Vista, Calif., defeated Betty Pratt of Winter Park, Fla., 75, 61, to win the 45andover title.

title: Havlicek Scores 54 Points In 134109 Celtic Victory
description: BOSTON, April 1 Sixteen straight points at the beginning of play and a careerhigh scoring performance by John Havlicek enabled the Boston Celtics to trounce the Atlanta Hawks) 134109, tonight at Boston Garden.

title: McIntire, Assailing Hanoi, Plans War Crimes Trials
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 1 (AP) The Rev. Carl McIntire, responding to stories of torture by returning prisoners of war, said today the planned to conduct war crimes trials of North Vietnamese leaders.

title: Crusty but Effective U.S. Diplomat
description: WASHINGTON, April 1When President Nixon asked for the name of a shrewd, ironwilled and experienced diplomat to replace Ellsworth Bunker as Ambassador to South Vietnam, the State Department came up with Graham A. Martin, a man who both his numerous boosters and detractors say fulfills all those requirements. For every officer who likes Martin, there is another one who detests him, one of his admirers said candidly on Friday, the day the White House announced Mr. Martin's nomination. But you won't find anyone who doesn't respect him or thinks he won't do the job out there.

title: 4 Couples Married Here in Hindu Rites
description: Making a joyful noise unto Lord Krishna and sharing a sweet and spicy vegetarian feast including Vedic eggplant parmigiana"more than 100 Hare Krishna devotees and their guests celebrated the weddings of four couples yesterday lat their Brooklyn temple, 439 Henry Street.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: LONDONOne of the great mistakes of Richard Nixon's critics over the years has been to regard him as a a man without basic beliefs, moved only by opportunism. Of course he has shown that he can bend to the wind. But us President he has surprised us again and again by meaning exactly what he said.
