title: GEORGE RIEMER
description: George Riemer, author and magazine writer, died Saturday of cancer in Long Island College Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 149 Clinton Street in Brooklyn.

title: Indonesian, on Visit to India, Hopes for Subcontinent Pact
description: NEW DELHI, April 1 (AP)Foreign Minister Adam Malik of Indonesia said today he would seek the normalization of relations between the three countries of the subcontinentIndia, Pakistan and Bangladesh.

title: SAIGON SAYS SIEGE AT CAMP CONTINUES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 1 (AP)The siego of a South Vietnamese ranger camp ended its fifth week today, the Government said. It also reported several small clashes in the Saigon region and said that seven civilians were killed in other attacks.

title: AUSTRALIANS RAID YUGOSLAV HOMES
description: SYDNEY, Australia, April 1 Federal and state policemen raided about 80 homes of Yugoslays here early this morning in a move against alleged Croatian terrorist activity.

title: Mailers'
description: The New York Mailers Union No. 6 last night ratified new contracts with the city's three major dailies.

title: The Boom in Counter Stocks Is Going Bust
description: About the only place you can still, spot a boOm in the overthecounter market, a securities trader quipped the other day, is at the bar in Harry's.

title: Keating May Go to Israel
description: Kenneth B. Keating, the former New York Senator and Ambassador to India, was reliably reported yesterday to be President Nixon's choice as the next ambassador to Israel. Mr. Keating would not comment. Page 12.

title: GRAHAM, CASPER LEAD BY 2 SHOTS
Irish Soccer
description: Longford (2 goals, 7 points) 13 points.

title: Award for Canadian Hero
description: PITTSBURGH, April 1 (Canadian Press)The Carnegie Hero Funds Commission announced yesterday that it had awarded a bronze medal for heroism and $1,000 to Keith Hunter of the Durham, Ontario, area. Mr. Hunter was cited for saving an undetermined number of lives Nov. 19, 1971, at a wedding reception. He disarmed an assailant who had shot and killed two persons.

title: KURT THOMAS, 69, CHOIR DIRECTOR
description: BAD OEYNHAUSEN, West Germany, April 1 (UPI)Prof. Kurt Thomas, who directed the choir of the Church of St. Thomas in Leipzig from 1957 to 1960 and subsequently taught at conservatories in Hamburg and Lubeck, died today after having undergone surgery. He was 69 years old.

title: ItalianAmericans Hit Brando Contradiction
description: An organization of ItalianAmerican professional and business men said yesterday that the actor Marlon Brando was guilty of a blatant contradiction in refusing an Academy Award because of the way American Indians are depicted in movies after he had played in the gangster film The Godfather.",

title: Walters and Sheila Young Dominate Speed Skating
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., April 1 (AP)Jack Walters of Lake Placid and Sheila Young of Detroit, both former Olympians, won seniors titles today in the Diamond Trophy indoor speed skating championships.

title: PEARSON WINNER OF ATLANTA 500
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Emma, the wandering oneton bison who escaped from Snyder's Darien Lake Children's Zoo in Genesee County last Thursday, is back in captivity. The nation's first buffalo hunt in many years ended when searchers flushed her from a wooded area two miles from the zoo and shot her in the flank with a tranquilizing dart.

title: Personal Finance: 3dParty Suits and Auto Insurance
description: If a wife is injured in an auto accident because of her husband's negligence, the law in New York State has long heldostensibly to prevent fraud or collusionthat she cannot sue him for damages and then collect from the insurance company, unless the insurer specifically offers such coverage.

title: Women's Caucus Backs A Woman for Governor
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, April 1 (UPI)The Women's Political Caucus of New Jersey, meeting here yesterday, endorsed a woman candidate for Governor and asked a male candidate to distribute his campaign literature outside.

title: U.S. Sets Diet Drug Recall In Drive on Amphetamines
description: WASHINGTON, April 1The Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs and the Food and Drug Administration have decided to recall diet drugs that contain amphetamines, with the objective of eliminating them from the market by June 30.

title: All 40 on Listing U.S. Ship In the Pacific. Are Removed
description: HONOLULU, April 1 (AP)All 40 crewmen of a disabled American freighter, the Silver Dove, were taken aboard Coast Guard cutter today after the 492foot ship developed 40degree list and appeared in danger of sinking, a Coast Guard spokesman said. The freighter is 220 miles from Johnston Island.

title: Hospital Walkout Ends
description: BALTIMORE, April 1 (UPI)Hospital workers ended a 10hour walkout yesterday at four state hospitals after an injunction was issued and Gov. Marvin Mandel threatened to dismiss them if the strike continued into the night shift.

title: 276 With Income of Over $100,000 Paid No Federal Tax in 1971, a Study Shows
description: WASHINGTON, April 1Senator Walter F. Mondale said today that 276 individuals with incomes in excess of $100,000 in 1971 had paid no Federal income tax for the year.

title: Bound for Kentucky
description: SANTA ANITA PARKSham won the $124,400 Santa Anita Derby.

title: Soviet Reproves Singer Of Underground Songs
description: MOSCOW, April 1Vladimir Vysotsky, a young movie star and dramatic actor who has built a wide following among young people with his throaty, underground songs that often parody Soviet life and the Establishment, has been officially scolded for giving illegal concerts.

title: THEFTS ARE LAID TO BLACK LEADER
description: Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, the advocate of black capitalism, was arrested yesterday on 121 counts of grand larceny and conspiracy that charged him with taking money from his Queens hospital and investing it in several of his other enterprises.

title: Books of The Times
description: MEMOIRS. AutobiographyFirst Draft. Journal. By W. B. Yeats. Transcribed and edited by Denis Donoghue. 318 pages. Illustrated. Macmillian. $7.95.

title: Wounded Knee Is Slipping Back Into a Sleepy Routine
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., April 1The occupation and siege of Wounded Knee began its second month today, a remarkable situation settling down to everyday tedium.

title: Source of Alleged Kickbacks TO ExIllinois Aide Reported
description: CHICAGO, April 1 (AP)The Chicago Tribune reported in its editions today that a Federal grand jury had traced more than $150,000 in alleged cash kickbacks made to the late Illinois Secretary of State Paul Powell.

title: Transit Alternatives
description: The strike against PATH, the Fort. Authority. TransHudson commuter system, means that thousands of riders will be looking for alternative means of travel today. PATH says it carries 145,000 fares on an average weekday.

title: Ruckelshaus Favors Aid For States on Land Use
description: William D. Ruckelshaus, Administrator of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, favors the enactment of national landuse legislation designed to help states conserve their diminishing land resources.

title: Transit Alternatives
description: The strike against PATH, the Port Authority TransHudson commuter system, means that thousands of riders will be looking for alternative means of travel today. PATH says it carries 145,000 fares on an average weekday.

title: Fighting Saints Are Upheld In Protest on Playoff Berth
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., April 1 (UPI)The World Hockey Association upheld tonight a protest by the Minnesota Fighting Saints and scheduled a game between the Saints and Alberta Oilers to determine the fourth team in the league's West Division playoffs. It will be played Tuesday or Wednesday at a site to be determined.

title: Scribner Power Remains Despite Terminal Vacation
description: The name on the door of the Chancellor's office on the 10th floor of the Board of Education headquarters building in downtown Brooklyn still reads Harvey B. Scribner and will for three more months. Inside the office and those occupied by his key aides there is a bustle of activity and a pretense that things are pretty much as they have been.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: John W. Campbell Anthology, introduction by Lester del Rey and Isaac Asimov (Doubleday, $9.95). Onevolume edition of three sciencefiction stories, The Black Star Passes, Island of Space and Invaders from the Infinite.

title: Suzanne Silvercruys, 74, Dies; Sculptor, Painter and Lecturer
description: BALTIMORE, April 1  Suzanne Silvercruys, sculptor, painter, lecturer and author, died here yesterday, apparently of a heart ailment, after becoming ill while on a lecture tour. She was 74 years old and lived in Tucson, Ariz.

title: Garelik, Short of Money, May Quit Mayoral Race
description: I just can't raise the kind of money to do the job, City Council President Sanford D. Garelik said yesterday, suggesting that he was about to abandon his campaign for the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: Soviet Jew Holds Vigil At Mission
description: WASHINGTON, April 1A 25yearold jazz drummer, a former mathematics student born a Russian and a Jew, is ending the first week of a hunger strike a the Soviet Embassy here that he hopes will bring enough pressure on the Soviet Government to force it to allow the emigration of his wife's parents and sister.

title: TIMING ASSESSED IN MALNUTRITION
description: How does malnutrition affect physical and mental development? How lasting are its effects?

title: MOSCOW IS PLANNING U.S. OIL EXHIBITION
description: MOSCOW, April 1With the Soviet Union looking increasingly to the United States for the technology, and capital to speed up development of its massive Siberian oil and gas reserves, Moscow is pressing negotiations for a huge American exhibition of petroleum technology here next fall.

title: Hackett and Dickenson Provide Joyful Listening, Joyful Dancing
description: Bobby Hackett and Vic Dickenson, whose gently lyrical cornet and dryly humorous trombone formed the basis of a delightful jazz quintet several years ago, have been reunited at the Royal Box of the Americana Hotel, where they are supported by the Hank Jones quartet.

title: Departing Traffic Safety Chief Says It's Hard to Find Successor in Hot Seat
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 Douglas W. Toms, the departing head of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, believes the Nixon Administration is having a difficult time finding someone to take his job.

title: 3 Youths Are Seized In South Bronx Fire At a Rescue Facility
description: An explosion and fire caused severe damage in the predawn hours yesterday to a building in the South Bronx being prepared to serve the Model Cities Rescue Corps, a Fire Department facility intended to reduce the toll of lives and property in the slum area.

title: 74Million Goes to Transit FromCarCommuter Tolls
description: The subways are getting an unexpected gift today: $74million from people who travel in automobiles. That is the amount of operating surpluses of 1972 from the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority being turned over to the New York City Transit Authority to help defray a deficit expected to total more than $200million this year.

title: Algerian Facility Planned By Chemical Construction
description: The Chemical Construction Corporation, a subsidiary of the AerojetGeneral Corporation, announced over the weekend plans to start building a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in. Arzew, Algeria by May 1. The announcement followed completion of the authorization and financing arrangements between representatives of the Algerian Government and United States interests, including the Federal Power Commission on Saturday.

title: Spying on Capitol Offices Laid to Watergate Figure
description: WASHINGTON, April 1A member of the Senate committee that is investigating the Watergate bugging case said today that one of the men involved in the illegal wiretapping was ordered last spring to keep the Capitol offices of certain Senators and Representatives under visual surveillance.

title: Attack on U.N.Stirs Literary Row
description: A literary feud, peppered with charges of censorship, cowardice, hypocrisy, male chauvinism and sloppy writing, has boiled over in New York's literary community.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Attack on U.N. Stirs Literary Row
description: A literary feud, peppered with charges of censorship, cowardice, hypocrisy, male chauvinism and sloppy writing, has boiled over in New York's literary community.

title: ONE PERSON KILLED, 11 HURT IN L.l. CRASH
description: BRENTWOOD, L.I., April I (UPI)One person died and 11 were injured in an accident involving a chartered bus and two cars on the Long Island Expressway near Brentwood today.

title: Schoolboy Ties Vault Mark
description: MADISON, Wis., April 1 (AP) Kim Scott, a 5foot10inch, 145pound senior from Madison West High School, tied the national high school indoor pole vault record at a meet here last night by soaring 16 feet inch.

title: HARRIET NEWHALL, MT. HOLYOKE AIDE
description: SOUTH HADLEY, Mass., April 1  Harriet Newhall, director of admissions at Mount Holyoke College from 1939 to her retirement in 1958, died Tuesday in Springfield, where she had been living. She was 80 years old.

title: New Peking Shop Offers Gems of Jade and Mao
description: PEKING, April 1 (Reuters)  Peking opened its new Friendship Store for foreign residents and visitors today. The store's star item was in the supertax bracket range an exquisite piece of green jade set in a gold ring, costing about $95,000.

title: A POST IN ISRAEL FOR KEATING SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 1Reliable diplomatic sources reported today that the former New York Senator, Kenneth B. Keating, would soon be named by President Nixon as the next United States Ambassador to Israel.

title: Campora Back in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 1 (AP)  Presidentelect Hector J. Campora returned today from a weeklong trip to Italy and Spain, where he met with his mentor, former President Juan D. Peron. He also was received by Pope Paul VI, President Giovanni Leone of Italy and the Spanish chief of state, Generalissimo Francisco Franco.

title: A RESORT SHIARES BASQUE TENSIONS
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain March 29A wide sandy beach that borders a horseshoeshaped bay makes this northern city one of Spain's most pleasant and popular summer resorts. Many Spanish officials withdraw to hotels and cliffside villas here from the heat of Madrid every August to carry on the work of government.

title: $16Million Asked in Suits On Sacramento Air Crash
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April 1 (AP)Suits asking for more than $16million for deaths and injuries suffered when a plane crashed into an ice cream parlor here last September have been filed in state and Federal courts.

title: Fire Kills Family of 5
description: NEW MARKET, Va April 1 (AP)  A family of five was killed early Sunday when a fire destroyed their twostory wood frame home two miles east of here. The victims were Otis Minion, 29 years old; his wife, 22, and their three children, David, 4, Debbie Jean, 2, and Otis Jr., 1.

title: Demarest Thwarts Road Plan
description: DEMAREST, April 1Widening the Hardenburg Avenue bridge would have been bad enough. Disturbing the nesting places of the town's flock of Canada geese and chopping Iowa its swamp maples would cave been equally bad. But to make a freeway out of a twisting residential road was simply too much.

title: Credit Sag Leaves Doubts OnInterestRate Direction
Airport Limousine Drivers Walk Out as Talks Falter
description: Drivers for the Long Island Airports Limousine Service Corporation struck yesterday after negotiations for a new contract broke down, a spokesman for the service said

title: Pennsylvania Ballet Stages Butler Work
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 1  The world premiere of John Butler's Black Angel at the Academy of Music this weekend was another signal success for the Pennsylvania Ballet. As he did with According to Eve, for the Alvin Ailey Company earlier this season, in Black Angel Mr. Butler is collaborating with George Crumb's music and Rouben TerArutunian's designs.

title: Advertising: Photos at Downe
description: Time Inc., is thinking about it. Playboy Enterprises has considered it. Now Downe Communications is going to do it. It is going to bring out a photography magazine.

title: Communes of Jewish Students Have Sprung Up on 20 Campuses
description: CLEVELAND  It's difficult to be Jewish ,alone, remarked 20yearold Cindy Pearlman.

title: Two Die in English Gales
description: LONDON, April 2 (UPT)Gales of near hurricane force blew across southeastern England today, causing at least two deaths and widespread damage. A pine tree blown down by the winds crushed a car at Scoulton in Norfolk and killed two men inside. In London's Kensington area, a billboard broke a 21yearold girl's legs,

title: U.S. Calls Charge in U.N. Against Lisbon Unproved
description: GENEVA, April 2The United States described as largely unsubstantiated charges by group of United Nations experts tbat Portugal was waging chemical warfare against the rebels in her African territories.

title: MEDICAL CENTERS OVER DRIVE VOTED
description: The construction of a vast array of medical facilities over the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive was approved by the Board of Estimate yesterday. The vote was 18 to 4, with the Borough Presidents of Manhattan and the Bronx opposed.

title: Botany Plan Is Approved
description: The plan of arrangement for Botany Industries, Inc., and its subsidiary, H. Daroff & Sons, has been approved by its creditors. The Federal Bankruptcy Court in Philadelphia announced that it would set the confirmation date later.

title: Inquiry on Torture Is Asked
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI) The Council Against Communist Aggression, a group formed during the Korean War, called today for formation of a tribunal to investigate charges by freed American prisoners of war that some prisoners had been tortured and killed.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Raissa Struchkova, a senior Bolshoi Ballet ballerina, and the husbandwife team of Yuri Vladimirov and Nina Sorokina will lead a group of 70 dancers from the company and 60 students and recent graduates of the Bolshoi's ballet school in fourweek engagement here. The Soviet group, presented by S. Hurok, will open on June 26 at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: ExManager Severs All Ties With Beatles
description: Allen Klein, who took control of the financial affairs of the Beatles after their manager died in 1968, severed the remnants of his relationship with the singing group yesterday.

title: Misadventures on Chile
description: Harold S. Geneen, chairman of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, maintains in testimony before a Senate Foreign Relations subcommittee that the giant firm he heads did not take any steps to block the election of Salvador Allende as President of Chile and that an I.T.T. director did not offer to contribute anything to the C.I.A., in talks with Richard Helms, then director of the intelligence agency, and with Henry A. Kissinger in the White House in September of 1970.

title: HAUGHTON DRIVES 2 WINNING PACERS
STARS'
Japan Starts to Import Gold Through Private Channels
description: TOKYO, April 2 (Reuter)Industrial gold began to flow into Japan through private channels today as imports, previously handle by the government, were liberalized for the first time since World War II.

title: Supreme Court in Manila Rules Constitution Legal
description: MANILA, April 2The Philippine Supreme Court rejected a series of protests today and declared that there is no further obstacle to the new Constitution, which gives President Ferdinand E. Marcos the right to rte indefinitely until new elections are called.

title: BRITISH RUGBY
description: Gloucester 39, Clifton 4.

title: REYNOLDS TOO, ENDS ALUMINUM DISCOUNT
description: In a move to end discounting the Reynolds Metals Company said yesterday that it would charge the full list price on aluminum ingots as existing commitments expire and as new orders come in.

title: Lennon Sees a Wide Impact in Ouster
description: John Lennon, announcing the appeal of an order to leave the United States by May 21, sought yesterday to show that the Justice Department's legal arguments in the action against him had made it not just JohnandYoko case but one where many cases hinge on the outcome.

title: Equity Financing
description: A special offering of 38,750 common shares of the Hospital Corporation of America at 17 per share was made yesterday by Bear Stearns & Co. The company's stock was down  at 17 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: OLIVER HURD EVERETT
description: LONDONDERRY, Vt., April 2  Oliver Hurd Everett, an investment broker, died of cancer today at the United Hospital in Port Chester, N. Y. He kas 56 years old and lived here.

title: Arthur Berger: A Retrospective Of His Music
description: As a timecapsule report on what the American academic establishment has been up to in musical composition during the last 30 years, Sunday night's program of Arthur Berger's works at Carnegie Recital Hall might serve surprisingly well. Mr. Berger, as teacher, critic and editor, has been.at the center of this country's musical life, and a birthday, retrospective (he is 60 years old) was in order.

title: WILLIAM PLUMMER JR.
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 2 William Plummer Jr., former chairman of the Hires Turner Glass Company of Wilmington, Del., and past president of the National Association of Glass Distributors, died yesterday in Bryn Mawr Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived in Radnor.

title: American Can Ca. to Sell Mill to Weyerhaeuser Co.
description: The American Can Company and the Weyerhaeuser Company yesterday announced the signing of a letter of intent for the sale of American Can's pulp and paper mill at Rothschild, Wis., to Weyerhaeuser. The sales price was not disclosed.

title: Egg Roll on. April 23
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP)  The traditional White Housi Easter egg rolling event will be held Easter Monday, April 23 Circus performers will add a new attraction for the young sters. The frolic on the South Lawn will be from 10 A.M. to 2 P.M., with military bands per forming.

title: STATE PANEL ASKS ENDING OF H.D A.
description: Branding the city's Housing and Development Administration counterproductive and severely wanting, a state study group urged yesterday that the superagency be dismantled and replaced by a new system that would include Deputy Mayor for Housing.

title: Prices and Turnover on Amex And Counter Register Declines
Condemned Man Wins a Parole For First Time in State History
description: TRENTON, April 2  The first parole ever given to a man in state prison who had been condenmed to death was disclosed here by the. State Parole Board.

title: CONGRESSMEN JOIN SCUBA DIVING CLUB
description: WASHINGTON, April 2, It's a beautiful new world down there. I'd like to do more of it.

title: Ban on Alaska Oil Pipeline Left Standing by Justices
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 The Supreme Court declined to review today a decision barring Federal officials from authorizing construction of the TransAlaskan oil pipeline,

title: Mulcahy to E. Kentucky
description: RICHMOND, Ky., April (AP)Bob Mulcahy, the head basketball coach at the University of South Dakota, was named to a similar post today. at Eastern Kentucky University, his alma mater. He succeeds Guy Strong, who moved to Oklahoma State.

title: Women's WorkRights Measure Passed
description: ALBANY, April 2After some sharp differences over women's liberation, the Assembly today passed a bill that would end longstanding strictures requiring certain women to, work fewer hours than men and preventing a woman from returning to work sooner than a month after giving birth.

title: Expert Cautions Nixon On Dispute With Ervin
description: WASHINGTON, April 2A professor of law at President Nixon's alma mater, Duke Univeresity Law School, cautioned Mr. Nixon today, against pressing his differences with Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. over an interpretation of the executive privilege doctrine.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: New Construction Dips
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (Reuters)The value of new construction. put in place in February was at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $135.3 billion, the Commerce Department announced today.

title: Advertising: Motorcycle Time
description: If they learned nothing else, weekend television watchers learned that we have entered the motorcycleselling season. They also learned that the only cycles being advertised on the tube are made in Japan.

title: Shift of Hambletonian To Saratoga Is Sought
New Knick Ticket Plan Is Weighed
description: While capacity crowds scream in delight at Knickerbocker playoff games, there are cries of disappointment and anger from thousands of basketball fans about the method of distributing tickets.

title: Research Voyage Finds Atlantic Ocean Breathes
description: A ninemonth voyage from the Arctic to the Antarctic by the research vessel Knorr has led to the discovery that carbon dioxide produced by the smokestacks of the Northern Hemisphere is being inhaled by North Atlantic waters and exhaled by the South Atlantic.

title: Brandeis Protest Staged For Aid to Needy Students
description: WALTHAM, Mass., April 2 (AP)Faced with a, restraining order and a show of force, members of the Third World Coalition left the Brandeis University administration building tonight after occupying it for about nine hours.

title: People and Business
description: Ib Thomsen, the 47yearold president of Goodyear International, was named yesterday to the additional post of an executive vice president of the company's parent, the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company. Mr. Thomsen, a Dane who also worked for Goodyear in Sweden, India and Britain, was named head of the international subsidiary last year.

title: New Orleans Superdome Seeks Yanks as Tenants
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 7The Yankees and the Mets played their second game on a makeshift baseball field at City Park stadium tonight, but when they come here two years from now, they'll play the first baseball game in the $151million Superdome. Furthermore, it's conceivable the Yankees could play some regular season games as the home team in the Superdome in 1975.

title: DR. LOUIS N. KATZ, RESEARCHER, DIES
description: CHICAGO, April 2 (AP)Dr. Louis N. Katz, a medical researcher who pioneered in determining the. cause of hardening of the arteries, died today. He was 75 years old.

title: Meat Store Looted Of HighCost Items, But Not of Chicken
description: Theyre just plain, lousy crooks who are capitalizing on the boycott, remarked Joseph Rothenberg, owner of the meat store at 1040 Third Avenue, between 62d and 61st Streets.

title: Suit Filed to Drop Davis From Raiders'
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., April 2Wayne Valley, the major owner of the Oakland Raiders football franchise, filed a suit today seeking to dismiss Al Davis, who runs the team for him so successfully. Valley alleged that Davis and a minority owner, Ed McGah, arranged a new sweetheart contract for Davis as the club's managing general partner without Valley's knowledge. Davis has, signed the contract, one for 20 years, and the suit filed in Oakland will attempt to nullify it.

title: STOCKS TUMBLE AS VOLUME DROPS
200 PATH Riders Take a Slow Boat
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., April  Two hundred of the more affluent commuters of the struck PATH line avoided congested roads and crowded trains today by taking a panoramic trip to lower Manhattan in a 120foot fishing boat.

title: GOVERNOR SCORES PLAN ON TAX CUTS
description: ALBANY. April 2Governor Rockefeller said tonight that a disposition in the. Legislature for tax cuts this year, a movement fostered in large measure by the Republican majority leaders, was unwise and irresponsible.

title: Shield Bill for Newsmen Is Approved by Nebraska
description: LINCOLN, Neb., April 2An unqualified shield bill for newsmen was posted today by the Nebraska Legislature. The vote was 39 to 6.

title: Price of Colt Car Raised
description: DETROIT, April 2 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation announced today that it was raising the price of its Japaneseproduced Dodge Colt an average of $183 because of changes in currency rates between the United States and Japan. The company also put into effect a previously announced increase on domestic cars.

title: CITY POLICEMEN CLEARED IN BRIBE
description: NEWARK, April 2 (AP) Eigh': present and former New York City policemen were round not guilty by a Federal jury today of charges they took payoffs to protect an $8million numbers racket operating on both sides of the Hudson River.

title: Who, Why and What?
description: To those who never answered us: We had been given permission to go. My son, aged 17, who had wisely changed his name for a bettersounding one, came to embrace me for the, last time.

title: ARTHUR P. COATES
description: CHESHIRE, Conn., April 2 Arthur P. Coates, who retired in 1962 as a director of Tiffany & Co., the New York jewelers, died yesterday. He was 85 years old and lived here.

title: C.B.S. Adds Shaft Series
description: Shaft, a 90minute dramatic series based on the popular movie of the same name, has been added to next season's Columbia Broadcasting System television schedule.

title: AMERICAN SEIZES A SAIGON ROBBER
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 2A Vietnamese bandit dressed as a policeman who had been robbing American officials and civilians in downtown Saigon was caught today when one of his intended victims pulled a gun.

title: Judge Seals Jury Report On Sale of Suffolk Beach
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., April 2The greater part of a secret gradd jury report urging sweeping revisions in the methods by which Suffolk County condemns private land for public use was ordered sealed forever today by a County Court judge.

title: Two Tracks Vs. Eight Lanes
description: New or renewed rail transit is an idea whose time has come, despite the highway lobby's propaganda. Here are a few facts to support that proposition:

title: Coast Guard Is Discontinuing MidOcean Patrols and Retiring 10 Old Cutters
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP)The Coast Guard said today that 10 of its older cutters would be retired over the next year because the ocean stations they have been patrolling in the Atlantic and the Pacific are being discontinued.

title: Dresdner Plans Expansion
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, April 2 (UPI)  The Dresdner Bank, one of West Germany's oldest finance hatuses, plans to open a branch in Japan, the Chairman of the Board, Juergen Ponto said today. Ponto said the Dresdner Bank had asked the Japanese Finance Ministry for permission for project. The bank now operates foreign branches in Singapore, New York, London, Moscow and Los Angeles.

title: MEDICAL CENTERS OVER DRIVE VOTED
description: The construction of a vast array of medical facilities over the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive was approved by the Board of Estimate yesterday. The vote was 18 to 4, with the Borough Presidents of Manhattan and the Bronx opposed.

title: NIXON AND THIEU OPEN 2DAY TALKS
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., April 2President Nixon and President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam opened a twoday conference here today in what the White House called an atmosphere of friendship and cordiality.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Eastern StandardTime
description: AFRICAN COMET (Farrell), Capetown April 16; sails from Joralemon St., Brooklyn.

title: 34 Saved as Freighter Sinks
description: HONOLULU, April 2 (UPI)The American cargo ship Silver Dove sank today in the Pacific 220 miles southwest of Johnston Island. The Coast Guard said the ship went down before dawn but all 34 crewmen from the 292foot vessel were rescued early yesterday.

title: Badillo Displays Concern for Wagner's Intentions in Scramble for the Democratic Mayoral Nomination
description: Four years ago, Robert F. Wagner in effect pulled the rug out from under Herman Badillo when the former Mayor entered the Democratic mayoral primary at the laat minute and thus divided tlie liberal Democratic vote with Mr. Badillo so that both lost to Mario A. Procaccino.

title: Rutgers Law Schools Accused 0f Breaking EducationAid Rule
description: TRENTON, April 2  The Rutgers University Law Schools at Camden and Newark are not complying with academic and financialneed guidelines established for the distribution of education aid under the State's 1968 Economic Opportunity Fund, a state legislative watchdog agency charged today.

title: Red Meat Decadence
description: Nobody who remembers the Depression of the nineteenthirties will be impressed by the heroism of boycotting meat for a single week. During all the years of that era there must have been one or two pieces of beef, a panfried steak somewhere in 1934 or 1935 surely, but if so it left no imprint in memory.

title: Faure Chosen French Assembly Chief
description: PARIS, April 2  The newly elected National Assembly, responding to demands for more effective legislative forum, elected Edgar Faure today as its President.

title: Notes on People
description: Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany will visit Israel for four days in June in the first visit to the Jewish state by a German head of government. Mr. Brandt was in Israel in 1960 when he was Mayor of West Berlin. He was scheduled to make his first visit as Chancellor last fall, but the trip was delayed by West German elections and by the assassination of 11 Israeli athletes by Arab terrorists at the Olympic Games in Munich. On his trip to Israel, Mr. Brandt will be accompanied by his wife and is scheduled to confer with Premier Golda Mein.

title: JOSEPH E. KNIGHT, 61, KERNER AIDE, IS DEAD
description: CHICAGO, April 2 (AP)JOseph E. Knight, a Democratic, party official in Illinois for 40 years, died today in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 61 years old.

title: Justices to Review Charges by Blacks Of Bias in Law Enforcement in Illinois
description: WASHINGTON, April 2The Supreme Court agreed today to review charges by a group of Illinois blacks that state judges and law enforcement officials there had systematically discriminated against them in conducting investigations, setting bail and imposing sentences.

title: Lexington Tops Cincinnati In A.A.U. Basketball Final
description: ASHLAND; Ky., April 2 (AP)  George Bryant scored 29 points to spark Lexington, Ky., to an 8584 victory over Cincinnati in the title game of the 66th annual Amateur Athletic Union men's basketball championships tonight. The Lexington victory ended a fiveyear championship reign by the Armed Forces AllStars.

title: SOVIET ORDERING INDUSTRY REFORM OVER THREE YEARS
description: MOSCOW, April 2  The Kremlin ordered today a reorganization of this, nation's industry as part of a continuing search for an efficient system of managing the vast Governmentrun Soviet economy.

title: Record $1.5Million for Paperback That Revels in
Judge Denies an Extension Of Time in Judiciay Race
description: Jacob D. Fuchsberg lost court effort yesterday to extend the time allowed for filing petitions for chief judge of the Court of Appeals in the Democratic primary elections scheduled for June 4.

title: Dr. Matthew,Calls Arrest A PoliticalThing by D.A.
description: Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, the black selfhelp advocate who was arrested Sunday for allegedly taking $250,000 of Medicaid payments from his Interfaith Hospital, charged yesterday that his arrest was a political thing to use a popular black man to whitewash their own problems.

title: 6 Million Acres Flooded by Mississippi
description: VICKSBURG, Miss., April 2The water of the Mississippi River is higher than it has been in a generation and the Army Corps of Engineers is fighting with increasing anxiety to keep it in its levees.

title: U.N. GROUP DEEMS APARTHEID A CRIME
description: GENEVA, April 2  The United Nations Human Rights Commission approved today the draft of a convention that would make apartheid, the racial segregation practiced in South Africa, and similar policies of racial segregation a crime against humanity.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
The Mysterious Mushroom Feels Impact of Canned Imports
description: TOUGHKENANON, Pa. The ancient Chinese called mushrooms the divine fruit of immortality. Russian peasants are said to talk to them and Buddha., reportedly ate bowl or two before being translated to nirvana. The Aztecs thought mushrooms were God's flesh,4nd the preChristian Guatemalans not only talked to them, ancient carvings suggest, but they also believed the mushrooms occasionally talked back.

title: Leeds United Wins, 10
description: COVENTRY, England, April 2 (Reuters)Leeds United beat Coventry City, 10, tonight in an English Football League Division One match.

title: An Organist ImprovisesWith Eclat
description: There have been musicians in our time who devoted part of a concert to improvisation. It is hard to think of an entire concert devoted to improvisations. But that is what the. French organist Pierre Cochereau did at the console of the Philharmonic Hall, organ on Sunday night.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Grumman Aerospace Corporation, a subsidiary of the Grumman Corporation, received a $16million addition to a previously awarded Navy contract for E2C carrierbased reconnaissance aircraft; it was announced yesterday.

title: DR, NATHAN EDDY, DRUG DEVELOPER
description: BETHESDA, Md., April 2Dr. Nathan B. Eddy, who was widely known for his research on painrelieving drugs, died Wednesday at his home here. He was. 82 years old.

title: Meat Sales Drop 80% in Places as the Boycott Begins
description: Supermarkets in the New York metropolitan area began to feel the impact of the meat boycott by consumers yesterday, as shoppers shunned beef, pork and lamb to protest high prices.

title: Triumph American's Bid For General Host Ended
description: Triumph American, Inc., announced yesterday it was withdrawing its recent cash tender offer to buy 51 per cent of the outstanding common stock of the General Host Corporation for $19.8million.

title: Official Says a Medicaid Defect Cost State $50Million Last Year
description: ALBANY, April 2  State Social Services Commissioner Abe Lavine said today that the state had unnecessarily paid at least $50million last year in Medicaid funds for people who instead should have had their medical bills paid by private health insurance.

title: Top Executives Changed By Equity Funding Corp.
description: The Equity Funding Corporation of America, rocked by widespread reports of major financial irregularities in a life insurance subsidiary hurriedly reshuffled its top management yesterday.

title: NEW TRUCE BODY PERILED AS SAIGON ORDERS BOYCOTT
N.C.A.A. AND A.A.U. ATTEMPT ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI)  The National Collegiate Athletic Association and the Amateur Athletic Union agreed today to attempt settlement of their dispute that threatened the upcoming basketball series between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: Juvenile Justice: Helpless Frustration
description: Juvenile crime is skyrocketing, and the city's juvenile justice system finds itself able to do;little, to stem it.

title: NIXON AND THIEU OPEN 2DAY TALKS
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., April 2President. Nixon and President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam. opened It twoday conference here today in what the White House called an atmosphere of friendship and cordiality.

title: Chess: Strategy v. Tactics, Wherein 99% Proves to Be Insufficient
Queens Bus Line Disrupted By Wildcat Work Stoppage
description: ueens Transit Corporation, which operates buses in Queens and to and from Manhattan, was struck by drivers yesterday in a dispute over the suspension of an employe, but a spokesman, said that service was restored shortly before 6 P.M.

title: Pyramid Sales Are Now Chief Consumer Fraud Here
description: James Green is an energetic black civil servant in his 40's who signed on with a sales outfit called the P.R.I.C.E. Club in July, 1971. He had visions of finally making big money. Today, James Green is $5,000 in debt and his life savings are gone. He is another victim of the pyramid sales scheme.

title: Scholars Compare 2 Black Poets
description: These lines, penned To a Captious Critic, were written near the turn of the century by the black American poet Paul Laurence Dunbar, whose short life ran from 1872 to 1906.

title: Morocco Bans Leftist Party And Seizes Many Members
description: RABAT, Morocco, April 2 The Moroccan Government today outlawed the leading leftist political party after charging that its members had led a terrorist movement discovered last month.

title: Prison Uprising in Rhode Island Quelled by Troopers and Guards
description: CRANSTON, R. I., April 2 (AP)Four guards were reported injured before the state police helped quell a prisoner uprising that also left heavy fire damage at Rhode Island's Adult Correctional Institutions this afternoon.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Massachusetts plans to ask permission to exhume the body of Ellen Reich, who was murdered last year while attending Emerson College in Boston. Miss Reich was buried in a cemetery in Hackensack.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The March 3 news article on the tragic public school integration problems of Charlotte, N. C., cites local and regional factors underlying recent violent behavior of black and white students toward each other. Omitted was any mention of the effect of the national mood and attitude toward racial integration upon the children in integrated classrooms.

title: U.S. Negotiator Says Surrender Of Wounded Knee Is Imminent
description: PINE RIDGE, S.D., April 2The surrender of Wounded Knee by insurgent Indians could come in two or three days, Assistant Attorney General Kent Frizzell said tonight.

title: Calley Appeals Conviction To Highest Military Court
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. appealed his conviction today for killing civilians at My Lai in South Vietnam.

title: 5 CITY DETECTIVES SUSPENDED IN BRIBE
description: The Police Department announced yesterday the suspension of five detectives who were accused of accepting a $15,000 bribe on Sept. 21, 1970, for not arresting a Queens couple on narcotics charges.

title: Senate Vote on Pray Sought
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI)  The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield, said today that he would try to schedule a vote by the full Senate on L. Patrick Gray 3d's nomination to be F.B.I. director.even if the Judiciftry Committee does not endorse Mr. Gray.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, April 2 (UPI)  The dollar continued strengthen in European money markets today and the price of gold dropped below Friday's rate of $90 an ounce. The pound sold at $2.4757 just before the close, a net loss of 18 points on the day. But the pound did well against most European currencies.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Pro football averaged a record 57,395 fans for regular season games in 1972 and attracted 15,059,364 over all, including playoffs and preseason games, according National Football League figures released yesterday. The total was an increase of 4.78 per cent over 1971.

title: TALK OF WIRETAPS SPREADS IN ITALY
description: ROME, April 2A judicial inquiry into largescale wire tapping practices here has brought the arrest of more than 20 persons, but while there is increasing talk about the scandal, very little has been made public about it.

title: Rocimfeller Again Terms Wagner Best for Mayor
description: ALBANY, April 2Governor Rockefeller, in a cautiously worded statement, today reaffirmed his support of former Mayor Robert F. Wagner as a candidate for Mayor of New York City despite Mr. Wagner's refusal to run for his old office on the Republican line.

title: Owners Name Skipper For Intrepid's Cup Bid
description: Gerald Driscoll of San Diego and Bill Buchan of Seattle, both former world champions in Star Class sailing, have been named skipper and assistant helmsman, respectively, the 12Meter yacht Intrepid's America's Cup campaign.

title: INTEREST RUES RISE SOME MORE
Glen Cove Butcher joins The Meatless Movement
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., April 2Ken Rojek, Bohack's meat manager, sold only $35 worth of meat until noon.

title: MUSKIE CAUTIONS ON ONEMAN RULE
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Senator Edmund S. Muskie declared tonight that Congress would resist any effort by PresIdent Nixon to assert oneman rule over the Government.

title: VESCO, IN COSTA RICA, SUES N.Y. LAWYER
description: SAN JUAN, Costa Rica, April 2 (UPI)Robert L. Vesco filed suit in San Jose criminal court today charging a New York lawyer with malfeasance and defamation.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Branding the city's Housing and Development Administration counterproductive and severely wanting, state study group urged yesterday that the controversial superagency be dismantled and replaced by a new system that would include a Deputy Mayor for Housing.

title: Jascha Horenstein, a Conductor And Recording Artist, 74, Dead
description: LONDON, April 2 (Reuters)Jascha Horenstein, the conductor, died today in a hospital here at the age of 74. He had entered the hospital last week for heart surgery.

title: U.S. Bill Rates Rise At Treasury Auction
Main Course Is Reef At Dinner for Thieu
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP)President Nixon and the Western White House are not taking part in the meat boycott and an expensive cut of beef was on the menu for a dinner tonight in honor of President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam.

title: 2 G.I.'s Occupy Police Tower in the Heart of Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 2Two American soldiers, armed with light machine guns and M16 rifles, holed up in a hilltop police box here for nine hours today demanding honorable discharge from Army service and a safe trip out of South Korea. But they surrendered peace, fully after appeals by two of their G.I. friends.

title: UTILITY FORECASTS RISE IN CAPACITY
description: The General Public Utilities Corporation expects to increase its installed generating capacity by some 87 per cent over the next eight years, William G. Kuhns, president, told some 250 stockholders at yesterday's.annual meeting at One Chase Manhattan Plaza.

title: To Rural Turkey, Political Strife Is Distant
description: ANKARA, Turkey  Across the bleak Anatolian plain of central Turkey, the fields that stretch as far as the eye can see are lightly greening with spring wheat sprouting amoni patches of snow.

title: Greek Orthodox Bishops Refuse To Accept Primate's Resignation
description: ATHENS, April 2Archbishop) Ieronymos withdrew his resignation as primate of Greece's Orthodox Church today after being told that the Holy Synod, the church's cabinet, had ordered him to stay on.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Four manufacturers in the fur industry pleaded not guilty yesterday to charges that they had paid off union officials to permit violations of labor agreements in the city's Garment District. The pleas were made in Federal Court here by Karl Schwartzbaum, Sam Sherman, Harry Hessel and Sol Cohen, who were indicted last week with seven officials of the Furriers Joint Council. The seven union officials had pleaded not guilty earlier.

title: A TORTURE VICTIM ASKS AID TO HANOI
description: WASHINGTON, April 2The highestranking American diplomat held prisoner in Vietnam said today that despite torture and four and a half years of solitary confinement, he advocated giving American economic aid to North Vietnam to generate a stable peaceful coexistence between the two countries.

title: Neighbors Denounce Interfaith Hospital
description: Residents of the Jamaica neighborhood where Dr. Thomas W. Matthew's Interfaith Hospital is situated said last night that they hoped it would be closed permanently.

title: Showers Continue. Second Day; Minor Flooding Delays Drivers
description: April showerswith only occasional lapses into the heavy rains of the weekendcame New York's way yesterday, producting minor problems for motorists, puddle obstacles for pedestrians and reflections on rainslick streets for windowsitters.

title: Writers Honor Havlicek, Cunningham
description: John Havlicek of the Boston Celtics, Bob McAdoo of the Buffalo Braves, Billy Cunningham of the Carolina Cougars and Brian Taylor of the Nets were the pro players honored yesterday at the Metropolitan Basketball Writers Association's 40th annual awards luncheon at Mamma Leone's.

title: Valid Boycott
description: Never underestimate the power of the embattled consumer. Outraged by President Nixon's belated decision to fix ceilings on meat prices only after they had soared to the highest levels in history, millions of Americans are seekingalmost spontaneouslyto impose their own discipline on the marketplace by refusing to buy steak, chops or other cuts of meat at the present wildly inflated prices.

title: ERVIN IN A CLASH WITH WHITE HOUSE OVER WATERGATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. and the White House engaged to day in a blunt and spirited exchange over the Watergate case. The clash held significant implications for the current Congressional investigation of the affair.

title: OneYear Contract Reached With State By Prison Guards
description: ALBANY, April 2 (UPI)The union representing the state's 3,500 prison guards and another 3,500 workers in the state security unit yesterday announced tentative agreement on a new oneyear contract with, the state.

title: NEARBY CONTRACT IN CATTLE STEADY
description: Although the meat boycott is on, nearby April live cattle futures delivery held steady yesterday at the close of trading, showing little change from Friday.

title: AMTRAK ANNOUNCES U.S. FARE CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) Amtrak, The National Railroad Passenger Corporation said hoday that it would raise some Western and Midwestern fares 10 or 12 per cent and reduce some fares in other areas as much as 19 per cent April 29.

title: Corning. Glass Works Reports Sales and Profit Set New Highs
PRINTERS TO RESUME TALKS WITH PAPERS
description: Typographical Union No, and the city's three major dailies are scheduled to resume contract talks today.

title: LOW CHARTER FARES FROM EUROPE BEGUN
description: LONDON, April 2 (Reuters) Cutrate air charter travel began across the Atlantic today, on a flight from Manchester, England, to Toronto for as little as $112 round trip.

title: Renata Tebaldi Enraptures Her Fans
description: Renata Tebaldi swept ont the stage of Carnegie Hall on Sunday night, the glamorou opera diva from head to to No other opera singer of the last 25 years inspires quite the same kind of love and devotion from her fans, and needless say everything she sang, short chronological survey the nonetoonourishing Italian song repertory, was receive, with unmodified rapture.

title: The Choices in Watergate
description: Although I decline. with thanks the protection offered me by President Nixon's declaration extending executive privilege to all former White House aides, no previous White House counsel could be unmoved by the plight of the present counsel, John W. Dean 3d. No doubt mindful of the tradition among his predecessors to maintain their vows of secrecy at least until their memoirs are published, Mr. Dean has invoked the privilege in refusing to appear before a Senate committee, thereby provoking threats of his arrest by the Senate sergeantatarms.

title: Construction Set to Start For Algerian Gas Project
description: HOUSTON, April 2, (AP) The El Paso Natural Gas Company announced today that construction would begin immediately on a $1.7billion project to deliver liquefied natural gas from Algeria to the East Coast.

title: Meat Sales Drop 80% in Places as the Boycott Begins
description: Supermarkets in the New York metropolitan area began to feel the impact of the meat boycott by consumers yesterday, as shoppers shunned beef, pork and lamb to protest high prices.

title: DR. ERNEST L. HETTICH
description: Dr. Ernest L. Hettich, professor emeritus of classics and director emeritus of the library system at New York University, died on March 20 at his home in Sandyston Township, Sussex County, N. J. He was 75 years old.

title: Geneen Concedes I.T.T. Fund Offer To Block Allende
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Harold S. Geneen, chairman of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, said today that he did not recall having offered a substantial sum of money to the Central Intelligence Agency in 1970 to help prevent the election of Salvador Allende Gossens as President of Chile.

title: Corporate Capital Outflow Down by Almost $3Billion
description: WASHINGTON, April 3 (Reuters)Net corporate capital outflows amounted to $1.478billion in 1972, a drop of $2.934billion from 1971 levels, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: A Gasoline Shortage Soon Is Predicted
description: The Petroleum Industry Research Fotindation, Inc., yesterday released a study predicting a gasoline shortage of 125,000. barrels a day in this year's second and third quarters.

title: Brandt Parries Barzel Attack By Affirming Loyalty to NATO
description: BONN, April 2  Chancellor Willy Brandt, rejecting an accusation by the Opposition conservatives that his Government was fostering antiAmericanism, issued a fourpoint declaration of loyalty to the Atlantic alliance today.

title: Embezzling Banker Wins at Race Track But Ends Up a Loser
description: On Oct. 27, 1971, a bank supervisor's unhappiness turned to joy when he won $25,350 on. an exacta at Yonkers Raceway, enabling him to make restitution of $6,665 he had embezzled to cover his earlier gamblings.

title: 9,000 Teachers Strike Hawaif's Public Schools
description: HONOLULU, April 2Nearly 9,000 public school teachers throughout Hawaii went on strike today in the nation's first statewide teacher walkout.

title: 300 Evacuated as a Train With Ammonia Gas Derails
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., April 2 (UPI)  Nearly 40 cars of Southern Railway freight train derailed yesterday and ammonia gas leaked from several of the tank cars, forcing evacuation of about 300 persons from a mobile home park.

title: NEW TRUCE BODY PERILED AS SAIGON ORDERS BOYCOTT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, April 3The TwoParty Joint Military Commission, which began operating as a peacekeeping body only five days ago, was threatened with collapse today in a dispute over a besieged South Vietnamese ranger outpost.

title: F.B.I. Is Accused of Political Spying
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI)With a Senate committee vote nearing on L. Patrick Gray 3d to be permanent director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Representative Les Aspin charged today that the Nixon Administration had used the F.B.I. as a political peeping Tom since taking office in 1969.

title: Armco Sets Steel Deal
description: The Armco Steel Corporation said yesterday it had entered into a technical assistance agreement with the Yugoslavian steel mills of Skopje and Smederevo. Terms were not disclosed. Armco said the agreement would cover all stages of steel processing.

title: WILLIAM H. ZIMMER
description: LAKE CITY, Fla., April 2 (AP)William H. Zimmer, retired president and board chairman of the Cincinnati Gas & Electric Company, died last night at the age of 67.

title: Insurer Told to Cut Rates
description: SEATTLE, April 2 (UPI) The state Insurance Commissioner, Karl Herrman, today ordered Safeco Insurance Company to roll back its automobile insurance rates by 27.5 per cent for its nearly 250,000 Washington policy holders as a result of overcharges in its current rate structure.

title: FUND IMPOUNDING MISSOURI UPSET
description: ST. LOUIS, April 2The Nixon Administration's impoundment of Federal highway construction funds appropriated by Congress for the state of Missouri is illegal, the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit ruled today.

title: Money Mechanism of Fed Defended
description: WASHINGTON, April 2The Federal Reserve Board's yearold technique for controlling more accurately the nation's money supply is alive and well despite some fears outside the Reserve that it was not working, a board member said today.

title: LOUIS FRANKLIN
description: Louis Franklin, a manufacurturing jeweler and president of the corporation bearing his name at 29 West 57th Street, diec Sunday at his home. He was 96 years old and lived at 907 Fifth Avenue.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FINISHED PHOTOS The Witkin Gallery is up a flight of stairs on the busy block of East 60th Street between Second and Third Avenues, at No. 243 (3551461). On a weekend, at least, it is about as busy as the street below, with camera fans and photo fanciers filling the front and rear galleries. Witkin has been on this street for four years, selling photo prints and books on the subject to which it is devoted.

title: Screen: Museum of Modern Art Presents New Directors Series
description: Now in its second year, the New DirectorsNew Films series currently at the Mu seum of Modern Art comes as something of an old friend and a cultural ornament in a movie season not overloaded with cultural ornaments, or old friends. The series, presented jointly by the museum and the Film So ciety of Lincoln Center, serves as a modest but adventurous appendix to the more institutionalized New York Film Festival.

title: Television
description: 6:30 (2)Sunrise Semester

title: A Fashionable Word on Seventh Avenue: Reorganization
description: Although many store buyers are in Paris, things haven't been exactly dull on Seventh Avenue. Closings or the rumors of closingsof several wellknown American design houses are keeping tongues wagging and telephones ringing.

title: HECTOR CASTRO, 78, LATIN ENVOY TO U.S.
description: SAN SALVADOR, April 2 (AP)  Hector David Castro, one of El Salvador's most distinguished diplomats and a former Ambassador to the United States, died yesterday at the age of 78.

title: UNIFORMITY URGED IN AUTO INSPECTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI)  The Government proposed today Federal safety inspection standards for the nation's nearly 100 million used cars, including uniform brake, tire and steering tests.

title: Cell Messengers Linked to Diseases
description: NOGALES, Ariz., April 2An evolving understanding of the chemical messengers that control the activities of individual body cells may lead to new ways to treat such diverse diseases as psoriasis, asthma and cancer, it was reported today.

title: TV: Portrait of Dr. King
description: The faces and comments of two genuinely beautiful people, the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his widow, Coretta, light up the home screen for an hour tonight at 10 over Channel 9. The character, the earthiness and something closely akin to nobility are there, plain to see and certainly to contemplate.

title: ASSEMBLY PASSES RAIL SUBSIDY BILL
MUSKIE CAUTIONS ON ONEMAN RULE
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Senator Edmund S. Muskie declared tonight that Congress would resist any effort by President Nixon to assert oneman rule over the Government.

title: U.N. IS SURPRISED BY VIETCONG MOVE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 2United Nations authorities say they have been caught surprise by the Vietcong's pointment of a diplomat represent the Provisional Revolutionary Government at United Nations.

title: Nixon Veto of a Freeze Bill Would Not Surprile Shultz
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz said today he wouldn't be surprised if President Nixon vetoed any legislation that would freeze prices, rents and interest rates, and urged Congress simply to extend the President's existing economic control authority.

title: Stage: The Karl Marx Play Arrives
Argentine Terrorists Kidnap American and Admiral
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 2 A retired Argentine rear admiral and a United States business executive were kidnapped today in separate incidents.

title: Zoo Loses Snakes and. Bird
description: PROVIDENCE, April 2 (AP) Two boa constrictor snakes and a South American Lory bird were stolen over the weekend from the Roger Williams Park Zoo.

title: 1,000 Attend First U.S. Design Assembly
description: WASHINGTON, April 2The first Federal Design Assembly, the Government's initial move to upgrade design in all of its agencies, attracted about 1,000 top Federal and state administrators and design professionals for the opening session here tonight.

title: 200 PATH Riders Go by Boat
description: By MICHAEL J. BOYLAN Special to The New York Times HOBOKEN, N. J., April Two hundred of the more affluent commuters of the struck PATH line avoided congested roads and crowded trains today by taking a panoramic trip to lower Manhattan in a 120foot fishing boat.

title: PROTEST PLANNED ON DAY CARE CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, April 2  A coalition of child care interests has named April 10 National Working Mother's Day and is urging mothers to take their children to work with them on that day.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: CEDAR GROVE, N. J., April 2Steve Sobel, a 40yearold attorney who once starred at Columbia University as saber specialist, has helped to make New Jersey one of the most active fencing centers.

title: At the Paris Shows, Lots of Smoke but. Not Much Fire
description: PARIS, April 2A tightrope walker balancing a pole high above the heads of the fashion show audience at the Bourse du Commerce, the commodities exchange here. The esthetic strippers at the Crazy Horse Saloon, proving they can put on clothes as gracefully as they take them off. Assorted bicyclists, jugglers and fireworks displays. A tango contest at the Salle Wagram, where Last Tango in Paris was filmed.

title: RANGERS, BRUINS START TOMORROW
Renewing Housing...
description: While figures on the city's prolonged housing shortage are as shaky as the shells of some of its abandoned buildings, housing deterioration may no longer be outpacing housing construction. Especially encouraging are reports of progress in rehabilitating older buildingsstructures needing freshening up, even new plumbing and rewiring, but otherwise basically sound. The subsidized conversion of lowincome and middleincome housing to cooperatives has been part of this process; it deserves still further public support. Mayor Lindsay's recent announcement that some 1,200 apartment units are to be renovated and converted into tenantowned cooperatives and his statement yesterday that 2,100 buildings in three depressed areas are to be rehabilitated, signal a good start on what could be a much larger and bolder program.

title: SOVIET ORDERING INDUSTRY REFORM OYER THREE YEARS
description: MOSCOW, April 2  The Kremlin ordered today a reorganization of this nation's industry as part of a continuing search for an efficient system of managing the vast Governmentrun Soviet economy.

title: Windup in Cambodia
description: No one can dispute Secretary of Defense Elliot Richardson's assertion that it would be very difficult for the Cambodian Government of President Lon Nol survive without the massive American air support it currently receiving. The commander in chief of Cambodia's crumbling forces has said as much.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: ITHACA, N. Y.  Two spawning rainbow trout hovered side by side on the edge of a run in the creek, and as we watched from a wooded bank eight feet above them, an ecstatic shudder went through the smaller fish the male.

title: Nets Again Unveil Baum, Secret Playoff Weapon
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Value Added Tax Confusing to Britons
description: LONDON, April 2  The British public came to grips today with the Value Added Tax, the system of indirect taxation in use in the Europen Economic Community.

title: Bridge: Boy TitleWinner Grows Up Into Youngest Life Masters
description: About two years ago, an alert, mature 13yearold boy created a minor sensation by winning a title in a NassauSuffolk sectional tournament. Now even more alert and even more mature, Bobbie Levin has created a major sensation by becoming the youngest Life Master ever, beating by a month the record set by Joseph Livezey of Springfield, Pa.

title: TVNEWS CREDIBILITY CITED BY 48% IN POLL
description: Fortyeight per cent of Americans consider television the most believable of the four major media, according to a survey taken by the Roper Organization for the Television Information Office of the National Association of Broadcasters.

title: Defertse Seeking Mistrial In Magee Case on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 2After 53 hours of jury deliberation, the defense requested the California Court of Appeals to order Judge Morton Colvin to declare a mistrial in the Ruchell Magee case and dismiss the jury.

title: Rifle Group Elects Head
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) C. R. Gutermuth today was elected president of the National Rifle Association for 197374 at the final business session of the organization's annual meeting.

title: PATH RIDERS COPE RUT MEET DELAYS
description: Regular riders of PATH, the Port Authority TransHudson commuter railroad, found other ways to get into and out of Manhattan yesterday on the first weekday of the strike by 214 members of the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen. But it was not always easy.

title: Utilize Emergency Services to Get to Town in Strike No Talks Scheduled
description: Regular riders of PATH, the Port Authority TransHudson commuter railroad, found other ways to get into and out of Manhattan yesterday on the first weekday of the strike by 214 members of the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen. But it was not always easy.

title: Rodriguez, With 66 for 267, Wins by Shot at Greensboro
Cambodia Is Called U.S. Ally on Basis Of Common Enemy
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI) A State Department spokesmad said today that Cambodia was, not a formal ally of the United States since they were linked by no treaty or alliance, but'that the two countries were allied in the sense that they had been fighting a common enemy for the past three years.

title: Postal Chief Says Congress Intervenes on 2dClass Rate
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UN) Postmaster GenerakElmer T. Klassen suggested today that Congress was intervening in Postal Service operations by considering legislation to reduc postage for magazines and newspapers.

title: ERVIN IN A CLASH WITH WHITE HOUSE OVER WATERGATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. and the White House engaged today in a blunt and spirited exchange over the Watergate case. The clash held significant implications for the current Congressional investigation of the affair.

title: CHAMBER ENSEMBLE IS ROUTINELY SUPERB
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center's final program of its season on Sunday afternoon at Tully Hall turned out to be another of the group's routinely extraordinary events. One might possibly imagine superior performances of these pieces, but for consistently adventuresome programing and unassuming, refined musicianship, the society is hard to beat.

title: Determined S.I. Housewives Rally Shoppers to Back Boycott
description: The rain was coming down like bathwater yesterday when a woman in orange slacksher eyes blazing, her dark hair tied squawlike in two tresses  accosted a shopper coming out of the Finast supermarket on Tompkins Avenue in Staten Island.

title: Juvenile Justice: Helpless Frustration
description: Juvenile crime is skyrocketing, and the city's juvenile justice system finds itself able to do little to stem it.

title: Pakistan's Split Called Economic Boon
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, March 29Officials here are conceding that Pakistan is better off economically without her former eastern wing, which is now Bangladesh.

title: Schools in Canarsie Reopen as New Fight Looms
description: Schools in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn were alive with the sounds of children yesterday as pupil attendance returned close to normal following the callingoff over the weekend of a monthlong boycott by white parents.

title: Arthur Daley
description: He has a touch of magic, said Willis Reed, shaking his head ever so slowly as if he still couldn't believe some of the things he had seen on the Madison Square Garden court. No one could have fashioned a more appropriate description of the antics of Earl (the Pearl) Monroe than the one offered so elegantly by the captain of the Knicks.

title: 5 Mayoral Candidates Endorse A March May 6 for Soviet Jews
description: In a rare joint appearance at a news conference yesterday, five Democratic mayoral candidates endorsed a freedom march for Soviet Jews and shadowboxed with each other on municipal issues.

title: Senate and House Divide Over Meatless Entrees
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Mike Mansfield of Montana, the Senate majority leader, dined on roast beef. His counterpart in the house, Thomas P. O'Neill of Massachusetts, settled for a slice of melon and a cup of black coffee.

title: Cold Type Process Used By Washington StarNews
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI)  The Washington StarNews began publishing the complete newspaper today by a photographic process.

title: Geneen Concedes I.T.T. Fund Offer To Block Allende
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Harold S. Geneen, chairman of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, said today that he did not recall having offered a substantial sum of money to the Central Intelligence Agency in 1970 to help prevent the election of Salvador Allende Gossens as President of Chile.

title: Joseph Cardinal Lefebvre, 80; ExArchbishop of Bourges, Dies
description: PARIS, April 2Joseph Cardinal Lefebvre, former Archbishop of Bourges, died there today at the age of 80.

title: Banishment Reported Due, For Jailed Soviet Dissident
description: MOSCOW, April 2 (UPI) Vladimir I. Bukovsky, a dissident found guilty of antiSoviet activities and sentenced to imprisonment and banishment in January, 1972, has completed his prison term, a dissident source said today.

title: MRS. ANTONIO F. GARCIA
description: Mrs. Gertrude Anderson Garcia, widow of Antonio F. Garcia, who was presiden of Garcia & Vega, Inc., cigar manufacturer, died yesterday at the White Plains Nursing Home for Extended Care. She was 78 years old and lived in White Plains. leading scholar of the evolution of Communism in Europe, and part of the present volume"From Lenin to Mao Tsetung and Marx and Beyond"is full of shafts of light cast by the author's industry and intelligence. But two doubtful points arise. First, it is a pity he is so prejudiced about the Chinese; is Churchill's scorn (little yellow men) Lichtheim's too? He speaks of the Maoists'"blinkered ignorance and plain buffoonery. More seriously, he sees China as the last great bulwark of unreconstructed Stalinism"; Maoism is indeed even more terroristic than Stalinism in trying to impose uniformity and to prevent the satisfaction of material wants.

title: Grand Union Offers Unstructured Dance Experience
description: Collectively, The Grand Union knows everything about performing except when to stop. After two and threequarter intermissionless hours at the Dance Gallery Sunday evening, it released a limp and soggy audience.

title: Ban on Alaska Oil Pipeline Left Standing by Justices
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 The Supreme Court declined to review today a decision barring Federal officials from authorizing construction of the TransAlaska oil pipeline.

title: Meany Praises Steel Pact
description: WASHINGTON April 2 (UPI)  George Meany, A.F.L.C.I.O. president praised today the nostrike agreement by the United Steelworkers union that appears to assure labor peace in the basic steel industry for the next four years. It seems to be an excellent example of sound collective bargaining and labormanagement statesmanship, which may well serve as model for other industries, Mr. Meany said in a telegram to the union president, I. W. Abel.

title: CutRate Transit Fares Started in a Boston Tes
description: BOSTON, April 2 (AP)Re duced fares on rapid transit lines went into effect today tc begin a 90day experiment tc try to increase ridership during offpeak hours.

title: Banker Seizes Guard's Gun and Commits Suicide
description: An investment officer for Manufacturers Hanover Trust snatched a pistol from a guard in the glass and marble lobby of the bank's uptown headquarters on Park Avenue yesterday, stepped back and killed himself with one shot in the head.

title: NICHOLAS ATLAS, EXPROSECUTORI
description: Nicholas Atlas, a trial lawyer and former Federal and state prosecutor, died yesterday in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 28 East 10th Street.

title: City Acts to Refurbish Housing In 2,100 Buildings in 3 Areas
description: A major housing program to rehabilitate 2,100 buildings in three depressed neighborhoods two in the Bronx and one on the Lower East Sidewas announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: CAHILL ANNOUNCES 2 LAND PROJECTS
description: TRENTON, April 2Two state environmental projectsone designed to insure that much of the state's farmland remains so in perpetuity and one to plan for the state's still undeveloped land masseswere announced today by Governor Cahill.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: LEO BERNSTEIN, 61, ISRAEL BONDS'HEAD
description: Leo Bernstein, executive vice president of the Israel Bond Organization, with which he had been associated since meeting with Prime Minister David BenGurion in Jerusalem in 1950, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home, 2 Fifth Avenue. He was 61 years old.

title: Cincinnati Blast Is Linked To Gunshot at Gas Meter
description: CINCINNATI, April 2 (UPI)An explosion that killed seven persons, injured 19. others and demolished a building Saturday night was caused by a bullet fired into a gas meter, Fire Chief Bert Lugannani said tonight.

title: Books of The Times
description: Arthur Koestler used to write like novelist who wanted to be a scientist: now he writes like a scientist who wants to be a novelist. It has been 22 years since his last novel, The Age of Longing, and one feels immediately in The Call Girls noticeable stiffness in the author's joints. Characters speak eagerly, brightly, smilingly, dryly, gruffly, curtly, feelingly. They blurt, snap, snort, flute, titter, rasp. pipe, grunt and trumpet. Mr. Koestler's prose is worse than flat it is flatness trying to undulate. At its best, The Call Girls is like a poor imitation of Akious Huxley's novels, in which most of the characters are mouthpieces for an ism or an ology. Huxley was much funnier, infinitely more imaginative, and far better acquainted with the techniques of fiction. His characters sometimes even transcended their ologies and took on independent life.

title: I.D.S. Insurer Is Renamed
description: Investors Diversified Services, Inc., yesterday named its life insurance subsidiary, kwMerly the Inestors Syndicate Life Insurance. and Annuity Company, the I.D.S. Life Insurance Company and announced rate cuts on policies over $20,000 of from 61/2 to I11/2 per Cent: The company has assets of $18imillion, a spokesman said.

title: PENTAGON URGED TO KEEP FORT DIX
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 A delegation of New Jersey Congressmen boarded a green and white Army bus this morning to go to the Pentagon to appeal to Secretary of Defense Elliot L. Richardson to save Fort Dix, one of the Army's largest basictraining bases.

title: EUROPEANS AGREE ON CENTRAL BANK
description: LUXEMBOURG, April 2 (UPI)  The European Economic Community agreed tonight to set up its own central bank later this week after a complex compromise resolved a dispute between Britain and this tiny duchy.

title: Chairman of Export Bank Confers With Soviet Aides
description: MOSCOW, April 2 (UPI)$Henry Kearns, chairman of the United States ExportImport Bank, visited Soviet officials at three agencies today to explore trade possibilities, the United States Embassy said.

title: People in Sports: The Ali Shuffle
description: Limiting his speech because of his broken jaw, Muhammad Ali, still in a San Diego hospital, called his wife, Belinda, in another hospital Sunday and learned she was in satisfactory condition. She was hospitalized because of a hysterical breakdown after watching Ali's loss to littleknown heavyweight, Ken Norton, Saturday.

title: Heath Pressed to Steer Nixon Course
description: LONDON, April 2Thanks in large part to President Nixon, Prime Minister Heath has found himself under increased pressure here on two major domestic issues.

title: Indians Trade 2 Players To Angels for Cardenas
description: CLEVELAND, April 2 (UPI)The Cleveland Indians obtained Leo Cardenas, an experienced shortstop, from the California Angels today in exchange for Tom McCraw, an infielderoutfielder and Bob Marcano of the Tribe's Triple A affiliate in Oklahoma City.

title: Carolina Reporter Honored
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI) Bob Poole, 23 years old, a special assignment reporter for The WinstonSalem, N. C., Twin City Sentinel, was named today winner of the 1972 Thomas L. Stokes Journalism Award. He was cited for his series of articles on the serious environmental hazards to rivers and streams from channelization projects.

title: Judge Seals Jury Report On Sale of Suffolk Beach
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., April 2The greater part of a secret grand jury report urging sweeping revisions in the methods by which Suffolk County condemns private land for public use was ordered sealed forever today by a County Court judge.

title: DOLLAR OUTFLOW CALLED SERIOUS
description: WASHINGTON, April 2$The outflow of dollars from United States banki during international monetary turmoil this year was about $2.5billion, but the bulk of it was in loans to foreign banks that drew on existing lines of credit, a member of the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Writers Elect Goldaper
description: Sam Goldaper of The New York Times was elected president of the Metropolitan Basketball Writers Association yesterdays Dave Hirshey of The Daily News was named vice president and Moss Klein of The Newark Star Ledger was chosen as secretarytreasurer.

title: Ellsberg Jury Is Told for First Time of Exculpatory Analyses
description: LOS ANGELES, April 2Government analyses concluding that disclosure of some of the Pentagon papers did not damage the national defense were presented to the jury today for the first time in the trial of Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr.

title: Indiana Rejects Rights Bid
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 2 (AP)The Indiana Senate overwhelmingly rejected today ratification of the proposed equal rights amendment, but supporters vowed it would be presented again next year with a better chance of passage. The vote against the measure was 34 to 16.

title: Bradley and Yorty Gain Coast Runoff
description: LOS ANGELES, April 3Thomas Bradley and Mayor Sam Yorty headed tonight for a onetwo finish in the first round of the Los Angeles mayoral election and a bitter battle in a runoff next month.
