description: Perhaps history, if not fate, will be on the Boston Bruins side tonight when they meet the Rangers in Game 3 of their Stanley Cup playoff series at Madison Square Garden.

title: Notes on People
description: Jean Westwood, the former Democratic National Committee chairman, plans to take a poll to determine what her chances might be of winning a Senate seat next year from Utah, her home state. Mrs. Westwood was replaced by Robert Strauss as party chairman in December in the wake of the defeat of Senator George McGovern in the Presidential campaign. She said in Salt Lake City that either she or Representative Wayne Owens might have a chance to win the Utah seat now held by Senator Wallace F. Bennett, a 74yearold Republican who has not yet said whether he would run for reelection in 1974. Mrs. Westwood, who is 49 years old, said that if Mr. Owens, who is 35, decided to run for the Senate, she might run for the House.

title: MERGER PUT OFF BY PROTESTANTS
description: MEMPHIS, April 6Representatives of eight major Protestant denominations voted unanimously today to shelve for the time being efforts to reach agreement on a detailed plan for their merger into a 22millionmember Protestant church.

title: Done, Says Butcher as Women Bargain for Lower Meat Prices
description: WATERBURY, Conn., April 6  Mrs. Elaine Hudsak, a mother with two preschoolaged children in tow, approached the butcher counter in a Grand Union supermarket here, surveyed the prepackaged meat and said:

title: L.I.R.R. to Resume Today Its Fishermen's Specials
description: The Long Island Rail Road resumes its popular Fishermen's Specials today.

title: Gold Rise Stirs African Mines
description: JOHANNESBURG, April 6 The rising price of gold has given South Africa's gold mines a new lease on life, according to an industry assessment of the country's 38 mines. Several mines that had prospects of continued operation for 10 years or less can now look forward to a productively rewarding existence of up to 20 years. Others may be able to extend their production in the long term to more than 20 years.

title: 56,000 Bogus Policies Reported Found at Equity
description: Slightly more than 56,000 fake life insurance policies have been discovered in the records of the Equity Funding Life Insurance Company, the California Insurance Commission disclosed yesterday in Los Angeles.

title: VIOLENCE FEARED AT WOUNDED KNEE
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., April 6 The affair at Wounded Knee has been settled in the negotiating tepee but no one here is resting easily just yet.

title: JANE FONDA GRANTS SOME P.O.W. TORTURE
description: LOS ANGELES, April 6 (AP) Jane Fonda, the antiwar activist, said today that she believes some American prisoners of war were tortured in North Vietnam but  it probably was not widespread nor was it a general policy.

title: WINE TALK
description: ITHACA, N. Y.  Even though they may already have had lunch, some of the students come to class with bread and cheese in plastic bags. They have a reason  it's to clear their palates.

title: Rinfret Management Co. And Fund End Accord
description: Directors of the Rinfret Fund, Inc., said yesterday that the mutual fund and the Rinfret Management Company, Inc., had agreed to terminate their investment advisory agreement.

title: New Techniques Monitoring Fetus Seek Birth of Healthier Babies
description: The human fetus, which for millenia has gestated undisturbed in the womb, is being probed, photographed and otherwise monitored by medical researchers whose goal is the birth of healthier babies.

title: Philadelphia Strike Ends
description: MEDIA, Pa., April 6 (UPI)Workers on the Red Arrow bus, trolley and train lines returned to their jobs today after a Delaware County Court judge ruled that their threeday strike was illegal. The strike by 347 transit workers affected about 35,000 Philadelphia area, commuters in Chester, Delaware and Montgomery counties. Judge Paul R. Sand ordered the Red Arrow employes back to work yesterday.

title: Theatrical Memorabilia on View to Aid Actors Fund
description: Sir John Gielgud has contributed two scenic designs he did at the age of 20 when he was contemplating a career on the other side of the footlights.

title: Newsman Draws Year in Jail Alter Secret Trial in Rhodesia
description: LONDON, April 6After secret trial on undisclosed charges, a 28yearold Rhodesian journalist was sentenced by a court in Salisbury today to two years imprisonment at hard labor. One year of the sentence was suspended.

title: Colellas Dominate A.A.U. Swithming Triag
description: CINCINNATI, April 6 (AP) Lynn Colella, who set an American 200yard butterfly record, and her brother Rick, dominated qualifying in the Amateur Athletic Union's shortcourse indoor swimming meet today.

title: Iraqi, on a Guerrilla Mission Shot and Killed in Paris Street
description: PARIS, April 6 (AP)  An Iraqi who was a former professor at the American Umversity in Beirut was shot and killed last night and police sources said, It looks very much like the execution of a secret agent.

title: Murder Charge Dropped In Police Death in Detroit
description: DETROIT, April 6 (UPI)A firstdegree murder charge against fiayward Brown, accused in the Dec. 27 shootings of two Detroit policemen, was dropped today for a lack of evidence.

title: The Language Programs
description: The proverbial warnings against policies that are penny  wise but pound  foolish apply in full measure against the Administration's recommendation to end Federal budgetary support for university foreign language and area programs. The amount that will be saved $15.3 million in the last budgetis truly minuscule the Federal spending picture. But the loss is potentially colossal. Implementation of the Administration proposal would cripple or destroy much of the work now going on to train specialists in the culture and history numerous smaller nations and peoples.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LONDON, April 6 (UPI)The bookies have made Oxford a slight favorite to end a run of five defeats with victory in the 119th renewal of the varsity boat race against Cambridge tomorrow. The historic event, often tagged the greatest free show on earth, is held along a 4 mile stretch of the Thames River.

title: People and Business Henry Ford's 72 Pay Up 27%
description: Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, is apparently the new champion in the corporate compensation sweepstakes. According to the company's proxy statement for the forthcoming annual meeting, Mr. Ford earned a total of $874,567 in 1972, a 27 per cent increase from the $689,000 he received in 1971.

title: TWO POLICE HELD IN COCAINE THEFT
description: Two New York policemen were being held yesterday for allegedly trying to steal $80,000 worth of cocaine and the office of Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's anticorruption prosecutor, said it was investigating reports of similar robberies by other policemen.

title: Pacifist Doctor Is Released
description: DAYTON, Ohio, April 6 (UPI) First Lieut. Bruce M. Ashley, a pacifist Air Force physician who was sentenced Wednesday to 18 months at hard labor and fined $25,000 for refusing to perform his military duties as protest against the Vietnam war, has been released from custody pending a hearing on an appeal. Ashley, a 26yearold Quaker, will be on an unpaid leave of absence until the appeal of the courtmartial sentence is heard.

title: Shadows at Albany
description: The leadership in the State Assembly at Albany continues to resist adoption of reforms that would open legislative procedures to greater scrutiny and encourage individual lawmakers to take a more responsible attitude toward their public trust. As so often in the recent past, the Republican majority again this week accepted the shadow of reform but rejected the substance.

title: People in Sports: Coach Terms N. C. A. A. Elite
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association holds no enchantment for Rod Paige, the head football coach of Texas Southern. Paige said yesterday that the N.C.A.A. was a group of elite universities in which his predominantly black collegedivision school had no business. I think it is an organization that represents major schools. I think we have a secondclass membership, and that's not a racial statement. You just have to look at the television. Only one smallcollege football game, GramblingMorgan State, was ever televised nationally.

title: PIONEER II COASTS ON PATH, TO JUPITER
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 6Pioneer 11 settled into coasting trajectory toward Jupiter today with flight controllers reporting all systems beautiful.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Two films starring Paul Robeson have joined the list of motion pictures withdrawn from the American Film Institute Festival, in protest af its cancellation of Constantin CostaGavras's State of Siege. George Stevens Jr., the Film Institute's director, said late yesterday that he would bow to the wishes of Paul Robeson Jr., who is representing his father, in withdrawing The Emperor Jones and Song of Freedom, two films of the nineteenthirties.

title: Guild Strikes in Virginia
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., April 6 (AP)Members of the Newspaper Guild picketed The Alexandria Gazette today after calling a strike yesterday over wages.

description: CLEVELAND, April 6 (UN) George D. Forbes was elected president of the City Council today, becoming the first black ever to hold that post.

title: West German Police Hunt 2 Gunmen With $357,000

description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., April 6 Jackson H. Taylor, a civil engineer who had been project manager on the design of the Pennsylvania Turnpike, the. Garden State Parkway and the Atlantic City Expressway, died yesterday in the White Plains Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 14 Barry Road.

title: PHONE UTILITIES PLANNING MERGER
description: The Continental Telephone Company, the nation's thirdlargest telephone holding company outside the Bell System, disclosed yesterday terms of its offer to acquire Telephone Utilities, Inc., involving about $35million in an exchange of stock. Charles Wolstetter, chairman of Continental, said it was extending its offer to April 13 because a proposal made earlier this week expired yesterday. Continental is offering to exchange 0.6 of share of Continental common for each of Telephone Utilities 2,400,000 shares outstanding.

title: Tough Code of Ethics Adopted For Judges in Federal Courts
description: WASHINGTON, April 6A tough and comprehensive new code of ethics covering all Federal judges except the nine members of the Supreme Court was adopted today by the Judicial Conference of the United States.

description: WASHINGTON, April 6Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, who has repeatedly criticized what he views as the politicization of the Federal Bureau of Investigation under L. Patrick Gray 3d, introduced legislation today that would make the bureau an independent agency.

title: Prof. Richard Tittnuss, Author Of Gift Relationship, Is Dead
description: LONDON April 6  Prof. Richard M. Titmuss, an expert on social administration who advised the British Labor party, and many governments, died here today. He was 65 years old.

title: Boycotters Holding Firm, But So Are Meat Prices
description: Rebellious meat boycotters held their ranks and shunned meat purchases in supermarkets across the country yesterclay, but as the weeklong campaign approached its end today there was no general price retreat.

title: FISK'S 2 HOMERS SET BOSTON PACE
description: BOSTON, April 6Some day Ron Blomberg will tell his grandchildren how he was the first player to bat as the designated hitter in the major leagues and how his bat wound up in the Hall of Fame to recognize that distinction.

title: JOB BIAS AGENCY PUSHES LAW SUITS
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (UPI) The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission says it hag opened a new era of increased enforcement of the Civil Right Act of 1964, which prohibits job discrimination on the basis of sex, race or religion.

title: FundSharing Checks Sent
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) The first revenuesharing payments of 1973 were sent today to 36,492 state and local governments, the Office of Revenue Sharing said. The checks represent payment for the first three months in the year and total $1.4billion. A second mailing of checks will be made in early July.

title: Mrs. Meyer Horowitz, 96
description: Mrs. Esther Schertz Horowitz, the mother of Jed Harris, the writer and producer, died yesterday at the DeWitt Nursing Home, Third Avenue at 79th Street. She was 96 years old. Mrs. Horowitz was the widow of Meyer William Horowitz, a wholesale grocer, and lived with her daughter, Mrs. Mildred Harris Wilcox, at 29 East 9th Street.

title: Federal's, Detroit Chain, Must Deposit $17.9Million
description: Federal's, Inc., Detroit retail chain operating under the voluntary Chapter XI proceedings of the Federal Bankruptcy Act, was told yesterday by a bankruptcy court that it must deposit $17.9million by next Friday to cover its creditors debts.

title: Printers Union Head Charges Papers With Unfair Practices
description: Bertram A. Powerst president of Typographical Union No. 6, said yesterday that his local had filed unfair labor practice charges against The Daily News, The New York Post and The New York Times.

title: MARINE IS CONVICTED OF ABUSING RECRUITS
description: PARRIS ISLANI, S. C., April 7.(UPI)A Marine drill instructor has been given a bad conduct discharge and sentenced to 12 months at hard labor after being convicted of two of Seven counts of dereliction of duty and mistreatment of recruits at this Marine training depot.

title: Campus Notes
description: After three years of allowing students unlimited class cuts, Long Island University has reinstituted rules requiring class attendance except for students on the dean's list.

title: Women Again Dominate A.A.U. Swimming
description: CINCINNATI, April 6 (AP)Shane Gould, Lynn Colella and Keena Rothhammer smashed American records tonight as women continued to dominate the Amateur Athletic Union's national indoor short  course swimming championships.

title: The Convicted Children.
description: In several cases during the left decade, the United States Supreme Court has propounded the doctrine that the Constitutidn is not for adults only. An important ruling written by Associate Justice Brennan held that the same considerations which demand extreme caution in factfinding to protect the innocent adult apply as well to the innocent child.

description: CROSSWORD PUZZLE

title: Vienna Revisited
description: This is mainly about two very important oranges that I bought at an outdoor fruit stand in Vienna last Jan. 20. The oranges were important only to me.

title: Rogers Limits Hopes for Accord on Latin Issues
description: WASHINGTON, April 6Secretary of State William P. Rogers told the annual meeting of the Organization of American States today that it was unrealistic to hope for agreement between the United States and LatinAmerican nations on all issues, and that we should concentrate on areas where our interests converge.

title: British Football
description: Third Division Spythem] 3, York 0.

title: 56,000 Bogus Policies Reported Found at Equity
description: Slightly more than 56,000 fake life insurance policies have been discovered in the records of the Equity Funding. Life Insurance Company, the California Insurance Commission disclosed yesterday in Los Angeles.

title: The President and the Senate: Why Some Nominations Failed
description: WASHINGTON, April 6No President in recent memory has had more of his nominees for high office rejected by the Senate then President Nixon.

title: State Acts to Wipe Out Monk Parakeet
description: The State of New York has declared war against the monk parakeet, a flamboyant invader from South America that is threatening farmers crops and suburban gardens as well as driving native birds from their nests.

title: STOCKS REBOUND ON AMEX AND 0TC
description: Ending a fivesession slump, prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market rose yesterday in active trading.

title: Business Records
description: Petition filed by:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: BULLETS PUT END TO KNICKS STREAK
description: BALTIMORE, April 6The law of averages and an aroused group of Baltimore Bullets caught up with the New York Knicks tonight and prevented them from ending the first round of the National Basketball Association playoffs. Baltimore's 9789 victory sent the teams back to New York for fifth game Sunday afternoon, with the Knicks leading 31 in the fourofseven game series.

title: THEATER LAB OFFERS 6 NEW DANCE WORKS
description: Eyeryone has to begin sometime. But not everyone has beginner's luck. So long as anaudience understands this, there is presumably no harm in giving public exposure to programs such as the one that opened the latest Choreoconcerts Workshops series Thursday might at the American Theater Lab, 219 West 19th Street.

title: Makarios Supporter Is Killed By Three Gunmen in Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, April 6 (AP)Three men with submachine guns killed a supporter of Archbishop Makarios, the president of Cyprus, on Thursday night. The death was the first in the current conflict between Archbishop Makarios and Gen. George Grivas, whose underground movement demands union with Greece.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Autopsy Finds Bullet in Girl's Body

title: Equity Financing
description: BrowningFerris Industries, Inc., yesterday said it would file a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission for an underwritten secondary of 1,750,000 common shares by stockholders who are mostly former owners of businesses acquired by the company. The company's stock was up  at 20% on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: NORD SAYS DEAN PASSED ON HIS JOB
description: WASHINGTON, April 6James W. McCord Jr. has indicated in sworn Federal Court testimony made public today that his employment by President Nixon's political organization was cleared by John W. Dean 3d, the White House counsel.

title: Independent F. B. I. Asked in Senate Bill By a Critic of Gray
description: WASHINGTON, April 6Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, who has repeatedly criticized what he views as the politicization of the Federal Bureau of Investigation under L. Patrick Gray 3d, introduced legislation today that would make the bureau an independent agency.

title: RICHEY CONQUERS LAVER BY 61, 76
description: MUNICH, West Germany, April 6 (AP)A young Taan, Cliff Richey, defeated a struggling Rod Laver, 61, 76, tbday and gained the semifinals of the World Championship Tennis Group A tournament.

title: Pirates Beat Cards With 5Run 8th
description: PVITSBURGH, April 6 (AP)Gene Clines delivered a pinchhit triple, driving two runs home and sparking a fiverun Pittsburgh rally today that gave the Pirates a 75 victory over St. Louis in their 1973 baseball opener.

title: OFFDUTY POLICEMAN IS SHOT BY A ROBBER
description: An offdutypatrolman was shot in the leg last night when he exchanged gunfire with three men who had robbed a beverage distribution company in the Hunts Point section of the Bronx, the police reported.

title: Body of Woman Is Found In Mill River on Long Island
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., April 6The body of an unidentified young woman was found in Mill River here this afternoon by a Parks Department employe who was walking near the edge of the river near a former dumping area and a Little League baseball field, the police reported.

title: Staff of the National Security Council Is reshuffled
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., April 6The White House announced today a realignment of the National Security Council staff and the departure of one of its key members.

title: Sikkim's Royal Family Guarded As 15,000 Protest Near Capital
description: NEW DELHI, April 6Nearly 15,000 antiGovernment protesters were poised tonight outside Sikkim's capital, Gangtok, amid rising violence in that tiny Indian protectorate.

title: In Soviet Estonia
description: TALLINN, U.S.S.R.The capital of Soviet Estonia has at its center an old town of medieval shapes and narrow, the hills steep. Redtiled shadows. The streets are cobbled and conical turrets surround the old town, and above it soar the extraordinary spires of Baltic Protestant Churches.

title: Back to Work, Drivers Told
description: CAMDEN, April 6 (AP) Truck drivers who struck six southern New Jersey concrete comparires Monday in a pay dispute and halted work on two Delaware River bridges were told by'their union leader today to go back to work. The order to the 150 drivers came from the Teamsters Union Local 676 president, John Greeley.

title: BERNARD A. SULLIVAN
description: WASHINGTON, April 7Bernard A. Sullivan, a retired executive of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, died Wednesday. He was 76 years old and lived here.

title: If You Go
description: to Nova Scotia to explore fishing villages, you'll find hundreds of them among the bays and inlets that indent the wandering coastline of the 375milelong peninsulaprovince. Tour buses touch several villages, of course, and some buses, from Halifax, the capital, pass through East Dover, and stop at nearby Peggy's Cove, more picturesque, and less rugged spot than its neighbor.

title: F.A.A. Cites Teterboro Woman
description: TETERBOROIt was eight years ago that Ann Kovacs boarded a twopassenger Cessna150 for the first airplane ride of her life. Clutched tightly in her hand was coupon, clipped from a local newspaper, offering an initial flying lesson for $5.

title: Elizabeth Bowen, 18991973
description: She was rare. A largeboned, redhaired beauty with a face of such distinction that the only comparable one in recent history is Virginia Woolf's. What they said when they met remains unknown. Their few meetings in A Writer's Diary are unilluminating. Perhaps they never discussed writing. Perhaps Mr. Woolf was a judicious editor  one wonders why Bowen, Elizabeth doesn't appear in the index. Possibly Mrs. Woolf's malicious streak came into play. (The publication of the complete diary will, I assume, be more revealing.) If Elizabeth Bowen had a streak at all, it wasn't malicious  mischievous would be closer to home. In fact, it would be hard to imagine anyone kinder. But kindness, these days, suggests some sort of nambypamby person, soft and easily swayed. Nothing could be farther from the truth. She could be acerbic, was one of the wits of her time, and could detect, from a great distance, the faintest whiff of the false. With the pretentious, she could be devastating.

title: Convoy for Phnom Penh Reports Border Ambush
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Sunday, April 8 (UPI)Commufist gunners ambushed a 19vessel convoy carrying vital supplies up the Mekong River to Phnom Penh today and forced most of the vessels to turn back into South Vietnam, according to radio messages from the vessels.

title: Gulfstream Results
description: Gulfstream Results

title: PERFECT CAST TAKES POINTTOPOINT RACE
description: MONKTON, Md., April 7 (AP) Perfect Cast, owned by Audrey Riker of Monkton, ran and jumped to a 2length victory over Happy Orphan in the annual ElkridgeHarford pointtopoint race today. In such an event the horses race from one designated point to the next.

title: Have You Met Miss Jones And Mr. Oscar?
description: IT'S too easy to be critical of this year's Academy Awards telecast to make it much fun, even in a week otherwise highlighted by the opening of an absolutely ridiculous new porno film, The Devil in Miss Jones, which a lot of people, who should have known better, seem to have been conned into finding a breakthrough movie. Ever since Last Tango in Paris, finding breakthrough movies has virtually become an epidemic. Sometimes two or three in a week. It reminds me of fleebus, the curious virus that swept through Bob & Ray's Skunk Hollow some years back and caused its victims to walk as if they were sitting down.

title: Indochina
description: SAN CLEMENTEFar Nguyen Van Thieu it was a longsought opportunity a week in the United States, chance to brush up his image here, a chance to demonstrate to the people at home how important he is. For Richard Nixon it was a duty performed a bit grudginglyan invitation long delayed, a reception at the Western White House instead of the Washington greeting so eagerly sought by Mr. Thieu, a warm but relatively noncommittal welcoming speech.

title: SUDANESE WOMEN SEEK NEW PATH
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, April 7 (Reuters)  A tiny fraction, of educated women are beginning to have an impact, on the highly conservative society of the Sudan, where 90 per, Cent of women are officially listed as illiterate.

title: NEW BUS STATION AIDS PATH RIDERS
description: Government agencies and transportation companies, using nylon rope, cardboard signs, a little imagination and a lot of advanced planning, have transformed city street into a bustling openair bus terminal.

title: Harlem Four
description: In the spring of 1964, they were Smart, tough teenagers. Theirs was the street life of central Harlem  not much school for them, better the pinball machines and the tenement stoops. Then, on April 29, a clothing store on West 125th Street was robbed, the proprietress stabbed and killed, It was the start of the long, controversial saga of the socalled Harlem Four.

title: She Runs in Mother's Footsteps
description: CHICAGO, April 17 (UPI)Wilma Rudolph, winner of three gold medals in track for the United States Olympic team at Rome in 1960, is planning to relive that thrill at Montreal in 1976.

title: Brooklyn Losing Most of Its Younger Physicians
description: Brooklyn is losing many of its younger physicians in a continuing exodus from the borough and, as a result, the average age of the remaining general practitioners is estiniated at 60.

title: Official at Wellesley College Shifting to U. of Puget Sound
description: TACOMA, Wash., April 7R. Franklin Thompson, president of the University of Puget Sound for 31 years, will be replaced in June by Philip Phibbs, executive vice president of Wellesley College, the university has announced.

title: Picnicking Areas To Open Friday
description: The Garden State Parkway's seasonal picnic areas will open next Friday. Only one area, Shoemaker Holly, is open the year round.

title: Hearing Is Set on Jamaica Center Plan
description: The City Planning Commission has scheduled a hearing for its next session, May 2, on establishing a new zoning district to promote the development of regional commercial centers, beginning with Jainaica.

title: Roosevelt Raceway Entries
description: Roosevelt Raceway Entries

title: Mauritania Prepares for a Big Influx of EclipseWatchers
description: NOUAKCHOTT, MauritaniaMohammed Soud had not heard, he said as he watered two donkeys at a well in the sandy outskirts of this capital city, that on June 30 Mauritanians would witness the century's longest total eclipse of the sun for a duration of 6 minutes and 39 seconds.

title: Trudeau Facing Crucial Battle Over Corporate Taxes
description: OTTAWA, April 7  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau, who has stood off the perils of minority rule for nearly six months, is facing a crucial parliamentary battle over corporation taxes.

title: TALKS POSTPONED ON WOUNDED KNEE
description: WASHINGTON, April 7Negotiations to work out implementation of the agreement designed to end the siege of Wounded Knee, S.D., were postponed here today after a dispute developed between a leader of the American Indian Movement and Justice Department representatives.

title: An Assassin's Diary
description: The assassination buff was one of the grisly results of President Kennedy's death. Conspiracies, right and left, were discussed and traded like baseball cards. Starting from grassy knolls and Zapruder stills, men journeyed in conjecture out through the labyrinths of Dallas, New Orleans, Havana, Moscow and Washington, sifting motives for a cast of thousands. Birchers vied with leftists in accusation. Buff alliances and heresies, rival theories and personal squabbles led to the sordid New Orleans prosecution of Clay Shaw.

title: Queens Leads City In Foreign Stock
description: A dozen years ago, in three of the city's five boroughs  Queens, Brooklyn and the Bronx  more than half of the residents were either foreign born or of foreign parentage.

title: One Cranberry's Predictions
description: The idea of a perfect and immortal commonwealth will always be found as chimerical as that of a perfect and immortal man. And yet we go on trying, tinkering with the world and with ourselves: the hope for improvement distinguished people from cranberries.

title: 2 British Soldiers Are Killed in Ulster By a Mine on Road
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 7 (UPI)A mine exploded under a British Army patrol car jn County Armagh near the border with Ireland tonight, Milling two soldiers and seriously wounding a third, the army said.

title: Rodgers Is Ordered to Jail Or Boys Town for 30 Days
description: LINCOLN, Neb., April 7 (AP) Johnny Rodgers, winner of the Heisman Trophy, will begin serving a 30day jail sentence Monday for a traffic offense, his attorney said yesterday.

title: MYSTICISM MAKES COMEBACK IN JAVA
description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaAlthough Indonesia is usually regarded as a Moslem state, a substantial number of Indonesians are turning away from nominal adherence to Islam toward other faiths, notably in Java toward a revived Javanese mysticism with overtones of HinduBuddhism.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Aqueduct Race Charts

title: World News Briefs
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, April 7 (Reuters)Four bombs were exploded on Cyprus overnight and though they caused no deaths or injuries, they fed fears that fullscale civil war was approaching. The country has been seized by mass insanity, said the nationalist Greek  language newspaper Agon. Chaos is coming and the island has turned into hell,

title: New Unit to Analyze Crime in Schools
description: A special unit is being set up by the Board of Education's office of school safety to study acts of crime and violence occurring in the schools.

title: Jungle Hsbitat Is Cleaning Up Water
description: WEST MILFORD  Jungle Habitat, the sprawling wildlife preserve that had its troubles because of its immediate success, finds itself in the midst of another problem: water pollution caused by the droppings of its 1,600 animals.

title: DOGRUN ON A LOT STIRS UP ORATORY
description: Dog owners dog haters, dog lovers and dog batters all had their day last week during a raucous exchange of oratory that focused on whether a modest vacant lot in Greenwich Village should remain a dogrun or be converted into a basketball court.

title: Crafts Show in Shrewsbury
description: SHREWSBURY  Arts of the past and present will be twin attractions on Tuesday and Wednesday, when the Shrewsbury Historical Society holds its first antiques and crafts show.

title: CHAMBLISS HOMER DEFEATS LOLICH
description: CLEVELAND, April 7 (AP)Chris Chambliss's tworun homer and Gaylord Perry's fourhit pitching led the Cleveland Indians to a 21 victory over the Detroit Tigers today before an opening day crowd of 74,420 fans.

title: Roger Elsas Marries Susan Lea Denison
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., April 7Miss Susan Lea Denison was married here this afternoon to Roger DeWitt Elsas, who is with the New York investment firm of L. F. Rothschild & Co. The Rev. Frederick W. Rapp performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation.

title: Survey Shows Executives Got Raises Within Limits
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP)The Cost of Living Council said this week that a survey showed that salary increases of executives and salaried employes averaged 5.1 per cent during 1972, within the council's overall guidelines.

title: Connecticut
description: HARTFORDJust about every politician, educator and homeowner in Connecticut accepts the need for reform in the public school finance system. But the politicians have been given time to catch their breath. Most thought the existing system of financing schools mainly by the property tax would have been declared unconstitutional by now.

title: The Car Rental Service and How It Grew
description: Seasoned travelers and businessmen accustoned to the convenience of picking up and returning their rent ed cars at airports around the world might find it lard to believe that this service was unheard of 20 years ago.

title: The Region
description: For the men and women on the cellblocks, it was one step forward, one step back.

title: Five Dead G.I.'s Are Alive, Relatives to Keep Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, April 7 (AP) The Veterans Administration says that it will not attempt to recover $10,000 G.I. insurance payments made to wives or parents of five war prisoners who once were listed as dead.

title: Car Dealerships Starting to Open to Minorities
description: DETROIT (UPI)Less than onehalt of 1 per cent of the nation's 25,441 new car dealships are minorityowned. Blacks control 39 of these enterprises.

title: Tourne: More Than a Rose Garden
description: BOONTON TOWNSHIP They call it the Tourne. It is a haven, an oasis of seren ity in the midst of bustling civilization, a place where, last year alone, 125,000 people came to be alone.

title: Local TV? You Get More Local Than This
description: RAPIDLY becoming the journalistic clich of the year is something called public, access. It is usually associated with cable operations, some of which are providing free channels to be used by public groups. But, in varying degrees, it can alto be found lurking around the corridors of television, radio and even print journalism.

title: HighRise Complex Arouses Bayside
description: Mrs. Helmuth Enzensperger stood in front of her singlefamily home on 26th Avenue in Bayside, Queens, and looked across the street at the foundation of a planned 26story apartment complex.

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: Fittipaldi Wins Pole Position At 137.9 M.P.H. for Record
description: SILVERSTONE, England April 7 (AP)  Emerson Fittipaidi, the auto racing champion of Brazil, flashed around the Silverstone circuit at a recordshattering 137.92 miles an hour today to clinch the pole position for the silver jubilee international trophy race.

title: CENTROWITZ SETS 2MILE RUN MARK
description: NANCJET, N. Y., April 7 Matt Centrowitz, who has won more than 40 races in his fouryear schoolboy career, posted his first outdoor victory today in impressive style.

title: A Man on the Spot
description: DETROIT  A series of crucial decisions that will affect every car buyer after 1975 will soon be made by the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, which enforces the nation's antipollution laws.

title: Dance
description: THE big surprise of the ballet season so far has been the success of the old Diaghilev work, Parade, which the Joffrey Ballet gave at the end of their spring season at the City Center 55th Street Theater. Although it is tragic to think of the future of the Jaffrey Ballet being in jeopardy, it is certainly in unusually good performing condition, and with Twyla Tharp's Deuce Coupe (the runaway hit of the season), Eliot Feld's Jive and finally Parade, the company added substantially to its repertory.

title: Europeans Say U.S. Borrows Car Ideas
description: Seven internal combustion en es were displayed at the 1876 International Centennial Exposition in Philadelphia, six of them the inventions of two Germans, Wilhelm Otte and Eugen Langan, and the seventh a design by George Brayton of Boston.

title: Charles Edison Estate Sold in Jersey
description: Landmore, the estate of the late Charles. Edison, the former Governor of New Jersey and son of Thomas Alva Edison, the inventor, has been purchased by the head of a New York advertising agency.

title: Law Clerk Led Schools Battle
description: TRENTONMost court decisions on major constitutional issues derive from the collision of competing private or government interests. But the State Supreme Court's landmark decision last week on publicschool financing was the consequence of an unusual series of events that began seven years ago in the mind of a young law clerk in the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court.

title: Survival of the Fittest, Canine Fashion
description: With more than a million dogs being registered annually by the American Kennel Club, exhibitors were urged at the recent symposium here, sponsored by the Dog Lovers Digest magazine, to pause and consider a planned breeding program. Successful breeders, said Elaine Samuels, owner of the Karelane Kennels, of Shetland sheepdog tame, in Boothwyn, Pa., know that the need for carefully bred dogs is as basic a truism as is the need for a planned breeding program. One cannot exist without the other. The contribution to purebred dogs will be in direct relation to the foundation on which the breeding program is built. It is no harder to love a good dog than a bad one and costs no more to raise a good litter than a poor one.

title: Dollars Versus Learning
description: A widespread assumption underlying the court battles over school funding is that more textbooks, slide projectors, laboratory beakers and wellpaid teachers add up to better education. Even though simple social justice might dictate that the poor should have equal access to these benefits, the question of whether more money for schools in poor communities will actually raise the educational level of their pupils remains the subject of sharp dispute. A growing body of social scientific evidence suggests that if there is a relationship between dollars and learning, it is probably very slight.

title: National Champion Reaches Semifinals in Badminton
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 7 Pam Bristol, the national titleholder from Frint, Mich., defeated Cynthia Tudor of Philadelphia, 111, 113, in reaching the semifinal round of the Middle Atlantic badminton championships today. Pat McCarrick of New York won from Charlotte Ackerman of Granby, Conn., 411, 117, 112.

title: NIXON SENDS HAIG ON INDOCHINA TRIP AS OUTLOOK DIMS
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., April 7President Nixon sent one of his most trusted military Advisers to Indochina today in what was described as an effort to get a clearer picture of the deteriorating military situation in the region.

title: Alaska Guard's Head Quits Post in Dispute
description: ANCHORAGE, April 7 Maj. Gen. William S. Elmore, aajustant general of the Alaska National Guard, has siiimitted his resignation to Gov,. William A. Egan, who htd said that some charges of alleged misuse of Guard aircraft were true.

title: Master of a Dying Art
description: On a quiet commercial street in the Bath Beach section of Brooklyn a master craftsman is practicing a dying art. Don Cazzetta, who came to the United States from Italy at the age of 9 is a master of the art of making smoking pipes and his skill draws connoisseurs from all over the Northeast to the door of his shop.

title: 5 Olympians to Be Cited During the Penn Relays
description: Five Olympic gold medal winners will be honored during the Penn Relays as Dave Wottle, Larry Black, Julius Sang, Robert Oukti and Gerald Tinker return to run at the oldest and largest relay meeting April 27 and 28.

title: A Snakeskin Guppy Wins at Fish Show
description: PARAMUS  Edmond A. Martin of Leonia is very fond of Charlie. He rubs his gray forehead gently, he grooms him tenderly and he feeds him on a lavish cuisine, of sliced codfish, shelled shrimp, smelts and live goldfish and baby sunnies.

title: F.A.A. Sees Doubling Of Airline Passengers
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)Federal Aviation Administration officials predict that airline passenger traffic will more than double over the next decade, exceeding the 500millionayear level.

title: BRITAIN
description: COONDerek Cox is a cockney, and he loves his little car. To a suggestion that he might be spending too high a proportion of his income on motoring he replied, Well, I must have a car so it might as well be the one I want.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: William Davis's Really, This Jargon Is Getting Out of Hand [March 25] failed to come down hard enough on the worst jargoneers of them all  the business schools.

title: Brooklyn Area Retains Character
description: In 1899 a realestate developer from Syracuse, N.Y., bought a tract of marshland and corn fields south of Prospect Park from the Dutch Reformed Church and laid out what he called in his advertising brochures a rural park within the limitations of the conventional city block.

title: DOGRUN ON A LOT STIRS UP ORATORY
description: Dog owners dog haters, dog lovers and dog baiters all had their day last week during a raucous exchange of oratory that focused on whether modest vacant lot in Greenwich Village should remain dogrun or be converted into a basketball court.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: EQUITY FUNDING CORPORATION, caught up in multimilliondollar bogusinsurance scandal, has filed for reorganization under Chapter X of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. Wholesale prices rose 2.2 per cent in March, the largest monthly increase since 1951. Food prices rose 4.6 per cent during March.

title: Democrats Assert Rockefeller Budget Includes a $722Million Cushion
description: ALBANY, April 7The Democratic minority in the Legislature asserted today that Governor Rockefeller had built a $722million electionyear cushion into the 197374 state budget that went into effect on April 1.

title: Miss Lee Brennan Is Betrothed
description: ATLANTA, April 7  Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Trainor Brennan have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lee Saint Clair Brennan, to Kevin Gillmore Kidd, son of Adm. Isaac Campbell Kidd Jr., Chief of Naval Matriel, and Mrs. Kidd of Washington.

title: Controversial Debates Fall Short in Syosset
description: SYOSSET, L.I.The Midway Jewish Center Men's Club here, which had scheduled a series of lectures by controversial speakers who, the club hoped, would spark some life into a sleepy bedroom town, has been forced to postpone its latest debate because of a lack of interest.

title: Evolution in Taiwan
description: In world affairs problems are rarely solved. At best they are transformed, from an armed confrontation to political maneuver, or perhaps from a bid for political power to a bid for economic influence. Sometimes dip., lomatic success consists of nothing more than converting an urgent situation into a tolerable irregularity.

title: There's No Game in Newark Today
description: NEWARK  For a while, baseball fans in the metropolitan area were singing, Where have you gone, Joe DiMaggio? That was before they found him in a television commercial for a New York bank.

title: The War That Is Yet to Come
description: SAIGON, South, VietnamThe United States has now withdrawn from direct involvement in the Vietnam conflict to assume a status approaching that of Russia or China in their proxy war. They give North Vietnam only logistical and political support.

title: Living Farm History, Slightly Revisionist
description: BACK in 1940, Newell Walker quit his Job as a postman, put nearly his last dollar down on 100 acres of land, and set out, in middle age, to farm fulltime in Southbridge, Mass.

title: Wounded Knee
description: PINE RIDGE, S. Dalc.It was scene right out of the Old Weststaged that way, some believed, for effect. Indians on ponies ambled slowly about a tepee on a hillock of the Dakota plain. A dog slept in the sun next to the tent's entrance. And inside, craggyfaced Sioux shared a pipe of peace with emissaries from Washington, signifying the conclusion, of yet another agreement between the United States Government and the Red Man.

title: GREENE TIES NEVIL FOR LEAD IN GOLF
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss., April 7 (AP)Bert Greene shot a fourunderpar 66 today and tied Dwight Nevil for the lead at 202 after three rounds of the Magnolia Classic golf tournaiment.

title: SEVERE DROUGHTS FORESEEN IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, April 7 (AP)Some areas of Britain face drought conditions over the next few months on a scale experienced only twice in the last 170 years, water experts forecast.

title: SOUTH AFRICA TIES TROUBLING BRITISH
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, April 7The investigation into United States business interests and practices in South Africa, begun seriously by American critics of apartheid some two years ago, has now moved with greater intensity to other foreign business in the country, particularly that of Britain.

title: BREASTFEEDING URGED BY DOCTOR
description: GENEVA, April 7A report published by the World Health Organization deplores an increasing trend away from breastfeeding because a mother's milk has for countless generation's been timetasted as the ideal food for infants!

title: Woman Found Dead in River Identified as. Nurse's Aide
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., April 7The body of a 24yearold woman found yesterday in Mill River here about a block east of South Park Avenue was identified today as that of Dorothy Anderson, who had lived with her mother, Lucille Anderson, at 10049 196th Street, Hot lis, Queens, a police spokesmar said. The cause of the death has not yet been determined.

title: BOYCOTT OF MEAT ENDS WITH A CALL FOR NEW PROTESTS
description: The weeklong nationwide meat boycott ended yesterday with its leaders calling for some form of continued consumer action in the fight against high meat prices.

title: Duke of Argyll, Chief of Clan Campbell, Is Dead at 69
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, April 7  The 11th Duke of Argyll, whose marriages and divorces made headlines throughout the world, died in a private hospital in Edinburgh today from the effects of a stroke. He was 69 years old, and he end the Duchess had lived in a Paris apartment for years, visiting Scotland only briefly.

title: RED SOX BONE YANKS AGAIN, 105
description: BOSTON, April 7  It's already been a long season for the Yankee pitchers. Victimized by Carl Yastrzemski's revitalized bat and their own team's sloppy, defense, the pitchers gave up another flock of runs as Boston whipped the Yankees, 105, today.

title: Report Declares Food Additive Makes Bacon a Cancer Threat
description: WASHINGTON April 7 (UPI) A privately financed report on a widely used food additive said today that bacon may be the most dangerous food in the supermarket in terms of cancercausing potential.

title: Susan Davis Is Bride Of Gene Paul Phillips

title: Stella Wright: Housing Crisis
description: NEWARKFifteen years years ago, the Stella Wright lowincome housing project was opened here in the Central Ward. The seven, 13story buildings were hailed as a panacea for the critical housing shortage afflicting Newark.

title: UNITED STATES
description: HAZEL PARK, Mich.  Mr. and Mrs. Robert Martell still talk wistfully about the sleek Ford XL they used to have as a family car, with its bucket seats and floor shift and FM stereo radio. Like many Americans, the Martells consider a car not only a necessity, a takenforgranted part of everyday life, but also a thing of pride, and sometimes almost a friend.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: CONGRATULATIONS to John Simon (end you) on his pungent review of Bunuel's The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie. It's the best thing since The Emperor's New Clothes.

description: About 400 freshair enthusiasts bicycled through the perfect spring afternoon in Manhattan yesterday to dramatize their demand for a separate bike lane on city streets.

description: HAMBURG, West Germany, April 7 (UPI)Sue, Dickey of South Africa captured her second title today at the West German international indoor swimming championships, winning the women's 400meter freestyle.

title: Book Says Knapp Laxity Saved Kriegel From Perjury Indictment
description: Peter Maas, the author, says in a forthcoming book, Serpica, that deficient questioning by the Knapp Commission was the:main reason why the Manhaftin District Attorney's office did not indict Jay Kriegel, a mayoral aide, for perjury in his testimony before the commission.

title: SHOP TALK
description: PROSPECT. PARK  The thing that makes the Haband Company's retail outlet a great place for men's mbderatepriced clothes in the large mailorder business behind the concern's operation.

title: Investigating Watergate
description: Watergate, the officeandapartment complex in Washington in which the Democratic National Committee formerly had its headquarters, has become the shorthand syhibbl for a yearlong campaign of espionage and sabotage conducted, on behalf of the Nixon Administration in 197172. The scope, complexity, and duration of those clandestine activities reach far beyond the single episode of breaking into the Watergate office for which seven men have been convicted.

title: Do you know the aim of life?; The guru business

The Delhi headquarters of the Divine Light Mission is like a fortress: an 8foothigh wall with an irongrilled gate encloses a courtyard and a complex of buildings consisting of offices, reception rooms, kitchen, refectory, dormitories, a temple and the residential suite of Balyogeshwar, the Child God.

title: Criminals At Large
description: One of the strangest funandgames books that has come along in some time is SHOOT by Douglas Fairbairn (Doubleday, $4.95). On one level, it is an action story about a bunch of guys out hunting. They get shot at by another group of guys. The result is a private war.

title: Michael McCullough Marries Miss Fisher
description: HARRISON, N. Y., April 7 Miss Cheryl Gail Fisher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lester Fisher of Harrison and Palm Beach, Fla., was married here this evening to Michael E. McCullough, son of Mr. and Mrs. Earl McCullough of Coshocton, Ohio. Rabbi Burt A. Siegel performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: 3 Baltimore Teams on Way Out.
description: BALTIMORE, April 7Loss of major league franchises in football, baseball and basketball is a real possibility for the city of Baltimore, whose teams have won the football Super Bowl and the baseball World Series and have gone to the National Basketball Association finals during the last three years.

title: Mission: to let the world in again on modern art
description: The distinguishing characteristic of the art scene at the present moment is the collapse of modernist orthodoxy. Though we lack neither artists nor critics who persist in upholding one or another version of the modernist faith, these votaries of an absolutist view of what is, and what is not, permissible for art to accomplish at a given historical moment tend to look more and more sectarian. Chastened by history and weary of doctrinaire imperatives, a new generation of artists  and indeed, the art public itself  no longer give an easy credence to exclusionary theories of the esthetic enterprise: The immediate result of this recoil from the absolute has been an increase in our consciousness of the sheer variety and multiplicity of artistic statement that the history of modern artcontrary to the myths of modernismhas actually harbored.

title: News Source Bill Passed
description: SPRINGFIELD, 111., April 7 (UN)  The Illinois House passed and sent to the Senate yesterday a bill that would allow newsmen to keep their sources confidential. The bill applies only to protection of sources and could not be used when a reporter witnessed a crime or an accident.

title: Princes Under the Volcano
description: In his prologue Raleigh Trevelyan contends that he has written a kind of a saga about the past 200 years in Sicily, but in point of fact Princes Under the Volcano is a kind of a clutter of fragmentized history, onthescene observations and titillating tidbits about private and public lives among the upper reaches of European society. Only a novelist of Tolstoyan stamina, with more understanding of Sicilians than Mr. Trevelyan (a relative of G. M. Trevelyan and author of The Fortress) reveals, could possibly put together such diverse elements into anything resembling a saga.

title: Indians Youth is Served by Record Cleveland Crowd
description: CLEVELAND, April 7 (AP) The young Cleveland Indians beat the Detroit Tigers in the season opener, but the team, from the players to Manager Ken Aspromonte, shared the glory with the record opening day crowd of 74,420.

title: ALABAMA DEADLINE ON DISTRICTING SET
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., April (AP)  A threejudge Federal panel has instructed the Alabama Legislature to come up with a reapportionment plan by May 17 or a plan ordered by the court will be in effect for 1974 legislative elections.

title: Beltoise, Mass Pace Trials
description: HOCKENHEIM, West Germany, April 7 (UPI)  JeanPierre Beltoise of France, in MarchBMW, and West Germany's Jochen Mass, in a Surtees TS15, had the best training runs today for the Jim Clark Memorial Formula Two auto race tomorrow. Each turned in a time of 2 minutes 2.8 seconds, an average of 124.3 miles an hour.

title: Education
description: ATLANTAIn the halcyon days of the civil rights movement, such bickering among friends would have been settled within the family and not in full public view. But here was the local branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People squabbling with national headquarters. At issue: a compromise plan to settle a 15yearold fight to desegregate Atlanta's public schools.

Mr. Low, 31 years old, associate publisher of the daily newspaper for the last four years, succeeds his father, G. Prescott Low, in both positions.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: Those of us who live through periods of swift change frequently miss the true significance. The period from 1965 to 1970 changed forever the traditional structure of the advertising business and only now in 1973 are we learning to accept the new styles and procedures. And, hopefully, to profit by them.

title: If You Can Find Liechtenstein, the Baron Will Be Waiting
description: Y ou don't have to be P.T Barnum to draw visitors to the Riviera or the Colosseum, but you may have to be half Merlin and half Svengali to get the traffic flowing into Liechtenstein. There is no such fortuitous specimen in the little principality, but it has had the benefit of the next best thing, Baron Edward von FalzFein, once hurriedly nicknamed Quick. Not only does the tratfic flow, it stops, and almost always at the Quick Tourist Office, a souvenir shop on Stadtle Street, the main drag of Vaduz, the country's capital. How did the baron do it, when American postal workers have been known to say of Liechtenstein, Which is that in?

title: The Fight to Save Seesaw
description: THE new Broadway musical, Seesaw, opened at the Uris Theater Sunday, March 19, to a standing ovation from the audience and solid reviews from the critics. But the next morning producer Lawrence Kasha sat in his office chewing on valium while his partner, Joseph Kipness, also known as Cryin Joe, cried. Then they did what they had to dothey posted the closing notice for Seesaw on the backstage bulletin board. It would close the next Saturday, after nine performances.

title: Robert Goldwater 19071973
description: IN the art world, Robert Goldwater was distinguished for so many different things that any personal tribute, like this one, must narrow his true range. I think of him mainly as an illuminating scholar of Western art, but there are others who will think of him first as the man who directed the Museum of Primitive Art or as one of the finest early critics of Abstract Expressionism or as the editor of one of America's best periodicals on artnow sadly gone, toothe Magazine of Art.

title: Lisbon Official Reports On Overseas Elections
description: LISBON, Portugal, April 7 (AP) Overseas Minister Joequim da Silva Cunha said this week that elections in Portugal's overseas provinces had given legislative control there to locally born population, except in Angola.

title: Bridge
description: Good positioning, a major factor in most competitive athletic activities, plays a minor role in bridge games. If two experts are at a table, playing against each other, Expert A will sometimes maneuver so that Expert B is on his right. If B creates a bidding problem, perhaps with a preemptive action or a psychic call, A wants to be in a position to solve it rather than have his weaker partner put to the test.

title: Tampering With Antipollution Devices
description: Dave D., a prosperous professional man who lives just outside the city, bought his second English sedan last year because he liked the first one, a late nineteensixties model, so much. Before long, however, he was back at the dealer's to complain: The new car was hard to start; it stalled in stopandgo driving it didn't have as much power as the old model, and its gas mileage was much worse.

title: Miss Siepmann Fiancee
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., April 7Mrnd Mrs. Charles Siepmann of New Canaan and Brookline, Vt., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sarah Tyler Siepmann, to Harold R. Harb, son of Mrnd Mrs. Theo Harb of Val David. Quebec. The future bride was graduated from the Putney (Vt.) School; the Villa Met cede in Florence, Italy, and Sarah Lawrence College. Her fianc attended schools in Austria and in Canada. He is a professional ski racer and a former member of the Canadian National Ski Team. The couple plan to marry next month.

title: Sewage Plant Operating
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, April 7 (AP) The city's disabled waste water treatment plant has stopped dumping raw sewage into Maumee River and has begun primary treatment, a spokesman for the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency announced. The spokesman estimated that more than 60 million gallons of raw sewage had been dumped into the river after the plant was closed Wednesday.

title: Only the voice of love is missing
description: A poet has written this book. No praise is higher than thatthat is, if the poet has succeeded in mastering the words for it, the handful of words It takes to write the poem one intended or the book one had in mind. North of Jamaica, a story of Louis Simpson's life, is told in prose with the clarity, precision, condensation of poetry. Through its six parts, he speaks in many voices, yet amazingly each voice is his own: quiet, dispassionate, amusing, disturbingseparate voices. By listening to the tone, one hears them all.
