description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) In a report indicating consumers lnay face higher prices for vegetables, the Agriculture Department announced today that production of 14 crops for fresh sale from April 1 through June 30 is estimated at 37.9 million hundredweight, 2 per cent less than last spring's harvest.

title: Aaron's 283 Wins Masters by Shot
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 9 There is no longer need to call Tommy Aaron a runnerup. Although he has had that role 14 times since joining the professional golf tour in 1961, the 36yearold Georgian swept off with the prestigious Masters tournament title today by one stroke.

title: U.N. Bid Held Rejected
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 9 Secretary General Waldheim has informed the Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government that it may not open an office at the United Nations, qualified sources reported today.

title: C.I.A. SAYS IT ERRED ON FORD FUND ROLE
description: The Central Intelligence Agency says it was wrong when it suggested that a representative of the Ford Foundation had initiated the suggestion that the New York Police Department go to the intelligence agency for training.

title: 9 U.S. Nuclear Heart Devices Implanted
description: BETHESDA, Md., April 9Surgeons implanted Americandeveloped nuclear  powered heart pacemakers in nine patients today.

title: PorkBarrel Waste
description: WASHINGTONIn his most recent move in the battle of the budget, President Nixon last week vetoed the rural water and sewer bill. This is one of the several measures moving through the Congress that, taken together, would add billions of dollars to the Federal budget. These increases now threaten all Americans with higher taxes, more inflation or both.

title: Shubert Figure Loses Court Bid to Regain Empire
description: A State Supreme Court justice dismissed yesterday a petition by Lawrence Shubert Lawrence in which he sought to regain control of the nationwide theater and real estate empire of the Shubert Foundation, Inc.

title: Meat Sales Up, but Buyers Still Resist High Prices
description: Business at meat counters picked up yesterday, the first shopping day after the weeklong nationwide boycott, but retailers still encountered resistance to continuing high prices.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For two decades after World War the United States was strong and wealthy, commanding admiration and inspiring confidence. Today, while militarily still powerful, it has lost its economic leadership of a group of industrialized entities and become a member in poorer health than others.

title: Sabotaging the Peace
description: Continuing Communist attacks against helicopters carrying peacekeeping observers over South Vietnam raise grave questions about the Vietcong contention that last Saturday's incident, in which four members of the International Commission of Control and Supervision were killed, was merely a regrettable accident. The emerging pattern suggests a deliberate attempt to sabotage the peacekeeping effort.

title: DR. WALTER HIPP
description: CORAM, L. I., April 9 Dr. Walter Hipp, a former New York ophtalmologist who had lived and practiced until last year in Sands Point, died Saturday at his home here. He was 74 years old.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: KANSAS CITY, April 9 (AP)The 1973 version the Kansas City Royalsand baseball's 1973 version electronic entertainmentwill be unveiled in the Royals' new $43million stadium tomorrow night. More thin 42,000 persons will view the game against the Texas Rangers.

title: Mike Quarry and Carroll Will Fight Here April 23
description: Mike Quarry and Hal (TNT) Carroll, heavyweights, will fight in a scheduled 10rounder, April 23, at the Felt Forum, Madison Square Garden Boxing, Inc., announced yesterday.

title: Crawford: Many Eras Many Fans
description: The many ages, and the many faces, of Joan Crawford passed in review before a capacity audience of 1,500 in Town Hall on Sunday night.

title: Major Part of Abortion Law Is Struck Down in Arkansas
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., April (UPI)The Arkansas Supreme Court, in a 7to1 decision, struck down today the major part of the state's abortion law.

title: Theater: Feline Antics
description: We see comparatively few modern French plays in New York. Does one count Ionesco? Perhaps. Beckett? Hardly. Duvas? Of course. For the rest we have a little Anouilh for Establishment fare, and a great deal of ennui from the standard translations of the equally standard boulevard farces. It was therefore with some pleasure that one contemplated last night's premiere of L'Ete (which is freely translated on the program as Summer) at the Cherry Lane Theater. Most of the pleasure was in the contemplation.

title: The U.S. vs. The People
description: The Nixon Administration has submitted to Congress the equivalent of an Official Secrets Act that could bring down an impenetrable curtain over virtually all governmental activities related to defense and foreign affairs. The proposed legislation would give to the executive branch and its huge army of officials ironclad protection from public scrutiny.

title: U.S. Weighs New Missile Aid for Britain
description: WASHINGTON, April 9United States officials are studying three alternative courses by which Britain's aging arsenal of submarinebased missiles might be modernized to better enable them to penetrate Soviet defenses.

title: Reds Score 4 in Ninth To Braves 3 and Win, 87
description: ATLANTA, April 9 (AP)Tony Perez made three hits and drove in two runs tonight as Cincinnati defeated Atlanta, 87.

title: XEROX INTRODUCES TWO NEW COPIERS
description: The Xerox Corporation introduced here yesterday two new productsa compact copier and an automatic facsimile systemas part of its promised line of major new products this year and next.

title: Officials of Thruway Report Republican Clubs Clear Workers for Seasonal Jobs
description: The little green card from his local Republican club that can help guide someone to summer job in a state park is also honored in seasonal hiring on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway, officials said yesterday.

title: Japanese Carp Go on View
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) Eleven multicolored carp, described as the most beautiful fish ever displayed in the United States, went on exhibit today at the National Aquarium. The fish are a gift from former Japanese Premier Nobusuke Kishi to President Nixon.

title: Rangers Seeking to End Bruins Season Tonight
description: At a peak and moving better than any Ranger team during the Emile Francis era, the New Yorkers sail into Boston Garden tonight for what could be a clinching party against the Bruins.

title: EDWARD W. WENDELL
description: ALBANY, April 9 (AP)Edward W. Wendell, a designer of the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway and former Mayor of nearby Altamont, died Saturday at his home. He was 88 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L.I., 8 P.M.

title: Democrats Raising Funds
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI)  A fundraising dinner to be held here next month is expected to net more than $1million to help Democratic Congressional candidates in 1974, Senator Lloyd Bentsen of Texas, said today. Senator Bentsen, new chairman of the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee, indicated that the party's campaign treasury was in good shape but declined to give any figures. We have enough money to pay our operating expenses, he told news conference.

title: Pike Sees Political Motive In Military Base Closings
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) A House subcommittee chairman says the White House is holding back a $1billion list of military bases to be closed, possibly to reward their friends or punish their enemies in Congress.

title: Nixon Asks Funds For a Peking Office And P.O.W Claims
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) President Nixon asked Cons gress today to appropriate $361million more for the 1973 fiscal year, including $1.5million to set up the new United States liaison office in Peking.

title: IDAHO MAY PUMP DESERT FOR WATER
description: TWIN FALLS, Idaho, April 9Faced with increasing public criticism of dam construction, and a shortage of possible dam sites, Idaho's water planners are looking to the state's southern desert for new water.

title: Key Question in Playoffs: Will Layoff Benefit or Hurt Knicks?
description: At least six days of idleness confront the New York Knicks as they wait for the BostonAtlanta series to produce their secondround opponent in the National Beiketball Association playoffs. The danger in that is they may lose the sharp edge their eight regulars displayed during the disposal of the Baltimore Bullets by, four games to one.

title: Vietcong's U.N. Bid Reported Rejected
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 9  Secretary General Waldheim has informed the Vietcong's Provisional Revolutionary Government that it may not open an office at the United Nations, qualified sources reported today.

title: S.E.C. Softens Rule on Brokers Fees
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 The Securities and Exchange Commission softened today a rule restricting brokerage firms paymnt of commissions to employes who solicit the purchase of securities other than for the account of the person paying the commission.

title: 3 Nominated to Positions for the First Time
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday slate of 10 candidates for twoyear terms on the exchange's board of directors, with the election to be held May 14.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: EAST DIVISION A.B.A. Playoffs WEST DIVISION FINAL

title: British Soccer Standings
description: SCOTTISH LEAGUE ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: College to Honor Muskie
description: WATERVILLE, Me., April 9 (UPI)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, will return next month to this city, where he started his political career 25 years ago, to receive an honorary degree from Thomas College.

title: Oregon's Bottle Bill Attacked and Praised
description: HEBO, Ore., April 7As owner of the Hebo Food Market in this village near the scenic Pacific Coast, Eugene Wesley complains that Oregon's controversial bottle bill, which requires a return deposit on any beverage container, is costing him money and adding drudg ery to his day.

title: ExP.O.W. Says Enemy Used Pro Torturers
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI)The nation's highestranking former prisoner of war says that the P.O.W.'s in North Vietnam learned to recognize and appreciate the real pros among the guards who tortured them.

title: Kitty Hawk Trials End
description: SAN DIEGO, April 9 (AP)The Navy today wound up the last of its trials in connection with last October's race riots aboard the aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk with the conviction of a black sailor on assault charges. Airman Noel A. Smith, 19 years old, of San Francisco was the 22d sailor and the 21st black to go on trial on charges stemming from the disturbance.

title: A Foxhole Was His Kitchen
description: STAMFORD, Conn.During World War II, Staff Sgt. George Engelhardt found Army field rations such a bore that he decided to improvise, using his helmet as a pot and whatever he could find as his ingredients.

title: Memories Are Full but Many Seats Empty on Yankee Anniversary
description: Even on a chilly afternoon of 47,972 empty seats, the peanuts and popcorn and crackerjacks had a nostalgic flavor at Yankee Stadium yesterday as the New York Yankees celebrated the goldenanniversary baseball opening of the House That Ruth Built.

title: Lake Ontario Waves Hit Rochester Area
description: ROCHESTER, April 9 (AP)About 20 homes at Sodus Point, 30 miles east of Rochester, were surrounded by water to day after weekend winds sent waves crashing ashore from Lake Ontario.

title: BLUE CHIPS LEAD MARKET UPWARD
description: Sparked by a surge of buying in blue chips, the stock market climbed sharply yesterday in slow trading.

title: From Second to First
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., April 9In the glow of his victory in the Masters golf tournament today, Tommy Aaron was told:

title: L.I. R. R. Accidents Kill 2; Evening Service Curtailed
description: Two persons died and three were injured yesterday in four accidents involving Long Island Rail Road trains. The accidents also caused two derailments that knocked out service on two lines for the evening rush hour.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, April 9James Gallagher, director of amateur and college baseball relations in Bovrie Kuhn's office, told the New Jersey college baseball coaches and writers today that coaches were to blame for college baseball's failure to grow.

title: international
description: Israeli commandos attacked Arab guerrilla bases early today in Beirut and Saida in southern Lebanon. Two prominent leaders of the Palestinian Fatah guerrilla organization were killed in the Beirut attack. The raids followed a Palestinian commando attack in Nicosia, Cyprus, yesterday. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: NORTH KOREA BIDS U.S. MOVE TROOPS
description: TOKYO, April 9North Korea today made public a direct appeal to the United States Congress to have American military forces withdrawn from South Korea and remove the obstacles lying in the way to Korea's peaceful reunification.The official Central News Agency said in a dispatch from Pyongyang that the Supreme People's Assembly, the highest parliamentary body in North Korea, approved a letter on Friday to be sent directly to Congress.

title: Levees Containing Mississippi But Officials Prepare for Flood
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 9 (AP) Army flood control experts said today that surging waters of the Mississippi River were till safely contained by levees here, but they continued to prepare for higher water.

title: Park Reservations Planned
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI)  Ronald Walker, the new director of the. National Park Service, said yesterday that a pilot program would allow a family to reserve camping space this summer at six of the nation's most heavily used national parks. He did not specify which six parks would be included in the experiment.

title: MRS. RYAN LINKED TO GIRL'S HANGING
description: Before she was put to death, the girl said in Polish: Remember me. The time, 1943. The place, Majdanek, a Nazi death camp near Lublin in Poland.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Forty thousand commuters began their second week of seeking alternative means of transportation as the Port Authority TransHudson (PATH) strike continued. Officials of the striking Brotherhood of Railway Carmen said yesterday that their members were prepared to stay off the job for a long time.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $2.500. Tickets, with the five numbers In reverse win $225. Tickets with the first or last four numbers In order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers In sequence win $25. Tickets with all live numbers scrambled win $25. Tickets matching the first and second digits, the second end third, the third end fourth or the fourth and filth win $2.50.

title: 9 Nuclear Heart Pacemakers Implanted
description: BETHESDA, Md., April 9Surgeons implanted Americandeveloped nuclear  powered heart pacemakers in nine patients today.

title: Danish Workers Approve A Return to Work Today
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, April 9 (AP) Workers and employers voted today to end Denmark's biggest labor conflict in 37 years. More than 260,000 workers are to return to work tomorrow after three weeks of strikes and lockouts.

title: Yanks Lose Home Opener, 31
description: When the Yankees opened their 50th season at Yankee Stadium last year, Rusty Torres and John Ellis sat on the bench. Charlie Spikes was in their minor league training complex in Hollywood, Fla., and Brent Strom was with the Mets Tidewater farm club in Norfolk, Va.

title: College Linescores
description: College Linescores

title: A Picasso Sets Mark, 1.1Million
description: The National Gallery of Art in Washington has purchased what some critics consider one of the most important early cubist paintings by Pablo Picasso, who died on Sunday. Although the gallery declined to reveal the purchase price, it reportedly cost $1.1million. The sum is believed to represent the highest price ever paid for a Picasso work.

title: CITY CHARTER UNIT ASKS POWER SHIFT
description: Charter Unit Urges a Decentralized City leather to try and reach that deadline, said State Senator, Roy M. Goodman, RepublicanLiberal of Manhattan, the commission's chairman, at a news conference.

title: A Picassb Art Record
description: Washington's National Gallery of Art has purchased a major cubist painting by Pablo Picasso. The gallery reportedly paid $1.1million for the canvas, a record sum for a Picasso work. Representing a nude woman, the 6foot painting is one of the artist's largest and most unusual works. Page 36.

title: British Soccer Standings
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE SCOTTISH LEAGUE

title: CONTRACT AWARD
description: The General Electric Company has received a $32.1million supplemental agreement to a previously awarded Air Force contract for turbojet engines.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: Calls New York a Creature of the State and Repeats Corruption Charges;By FRANCIS X. CLINES
description: ALBANY, April 9  Governor Rockefeller defended today his criticism of the Lindsay administration and his mayoral campaign maneuverings by asserting again that the city was suffering from corruption, inefficiency and mismanagement. New York City is a creature of the state the Governor declared in explaining how he views his responsibility toward the city.

title: The Pepski Generation Is Still Embryonic
description: MOSCOW, April 9Soviet consumers, parched during last year's unusually hot and dry summer when beer and soft drinks often ran short, are being promised that Westernstyle tonic water and Pepsi are on the way to help quench their thirst.

title: Indian Insurgents Denounce Accord; Siege at Wounded Knee to Continue
description: WASHINGTON, April 9An apparent agreement designed to end the 41day occupation of Wounded Knee, S.D., by a band of armed Indians fell apart before the eyes of a Congressional committee today.

title: Brazilian Legal Tactic Could Cost U.S. $1Million in House Sale
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 9 aThe sale of the United States Embassy residence here, a simple matter in itself, has somehow become the center of an international controversy involving the United States, West Germany and the Brazilian state of Guanabara.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Off at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, April 9Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale of these shortterm securities.

title: PLOHN ACCUSED; S.B.C. AIRS CASE
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The Securities and Exchange Commission ordered a hearing today on staff charges of violations of Federal securities laws by Charles Plohn & Co., a defunct New York brokerdealer.

title: singleMindedness a Liability Where the Target Is Unclear
description: Against a wellchosen defense, consistently continued, it is unduly optimistic to expect success with a onedimensional direct attack. Such strategy is correct only when there are clearcut weaknesses to bear down on or when so much firepower is amassed that the opponent cannot offer sufficient resistance.

title: BusTruck Crash Injures 2
description: TIPTON, Calif., April 9 (UPI) Twenty persons were Nurel today when a Greyhotui Cbu going from Redding, Catif, to Los Angeles collided With a trucktrailer rig on Highway 99 north of here overturned. Two of thoseinjured in the early morning accident were reported in poor condition at Tulare County Hospital.

title: EARNINGS INCREASE FOR HANOVER BANK
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation reported yesterday that its firstquarter net income, before securities transactions, went up 29 per cent to $23million from $17.8million. Pershare earnings rose to 80 cents from 62 cents.

title: U.A.W. ASKS DELAY ON EXHAUST CURBS
description: The United Auto Workers sent a closetodeadline appeal to the Environmental Protection Agency yesterday to grant the auto industry a year's delay in meeting the 1975 limits; on emissions of carbon monoxide and hydrocarbons.

title: Excerpts From Introductory Report on City Charter Revision
description: Following are excerpts from the introductory report of the State Charter Revision Commission for New York City:

title: ANACONDA BUILDING $25MILLION PLANT
description: The Anaconda Company announced yesterday that it had begun construction of a new hydrometallurgical plant for the production of copper at Anaconda, Mont.

title: TEXAS LEADER WINS DESPITE INDICTMENT
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., April 9 (UPI}The indictment of a South Texas political leader, George Parr, on income tax evasion charges for the third time in his 47year career apparently has not disenchanted the voters in the Duval County town he calls home.

title: CONGRESS PANEL DRAFTS REFORMS TO CURB SPENDING
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 Leaders of a special Senate and House study committee have reached tentative agreement on major reforms in the Congressional budget process.

title: Konigskinder, by Humperdinck; Given for First Time in 60 Years
description: Engelbert Humperdinck's Konigskinder received its first performance at the Metropolitan Opera in 1910, and everyone agreed that it was enchanting (more so than the Met's other world premiere that season. Puccini's Girl of the Golden West). Perhaps it was changing fashions, perhaps Geraldine Farrar's personal charm as the Goose Girl proved irreplaceablethe opera promptly disappeared from the repertory, and the three performances last weekend by the Manhattan School of Music Preparatory Division were the first hereabouts in 60 years.

title: SEOUL ENVISIONS TRADE WITH CHINA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 7In a cautious change in policy, South Korean officials have disclosed that their Government is prepared to establish trade relations with China.

title: STOCK PRICES RISE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market posted their second consecutive advance yesterday in slower trading.

title: International Stretch Elects
description: Eugene S. Cooper, 44 years old, has been named president, and a director of International Stretch Products, Inc. He succeeds Lester Cohen, who had previously been elected vice chairman. Martin Cohen continues as chairman. Mr. Cooper had been associated with Deering Milliken since that company acquired his family business, Cooper Textile Mills, in 1965. The latter then a major elastic knitter.

title: ROBE DOWNS STOLLE IN FINAL
description: HOUSTON, April 9 (AP)Ken Rosewall fought back from two service breaks in the final set to defeat Fred Stolle, 36, 62, 75, in the final of the $50,000 River Oaks tennis tournament.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The Yankee Stadium shone with resplendent attractiveness in the bright sunlight yesterday, an elegant old dowager about to celebrate an occasion of considerable distinction. This is the golden anniversary year for the ancient ball park and a considerable number of parties will mark various phases of these yearlong festivities. It is fervently hoped by the new Yankee management that they are better attended than was yesterday's home opener with its unimpressive gathering of only 17,028.

title: All Tied in N.B.A.
description: Golden State vs. Milwaukee Bucks

title: MEYER KATZMAN
description: Meyer Katzman, senior partner of Katzman Associates, architects at 147 East 50th Street, died Saturday at New York Hospital. His age was 70 and he lived at 60 Sutton Place South.

title: Kolton Cautions on Changes in Stock System
description: Paul Kolton, chairman of the American Stock Exchange, cautioned yesterday that the auctionmarket system, which was created to serve all investors, must not be weakened by any of the proposed restructuring now being considered.

title: Dollar and Gold Show Declines On Money Markets in Europe
description: LONDON, April 9 (UPI) The dollar and gold weakened today on European money markets.

title: LINDSAY ATTACKS ROCKEFELLER AGAIN
description: Mayor Lindsay, in the second day of attacks on Governor Rockefeller, warned yesterday that the city would not tolerate a Boss Rockefeller any more than we have accepted rule by and local boss and would reject a new kind of politically regressive rule from Albany.

title: Russo Weeps as He Tells Jury About Change in. Views on War
description: LOS ANGELES, April 9 knthony J. Russo Jr., one of the two defendants in the Pentagon papers trial, testified for the first time today and wept as he told how his feelings about the war in Vietnam, and finally his life, had been changed by a captured member of the Vietcong.

title: German Printers Strike
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, April 9 (AP)  West German printers conducted a surprise walkout today to back demands for higher wages. Their union said the strike would preyent publication tomorrow of nearly all the nation's newspapers.

title: Butz Set for O.E.C.D. Talks
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (Reuters)Secretary of. Agriculture Earl L. Butz will represent the United States at the conference of agriculture ministers of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in Paris Wednesday and Thursday, it was announced today.

title: JOHNS HOPKINS TOPS LACROSSE RANKINGS
description: Johns Hopkins vaulted into the top spot in the national lacrosse rankings after trouncing Cornell, 178, last Saturday. The victory was the Blue Jays' fourth in four starts. Cornell slipped from eighth to 10th in the weekly coaches poll.

title: City May Expand Decoy Police Unit
description: WASHINGTON, April 9New York City police officials told a Congressional hearing today that the use of undercover policemen on the streets, dressed in a variety of disguises to blend into the scenery, had probably deterred some street crime in the city.

title: 2 OFFICIALS DIFFER ON JERSEY INQUIRY
description: TRENTON, April 9  State and Federal investigations of the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 election campaign precipitated a new public dispute today between State Attorney General George F. Kugler Jr. and Herbert J. Stern, the United States Attorney.

title: CITY OPERA FIGARO OFFERS TWO DEBUTS
description: Sunday night's Marriage of Figaro by the New York City Opera at the State Theater offered two debuts, and it is probably as much a credit as a debit that neither of them stood out unduly. For this was one of the company's more convincing ensemble efforts, boasting an evenly matched, generally competent cast (apart from Spiro Malas's wooly, crude Figaro) bound together by Christopher Keene's sometimes pressed but always light and buoyant conducting.

title: Hawaii Teachers Still Out
description: HONOLULU, April 9 (AP)A teachers strike that has left Hawaii's 181,000 public school children without normal classes went into its second week today. In resumed negotiations the Hawaii State Teachers Association was reported to have eased its pay demands to a 7 per cent increase Sept. 1 and an equal amount in September, 1974. The state reportedly held to an offer of a 5.5 per cent increase now and 2.5 per cent in September, 1974. About 90 per cent of Hawaii's 9,000 teachers joined the walkout.

title: SNG Gas Venture Planned
description: Moore and McCormack Company, Inc., and the South Carolina Electric and Gas Company announced yesterday plans for construction of a synthetic natural gas (SNG) plant at a cost of $10million near Charleston, S. C. The plant will be owned and operated by Moore and McCormack and the output of 30 million cubic feet of SNG a day will be purchased under a longterm contract by the utility.

title: Opposition Bids Portugal Cease Warfare in Africa
description: LISBON, April 9The first gathering of opponents of the Portuguese regime to be allowed in four years issued an appeal last night for the end of the colonial war in Africa and the establishment of political freedom in Portugal.

title: College and School Results
description: BASEBALL BASEBALL

title: Russo Sobs at Triai In Testifying on War
description: LOS ANGELES, April 9 Anthony J. Russo Jr., one of the two defendants in the Pentagon papers trial, testified for the first time today and wept as he told how his feelings about the war in Vietnam, and finally his life, had been changed by a captured member of the Vietcong.

title: MARILYN COCHRAN CAPTURES SLALOM
description: MAMMOTH MOUNTAIN, Calif., April 9 (AP)Marilyn Cochran of Richmond, Vt., won the women's slalom today and her 17yearold sister, Lindy, was third in the Dick Springer Memorial ski races.

title: U.S. Won't Pay I.T.T. for Chilean Loss
description: WASHINGTON, April 9The Government corporation that insures American businesses against losses from expropriation of their overseas plants today turned down a $92.5million claim filed by the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: People in Sports: Littlest Pro
description: Howard Stevensof toy size compared with most National Football League players but the 5foot5inch, running back, a 16thround draft choice, signed yesterday with the New Orleans Saints. His credentials at RandolphMacon and Louisville (two years at each) were impressive. Stevens can run 40 yards in 4.5 seconds and his rushing totals, 5,297 yards, 69 touchdowns and 418 points, are fourseason National Collegiate records. He also returned 31 punts for 378 yards and a touchdown, and ran back 12 kickoffs for 240 yards  The Saints also acquired Adrian Young, an outside linebacker from the Detroit Lions in exchange for an undisclosed draft choice.

title: BROOKLYN SCHOOL SHUT BY PROTEST
description: A junior high school in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn was closed yesterday to cool emotions after pupils walked out of classes to protest a decision by the local school board to remove the principal.

title: TRACKS IN A FEUD ON WINTER DATES
description: Leon Greenberg, president of Monticello Raceway, accused the management of Roosevelt Raceway yesterday of indirectly attempting to kill winter racing at Monticello. Greenberg referred to a bill recently introduced in the New York State Legislature calling for yearround racing dates at Roosevelt and Yonkers harness tracks.

title: INJUNCTION IS SET ON OPTIONS CASE
description: LOS ANGELES, April 9 (AP) Commodity Options International, Inc., has agreed to permanent injunction after the Securities and Exchange Commission charged it with violations of securities laws.

title: An Annual Outlay of $1Billion Is Urged to Find Energy Supply
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP)  A House study group recommended today a $1billion year increase in research to meet the energy crisis, including an allout attempt to replace petroleum with synthetic coal gas.

title: Postal Strike Right Scored
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) The United States Postal Service, facing a possible walkout of mailmen in midsummer, expressed opposition today to pending legislation giving postal workers the right to strike. Postmaster General Elmer T. Klassen told a House Post Office subcommittee that his Board of Governors had decided to oppose the righttostrike bill and that he was opposed to a separate measure granting unions the right to form a union shop.

title: Alaska Airlines Elects
description: The executive committee of Alaska Airlines has elected O. F. Benecke as president, effective with the retirement of L. P. Blatter on July 1. Mrd Benecke is currently senior vice presidentservices for Alaska Airlines.

title: Books of The Times
description: One can say what one wants about Ralph de Toledano's J. Edgar Hoover: The Man in His Timeand most of what one wants to say is derogatory. But at the very least one comes away from this book by conservative journalist with a general estimation of Hoover that most of us can probably live with. Tb wit, that Hoover shaped and influ

title: Two Officials Clasfr Over Jersey Inquiry On Cahill Finances
description: TRENTON, April 9  State and Federal investigations of the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 election campaign precipitated a new public dispute today between State Attorney General George F. Kugler Jr. and Herbert J. Stern, the United States Attorney.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Forty thousand commuters began their second week of seeking alternative means of transporat! on as the Port Atithority TransHudson (PATH) strike continued. Officials of the striking Brotherhood of Railway Carmen said yesterday that their members were prepared to stay off the job for a long time. Transport of New Jersey said it would provide extra bus service to ferry commuters between Jersey City and lower Manhattan.

title: General Cinema Holders Told to Expect Higher Net
description: Stockholders of the General Cinema Corporation were told at their annual meeting yesterday in Wilmington, Del., that the company's earnings are expected to continue upward in the second fiscal quarter ending April 30: No specific earnings prediction, however, was made.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Book About Nymphs Designed to Stir the Longings of a Trout Fisherman.

title: On Paper, A Good Prison Plan
description: New York State's Department of Correctional Services has sounded many of the right notes in proposing a $276.9million prison construetion master plan. This is important, since New York is one of the major centers of imprisoned men; but whether this proposal is worth the paper it is written on remains to be seen. The chances do not appear favorable.

title: Tabie for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Tabie for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: Dirks Says Equity Articles Led to a Brief Loss of Post
description: Raymond L. Dirks, who first brought to light the burgeoning, multimilliondollar Equity Funding Corporation of America scandal, said yesterday that he had been briefly dismissed and then rehired by his Wall Street firin over the weekend.

title: Brennan Cautions Congress On Penn Central Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI)  Peter J. Brennan, the Secretary of Labor, asked Congress today not to intervene in a dispute between the Penn Central Railroad and the United Transportation Union, although there is only one month left in their 90day coolingoff period. Central Railroad and the United Transportation Union, although there is only one month left in their 90day coolingoff period.

title: Gunman Is Killed as 3Day Toll in Ulster Rises to 5
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 9 (UPI)British soldiers shot and killed a gunman today and a soldier died from wounds he received two months ago, bringing the number of dead in Ulster violence to five since Saturday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee to investigate Israeli practices affecting human rights in occupied territories11:30 AM.

title: Trooper Started Federal Cahill Inquiry By Following a Familiar Route to Stern
description: TRENTON, April 9State Police Detective James Challender walked a familiar path last month when he provided United States Attorney Herbert J. Stern with information that launched an investigation into the handling of campaign funds during Governor Cahill's 1969 campaign.

title: Driver's BulletRiddled Car Leads to Burglary Charges
description: CLAY, N. Y., April 9 (AP)The police said they arrested the driver of a car riddled with bullet holes today after the owner of a service station said he fired 15 rounds of ammunition into a car driven by a man trying to break into the station.

title: CONSULTANT SUES OVER LINDSAY FEE
description: David Garth, the political television consultant who packaged Mayor Lindsay's efforts in one Presidential and two mayoral campaigns, filed suit in State Supreme Court yesterday to collect more than $31,000 that he said the Lindsay 1972 Presidential campaign apparatus owned him.

title: Liddy Termed Only High Official Knownto McCord
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) The lawyer for James W. McCord Jr. said today that his client had no firsthand knowledge that anybody higher up than the convicted G. Gordon Liddy knew of plans to wiretap Democratic headquarters at the Watergate office complex here.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: A message from the Spanish Government was among the many expressions of tribute and condolence delivered to the family of Pablo Picasso, who died on Sunday in Mougins, France. The artist had been an exile from his native land since 1939, when Generalissimo Francisco Franco came into power.

title: JOSEF PAM DIES; AIDE OF DUBCEK, 64
description: PRAGUE, April 9 (Reuters)Josef Pavel, Interior Minister of Czechoslovakia during the liberal regime of Alexander Dubcek, Communist party leader, died today. He was 64 years old.

title: Two Hurt by Tel Aviv Bomb
description: TEL AVIV, April 9 (AP)A homemade time bomb exploded outside Tel Aviv's central bus station today, slightly injuring two Arabs, the police said. The charge was apparently planted by Arab guerrillas, a police spokesman said.

title: Rains and Flooding Hurt 2 Harvests in Delta Area
description: ROLLING FORK, Miss., April 9 The flooding of the Mississippi River and its tributaries this spring is the second part of a doublebarrel calamity for many farmers.

title: Westinghouse Officials Visit Facilities in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, April 9 (UPI)A group of Westinghouse Electric Corporation officials visited Soviet electrotechnical industry facilities in Leningrad today, the Tass news agency reported.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: This road climbs steadily into the ??? forested foothills above Elkin, where the whiteclapboarded houses of Blowing Rock lie in the first summits of the Blue Ridge. The midsummer heat of the coastal plain is weaker there. Hawks and ospreys circle patiently on the foothill thermals. The road climbs higher toward Altamount, and beyond the barrier of these hazecolored mountains lie the winding currents of the French Broad. Or this:

title: 2 Drink Strychnine At Service and Die In Display of Faith
description: NEWPORT, Tenn., April 9A preacher and another leader in church snake handling died early yesterday after drinking strychnine at a service that Cocke County officials said was a demonstration of; faith.

title: MISS TROXELL SINGS IN VIVACIOUS STYLE
description: Suzanne Troxell's soubrettecoloratura soprano is of a sort highly prized and much cultivated in German opera houses very bright in timbre with a hard ping around the edges and colored with a rapid but not excessive vibrato. Her program of songs at Carnegie Recital Hall on Sunday night made the most of these qualities.

title: GOING OUTGuider
description: CARIB COMERS Jamaica is a young island nation in the Caribbean but its culture goes back centuries. Starting tonight at 7:30, Jamaican culture will be graphically illustrated by the 10yearold Jamaica National Dance Theater Company on its first New York visit. The company will be appearing through Sunday at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, 30 Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn (783.6700), in seven performances. There will be dancers, singers and musicians, and the selections will range from sheer traditional folk to modern, more abstract ballet. The company works dance theater into its name because each number it does has a story to tell. The troupe has played Britain, West Germany, Guyana and Stratford, Ontario, as well as Miami, Atlanta and Washington in this country.

title: OTHER PETROLEUM REPORTS
description: RRecord Periods ended Feb. 28 unless otherwise Indicated.

title: FRENCH PRIEST ASKS IMPEACHING OF POPE
description: ROME, April 9The leader of a small French group of ultraconservative Roman Catholics, the Rev. Georges de Nantes, announced at an outdoor press conference here tonight that he would formally ask the Vatican tomorrow to start proceedings for canonical impeachment of Pope Paul VI.

title: Syracuse Boy Killed In Chase by Police
description: SYRACUSE, April 9 (AP)A 14yearold boy who was said by the police to be a passenger in a stolen car was killed today when the car slammed into tree during a highspeed chase.

title: A Band of Arab Guerrillas Attacks Israelis on Cyprus
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Tuesday, April 10A band of Arab guerrillas using a powerful bomb blew out the entrance to the apartment building housing the Israeli Ambassador yesterday and then attacked an Israeli airliner in an apparent attempt to hijack it before takeoff.

title: TEACHER, 21, TELLS OF RAPE IN SCHOOL
description: Testifies in Paterson That Defendant Wielded Knife Mother Breaks Down Motion for Mistrial

title: Butcher's Shopping Lecture Draws a Rapt Crowd
description: ORANGE, N. J., April 9A group of 100 housewives and several men crowded into the basement of the public library on Main Street here this morning to pick up insider tips on how to get the most and the best for the least money at the retailstore meat counter.

title: NIXON ACTION URGED ON FOOTWEAR TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) A group of 23 New England Congressmen today urged President Nixon to take immediate action to permit the American footwdar industry to survive.

title: Insurance Merger Opposed
description: Four general agents of the Standard Security Life Insurance Company of New York said yesterday that they would] oppose the proposed merger of Standard Security with USLife Corporation. They said the merger would reduce competition.

title: Anchovy Fishing Resumed By Peruvian Fishermen
description: LIMA, April 9 (AP)More than 18,000 Peruvian anchovy fishermen returned to sea today.

title: Parnelli Jones Group Bids To Run Ontario Speedway
description: ONTARIO, Calif., April 9 (AP) A group headed by a former Indianapolis 500 winner, Par nelli Jones, was reported today to be in line to become the new operator of the $25.5  million Ontario Motor Speedway, idle since financial difficulties shut it down last fall.

title: PATERSON SYSTEM: IS RULED INVALID
description: TRENTON, April 9 The, State Supreme Court ruled today that the form of govern,ment now in effect in Paterson the only one of its kind in the state and perhaps in the nation, is unconstitutional. The system gives great power to appointed commissioners and little or none to elected Aldermen.

title: Bridge:
description: Two undefeated teams survive in the Greater New York Bridge Association's double knockout team championship for the Von Zedtwitz trophy: the Precision Team and a sextet headed by Sandy Stern. They will meet later this month.

title: ARABS IN CYPRUS
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Tuesday, April 10A band of Arab guerrillas using a powerful bomb blew out the entrance to the apartment building housing the Israeli Ambassador yesterday and then attacked an Israeli airliner in an apparent attempt to hijack it before takeoff.

title: PICKETS PROTESTING IMPORTS OF APPAREL
description: Garment workers in the city began a weeklong informational picketing protest yesterday at major stores and shopping centers as part of a continuing campaign of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union aimed at stemming the increase in apparel imports.

title: Singer Co. Demonstrates Its Products to Russians
description: MOSCOW, April 9 (UPI)The Singer Company today began four days of product demonstrations in a bid to stir Soviet interest in its products.

title: RALLY EXTENDED IN BOND MARKED
description: Bond prices raced ahead again yesterday, extending rally ignited late last week on the growing belief that economic controls would be tightened or extended, or that the Federal Reserve would act to keep interest rates in check and, thus, out of any Phase 4'As a result, the entire spectrum of interest rates moved Credit notch lower  on Markets fixed  income securities due in only a few days out to issues with terms as long as 40 years.

title: City to Open 28 Housing Projects in 73, Golar Says
description: The City Housing Authority will open 28 new projects with 7,379 units this year, according to the authoraty chairman, Simeon Golar, who said yesterday that the agency could have produced many more units for the effort expended.

title: ARGENTINA SHIFTS TENNIS MATCHES
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 9Argentina will play its South American Zone Davis Cup semifinal series against South Africa in Uruguay this weekend, spokesman at the Argentine Tennis Association disclosed today.

title: Carolina Indians to Meet
description: RALEIGH, N.C., April 9 (UPI) Gov. James E. Hotsbouser sent word today tolndians who staged a 100mille march to Raleigh that he was willing to meet with a delegation tomorrow to discuss their demands. Howard Brooks, Selfproclaimed chief of the Tuscarora faction of Robeson County Indians, and his followers want the state Indian Commission to meet to hear demands for control of predominantly Indian schools and for more job opportunities for Indians.

title: Rate Guidelines Are Due
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (Reuters)A spokesman for the Committee on Interest and Dividends said the committee's guidelines for a dual prime rate might be issued next week or the week after.

title: Plus Ca Change, Plus C'Est La Meme Chose
description: A policeman is accused of corruption. Prices are soaring. A monetary crisis is developing in Europe. Irish rebels and troops are fighting. The State Legislature is talking about a crackdown on obscenity. A big Wall Street firm is in fraud trouble.

title: Agriculture Aide Charged With Bugging Wife's Phone
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) An official of the Department of Agriculture was indicted by a grand jury today on charges of hiring a private detective concern to place an electronic listening device on the telephone of his estranged wife.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Goalie's Walkout Sends Blazers Into a Tantrum
description: Management and players of the Philadelphia Blazers are infuriated at Bernie Parent. The goalie was the first name player to jump from the National League to the World Hockey Association and signed a longterm contract worth more than $120,000 a year with the Blazers. But Parent reportedly discovered that $600,000in escrow had been taken out of the bank by the team, and he refused to appear in the World Cup playoffs against the Cleveland Crusaders. Without him, the Blazers dropped weekend games. They used 40yearold Marcel Paille and a rookie goalie, Yves Archambault.

title: OFFICE BLOWN UP
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Tuesday, April 10 Israeli commandos attacked Arab guerrilla bases early today in Beirut and Saida, on the Lebanese coast. The raids, carried out in darkness, followed a Palestinian commando attack yesterday on, Israelis in Cyprus.

title: Photoengravers Ratify Pact
description: Charles L. McConnell, president of Photoengravers Local 1P, announced yesterday that his union had ratified a new agreement with 10 gravure shops in the city providing for a wage increase of $19 and benefit increases of $6.27 in the first year, and $15 more in wages and $4.70 in benefits the second year. The pact covers 354 workers, he said.

title: Denying I.T.T.'s Claim
description: Congress established the Overseas Private Investment Corporation primarily to provide risk insurance to American companies with investments in the developing countries. Earlier this month, the 0.P.I.C. president, Bradford Mills, made plain to a House subcommittee that the corporation would feel justified in rejecting an insurance claim where an investor was guilty of actions that would create political problems and provoke expropriation in a host country.

title: Hudderfield Loses in Rugby
description: BRADFORD, England, April 9 (Reuters)Bradford Northern beat Huddersfield, 14 to 7, in a Rugby League match tonight.

title: Music. Opera by Starer
description: So many applecarts were upset in music, the theater and the arts in general during the first third of this century that many artists still are trying to get past the debris and get on with their own generation's work. Robert Starer's new opera, Pantagleize, which had its first performances last weekend at Brooklyn College, is yet another attempt to recapture the past by imitating the moods and manners of Middle European expressionist art as we know it from the operas of Berg, Schoenberg, Hindemith and lesser composers such as Krenek.

title: Congressional Unit Drafts Reforms to Curb Spending
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 Leaders of a special Senate and House study committee have reached tentative agreement on major reforms in the Congressional budget process.

title: Key Qestion in Playoffs: Will Layoff Benefit or Hurt Knicks?
description: At least six days of idleness confront the New York Knicks as they wait for the BostonAtlanta series to produce their secondround opponent in the National Basketball Association playoffs. The danger in that is they may lose the sharp edge their eight regulars displayed during the disposal of the Baltimore Bullets by four games to one.

title: DUMPING OF STEEL FOUND BY TREASURY
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (UPI) The Treasury said today it had found out that Frenchmanfactured stainlesssteel wire rods were being dumped on the American market in violation of United States trade laws.

title: Advertising: Local Marketing
description: Over at the American Research Bureau the thinking is that the big thrust of the 1970's for national advertisers will be toward local marketing.

title: STUDENT IS KILLED, 3 ARE HURT IN CRASH
description: THOMPSON, N.Y., April 9 (AP)A car carrying a coed and three athletes from the University of Bridgeport went out of control and overturned on Route 17 yesterday, killing one student and critically injuring the others.

title: JEWS SUE NEWSDAY OVER A DISPUTED AD
description: An Orthodox Jewish group sued in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday to enjoin Newsday, the Long Island newspaper, from refusing to accept an advertisement that condemned intermarriage as suicide, national and personal.

title: Events Today
description: Theater Film Opera Concerts Dance

title: Production of Steel Up by 0.1% After Showing OneWeek Drop
description: Steel production for the week ended Saturday resumed its upward trend after a oneweek decline, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: The Inquiring Reporter
description: The Times doesn't pay anything for questions like the following:

title: People and Business
description: Lehman Brothers, Inc., may be shifting its leaders. Lewis L. Glucksman,one of a dozen or so senior managing directors, Is expected to become executive managing director, a position that seems clearly the No. 4 spot of the investment banking house. Mr. Glucksman is president of Lehman Commercial Paper and chairman of Lehman Government Securities, two subsidiaries.

title: Bologna Gives Free Bus Rides in Effort to Reduce Use of Cars
description: BOLOGNA, Italy, April 8 This compact city of 500,000 people and 200,000 cars is in the throes of a revolution that has brought it free rides on buses, plenty of new walking space amid the palaces and churches of its wellpreserved historic center and nasty traffic snarls on its outskirts.

title: Television
description: Television

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L.I., 8 P.M.

title: President Wilson Ends Final Voyage on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 9 (UPI)  The S.S. President Wilson came home today for the last time to a welcome by a single fireboat and the strains of California, Here I Come.

title: 74,200 SEE YANKEES OPEN NEW STADIUM
description: Record Baseball Crowd Cheers as Slugger's Drive Beats Red Sox, 4 to 1. 25,000 ARE TURNED AWAY Gates to $2,500,000 Arena Are Closed Half an Hour Before Start of Game. MANY NOTABLES ATTEND Governor Smith Throws Out First BallShawkey, In Great Form, Allows Only Three Hits.

title: RegentTerm Cut is Defeated in Albany
description: ALBANY, April 9The State Senate rejected a bill today that would have shortened the terms of members of the State Board of Regents from the present 15 years to five years.

title: Sidney Nadel, 61, Is Dead; Board of Education Counsel
description: Sidney P. Nadel, former assistant Corporation Counsel who became, counsel to the Board of Education seven years ago, died Sunday in Maimonides Hospital, Brooklyn. His age was 61 and he lived at 1970 East 18th Street, Brooklyn.

title: Oil Deal Signed in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, April 9 An eightyear oil exploration and prospecting agreement was signed in Islamabad today between Pakistan and the Marathon Oil Company, the Pakistani radio reported tonight. The agreement covers 10,000 square miles, offshore and onshore, along the Mekran coast of Baluchistan province.

title: Football Transactions
description: PHILADELPHIASigned Guy Morriss, guard and center from Texas Christian; Gary Van Eist, tackle from Michigan State, and Joe Lavender, defensive back from San Diego State.

title: Canadian Banks Raise Prime Rates
description: TORONTO, April 9 (CanadianPress)Canada's major chartered banks raised their prime lending rate today following a Federal Government move designed to tighten credit and improve Canada's foreignexchange position.

title: Pot n Kettle Politics
description: The ceaseless feud between Mayor Lindsay and Governor Rockefeller has reached flashpoint once more. This is a feud that began appropriately enough during a citywide garbage strike. It has stayed at the level its origins for five yearsto the considerable discredit of both protagonists and to the even more considerable disadvantage of the people of this city.

title: Nevada Legislature Backs An Acupuncture System
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., April (UPI)  The Legislature approved today a bill allowing Nevada to become the first state to sanction the use of acupuncture on patients on a fullscale basis.

title: Rome U.S.O. Attacked
description: ROME, April 9 (Reuters)Two men overpowered a police guard outside a U.S.O. club near the Vatican tonight and threw two gasoline bombs through the windows. The fire destroyed some furniture. The police said they believed that the attack was linked to the visit by the South Vietnamese President, Nguyen Van Thieu.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Aqueduct Jockeys Roosevelt Results POST POSITION SUMMARY Roosevelt Drivers Roosevelt Raceway Entries

title: In the Absence Of Serious Men
description: The admission by the President's man, H. R. Haldeman, that he was responsible for intelligence during the Nixon campaign of 1972 is gravely damaging, for intelligence was the one commodity in which the campaign was povertystricken.bad taste will depend on the observer's political bias. Nobody, on the other hand, will disagree about their dumbness.

title: Home on the Range Where Buffalo Roam Is Upstate
description: STORMVILLE, N.Y., April 9Charles and Julia Tucker have a home where the buffalo roam only 90 minutes from Times Square in Dutchess County.

title: E. I. du Pont Is Expecting Highs for Sales and Profit
description: WILMINGTON, Del., April 9 E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc. told the annual meeting here that sales and earnings for the first quarter would set records.

title: 500 More Uganda Refugees Will Be Admitted to U.S.
description: GENEVA, April 9The United States will admit 500 more of the stateless Asians who were expelled from Uganda last year, the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees announced today.

title: Manila Reports 200 Rebels Slain in Mindanao Battle
description: MANILA, April 9 (AP) More than 200 Moslem rebels and at least 11 Government soliders were killed as the army drove insurgents from a southern Philippines town in two weeks of fighting, a police official said today.

title: Appeals Court Upholds Fining of 2 Reporters
description: NEW ORLEANS, April 9 (UPI)  The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit upheld today a contempt citation against two reporters who printed testimony in violation of a Judge's orders. The court said its ruling did not infringe on the right of a free press.

title: WNET Names Directors For Programing and News
description: WNET/Channel 13 has named Robert Kotlowitz director of programing and Frederick M. Bohen director of news and public affairs, it was announced yesterday by John Jay Iselin, acting president of the public television station.

title: BENJAMIN F. SHEPHERD
description: Benjamin Franklin Shepherd, who retired in 1960 as chief metallurgist of IngersollRand Company, died Sunday at his home in Phillipsburg, N.J. His age was 79.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Immigration Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) James F. Greene has been named Acting Commissioner of the Immigration and Naturalization Service, it was announced today.

title: CITY CHARTER UNIT ASKS POWER SHIFT
description: The State Charter Revision Commission yesterday reported that it had concluded that the city's government should be decentralized, but that it had not yet decided how or how much.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: LESLIE SAALBURG
description: Leslie Saalburg, an illustrator for leading magazines, died Sunday in Paris, where he lived. He was 77 years old.

title: 2,017 With $20,000 Income
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. April 9 (UPI)State tax officials report that 2,017 Californians with annual Incomes above $20,000 paid no state income taxes last year.

title: Sweden Six Tops Poland
description: MOSCOW, April 9 (AP)Sweden remained in second place today behind the Soviet Union by drubbing Poland, 70, in the world hockey championship tournament. The victory gave Sweden a 51 record with the Soviet 60.

title: Notes on People
description: The first candidate for a New York City mayoral nomination to hire a priest for his press secretary is Albert H. Blumenthal,a Manhattan Democrat. The new press secretary is the Rev. Mark Corrigan,a Roman Catholic clergyman who has been working at City Hall since September of 1970. Father Corrigan said he would resign this week from his $21,900ayear position as deputy city administrator to go to work for Mr. Blumenthal.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: EAST DIVISION Montreal vs. Buffalo WEST DIVISION

title: A Picasso Art Record
description: Washington's National Gallery of Art has purchased a major cubist painting by Pablo Picasso. The gallery reportedly paid $1.1million for the canvas, a record sum for a Picasso work. Representing a nude woman, the 6foot painting is one of the artist's largest and most unusual works. Page 36.

title: States Get U.S. Land
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) The White House said today that 17 parcels of sirplus Federal lands were being transferred to state and local governments under the Legacy of Parks program.

title: 3 VESSELS REACH CAMBODIA CAPITAL; OIL TANKER SUNK
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 9A tanker with fuel for this beleaguered city was destroyed today by rockets fired by Communist gunners, but three other supply vessels managed to slip through the blockade along the Mekong River and were reported to be approaching the city.

title: Fortunate Harbor Sets Track. Record at Aqueduct
description: Fortunate Harbor proved ready and fresh for the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday, Just in from a good campaign in California, the 4yearold Robert Dodderidge colt broke the track record in the 6furlong race, with a clocking of 1:15 15.

title: Moscow Says MIG23 Breaks Speed Record
description: MOSCOW, April 9The Soviet Union announced today that one of its leading test pilots, flying an advanced MIG23 fighter, had beaten his own speed record in a closed circuit of 100 kilometers (62 miles).

title: Vietcong Are Blamed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, April 10All flights by helicopters of the International Commission of Control and Supervision have been temporarily suspended because of shooting incidents involving such aircraft, a commission source said this morning.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS DOWN ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE

title: Wagner Calls Role in Fund A Judgment Error at Most
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner said yesterday his role as chairman of a foreignbased mutual fund was, most, a mistake in judgment. The fund is involved in a $30million civil lawsuit in which Mr. Wagner and other prominent persons are accused of fraud and diverting funds.

title: Senate Bill Will Ask Bilingual Courts to Aid Minorities
description: WASHINGTON, April 9A movement to require simultaneous translation in all Federal courts that serve communities with significant numbers of nonEnglishspeaking residents is taking shape in court reform and Congressional circles.

title: RHODESIA DEFENDS TRIAL OF NEWSMAN
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 9Reacting to the worldwide protests aroused by the secret trial last week of Peter Niesewand, a journalist, the Rhodesian Government said today that secret trials were held in other countries.

title: Strike Halts Paris Subway
description: PARIS, April 9 (Reuters)A morning rushhour strike closed down the Paris subway today, forcing hundreds of thousands of Parisians to walk to work or squeeze aboard packed buses. The strike, which ended at noon, was called to protest the death of a ticket collector who was attacked by a passenger.

title: Mrs. Daryle M. Feldmeir, Wife of Chicago Editor, Dies
description: CHICAGO, April 9  Mrs. Jeanne Elizabeth Meyer Feldmeir, a sculptor and the wife of Daryle M. Feldmeir, editor of The Chicago Daily News, died today in Billings Hospital. She was 46 years old and lived in Winnetka.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Now that dozens of the world's top artists and weavers are doing ruglike tapestries, the nation's two top rugmakers were bound to return to what they pioneered in decades ago  devising woven wall hangings.

title: Brooklyn's Unknowns Fight to Save Homes
description: On North Fourth Street in Brooklyn, a black banner heading Save Our Homes hangs from one of the neat frame houses as if the neighborhood were in mourning. On the same brickfacade residence, a poster shows a giant octopus with buildings gripped in its tentacles.

title: The Price of Energy
description: The anachronistic oil import quotas are soon to be declared officially deada welcome development, even if it comes three years or so after all life departed from them anyway. Unfortunately, with or without the quotas, or the import fees that are to take their place, it is now clear that the cost of fuels for American consumers is going to have to rise.

title: GeorgiaPacific Consents To F.T.C. Order on Sales
description: WASHINGTON, April 9 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission today tentatively accepted a consent order prohibiting the GeorgiaPacific Corporation, a Portland, Ore., based organization with a controlling interest in some 40 subsidiaries, from engaging in illegal reciprocal purchasing or sales arrangements.

title: 2 BIG BOARD FIRMS AGREE ON MERGER
description: Dominick & Dominick, Inc., and Lombard, Nelson & McKenna, Inc., both member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, said yesterday they had agreed in principle to consolidate.

title: Threat to Kidnap Son Reported by Aparicio
description: BOSTON, April 9 (UPI)Luis Aparicio of the. Boston Red Sox said today a gang of extortionists had threatened to kidnap his 15yearold son in Venezuela if they were not paid off. The shortstop, who resides during the offseason in Maracaibo, Venezuela, said his wife received the threatening telephone calls at their home about a week ago.

title: Gallagher May Face Contempt Charge
description: NEWARK, April 9 (UPI)A\ Federal judge began proceedings today that could lead to contempt charges against former Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher for a letter he wrote to another judge. The letter allegedly violated a court ban that had been imposed in part to protect national security.

title: Jupiter Craft on Course
description: PASADENA, Calif., April 9 (AP)The Pioneer 11 spacecraft, speeding toward Jupiter at 86,000 miles an hour, began to leave earth's sphere of influence today. The 570pound craft was launched Thursday from Cape Kennedy and is expected to complete its journey by December, 1974.

title: Bridgeport Player Killed
description: HARRIS, N.Y., April 9 (UPI) Paul T. Waters, 20 years old, of Montauk, L.I., a University of Bridgeport basketball player, was killed yesterday in a onecar accident on Route 17, Three other persons were injured critically.

title: Governor Defends Attacks On City and Repeats Them
description: ALBANY, April 9  Governor Rockefeller defended today his criticism of the Lindsay administration and his mayoral campaign maneuverings by asserting again that the city was suffering from corruption, inefficiency and mismanagement. New York City is a creature of the state the Governor declared in explaining how he views his responsibility toward the city.

title: Bergen Yields Records On Order of U.S. Judge
description: NEWARK, April 9The first four truckloads of Bergen County financial records subpoenaed by United States Attorney Herbert J. Stern arrived at the loading dock of the Federal Building here after District Court Judge Lawrence Whipple ordered them to be produced forthwith.

title: M'GRAW IS READY FOR BUSY SPRING
description: The little old schedulemaker has already made April an easy month for the New York Mets by giving them six days off, one of which (the 30th) they'll use to play the Cadets at West Point, and the little old rainmaker, who always works so hard this month, could make the schedule even easier.

title: British Newspapers Agree to Settlement Of Their Libel Battle
description: LONDON, April 9 (AP)An apology was disclosed today in the High Court from The Times to Lord Rothermere, his son and their newspaper chain for unjustified charges contained in an article written by a Times columnist, Bernard Levin.

title: WAGNER DISMISSES HIS ROLE IN FUND
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner said yesterday his role as chairman of a foreignbased mutual fund was, at most, a mistake in Judgment. Thelund is involved in a $30million civil lawsuit in which Mr. Wagner and other prominent persons are accused of fraud and diverting funds.

title: Apollos List Soccer Slate
description: ATLANTA, April 9 (AP)Atlanta's Apollos in the North American Soccer League anflounced an 11game home schedule today and said that all games would be played at Georgia Tech's Grant Field The Apollos open league play May 11 against Montreal.

title: OwensCorning Fiberglas Lists Peak Quarter Profit
description: The OwensCorning Fiberglas Corporation achieved record sales and earnings in the first quarter this year, continuing the 1972 gains. Expanded production and a strong national economy, were factors in the advance, William W. Boeschenstein, president, said yesterday.

title: ICELAND WILL HOLD TALK WITH BRITISH
description: LONDON, April 9After months of incidents on the high seas followed by diplomatic protests, Britain and Iceland are moving toward a new round of talks on ending their latest war over fishing rights.

title: Atlantic City Motel Is Badly Damaged in Blaze
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Tuesday, April 10Fire raged out of control for several hours last night and early this morning, destroying much of the Howard Johnson Motor Lodge on Pacific and Arkansas Avenues.

title: COUNCILMEN BALK ON BUYERS CENTER
description: Expressing caustic skepticism about the appropriate use of taxpayers money, the City Council's Finance Committee yesterday held up approval of $150,000 in city funds to help furnish a luxurious hospitality center for apparelindustry buyers.

title: At Least 100 British Tourists Killed In Plane Crash in a Swiss Snowstorm
description: GENEVA, April 10A British charter plane crashed during a heavy snowstorm this morning while trying to land at Basel, in northwestern Switzerland. More than 100 passengers and crewmen were killed.

title: Policemen Shot 6 Policemen In New Orleans Gun Battle
description: WASHINGTON, April 10 (UPI)Police Superintendent Clarence B. Giarrusso of New Orleans disclosed today that six policemen wounded in the January gun battle at the Howard Johnson's motel had been shot by policemen.

title: News Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, APRIL 11, 1973
description: The United States began airlifting fuel into Phnom Penh, the besieged capital of Cambodia. The first planes were scheduled to bring in only military fuel, American officials said, but they suggested that later flights might carry commercial fuel if efforts to ease the critical shortage failed. [Page 1, Column 1.].

title: Kleindienst Sees Wider Executive Shield
description: WASHINGTON, April 10 Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst appeared to widen the Administration's definition of executive privilege today to cover 2.5 million employes of the executive branch of the Government.

title: Football Transactions
description: BUFFALOSigned John LeHem defensive; tackle from South Carolina. CHICAGOSigned Wally Chambers, defensive end from Eastern Kentucky.

title: Inquiry Into Cahill Funds Centers on T ax Violations
description: TRENTON, April 10Authoritative sources reported here tonight that the state and Federal investigations of the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 Republican election campaign had narrowed down to Federal charges that heavy contributors wrote off their donations as business expenses in violation of incometax laws.

title: Platform Shoes Criticized
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 10 (AP)  The Keystone Auto Club's safety director has urged a recall of women's platform shoes, saying they could cause more highway accidents than bald tires. Roy D. Hansaw, the safety director, said it was difficult to shift the foot from the accelerator to the, brakes lin an emergency while wearing a fourinch or fiveinch platform shoe.

title: Rally Loses Steam In Credit Markets; Profits Are Taken
description: The latest bond market rally lost some steam yesterday although strong momentum continued to carry some sectors forward.

title: Fancy Dribbler Tries Hand at Fashion
description: Unlike a lot of other athletes, he's no snappy dresser. You'll never call me a pacesetter, said Marques Haynes, the legendary dribbler for the Harlem Globetrotters who later operated his own barnstorming basketball team, the Fabulous Magicians, for 19 years.

title: Notes on People
description: The daughter of Stalin, the former Svetlana Alliluyeva was sued for divorce in Phoenix, Ariz., by William W. Peters, chief architect at the Frank Lloyd. Wright Foundation's communal school, Taliesin West, at Scottsdale, Ariz. Mr. and Mrs. Peters, who were married, after a 20day courtship, on April 7, 1970, separated in December, 1971. At that time, Mrs. Peters, who is 47 years old, said she left her husband because she found life at the communeschool oppressive, stating, That's why I left Russia.

title: Bus Driver Draws 5 Years Probation In Crash Fatal to 5
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., April 10 Joseph Larkin, the driver of the school bus that was struck by a freight train, killing five students, was sentenced to five years probation today by a judge who told him: You will be punished for the rest of your life, and you deserve to be.

title: LandUse Planning
description: TRENTON, April 10I know full well many communities are frightened of the prospect of statewide landuse planning or statewide landzoning. It flies in the face of shortrun convenience and ageold traditions. But by failing to act today, we foreclose future options and guarantee the imposition of some form of massive Federal controls on land exploitation. William D. Ruckelshaus, administrator of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency, speaking here last week before an environmental conference, added his voice to those that have been getting mote insistent in New Jersey in recent weeks.

title: Nixon Honors Copernicus
description: WASHINGTON, April 10, (AP) President Nixon today proclaimed April 23 to 30 as Nicholas Copernicus week in honor of the 500th anniversary of the birth of the famous Polish astronomer.

title: Haig Finds Truce Units in Saigon Stalled
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, April 11 (UPI)Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., President Nixon's special envoy, arrived from Phnom Penh, Cambodia, yesterday to find truceobserver activities here at standstill.

title: College and School Results
description: LACROSSE TENNIS BASEBALL

title: $2.30 NE BASE BY 76 PROPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, April 10The Administration proposed today raising the Federal minimum wage to $2.30 from the current $1.60 an hour by 1976, but also asked for the lower minimum wage for youth that has been bitterly opposed by organized labor.

title: Victory Garden: A Wartime Avocation
description: Probably the most popular of all the civilian tasks during World War II was the Victory Garden program.

title: Canadiens Beaten, 3 to 2
description: MONTREAL, April 10 (UPI) . Rene Robert scored at 9 minutes 18 seconds of the first suddendeath overtime period tonight to give the Buffalo Sabres a 3.2 victory over the Montreal Canadiens fir their second straight National Hockey League quarterfinal playoff triumph after three straight losses.

title: Columbia Names Ceilhorn
description: Walter Gel'horn, a Columbia University authority on administrative law, clvii liberties and civil rights, has been appointed university professor  the school's highest academic rank.

title: Owens, No. 1 Pick, Signs 3Year Pact. With the Jets
description: Burgess Owens, a personable young man who wants to be a dentist, began earning more money than many dentists take home when he signed a multiyear contract with the New York Jets yesterday. The 6foot2inch defensive back from the University of Miami (Fla.) was the Jets first choice in this year's National Football League draft.

title: The Next President of Israel Ephraim Katchalski
description: Ephraim Katchalski, a 56yearold Russianborn biophysicist, was elected yesterday as President of Israel.

title: Carnesecca Names 2 Aides
description: Brian Mahoney, former Manhattan star, who played briefly with the New York Nets this season, and Jack Kresse, who was an assistant to former Coach Lou Carnesecca with the. Nets, were named yesterday as assistants to Carnesecca in his new post at St. John's University.

title: Equity Financing
description: An initial offering of 331,220 shares of the Neutrogena Corporation common stock at $12 a share was reported sold out yesterday by Hambrecht & Quist, San Francisco, managers of the underwriting group. All of the shares offered were sold for the account of Emanuel Stolaroff, chairman of the board of the Los Angelesbased manufacturer of skin care products.

title: 3 Top Guerrillas Slain
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 10Premier Saeb Salam submitted his resignation today following a predawn raid by Israeli commandos in which three prominent Palestinian guerrilla leaders here were killed.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: Kentuelsy vs. Carolina

title: Ellsberg Takes the Stand in Own Defense
description: LOS ANGELES, April 10 Dr. Daniel Ellsberg took the witness stand late this afternoon, to tell a jury of 10 women and two men why he disclosed the top secretsensitive Pentagon papers.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: *If necessary.

title: U.S. Moves to Protect Indian Fishing Rights
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., April 10The Department of Justice, acting in behalf of the Bay Mills Indian Community west of Sault Sainte Marie, has asked the United States District Court here to enjoin the state from enforcing its fishing laws against the Indians.

title: Rhodesia Imprisons Briton In Plot Involving Students
description: SALISBURY Rhodesia, April 10A Briton was sentenced today to five years at hard labor, four years of which were suspended, for conspiring with 11 other persons to overthrow the Rhodesian Government by violence or forcible means.

title: Bobick Scores a Knockout In First Round in Debut
description: MINNEAPOLIS, April 10 (AP)  Duane Bobick, Olympic heavyweight boxer, made his professional debut tonight, flooring Tommy Burns of Canada four times and stopping him at 2 minutes 59 seconds of the first round.

title: Nader Says US. Will Delay Car Pollution Rule for Year
description: WASHINGTON, April 10 (UPI) Ralph Nader said today that the Government had sold out to the automobile industry and would announce tomorrow that it was granting a oneyear delay in requiring achievement of the 1975 auto pollution control standard.

title: Toledo Jeep Strike Settled
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, April 10 (AP) Employes of the American Motors Corporation's Jeep plant in Toledo ratified today a settlement worked out by United Automobile Workers and company officials over the weekend. About 4,100 employes struck the plant Friday protesting more than 100 grievances that they said had accumulated over several months.

title: Owens, No. 1 Pick, Signs 3Year Pact With the Jets
description: Burgess Owens, a personable young man who wants to be a dentist, began earning more money than many dentists take home when he signed a multiyear contract with the New York Jets yesterday. The 6foot2inch defensive back from the University of Miami (Fla.) was the Jets first choice in this year's National Football League draft.

title: The Nixon Trade Bill
description: For the most part, President Nixon has come down on the side of an expanded trading system and against the protectionist forces at home and abroad in the message accompanying his request to Congress for unprecedented authority in the forthcoming world trade negotiations. In a period of warranted worry over the magnitude of executive power, the projected extension of authority is extremely troublesome; but there is no alternative if the United States expects to negotiate seriously for lowering trade barriers.

title: New Constitution is Approved by Pakistan's Assembly
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, April 10 A new constitution, the third in Pakistan's 25year history, was adopted today by the National Assembly in Islamabad.

title: Boy, 13, Crushed to Death Playing Atop an Elevator
description: A 13yearold Brooklyn boy was crushed to death in an elevator shaft yesterday as he, and othef children were playing on top of an elevator car, the police said.

title: TAX EVASION LAID TO A NIXON DOCTOR
description: A physician for President Nixon, Gvernor Rockefeller and other promient persons was indicted in Federal Court here yesterday on charges of incometax evasion.

title: Ted Gross Admits He Accepted Bribes
description: Ted Gross, the former Commissioner of the City Youth Services Agency, admitted in State Supreme Court yesterday that he had accepted bribes during his 16 months in office.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BOSTON, April 10 (UPI)Thet Boston Celtics will have Don Chaney back tomorrow night for the first time since the regillar season ended, and that may spell trouble for the Atlanta Hawks. The teams, tied at two games, apiece, resume their fourofseven National Basketball Association playoff series at Boston Garden. Chaney, a guard, has recovered from a pulled groin muscle and is reported ready to go 100 per cent.

title: M'GOVERN URGES BETTER REFORM
