description: DERBY, Conn., April 14Massachusetts Institute of Technology's lightweight crew outrowed Yale today to remain undefeated. The Engineers were timed in 6 minutes 2.5 seconds. Yale, which won its opening race last week, was timed in 6:03.0.

title: Pablo Picasso 18811973
description: Of the Spanishborn painter, who died in France last Sunday at 91, Hilton Kramer writes, That he was one of the greatest artists who ever lived seems to me undeniable. That he was the last of the great masters seems to me more than likely. For Kramer's tribute, see page 21.

title: State Moves to Fill CarPollution Gap
description: TRENTON  The head of the state's Department of Environmental Protection declared last week that the Federal Government's decision to give Detroit automakers a oneyear extension to meet tough, new autopollution standards would force New Jersey to do more on its own.

title: Americans Find Truck Is 7DayaWeek Vehicle
description: LOS ANGELES, April 14Lydia Clark wears miniskirts, loves to crochet, raises Irish setters and drives a truck.

title: ORIOLES DEFEAT BREWERS, 5 TO 1
description: MILWAUKEE, April 14 (AP) Earl Williams's bases loaded single sparked a threerun fourth inning today as the Baltimore Orioles defeated the Milwaukee Brewers, 51.

title: Railroad Stations Being Rehabilitated
description: RIDGEWOOD  Commuters heading for New York from this village use an ErieLackawanna Railroad station that looks like a rosy portent for the future of rail commuting.

title: COOKE DEDICATES EAST SIDE CHURCH
description: The Roman Catholic Church of St. John the Evangelist, an integral part of a new, 20story, $25million building that also houses a school and offices, was dedicated yesterday by Cardinal Cooke.

title: The New Movies
description: BROTHER SUN SISTER MOON, directed by Franco Zeffirelli and starring Graham Faulkner, Judi Bowker and Alec Guinness, got 1 favorable review (Archer Winsten, Post), 4 mixed (Kathleen Carroll, News; Kevin Saviola, Women's Wear; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; Paul D. Zimmerman, Newsweek) and 9 negative (Vincent Canby, Times; Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Joseph Gelmis, Newsday; Bernard Drew, Gannett News Service; Leonard Harris, WCBSTV; Stanley Kauffmann, New Republic; Judith Crist, New York; William Wolf, Cue; Jay Cocks, Time).

title: Ode to a Freeway
description: LOS ANGELES. Several years ago, the magazine Cry California ran an article about a family that lived most of its life on the Los Angeles freeways. Mike and Merilee Farrier, said the story, could not afford both a home and a camper, so they opted for the vehicle. At night, they parked in a deserted lot near downtown. At 7 A.M., Merilee arose, changed the baby, plugged in the coffee and headed for the Hollywood Freeway. Halfway to Burbank she woke up Mike, and when they arrived at the factory where he worked, they shared breakfast in the parking lot. Then Merilee dropped the baby off at her mother's and went to a halfday job. Later, she reversed her trip128 miles in all.

title: PEKING STRESSES SUN YATSEN ROLE
description: The Chinese Communists have invoked the memory of Dr. Sun Yatsen, founder of the Chinese Nationalist party who married the sister of President Chiang Kaishek's wife as the continue to press for the peaceful political reunification of Taiwan with mainland China.

title: Boulder Brook to Begin 3Day Show on Friday
description: In the sometimes confusing world of equestrians, the Boulder Brook horse show traditionally opens the springsummer season.

title: What's New In Art
Alison Brooks Fiancee Of Michael A. Gregian
description: MANHASSET HILLS, L. I., April 14Mr. and Mrs. Robert Brooks have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alison Linda Brooks, to Michael A. Gregian, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur S. Gregian of Cranston, R. I.

title: LEBANESE GROUP SAYS IT ATTACKED OIL INSTALLATION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 14An attack by armed men early today against an Americanowned oil terminal at Saida produced conflicting claims that they were Palestinian guerrillas, Lebanese revolutionaries or Israeli raiders.

title: Oversupply Tempers Rent Rises
description: The consumer, beset with large increases in major components of his cost of living such as food, can take some comfort from the fact that rises in another important component, housing costs, have not kept pace.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your March 26 editorial supporting the recent Supreme Court decision upholding the Texas system for financing public education fails to grasp the extent to which the opinion portends the Court's retreat from its role as the guardian of equal rights.

title: Miss Schoonmaker Becomes a Bride
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., April 14Miss Jennifer Lynn Schoonmaker, an assistant editor of children's books at Dodd, Mead, publishers in New York, was married here this afternoon to David Vance Anderson, a freelance assistant motion picture cameraman. The Rev. William Spillman performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church.

title: Talks on Oil Prices Recess After 2 Sessions in Cairo
description: CAIRO, April 14Exploratory negotiations ended inconclusively here tonight between representatives of Western oil companies and a threeman committee representing the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: NELSON OF REDS TOPS GIANTS, 30
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 14 (AP)The Cincinnati righthander, Roger Nelson, won his first National League game with relief help from Clay Carroll as Johnny Bench smashed a homer and scored twice in a 30 triumph over the San Francisco Giants today.

title: TAIWAN TO EASE CURBS ON TRAVEL
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, April 14The Chinese Nationalist Government has announced plans to permit its citizens to travel abroad on group sightseeing tours.

title: Split Killing Women's Tennis
description: If you can envision quarterfinal matches like Margaret CourtKerry Melville, Chris EvertRosemary Casals, Evonne GoolagongVirginia Wade and Billie Jean KingNancy Gunter, you can appreciate the urgency of a settlement in the current women's tennis feud.

title: Aaron in Piccadilly Golf
description: LONDON, April 14 (UN)Tommy Aaron, the winner of the Masters tournament accepted an invitation today to play in the Oct. 11 to 13 Piccadilly World matchplay golf championship at Wentworth.

title: POST POSITION SUMMARY
NEW RIZZO FIGHT: PHILADELPHIA AlD
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 14A proposal by business interests to make private contributions to specific programs of this fi nancially hardpressed city has stirred a new tempest around Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, who backs the plan.

title: Libyan CoPilot Recovers
description: JERUSALEM, April 14 (Reuters)The Libyan copilot of an airliner shot down by Israeli jets nearly two months ago was today declared fit to leave a hospital here. Yunis elMehdi had been admitted to the hospital in critical condition with severe lung damage and broken legs.

title: Official to Seek Indictment In Poison Deaths at Church
description: NEWPORT, Tenn. April 14 (UPI)A district attorney said today that he would seek an involuntary manslaughter indictment against a minister whose brother died after taking poison during church services.

title: Immediate Joy Takes Mile By 8 Lengths, Pays $19.60
description: LINCOLN, R. I., April 14 (AP)  Immediate Joy, ridden by Tony Ricci, won the $7,500 Palm Handicap by eight lengths over Nilo Bay, the 21 favorite, at Lincoln Downs today.

title: Will Kids Get Caught Up In. Charlotte's Web?
description: DURING the fifties, when I was a professional babysitter (seven nights a week and all day Saturdays and Sundays), I must have read aloud E. B. White's Charlotte's Web a hundred times. Which was O.K. by me, Kids loved it, and so did I. The plotas probably everyone knowsconcerns the efforts of Charlotte, a barn spider, to save her friend Wilbur, a young pig, from being butchered. To this end, she weaves into her web words in praise of Wilbur (e.g. some pig). Her dicta are accepted as miracles by the farm community, and eventually her plan off.

title: Westbury Realty Code Of Ethics In Dispute
description: WESTBURY, L.I.  A group of residents here have formed a coalition to maintain a balanced integrated community by establishing a code of ethics for real estate men. But the propos code has run into problems.

title: If you want to be noticed
description: As the days grow longer and the sun shines stronger, stand out in a blaze of stripes. These eyedazzlers make summergarden prints look faded and passe. The dresses shown here are great for travel, whether you're just doing the weekend bit in the Hamptons or Vermont or winging to faraway places. Warning! Stripes can work for or against you.

title: The Dance
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The National Ballet of Washington opened a brief subscription series at the Opera House of the Kennedy Center last night. The company has what is probably the most authentic version of Coppelia in the country. It has been based by Frederic Franklin on the Nicholas Sergeyef version, which in its turn derived from the St. Petersburg production at the turn of the century.

title: WING OUT CAPTURES COAST RACE BY HEAD
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 14 (AP)  Wing Out, ridden by Bill Shoemaker, recovered from a hard bump at the start, and galloped between horses in the stretch for a head victory over favored Quack in the $55,450 Lakeside Handicap at Hollywood Park today.

title: Not Militant, Merely Rewarding
description: SYNDICATION does not have a terribly bright image in the television industry. As a process for selling programs on a stationbystation basis, outside the awesome distribution machinery of the networks, it is generally topheavy with game shows and former network series. The money can be good but, with few exceptions, genuine accomplishment is at a minimum.

title: White House Yields Some Data On Campaign Flight Payments
description: Washington, April 14 (AP) Bending slightly to Congressional complaints, the White House has released records showing that President Nixon's reelection committee paid $149,291 for 55 campaign flights on Presidential aircraft.

title: If You Go
description: to Britain and are interested ?? its eccentric edifices, a useful guide to have is the recently published book Monumental Follies. It pictures and recounts the stories of more than 450 follies in England, Scotland and Wales. They are grouped county by county with an accompanying locator top.

title: School Bus Experts Oppose Safety Belts
description: ALBANY, April 14Despite public demands for installation of seat belts for all children on school buses, transportation experts here have rejected recommendations for mandatory seat belts in favor of other safety measures for children who ride buses to and from school.

title: U.S. Cancer Death Rate Up to 22Year Peak in '72
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP) The United States cancer death rate reached a 22year high in 1972, according to a new Federal report.

title: Everything's Wrong With the World, But...
WALL STREET
description: The scandal involving the Equity Funding Corporation of America exerted an adverse psychological impact on insurance stocks in the opening week of April, although only a relative handful of insurance companies appeared to have much of a direct involvement.

title: Pressures on Watergate
description: WASHINGTONFor weeks, the White House has been insisting that all the wrongdoers in the Watergate affair have been punished, that no more remains to be revealed, and that only the Democrats and their allies in the press were keeping the controversy alive.

title: SHOP TALK
description: ROCKAWAY  Everybody visiting Fran's Basket House for the first time gets a surprise. This small shop with the cozy name turns out to be the entrance to a forestan enchanted forest of willow and rattan in which the vines and branches are in the shape of furniture.

title: MANHATTAN VICTOR IN TRIANGULAR MEET
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., April Tony Colon and Bob Brady led Manhattan's track team to victory over Rutgers aid Fairleigh Dickinson in a triangular meet at Rutgers Stadium today.Manhattan scored 104 points while Rutgers had 70 and Fairleigh Dickinson 19.Colon won the mile and two mile events. Brady captured the shotput and discus.

title: 2 Schools and the Property Tax
description: RIDGEFIELD  At Ridgefield Memorial High School, Marty Diamond, a junior and president of his class, is taking a course entitled Food for Boys, a popular new offering this school year.

title: The World
description: BELGRADEA firing squad in Sarajevo seems to have closed a chapter in a mystery surrounding an incident of last June 20 in which a band of heavily armed Yugoslav emigrs slipped into Yugoslavia in an abortive counterrevolutionary mission. But some of the mystery lingers.

title: If You Go
description: to Venice and discover that your budget won't permit you to stay at the Gritti Palace, don't be discouraged. There are 200 other hotels and pensions, in the city, and no matter where you stay you can still stroll like a king through Venice's main square, the Piazza San Marco, which Napoleon called the most beautiful drawing room in Europe.

title: The Young Visiters
description: Misspelled and spellbinding, The Young Visiters is a tiny novel that begs comparison with giants. Tolstoy's War and Peace, Flaubert's Sentimental Education and Lawrence's Women in Love may be bigger, but The Young Visiters too manages to contain and display, more gracefully than the giants, an entire civilization. Daisy Ashford was only 9 years old when she wrote it, but her novel, like theirs, depicts with eloquence the grand passion of lovers set off by the mean backdrop of their Socierty.

title: Profile: The Manager Of a Major Hotel Is A Maestro Who Knows And Plays the Score
description: VENICEBeaming right and left with benign impartiality, Dr. Natale Rusconi greeted the concierge and the reception staff, ?? at the bellboy in blue and strode quickly beyond the reception area into his office. He closed the door behind him.

title: Johns Hopkins Sets Back Virginia in Lacrosse, 14.9
description: BALTIMORE, April 14Jack Thomas, an attackman, made first game at midfield a success today, leading No. 1ranked Johns Hopkins to a 14.9 victpry over No. 2ranked Vir?? ?? ?? three ?? ?? ?}? on three others as the Bluejays improved their wonlost record to 50.

title: Indochina
description: WASHINGTON  The White House press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler, was cryptic as to the reasons for Gen. Alexander. M. Haig's swing around Southeast Asia last week: The President's military troubleshooter was sent hurriedly on his mission because of developments. A senior Administration planner was a little more specific. The mission was both a signal to Hanoi that the President was fast losing patience and a move to assess the situation.

title: SMITH VANQUISHES STOCKTON, 61, 64
description: BRUSSELS, April 14 (UPI)Stan Smith advanced without problems to the final of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis Group A tournament today with a 61, 64 victory over a fellow American, Dick Stockton.

title: The Nation
description: The automakers In Detroit would make anyone rich who could answer such an ad. Since the emission levels of the Clean Air Act were passed in 1970, the Big Four have been searching for a catalyst that could meet its requirements: a 90 per cent reduction of present levels of hydrocarbons and carbon monoxide by 1975, and of nitrogen oxide by 1976.

title: Elizabeth Carpenter Sets Bridal
description: HARRISON, N.Y., April 14 Miss Elizabeth Ann Carpenter and Robert Woodrow McKay, graduates of the University of Kentucky, plan to marry here June 2 at the home of the parents of the future bride, Mr. and Mrs. Francis W. Carpenter, who have announced the engagement.

title: G.O.P. Editor Stirs Dispute by Letter On Picasso's Death
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP) The editor of the Republican National Committee newsletter confirmed today that he sent a letter to a Communist newspaper in New York saying. Ah, at last Pablo Picasso is now a good Communist.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Two devaluations by the United States in little more than a year have been hailed by some as the way to bring our trade balance back to a surplus position. The theory is that devaluation will make imports less competitive in our market and United Sates exports more competitive abroad.

title: A Political Siege
description: The profound disagreements between the Administration and its political opposition over foreign affairs, the military budget and domestic social policy have dominated the life of this Congress during its first three months. As has happened before in American history, such disagreements express themselves in legal disputes and differing constitutional interpretations.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Anne Sanger Fiancee of George Gager
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., April 14  Dr. and Mrs. Grant Sanger of Mount Kisco and Fishers Island have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Durant Sanger, to George Webb Gager, son of Mrs. John Jay Gager of Fitchville, Conn., and the late Dr. Gager.

title: The Magician
description: As a child, it always seemed to me manifestly unjust that Christians had both Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny on their team. Surely God must have known that small Jews everywhere were straining to catch almost any grace note of levity in the celebration of religious holidays that are overrich in tragedy and narrowlyaverted doom.

title: Nixon Seeks Sweeping New Power
description: WASHINGTON  We need basic trade reform, and we need it now. With those words President Nixon sent Congress last week a historic set of proposals in the foreign trade field. The bill he proposed would give him sweeping new authority both to raise and lower tariffs and other trade barriers.

title: Rolling Back to Zero
description: WASHINGTONThe House of Representatives is considering a bill to roll back prices to their level of March 16, 1973. This is obviously a step in the right direction. Since consumer prices have probably risen about .5 per cent since March 16, this action would at one stroke make everyone .5 per cent better off than he is. This calculation shows that the general thrust of the proposal is correct. However, it also shows that the proposal is mere tokenism, and goes only one twohundredth as far as is really required.

title: News of the Camera World
description: THE Eastman Kodak Company has published another Here's How book called, appropriately enough, The Eighth Here's How (Kodak No. AE94). Priced at $1.25, this 72page handbook has six chapters, each of which was written by staff members of the company who are expert in their specialty, and each illustrated with numerous excellent photographs. Subjects covered in this edition include photographing girls, planning and making successful pictures, creative photography, action photography, blacklight photography, and using photography to fight pollution. The Eighth Here's How can be purchased in camera stores or book stores, or it can be ordered direct from the Eastman Kodak Company, Dept. 454, Rochester N. Y. 14650

title: Judith Evans Sets Nuptials
description: Mrs. Donald Dickson of New York has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Judith Evans, to Steven Chapman Thomas, son of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Thomas of Del Mar, Calif.

title: Khan's Team in Semifinals Of Open Squash Racquets
description: Sharif Khan, of Toronto and Yusef Khan, of Seattle, the topseeded team, advanced to the semifinal round of the City Athletic Club open invitation squash racquet tournament yesterday. They defeated Bob Martinez of the City A.C. and Ric Rescigno of the Princeton Club, 1511, 1512, 1513.

title: Julia Kingsbury White Married to Michael Buchet
description: DARIEN, Conn., April 14Miss Julia Kingsbury White, daughter of Mrs. Elliott White of Darien and Frederick Kingsbury White of New York, was married here this afternoon to Michael Martin Xavier Buchet, son of Mrs. Jean H. Buchet of St. James, L.I., and Mr. Buchet of Paris.

title: Sanitation Fund Held Lax on Giving to Charities
description: A Sanitation Department spokesman has conceded that city and union officials were lax in not distributing promptly to charities up to $44,000 collected from sanitationmen in recent Sunshine Fund drives.

title: ThreeRun Belt by Anderson in 6th Caps Rally
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 14Slowly building himself a reputation as a nemesis to the New York Mets, Bill Robinson came in to pinchhit in the sixth inning and rapped the first pitch off a reliever, Ray Sadecki, into left field for a runscoring double that broke a 33 tie and helped the Phils defeat the Mets, 73, tonight.

title: Airlines Easing Policies That Once Served to Penalize Paraplegic Passengers
description: ROSWELL, N. M., April 14 When Ralph Markward, a paraplegic, propelled his wheelchair up to the Texas International Airlines ticket office counter at the Roswell Airport recently to make preliminary arrangements for a flight to visit his parents in South Bend, Ind., he had no reason to expect that he would be accepted as an ordinary passenger.

title: The World
description: PHNOM PENHGen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. had just landed. Speculation as to the purpose of his trip was rife. The American Ambassador, Emory C. Swank, felt that an explanation of United States policy on Cambodia was required. Hurriedly, he wrote out a statement to the press, in pencil. Because of the shortage of supply of petroleum products to Phnom Penh through normal channels, this mission has been authorized to airlift certain quantities of petroleum products to Pochentong [the capital's airport]. No particulars of this operation will be made public, since they would provide information to the enemy forces operating in Cambodia.

title: Soviet Names Farm Aide
description: MOSCOW, April 14 (Reuters) The Soviet Union announced today that Grigori Zolotukhin, a 62yearold farm specialist, has been named Minister of State Purchases. The Ministry handles procurement of agricultural crops from the nation's farms.

title: Pamela C. Gray And David Field Married on L. I.
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., April 14In St. Stephen's Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Pamela Carroll Gray, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sherman Gray of Sands Point, was married to David McLucas Field. He is the son of Russell Field Jr. of Los Angeles and Mrs. Howard D. Wolfe of Redding, Conn.

title: GUIDES SET FORTH ON JUDICIAL RACE
description: As campaigning for the Demecratic primary for the office of the Chief Judge of the state intensified last week, the Association of the Bar of the City of New York issued a series of ethical guidelines designed to forestall what it called the excesses that have been indulged in by a few judicial candidates in the past.

title: Thomas Castellano Weds Miss Manners
description: WILMINGTON, Del., April 14  The Westminster Presbyterian Church was the setting here this evening for the marriage of Miss Denise Manners to Thomas Castellano. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Vito Castellano of Armonk, N. Y. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Manners of Wilmington.

title: Scientists Find Use For Debris Of L.I.
description: MONTAUK, L.I.  The waters off Long Island may be covered with plastic debris, as a recent National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration study disclosed, but researchers at the New York Ocean Science Laboratory here are not overly concerned about the impact of these foreign matters on the ecology of the sea.

title: $124.40 SHOT WINs KEENELAND STAKE
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., April 14 (AP)Glenn Hild's Raging Whirl, a $124.40 long shot charged between horses in the final eighth of a mile today to win the $36,325 Ashland Stakes at Keeneland.

title: Beyond Condemnation
description: Confronted once more with persistent violence in the Middle East, the United Nations is in danger of being railroaded into another onesided action that can only exacerbate tensions threatening the peace of the area and the world.

title: The Road To Secession
description: To the Editor: May I comment on your critique of The Road to Secession, by William Barney?

title: UNION WIN TWICE AT RELAY EVENT
description: MONTVALE, N. J., April 14Ron Klotzer of Union, Ken Stokes of New Milford and Cameron Mosley of Rahway led their teams to double victories today in the eighth annual St. Joseph's Regional High Schoolboy Relay Carnival.

title: New Woes For Cahill
description: TRENTONIf the public believes there is any corruption in Bill Cahill or anybody associated with Bill Cahill, they shouldn't vote for Bill Cahill, New Jersey's Governor said last month in announcing his candidacy for reelection.

title: Proposed Rail Link In Queens Protested
description: Community opposition to the proposed ManhattanKennedy International Airport rail link is getting up steam in Forest Hills and Rego Park, Queens.

title: Son to the David Tecklins
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. David L. Tecklin of New York on March 30 in Mount Sinai Hospital. Mrs. Tecklin, the former Miss Adrianne Hirsch, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Hirsch of New York. The child has been named James Philip. Mr. Tecklin is a lawyer here.

title: WARRIORS SHOW QUALITY TO FANS
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 14There was a lot more to last night's triumph  and triumph is exactly the wordof the Golden State Warriors than met the naked eye or the unprotected ear.

title: FIRE KILLS FIGURE IN 34 MURDER CASE
description: A fire in an East Side hotel yesterday killed Andrew Donaldson Kirwan, 62 years old, who 39 years ago was tried and acquitted in Federal Court here of murder on the high seas.

title: Time to Return to Roots We Disowned Long Ago?
description: ONE of the most interesting art movements of recent years 19thcentury American paintinghas gotten another boost: A fine Winslow Homer retrospective has opened at the Whitney Museum. It is a curious development, this widespread new enthusiasm for a tradition once despised as provincial. Perhaps it might be viewed as a delayed bonus of the Abstract Expressionist revolution that, 25 years ago, put native art on a footing with the best European. Even Pop art, with its unabashed celebration of things American, may have had a hand in preparing the ground.

title: The BondFund Idea Catches On
description: There's a hot investment idea sweeping Wall Street these days, one that carries significant market risks, offers little hope of increasing your capital and calls for you to lend money at a stipulated rate of interest, regardless of inflation. It is called a bond.

title: Something to Gape At: Britain's Follies
description: BECAUSE they so seldom hear about them, tourists in Britain miss out on one of her most unusual attractions: her follies, grotesque, amusing, sometimes even beautiful structures that have gone up wherever there was someone with the requisite land, money and uninhibited imagination. In every county of Britain there are fake castles, Roman baths, lighthouses miles from the sea, obelisks, miniature Stonehenges, belvederes and gazebos. Some are moldering away, others are preserved by private owners the National Trust.

title: A New Day In L.A.or '69 Again?
description: LOS ANGELESThey're having a mayoralty election in this city of sun and smog, as well as in New York, and the threeterm incumbent, Sam Yorty, now appears to be getting down to the businessasusual of getting reelected.

title: ExTeamster Chief Appeals
description: ATLANTA, April 14 (AP)Edward Grady Partin, former Louisiana Teamsters union leader, has filed notice of appeal after being sentenced in Federal Court here yesterday to seven years in prison. He was convicted on a Federal extortion charge.

title: Labor
description: WASHINGTON  When President Nixon nominated New York hard hat Peter J. Brennan as Secretary of Labor last fall, his fellow trade unionists rejoiced and looked forward to a closer, more rewarding relationship with the Administration. Pete is one of ushe'll give us a fair shake, was a typical remark.

title: Spring Snow in Austria
description: VIENNA, April 14 (AP)A heavy snow caused traffic snarls and a series of accidents on Austria's highways today as spring relapsed into winter. Drifts on some roads measured six feet deep. Press reports from Hungary said that 20 inches of snow had fallen in the Bakony Mountains.

title: Whitmore
description: They leap up from the witness chair and point to the defendant in the dock. That's him! they shout. That's the man who shot (stabbed/raped/ robbed) me! And the man in the dock is on his way to prison.

title: JUDGE BARS TALK IN A MURDER CASE
description: HONESDALE, Pa., April 14 A judge presiding over the murder prosecution of John Reilly, 57 years old, operator of a home for retarded youths, has imposed a sweeping gag rule that includes all principals in the case and all elected state officials.

title: Mackell Aides Are Said to Have Profited by More Than $100,000 From Alleged Swindle
description: Members of the staff of District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell of Queens made more than $100,000 from a getrichquick scheme in which investors were bilked of about $1million, a source close to official investgators estimated yesterday.

title: Newark Seeking to Revive LongDormant Airport Head Tax
description: NEWARK  As Newark Airport's new image as an international air terminal begins to emerge, state and city officials are looking to revive a longdormant head tax on airport passengers.

title: Mine Shaft Yields Priceless Statue, Stolen in Santa Fe
description: SANTA FE, N. M., April 14A 348yearold statue of the Virgin Mary, stolen from its niche in a cathedral here last month, was recovered by the authorities early today in an abandoned mine shaft.

title: U.S. QUESTIONING SEAT BEET DEVICE
description: WASHINGTON, April 14The Federal Government is having serious second thoughts about the advisability of requiring manufacturers to produce automobiles that will not start unless frontseat passengers have buckled their seat belts.

title: Ford Aid Helps Minorities From Junior Colleges Toward Degrees
description: More than 700 members of minority groups are receiving bachelor's degrees across the country this spring with help from a scholarship program that focuses on a generally neglected problem in higher education: the difficulty many juniorcollege graduates encounter in continuing their schooling.

title: Sikkim
description: NEW DELHI  The Pallor Stadium, the only open ground in the capital of Sikkim, is where the King and his nobles played polo, During the last 10 days it has been a camping ground for thousands of demonstrators. The feudal order in the Himalayan ShangriLa of 200,000 people was shattered.

title: Bell
description: The telephone, as all the world knows, was invented by Alexander Graham Bell, a brilliant young Scottish immigrant, a teacher of the deaf and a parttime scientist, who bore a remarkable resemblance to Don Ameche. The momentous event took place in an attic laboratory in Boston in the 1870's, and the historic first words transmitted over the crude instrument were Mr. WatsonCome hereI want to see you"which were spoken by Bell to his resourceful young assistant, Henry Fonda, who was stationed in another room. As all the world also knows, Bell had invented the telephone so he could gain the social status and money enough to wed one of his star pupils, Loretta Young, who was totally deaf (and so could never use a telephone") and whose father (I can't recall who played the part but he was mostly beard) was Bell's chief financial backer appetite for Smithfield ham and apple pie. Moreover, he lived out his days with the same wife, whom he adored. He was an affectionate, if not always attentive father, and as a grandfather he was a triumph.

title: Anatomy of an Insurance Scandal
description: The Equity Funding Corporation of America, once among the most promising companies in mutual funds and life insurance, today lies smoldering in the ruins of what may yet become one of the biggest financial disasters in modern history.

title: Mailbox: Olympic Coach Replies on Racism in Wrestling
description: To the Editor: I am compelled to comment on your April 8 story entitled, Racism is Charged in Wrestling. Though there is no place for politics or racism in sports they do exist, but certainly on a minor scale as compared to other areas.

title: Easter Eggs For Everyone
description: I do not come from an eggdecorating family. In my liberal Jewish home, eggs were either sunnyside up, scrambled or, around this time of year, suitably roasted and dipped in salt water for the Seder. Even when my mother, in the spirit of ecumenism, invited our gentile friends over to make Easter eggs with us, I never probed beyond the small mysteries of vinegar and dye.

title: Where It Is Sunny, Try Evergreen Cover
description: EVERGREEN groundcover plants will grow in sunny situations. Deciduous types will, too, but the evergreen types should be given the first consideration.

title: SEAGREN AND RYUN WIN IN PRO TRACK
description: BALTIMORE, April 14  Bob Seagren regained his form, Bob Hayes talked of challenging the top sprint cats and Jim Ryun made it two mile victories in row tonight on the International Track Association tour.

title: WHALERS VICTORS IN PLAYOFFS 4 TO 1
description: BOSTON, April 14 (AP)Mike Byers's goal after 3 minutes 47 seconds of overtime gave the New England Whalers a 54 victory over the Ottawa Nationals tonight. The Whalers clinched the fourofsevengame World Hockey Association quarterfinal series, 41.

title: When The Bugs Come
description: CAN chemical pest control in home gatdgns be safe for the user and safe for the environment? There is legislation trying to make it so. On October 21, 1972, the Federal Environmental Pesticide Control Act was signed into law, to be administered by the Environmental Protection Agency, set up in 1970. This Act provides control of the user of pesticides, as well as the manufacturer, with penalties for misuse. Chemicals are classified for general or restricted use, the latter to be applied only by certified applicators.

title: Children Tidy Up Central Park
description: A gathering of children and passersby participated enthusiastically in the Parks Department's Green Is Clean drive yesterday, filling up trash bags with Central Park litter in exchange for petunia plants.

title: U.S. Thinks Communists Moved Crashed Copters
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 14American officials believe that the Communists secretly moved two truce commission helicopters that they shot down last week, in order to back their explanation of the incident.

title: Buchanan? Crazy
description: IF you like outsidereccentrics in your rock and roll, Roy Buchanan should be your man. For years he played in obscurity in the Washington, D. C. area, while a burgeoning, underground reputation began to indicate that he was one of the very finest rock guitarists around. Then he began to make more and more appearances outside Washington, and finally he recorded a disk for Polydor, simply entitled Roy Buchanan (PD 5033). It was a little odd, but at least Polydor was encouraged to put out a second Roy Buchanan album, called with equal bluntness, tile Roy Buchanan Second Album (PD 5046). This record too, is a bit strange, but it gives a better idea of Buchattan's limited yet extraordinary artistry, and a better indication of the kind of effect he can make in live performance.

title: Time and Place for Love
description: The motion picture Love, which had been scheduled to open at the Art Theater last Wednesday as was noted in review by Vincent Canby in today's Section 2, will instead open at the 8th Street Playhouse next Wednesday.

title: His Parish Is the Street and Jails
description: PRINCETONOn a recent Friday night, a local youth got off the New York bus in Palmer Square, carrying a pound of marijuana in a package under his arm. Waiting for him was the Rev. William Kight. Earlier that day, another youth had confided to the minister that the marijuana was coming in that night.

title: Letters: Subway Transitives
description: To the Editor: Alfred Kazin's nostalgic view of the New York City subways (Please, How Do I Get Out of Here?) in the Travel Section of March 25, is one to which distance has obviously lent considerable enchantment. While I cannot testify on traveling conditions between Brooklyn and the Upper West Side during the 1930's (I assume on the IRT Broadway), I have extensive knowledge of them during the same period on the IRT Lex., which I traveled between the Upper East Side and Washington Square, or (in summer) the Wall Street area where I worked in various mail rooms.

title: Conservative Church Growth Slower
description: Major conservative churches in the United States appear to be experiencing the same slowdown in numerical growth that has been evident for some time among their liberal counterparts, according to figures released yesterday by the National Council of Churches.

title: Toward a Recognition Of Androgyny
description: The truth is, a great mind must be androgynous. Coleridge's famous remark strikes us as irresistibly true. How could a great mind not be androgynous? But we do not always know what that word means. It comes from the Greek andro (male) and gyn (female): androgynous. It has a poetic, musical, rather mysterious sound. To Carolyn Heilbrun (a professor of English at Columbia) the very salvation of our species depends upon our recognition of androgyny as a conscious ideal; her book is a frank, passionate plea for us to move away from sexual polarization and the prison of gender toward a world in which individual roles and modes of personal behavior can be freely chosen. Though she has constructed a criticalscholarly study to support her argumentshe moves with dizzying rapidity from Homer to Joan Didion in 189 pagesthe essence of her

title: Music
description: THIS is the time of year when the forsythia blooms and musical organizations make public their plans for the 197374 season. The Philharmonic programs for next season are already at hand, and they make entrancing reading. They are so  well Boulezian! Boulez is as convinced of his rectitude as many Philharmonic subscribers are convinced of his irresponsibility. He goes along his own way, stubbornly his own man, putting together programs that have a distinct kind of profile. The Ravel Miroirs; Chabrier'sOde a la Musique; the Debussy Nocturnes; the Webern Symphony; Bartk's Music for Strings, Percussion and Celestaall on one program. It is a Boulez program. Even the fluff is intellectual fluff. Boulez is like a stern rabbi. Life is serious, art is serious, the function of God is not to entertain.

title: Louisiana Publisher to Appeal Fines
description: A Louisiana publisher Douglas L Manship, plans to ask the Supreme Court to review a United States Court of Appeals ruling of last week that upheld fines against two newsmen who defied a judge's ban on reporting testimony taken in open court.

title: 3 Conductors Lead Ambitious Concert Of 7 Varese Works
description: The Performers' Committee for 20thCentury Music gave a retrospective concert of Edgard Varse's works on Wednesday night at Columbia University. A standingroomonly audience in the McMillin Theater heard seven works, one of them twice (Hyperprism). The extraordinarily ambitious program, led by three conductors (Joel Sachs, Harvey Sollberger and Raymond DesRoches), was scrupulously played by more than 50 musicians drawn from the best young artists in this area.

title: Steelers Count on Gravelle
description: PITTSBURGH, April 14 (UPI)  The Pittsburgh Steelers' offensive tackle, Gordon Gravelle, is expected to be recovered from knee surgery when the team opens training camp in July.

title: A YankeeChina Trade That Wasn't All Good
description: FOR Americans, especially younger ones whose entire lives were cut off from all contact with mainland China, the gradually opening door to that country reveals mysteries of all sorts. But standing ready to serve as a sort of interpreter and educational gobetween is the fascinating Museum of the American China Trade, just outside Boston. Although the trade in the museum's title refers to the freewheeling set commerce of a century and a half ago that helped bring prosperity to several East Coast ports, Boston among them, the museum does more than just mirror that adventurous era. It also serves as a center for information on current relations between Peking and the United States, and its staff hopes to be permitted to lead a tour of several dozen Americans through various parts of China this year and to set up an exhibit of American arts and crafts in Peking.

title: Penn Crew Beats Cornell To Retain Matthews Cup
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 14 Penn retained the Matthews Cup today by outrowing Cornell by 2 lengths in the varsity lightweight race on a calm Schuylkill River.

title: NIXON SAYS AMERICA MUST BUILD PEACE
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP)  President Nixon said today that Americans have embarked on a great adventure together  building a peace that will last

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Rock Comes to TVWell, Sort Of
description: By LORAINE ALTERMAN

title: JUDGE BARS TALK IN A MURDER CASE
description: HONESDALE, Pa., April 14 A judge presiding over the murder prosecution of John Reilly, 57 years old, operator of a home for retarded youths, has imposed a sweeping gag rule that includes all principals in the case and all elected state officials.

title: China Grants Cameroon An InterestFree Loan
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon, April 14 (Agence FrancePresse) China has granted an interestfree loan of about $73million, to this West African nation, President Ahamadou Ahidjo has announced in an interview broadcast here.

title: Ballooning Gains Favor as Hobby
description: MANVILLE  Visitors to Kupper Airport here have experienced some disconcerting moments lately. Gazing skyward, they spy an ascension balloon, one reminiscent of Around the World in 80 Days, floating lazily about.

title: Leonia Park Still Disputed
description: LEONIAAs the glitter of spring settles in over the craggy woodland of Highwood Hills, it is difficult to believe that it was only 18 months ago that this placid tract had churned up a good deal of political froth and some bitter factional debates in this otherwise sedate community.

title: To Many in Nassau Clinic Is Lifesaver
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Susan C. Mixter Peter Blanchard Married in Ohio
description: CINCINNATI, April 14The marriage of Miss Susan Cutler Mixter and Peter Sherrill Blanchard took place here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Prices of Wholesale Beef Rise to Preboycott Ceiling
description: CHICAGO, April 14Wholesale beef prices climbed back to their ceiling limits in the week after the meat boycott and stayed there.

title: Israel Shows Off a New Rifle That She Says Rates With Best
description: TEL AVIV, April 14 (AP)Israel has unveiled a new assault riflethe Galil, designed to replace everything from light mortars to bottle openers.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
CAHILL CAMPAIGNS FOR REELECTION
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, N. J., April 14  Governor Cahill put in his first day of campaigning for reelection today, hopscotching about the state in a helicopter and citing what he described as the accomplishments of his Republican administration.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market shifted upward last week and the bond and money markets held steady, as the nation's corporations began reporting good results for the first quarter of 1973. Company after company reported strong earnings gains, confirming that the economy was in robust condition.

title: 5 Japanese Freed by China
description: HONG KONG, April 14 (AP) Five Japanese detained in China on spy charges for five years crossed into Hong Kong today after being freed by Peking. Persons at the border said that all of them appeared fit. The five were arrested in the spring of 1968 during the Cultural Revolution. They said they were on legitimate business activities at the time.

title: The Creature From I.R.S.
description: The dread is loosed. Machines of Internal Revenue Service justice are cranking at battle speed now, spitting out skewed incometax returns by the hundreds of thousands, delivering them down a brutally efficient track of keypunch operators and mailroom clerks and into the hands of I.R.S. agents for audit. It is that time of year when agents run into each other in downtown cafeterias between appointments and tell war stories. The fatcat caseswhere big money is involved and the agent deals with batteries of lawyers and accountants and never sees the taxpayer in questionare relatively dull: it is those cases where individuals try to claim their motherinlaw that gives I.R.S. employment its extra dimension.

title: Churchgoers May Find Palm Shortage
description: Thousands of churchgoers will go palmless todayPalm Sunday  because of labor problems in Florida and the flooding of the Suwanee River in that state.

title: Terri Jean Timbers Married to Teacher
description: GREENWICH, Conn., April 14Miss Terri Jean Timbers, a teacher in the Greenwich school system, was married here this afternoon to Charles A. McKendree 2d, a teacher at the Whitby School here. The Rev. Nathan Adams performed the ceremony in the Stanwich Congregational Church.

title: Hussein in Hospital
description: AMMAN, Jordan, April 14 (Reuters) King Hussein of Jordan was admitted to the military hospital here today for a medical checkup. This was announced by the King's private physician, who said yesterday that Hussein had acute influenza.

title: Cavein Kills Two Brothers
description: STANDISH, Me., April 14 (AP)Two young boys were smothered by wet earth here yesterday when a long tunnel they were digging at their parents farm caved in on them. The bodies of Dana C. Chatier, 9 years old, and his brother, Troy A., 5, were recovered by rescue workers last night.

title: Best Seller List
Britain
description: LONDONIf a raincoat disappears in London the tendency among the British is to talk of a crime wave. So it came as no surprise that statistics showing an increase in violent crime in the British Isles led to a major effort in Parliament last week to restore the death penalty for certain offenses.

title: College and School Results
Travel Notes: FastRising Sport
description: OVER the Memorial Day weekend about 300,000 people are expected to converge on Lancaster, Pa., to watch 50 giant hotair balloons compete in a brandnew event, the Americana Cup Races. Besides helping to create what is expected to be one of the biggest traffic jams in the history of the Pennsylvania Dutch country, the huge turnout will serve to illustrate the current popularity of ballooning in the United States. Another indicator of the spread of the sport is the fact that this year, for the first time ever, there will be ballooon races as part of the weeklong festivities preceding the Kentucky Derby, America's premier horse race, on May 5 and the Preakness in Maryland on May 19.

title: A College Counsels Cranford Residents
description: CRANFORDUnion College has for the last year been offering a variety of counseling services to the community.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: AT A TIME when the No. 2 economic power in the world, the Soviet Union, is striving desperately to improve its growth, efficiency and affluence, it might seem somewhat ironic that the leading economic performer, the United States, is hoping earnestly that it can soon achieve a substantial slowdown in the dynamic economic expansion under way the last two years.

title: Greek Cypriote Negotiator Reported Ready to Quit
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, April 14Glafkos Clerides, president of the Cypriote House of Representatives and the island's chief peacemaker, has reportedly threatened to quit both jobs.

title: Britain's Coles Captures Spanish Golf by 3 Shots
description: LA MANGA, Spain, April 14 (AP)Neil Coles of Britain won the $65,000 Spanish open golf tournament today with a finalround par72 for a 72hole total of 282. Coles earned $9,000.

title: Foes of Santa Barbara Oil Wells Ease Stand on Exploratory Work
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. April 14The Get Oil Out organization, a foe of the offshore oil industry, announced today that it would not oppose additional exploratory drilling in the Santa Barbara Channel to determine the extent of reserves that could be used in a real emergency.

title: CHINA'S PROTESTS MARK TOKYO TALK
description: TOKYO, April 14  Chinese officials have turned the normally staid annual meeting of the Economic Commission for Asia and the Far East into a turbulent political forum by openly quarreling with the Russians and by walking out on other delegates' speeches.

title: Sports Today
description: BADMINTON

title: Parking Problem Plagues College
description: Pollution control devices may eventually eliminate the breathing hazard caused by automobile exhausts across the nation, but residents around Queensborough Community College in Bayside, Queens, are concerned about a more immediate and visible problem  too many cars.

title: G.M. Converting Facilities To Use of Metric System
description: DETROIT, April 14 (Reuters) The General Motors Corporation has announced a program to convert its full production facilities to the metric system.

title: Sinatra Given Top Billing For White House Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP) The White House gave Frank Sinatra top billing today when it announced that he would entertain at a state dinner for the Italian Prime Minister, Guilio Andreotti, on April 17.

title: Rangers Seek to Lift Road Streak to Five
description: CHICAGO, April 14  In a nationally televised game that will be available in New York on Channel 4, beginning at 3 P.M., the New York Rangers will attempt to extend their streak of Stanley Cup victories on the road to five tomorrow against the Black Hawks at Chicago Stadium.

title: U.S. Plans 2Year Study On Kidney Transplants
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP) The Federal Government wants to pin down more precisely the results of using kidneys from unrelated donors in transplant operations.

title: A plot against Hitler that failed
description: Helmuth James von Moltke was hanged in Berlin in January, 1945, aged 37. That he lived as long as he did may have been due to his name; he was the great  grandnephew of the field marshal whose generalship helped Bismarck found the Second Reich. The Nazis had some respect for that. But after the failure of the antiHitler plot of July, 1944, their vengeance against the plotters and all they stood for no longer respected any names, however historic; indeed it turned with a special fury against descendants of the aristocracy.

title: PUBLIC COLLEGES FACE DROP IN FALL
description: Applications for next fall's freshman class at the country's major staterun fouryear colleges have declined this spring for the first time in more than 10 years, and the decline has been sharp.

title: 20,000YearOld Dwelling Is Discovered in Siberia
description: MOSCOW, April 14 (UPI)Archeologists have discovered a dwelling built 20,000 years ago by Paleolithic man from mammoth bones, the Soviet press agency Tass has reported.

title: The Green Revolution Hasn't Ended Hunger
description: LOS BANOS, the Philippines The Green Revolution, launched seven years ago with great hope for vanquishing hunger, is sputtering along as little more than a minor revolt as Asia, overpopulated and undernourished, continues the struggle to feed itself.

title: A Rape Trial Proposal
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 14 (AP)A candidate for district attorney here has proposed that rape cases be tried before only women to prevent embarrassment to the victims. The rape victim is subject to the shock of the assault and then a second shock when she must go through the ordeal of testifying as to what happened, said Michael Stack, a Democrat.

title: ExGovernor Going on TV
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., April 14 (AP)Former Gov. Frank Licht has agreed to serve as a news commentator on a regular basis for a Rhode Island television station. The twoterm Democratic Governor, who returned to private law practice after leaving office last January, will appear on WJARTV at least once a week, the station has announced.

title: Knicks Open Big Series in Boston Today
description: The eagerly anticipated playoff match between the Knicks and the Boston Celtics has at last become a reality and the war starts this afternoon in Boston Garden.

title: Abortion Foes Mount Drive on Hospitals
description: NEWARK  Antiabortion organizations, employing petitions, picketing, public relations and political and economic pressures, have begun a concerted drive throughout New Jersey to sway public opinion and hospitals against performing abortions.

title: PALER DISPUTES VALUE OF PARADES
description: The decline of the tickertape parade and the growing emphasis on informality and culture were discussed by John S. (Bud) Palmer as he retired last week as the city's official greeter.

title: Humanitarian Bureau Urged
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP) A bill to establish a Bureau of Humanitarian and Social Services in the State Department has been introduced by Senators Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts and James B. Pearson, Republican of Kansas.

title: House Mothers Phased Out at Fairleigh
description: TEANECKAn era is ending at Fairleigh Dickinson University. The familiar figure of the dormitory house mother is being passed into the history books.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: During this spring ?? of annual meetings, the ?? of the Protestant churche in challenging corporate be havior is pervasive. Abou half the proxy resolution submitted have come ?? a coalition of denominational groups asserting leader ship on the issues of invest ments in southern Africa and on the conversion by military contractors to peace time production.

title: SOVIET IMPATIENT ON HELSINKI TALKS
description: MOSCOW, April 14The Soviet press showed the first public signs of impatience today at the slow pace of preparations for the European security conference at Helsinki.

title: Are Britain's Actors Better Than Ours?
description: WHATEVER my various grumbles about the conventionality of the English theater recently, its professional competence lies beyond dispute. There is something dependable about production here, even in the most predictable plays, which assures the spectator that few evenings in the theater will ever be entirely wasted. It goes without saying that no such confidence exists in the United States. There, even the most adventurous programs are too often hobbled by awkward performing or hamhanded directing, especially if the material wanders too far from the personal experience of the actors.

title: WESTERNERS SEE PEKING'S TUNNELS
description: PEKING, April 14A sales clerk steps out from behind the counter in a crowded little clothing store, slips his fingers beneath a calendar hanging from the end of a display case, presses a hidden button, andpresto!a section of the pinktiled floor rolls away, revealing a subterranean staircase.

title: Dr. Russell Ciafone Weds Judith Vetog
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., April 14Miss Judith Ann Vetog and Dr. Russell A. Ciafone were married here this morning by the Rev. William Tierney in St. Dominic's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Dave Anderson
description: CHICAGO, April 14On or off the basketball court, the expression on his firm, lean face seldom changes, as if a mask were chalked under his black hair. Jerry Sloan of the Chicago Bulls is a hard competitor because he's never had it easy. When he was 4 years old, the youngest of 10 children, his mother suddenly became widow. They lived on a farm, 16 miles outside McLeansboro in the southern Illinois oil fields. I started working in the second grade, he was saying. We used to grub sprouts  that's yanking out stumps of littlebitty trees. I got $2 a day. I been working all my life.

title: Results of British Football
Fordham Crew Sets Back Post Varsity by 6 Lengths
description: Fordham's heavyweight junior varsity beat C.W. Post's varsity eight by six lengths yesterday on the Harlem River. The Rams covered the course in 7 minutes 11 seconds, rowing at a smooth 32 strokes a minute most of the way.

title: Head Start Offshoot Needs Aid To Survive
description: TRENTON  Follow Through, an extension of the Head Start education program and which involves parents as well as children, is seeking funds to stay alive. Its existence is threatened by a cutoff of Federal funds at a time when, educators say, the sixyearold project is just coming to fruition.

title: Screen: Imitating Life
description: One of the most pleasant possibilities of the new, relatively unassertive documentary movie has nothing to do with the truth it tells, but rather with the chance it offers to spend some time together with a sensibility you might find congenial. I felt this last year at a Whitney Museum showing of CoCo Puffs, Ira Wohl's charming film about a drum lesson. And I felt it all over again with The Magic Beauty Kit, another Ira Wohl documentart, and the first work in a program called New American Cinema, which opened Friday at the Film Forum.

title: Bach's Mass in B Minor Sung by Berlin Chorus
description: Since Bach was a German composer, we sometimes assome that interpretations of his music by German musicians will automatically be more authoritative and insightful than ours. Occasionally, this seems to be true, but the Berlin Concert Choir and Orchestra's performance of the Mass in B minor at Carnegie Recital Hall on Friday night showed that exceptions do indeed exist.

title: New Trade Bill BornIt's Siamese Twins
description: WASHINGTONThe Nixon Administration has given birth at last, and to neither a monster nor a mouse but something like Siamese twins. The longawaited trade bill, which was so adroitly presented to the world last week, turns out to be the amalgam of liberality and toughness everyone expected.

title: Gain on Infectious Hepatitis Reported
description: Researchers reported yesterday their ability to infect marmosets with the virus that causes infectious hepatitis in man and to use the animals to propagate the virus. The new advance is the first crucial step toward development of a vaccine against this epidemic form of the debilitating liver disease.

title: Birth Control Aid Backed
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, April 14 (UPI)The State Public Health Association has endorsed a proposal to provide birth control services to sexually active minors without parental consent. The resolution yesterday said, Parents should be involved but services would not be withheld if they were not.

title: New Offer in Britain In Thalidomide Cases
description: LONDON, April 14An improved offer of compensation indicated an end today to a long struggle by the families of hundreds of children who were born deformed because their mothers took thalidomide during pregnancy.

title: FatAnkled Gertrude
description: To the Editor: I've grown used to seeing women put down for stupidity, talkativeness, imperfections as mothers or wivesand, of course, for physical characteristics some male finds unattractive. I've never learned to accept this  but I've held my peace until now. R. V. Cassill's review of Mark Costello's The Murphy Game was just too much.

title: Miss Burke Is Wed To Michael Janson
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., April 14Miss Mary Anne Burke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward F. Burke of Portland, Conn., was married here this morning to Michael Martin Janson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Janson of New Milford, N. J. The Rev. David McDonald, a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the chapel of Wesleyan University.

title: Lot Owners Threatened in Asharoken
description: ASHAROKEN, L. I.People who paid $6,000 for a slice of beach here and space to park two cars are concerned about how the sale of a nearby estate to a developer will affect their small lots.

title: SOVIET WILL EASE SECURITY IN SHOPS
description: MOSCOW, April 14I was never so embarrassed in my life, Mariya S. Ivannikova reported. The other day I happened to do some shopping in a supermarket outside Moscow, and when I reached the checkout counter, they started going through my handbagand how! I can assure you I would never want to go back to that store again.

title: Israel/Lebanon
description: TEL AVIVIn the six weeks since three diplomats were murdered by Palestinian terrorists in the Sudanese capital of Khartoum, Israel watched the pace of Arab guerrilla activity quicken here and abroad, Khartoum was followed by an explosion aboard an Israelbound passenger ship, attempted bombings in New York, Paris and Rome, a letterbomb in Singapore, explosions in several Israeli cities and the murder of an Israeli in Cyprus.

title: Superfecta Bets Halted
description: Superfecta wagering has been suspended by Roosevelt Raceway, Monticello Raceway and the Offtrack Betting Corporation pending an investigation into questionable betting patterns. In this type of betting on harness race horses, bettors must pick the first four horses in their exact order of finish. Details in Section 5.

title: Harness Tracks Suspend Superfectas Because of Questionable Bet Patterns
description: Superfecta wagering at New York racetracks and OTB shops was suspended yesterday pending an investigation into questionable betting patterns.

title: Canoe Race Has Ecological Undercurrent
description: BROOKHAVEN, L. I.The League of Women Voters of Brookhaven South and Bellport High School's Students for Environmental Quality recently paddled in strong winds and snow flurries through a milelong stretch of the Carman's River in a canoe race. The purpose of the race was to muster support for a bill that would include the river under the State Scenic Rivers Act. The bill has been introduced in the State Legislature by Assemblyman I. William Bianchi, Democrat of Bellport.

title: Miss Johnson to Wed
description: SAUGERTIES, N. Y., April 14The engagement of Miss Christine Maria Johnson to Peter John Picirello has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. E. Robert Johnson, formerly of New York. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph N. Piccirello of Woodstock.

title: Fastest Sailboat in the World
description: Will the fastest sailboat in the world please stand up? With the John Player tobacco company of England offering $2,500 for the boat with the fastest time of the year, Long Island's fanatical sailors started holding speed trials yesterday in Port Jefferson Harbor. They'll last through next Sunday. What may be the fastest craft under sail in the world could appear on Long Island this week, but setting a worldbeating time isn't that easy, according to Prof. W. S. (Brad) Bradfield of Stony Brook University.

title: At the very least, an inspired kind of typing
description: Truman Capote said it wasn't writing but typing in 1959, when Jack Kerouac's books were crowding the market. Among the novels on the stands then was The Dharma Bums, written in ten sittings and labeled a potboiler by the author himself. In that novel were visions and prophecies of the famous rucksack revolution, landloving congregations of holy people taking to the hills, and the adaptation of Eastern philosophy in the unenlightened West. Much of what was foreseen is today. Surely people who still hold with Mr. Capote's statement would admit that it was, at the very least, inspired typing.

title: Black Aristocrats Helping Those at Other End of the Social Scale
description: We're great for joining things; I think we're into more clubs and organizations than white people are.

title: The New Soviet Trade War
description: The United States and the Soviet Union now seem to be engaged in major new trade deals, which so far have not been explained to the American people. These involve an exchange of American technical information for the sale of Soviet raw materials in the markets of the worldand the possibilities of such a deal are immensebut the negotiations for this transformation of U.S.Soviet trade are proceeding under strange circumstances.

title: Ellsberg
description: LOS ANGELESFinally, nearly two years after they were arrested, Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. got on the witness stand last week to tell the Pentagon Papers jury what they did and, more importantly, why.

title: Model Apartments Achieve a New Elegance
description: Model apartments are enjoying a new cachet these days. Gone are the early American and Mediterranean looks once used ad nauseam. Gone, too, are the apartments done up by the builder's bored wife and the fraying suites lent by the local Bon Ton in return for a neatly lettered sign.

title: College Baseball
JUDGE ORDERS 1,500 IN BRIGS RELEASED
description: LOS ANGELES, April 14 (UPI))A Federal judge here has ordered the immediate release from Marine and Navy brigs of some 1,500 to 2,000 men convicted in summary courtsmartial without being allowed lawyers.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Taxation today is one of the most delicate arts of government. It has come a long way from the old days when governments used to break into your house in dead of night, paint shotguns at your wife and children and say, We want it all.

title: He Came And Was Conquered
description: THIS week marks the first and last occasion for a pair of musicians performing here. On Thursday night Thomas. Stacy, the new English horn soloist of the New York Philharmonic, will make his debut as a soloist with the orchestra. And this afternoon Antal Dorati will lead the National Symphony Orchestra in the final concert of its Philharmonic Hall series for this season.

title: GARDEN/HOME SPRINGTIME
description: SOME perennials such as peony, Christmas rose, gas plant, baptisia and balloon flower grow and bloom profusely for many years undisturbed in their original locations. Others are improved by frequent division. When perennials are just starting to come into active growth in spring, it is an ideal time to lift and divide those that form dense clumps or become invasive by spreading. They should be divided when the clumps push up out of the ground or when they develop dry and woody centers or whenever they have become too dense with so many stems to sustain that they lose their vigor, bloom sparsely. Some of the early blooming kinds are best divided in early summer soon after, they have finished blooming. These include Iris, Oriental poppy, Doronicum and Maddona lily.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Pollution Control
description: WASHINGTON Just a year ago William D. Ruckelshaus, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, refused the auto industry's request for a year's delay in meeting emission standards for carbon monoxide and hydrocarbons on 1975 models. But last Wednesday he reversed his position and granted the extension.

title: RUDY PEREZ DANCERS OFFER 2 PREMIERES
description: The Rudy Perez Dance Theater presented two premieres as part of a single eveninglong piece entitled Open Site/Dance EventA Tribute to the Sixties, Thursday night at Marymount Manhattan College.

title: Susan Gambrill Goldsborough Bride of Edward F. Glynn Jr.
description: RUXTON, Md. April 14Miss Susan Gambrill Goldsborough, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Phillips Lee Goldsborough 3d, and Edward Francis Glynn Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Glynn of the Town of Mount Royal, Montreal, Quebec, Canada, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. David F. Gearhart, assisted by Msgr. Thomas A. Whelan, performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd.

title: ADVANCE IN ARMS BY SOVIET FEARED
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (AP)  The Pentagon's research chief, Dr. John S. Foster Jr., says he fears that the Soviet Union could make a weapons breakthrough in the next several years.

title: Stony Brook Medical School Gets Mixed Reaction
description: STONY BROOK, L. I.The first class of Long Island's only medical school has reached the half way point in a threeyear course hailed in advance as revolutionary.

title: Annapolis Honors Rickover
description: WASHINGTON, April 14 (UPI)The new engineering studies complex at the United States Naval Academy in Annapolis, Md., will be named in honor of Vice Adm. Hyman G. Rickover, who fostered development of the nuclear submarine. Secretary of the Navy John W. Warner made the announcement yesterday, noting that the fourstory, $27million complex is scheduled for completion next year.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
Mung Nose Victor at Suffolk
description: BOSTON, April 14 (AP)Mung led all the way and hung on to win by a nose over Neigh Neigh in the $5,500 feature race at Suffolk Downs today. Mung, a 92 shot, covered the mile and 70 yards in 1:43 45.

title: AID TO INDOCHINA URGED ON UNICEF
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 14The head of the United Nations Children's Fund has called for a $30million program of assistance for Indochina for 197374.

title: Ionesco's Macbett Is Not Bewitching
description: I WAS charmed to discover that one of the conventions of the Japanese theateror at least of the Japanese puppet theater, Bunrakuinsists that whenever two public officials enter a scene together, one must be assumed to be evil. That, as Bobby Clark used to say, about the division of the alphabet into vowels and consonants, seems only fair.

title: Who Makes Music and Where
Drug Center Aids Addicts In Finding Abilities
description: GLEN COVE, L. I.Last fall, Community Hospital here opened a drugabuse treatment center in a threestory brick mansion, opposite the main entrance to the hospital, that is expected to serve as a model for other voluntary hospitals.

title: STATE AIDE SAYS RENT FIGURES ERR
description: A study by a state housing official has challenged New York City's contention that rent increases in apartments removed from rent control have averaged more than 70 per cent.

title: LEGISLATIVE NOTES
description: TRENTONI don't want my 8yearold niece using restrooms with adult men, said Mrs. Eve O'Donnell of Cresskill, a leader in a drive to block the adoption of a constitutional amendment to grant equal rights to women.

title: Naval Armory in Brooklyn May Close
description: After a history that stretches back to the Revolutionary War, the State Naval Militia, a maritime counterpart of the National Guard, may be phased out of existence as a result of financial cutbacks by the state. This would include the closing of the vast armory at 52d Street and First Avenue on the Brooklyn waterfront.

title: College Evaluating Addicts' Treatment
description: NEWARK  Scientists at the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New JerseyNew Jersey Medical School are evaluating different drug treatment programs.

title: Architecture
description: IAM writing about something this week of such importance to the quality of citiesa proposal of such farreaching significance for the American urban heritagethat it is hard to know how to state the case. Banner headlines would be best. In short, this concerns a proposal at once overwhelmingly sensible and dramatically revolutionary that has been made by the Department of the Interior to the city of Chicago, with ramifications for every city in the country.

title: Social Announcements
Great Swamp Tour Boycotted by Frogs
description: NEW VERNONIt was a raw, moonlit night, and 45 students and nature lovers turned up in the bogs for an afterdark frog walk. The frogs didn't.

title: Ousted Mexicans Pay Off To Stay Close to U.S. Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Every other night between 11 and 12 o'clock 120 Mexicans who have entered the United States illegally file by a table at the Border Patrol sector headquarters in San Ysidro, Calif., where representatives of a Mexican charter airline take $39 each from envelopes containing their inventoried property.

title: Future Social Events
description: April 22And you'll be in style, too, because at the annual Easter luncheon and cocktail dansant held by New York City's Easter Seal Committee at the WaldorfAstoria there'll be celebrity guests who'll judge and give awards to the bestturnedout man, woman and junior. But that's only one item on the program. After you reach the wilting point in the Easter Parade, you make your way to the Hilton Room and start to rebloom with a cocktail or two and then it's full bloom all the way. You'll tuck into tiffin in the Empire Room, which will be an absolute bower. Each table will have five flowering plants as centerpieces, generously (and so unusual that it could be a first) given by the hotel so that guests who have the inclination and muscle may take them home. Just after dessert, which will be served in little flowerpots, you'll watch a presentation of fashions by the Canadian designer and Coty Award winner Claire Haddad. Then back you go to the Hilton Room, where Emery Davis will direct you in dancing off the calories. Tickets $25, except for the showstealing kiddies, who'll be admitted for $17.50. Mrs. H. Donald Sills

title: HUSKY IS CHOSEN BEST AT BROCKTON
description: BROCKTON, Mass., April 14 Ch. Dudley's Tavar of Innisfree, a 3yearold blackandwhite Siberian husky, owned by Clarence and Gladys Dudley of North Syracuse, N.Y., and handled by Mrs. Jane Forsyth won its second bestinshow award today at the South Shore Kennel Club's 28th event at the Fairgrounds.

title: T. D. Adams to Wed Miss Vanagelis
description: BALDWIN, L. I., April 14 Mr. and Mrs. Vladislays V. Vanagelis have announced the engagement of his daughter, Miss Inta Vanagelis, to Taggart D. Adams, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Rally Adams of New Canaan, Conn. The couple plan to he married in the summer.

title: Opera Theater Eyeing the Meadowlands
description: NEWARKOfficials of the Opera Theater of New Jersey, which is considering a move to the planned sports complex in the Hackensack Meadowlands, said last week that Newark would still be its home base.

title: Fancy Foliage Plants
description: FOLIAGE of perennial and annual plants diffell almost as much as the blossoms do, and can provide design drama. Leaf sizes vary from gigantic ribbed affairs that children could use as umbrellas, to the minute leaves of creeping thyme. In addition to all the shades that green comes in, leaf colors range from silvery white through greys, bronze tones, purples and several shades of red to almost black.

title: Guru's Disciples Active in Business
description: Sri Chinmoy Kumar Ghose, who is revered in India as one of the few holy men to have reached Nirvikalpa Samadhi, the absolute highest level of consciousness, directs the activities of hundreds of disciples around the world from his home in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Presidential Secrets
description: WASHINGTONThe Congress was stunned, Republicans and Democrats alike, There was Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst telling a Senate hearing that, yes, it was true, the notion of executive privilege was a blanket which the President, if he chose, could wrap around all 2.5 million employes of the executive branch of Government.

title: Deaths
9 RECORDS BROKEN IN SCHOOL RELAYS
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., April 14Records were broken in nine of the 10 championship events today in the West New York Memorial scholastic relays at North Hudson Stadium.

title: Picasso: Last of the Old Masters?
description: AFTER a man's long work is over and the sound of his voice is still, Henry James once wrote, those in whose regard he has held a high place find his image strangely simplified and summarized. The hand of death, in passing over it, has smoothed the folds, made it more typical and general. The figure retained by the memory is compressed and intensified; accidents have dropped away from it and shades have ceased to count; it stands, sharply, for a few estimated and cherished things, rather than, nebulously, for a swarm of possibilities. We cut the silhouette, in a word, out of the confusion of life, we save and fix the outline, and it is with his eye on this profiled distinction that the critic speaks.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
Study for Kennedy Panel Finds Half in Cambodia Are Refugees
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Senator Edward M. Kennedy said today that a recent Senate study in Cambodia had concluded that about three million Cambodiansnearly half the populationhad become refugoes since the Americansponsored invasion of Cambodia three years ago.

title: Aides for Papua New Guinea Trained
description: SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA, April 14The Sydney school that turned out the intrepid young agents of white power in the wild, malarial jungles of Papua New Guinea now has an allblack student body learning from white teachers how to run their own country.

title: Scandals
description: The city's, five district attorneys are among New York's most visible and powerful elected officials but to many New Yorkers the full extent of their powers is largely unknown. Each day the D.A.'s decide which of all the crimes committed they will investigate, which cases they will present to a grand jury, which indictments they will publicize and which, defendants they will permit to plead guilty to lesser charges and thus avoid lengthy prison sentences.

title: Mayoralty
description: First there were nine Democratic candidates for Mayor. Now, after two months of huffing and puffing, there are only the four B'sBadillo, Beame, Biaggi and Blumenthal.

title: First U.S. Official to Attend Canton's Trade Fair
description: HONG KONG, April 14The deputy chief of mission of the United States Consulate here will be the first American official to attend the Canton trade fair.

title: Nixons Lead White House Garden Tour
description: WASHINGTON, April 14Mrs. Richard M. Nixon, joined briefly by the President, led Mayor Walter W. Washington and a group of District of Columbia schoolchildren on a tour of the White House gardens today.

title: CARDS WALK 13 AS CUBS WIN, 41
description: ST. LOUIS, April 14 (UPI)The Chicago Cubs, taking advantage of 13 walks, beat the St. Louis Cardinals, 41, today as Rick Reuschel got his first victory of the season with ninthinning relief help from Jack Aker.

title: Family Entry of 3 in Boston Marathon Includes Olympian, Wife and Father
description: When a British Olympian, Dave Holt, married Loraine Epstein of Brooklyn last year, he didn't realize that he would be running together with his wife and inlaws in tomorrow's 76th Boston Marathon.

title: St. John's Crew Wins
description: St. John's University fouroared crew defeated Drexel Institute of Technology of Philadelphia yesterday by one length in the 1,500meter race. Drexel is the defending Dad Vail champion.

title: Susan Carey Is Married to Martin Joseph Dempsey
description: Miss Susan Carey, daughter of Representative Hugh L. Carey of Brooklyn, and Mrs. Carey, was married yesterday at noon to Martin Joseph Dempsey in St. Saviour Roman Catholic Church in Brooklyn by the Rev. Thomas Hagerty.
