It makes a fine home away from home for American Ballet Theater, which is now in the throes of its spring season in the capital.

title: Numismatics
description: ALTHOUGH it is listed in all the standard guidebookcatalogues of United States coins, the unique coinage of Hawaii is relatively little known to the average collector of U.S. material. The copper cent of 1847 and the four silver denominations of 1883 (dime, quarter, halfdollar and dollar) are unique in that they were issued when Hawaii was an independent kingdom, ruled by native Polynesian monarchs, with her independence recognized by the major governments of the world. (The 50th state did not become a U.S. territory until 1900).

title: Sinai Names Cancer Expert
description: Dr. James F. Holland, an expert in cancer research, has been named professor and chairman of a newly created department of neoplastic (tumorous) diseases at Mount Sinai School of Medicine and the director of the cancer center at Mount Sinai Medical Center. Dr. Hans Popper, dean of the medical school, said the new departments would go into operation on July 1.

title: The Rich Get Richer
description: PORTLAND, Ore., April 21 (AP)Richard Washington, a 7footer rated by many coaches the nation's No. 1 schoolboy basketball player, will enroll next fall at the University of California, Los Angeles, his coach at Benson High here confirmed today.

title: KEENELAND FEATURE TO KNIGHT COUNTER
description: LEXINGTON, Ky.; April 21 (AP)Robert Huffman's Knight Counter swept to the front with Tightly more than a quartermile left today and easily won the $28,900 Ben Ali Handicap at Keeneland.

title: New Issues Retell Story of Easter
description: STAINED glass windows, depicting in patterned grace events that are significant in man's faith, dominate stamps put out for this period of solemn religious observance.

title: Marriage a la Ingmar Bergman
description: WHAT is fundamental to the films of Ingmar Bergman is not the search for God, nor alienation, nor the inadequacy of the relationship between the artist and the world. Take the extreme statements of the search for God, The Seventh Seal and Winter Light: in the former, you have a knight who, though searching for the great metaphysical answers, must find his way to his wife to receive forgiveness, love and death; in the latter, you meet a pastor obsessed by God's silence, but who must really resolve a longing for a dead wife and a loathing for a living mistress.

title: Glen Ridge Show House Opening for Charity
description: GLEN RIDGEWhen 600 dedicated women and 15 professional decorators get together to do over an old house, they do it in style.

title: Sun Expected to Glow on Easter Parade
description: The Easter sun is expected to shine through scattered clouds today and the temperature will be a bit warmer than it was last Sunday when New Yorkers enjoyed ideal spring weather.

title: Eskimos Sign Tight End
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, April 21 (AP)The Edmonton Eskimos of the Canadian Football League today signed Lynn Ahrens, a rookie tight end from Eastern Montana College.

title: Engineers LookAgain to Wind As Answer to Ship Fuel Crisis
description: The Age of Sail may stage a surprise comeback in radically new form.

title: PUZZLES
description: WIRE SERVICEBy Mel Rosen

title: CLARK FORCED OUT OF AFRICAN RALLY
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, April 21 (UPI)Timo Makinen of Finland gained a slight lead in the East African Safari auto rally tonight after Roger Clark of Britain was forced to retire.

title: Mayflower Embassy
description: One of the most delicate arrangements in modern diplomatic history has finally been consummated. United States State Department officials are now in residence in Peking, and their opposite numbers from the Chinese People's Republic are installed in the Mayflower Hotel in Washington.

title: STOCKYARD PRICES OF BEEF MAY DROP
description: CHICAGO, April 21There was hope today that stockyard prices for fattened beef would drop slightly during the next four weeks.

title: Chartered Bus With ExL.I.R.R. Riders Is Running Into Franchise Problems
description: PORT JEFFERSON. STATION, L. I.A group of 40 former Long Island Rail Road commuters who banded together during last January's railroad strike earlier this year to charter buses for the daily trip into New York City are now finding their coaches slowed by barriers, of red tape.

title: HILTON CAPTURES KANSAS HE RUN
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., April 21 (AP)Leonard Hilton of the Houston Striders, with a blazing sprint on the last onehalf lap, won the Glenn Cunningham onemile run today during the 48th Kansas Relays. His time was 4 minutes 1.9 seconds.

title: Amabel Boyce Plans Nuptials
description: LUTHERVILLE, Md., April 21  Miss Amabel George Boyce and Hamilton Evans James plan to be married in August. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. John Cowman George Boyce of Lutherville and Wequetonsing, Mich., parent of the future bride.

title: Easter
description: Thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field, it was said long ago, and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee. And it was said, Speak to the earth and it shall be at peace with thee. Words to remember today, a day of peace and hope and belief, this springtime of the year.

title: ISLE OF WIGHT, 25, WINS 2:01 25 MILE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., April 21Isle of Wight remained unbeaten this year with a convincing 1length triumph in the $25,000 Irvin Paul Pace tonight at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Everybody is so enlightened these days about relations between the sexes that relations between the sexes hardly seem like relations anymore.

title: Black Enrollment Falls Short of Michigan U. Goal
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., April 21 A commitment to increase the number of blacks at the University of Michigan from 4.8 per cent of the student population to 10 per cent in three years has failed, university officials announced this week.

title: Tom Paine Would Drink to New Rochelle
description: THOMAS PAINE might he mollified were he to return today to New Rochelle, the Westchester community that was the home of his twilight years. A small lake bears his name; an avenue, too. The Post Office is dispensing Thomas Paine stamps. His cottage has been newly designated a historic landmark by the Department of the Interior. A hulking stone museum enshrines his modest possessions: writing set, pocket watch, candle snuffers, gloves and a leather walletas flat as when Paine carried it in his pocket.

title: Youth in Canada: Drifting Around With the Government's Blessing
description: IN the last five years or so bumming around has become young America's most common summer activity. Usually it's bumming around Europe that attracts the thousands upon thousands of kids from the United States, although bumming around Mexico and bumming through Asia are becoming more and more popular.

title: Gardeners Get Advice on Wet Spell and Growing Vegetables
description: HACKENSACK  Everything may not be coming up rosesor radishesfor New Jersey gardeners this spring and summer.

title: The New Play
description: GHOSTS, the Roundabout Theater's production of Ibsen's play, got six favorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Watts, Post; Wallach, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Glover, AP; Sanders, ABCTV), two mixed (Watt, News; Gayer, UPI) and one unfavorable review (Gottfried, Women's Wear).

title: Miss Susan Willett, Teacher Is Fiance of Michael Fairchild
description: ROUSES POINT, N. Y., April 21Mr. and Mrs. Adolphus H. Willett have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Maria Willett, to Michael MacCollom Fairchild of Cold Spring Harbor, L. I., a descendant of the Fairchilds who were a founding family of Stratford, Conn in 1639.

title: Powerless Potlines
description: To the aluminum producers of the Pacific Northwest the energy crisis is more than an abstract worry. It's costing them profits when demand for aluminum is high.

title: 10 Games Listed for Week In Knickerbocker Baseball
description: The Knickerbocker College baseball conference has 10 games sceduled this week. All 10 teams will play with Hunter, Pace and Pratt having three games each. Lehman, the defending champion, plays once.

title: BELGRADE CRITICISM OF FACULTY DEEPENS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, April 21A struggle by the Communist party against socalled anarcholiberal faculty members in Belgrade University's philosophy department sharpened this weekend.

title: New Directions at Inco
description: TORONTOAfter decades of relentlessly pursuing one goal, increased production, Inco, under the leadership of L. Edward Grubb, is moving quickly and simultaneously on several fronts.

title: Miss Mawer Bride Of Peter Markwith
description: LIVINGSTON, N.J., April 21Miss Shirley Jean Mawer and Peter George Markwith were married at noon today in the Livingston United Methodist Church by the Rev. Randall Bean.

title: U.S. Note to Big Powers Rebuts Hanoi's Charges
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) The United States has distributed to the members of the Paris conference that guaranteed the Vietnam peace agreement a note accusing North Vietnam and the Vietcong of violating the accord.

title: JEWS AND POLICE CLASH AT STATION
description: Several hundred Hasidic Jews converged on the Borough Park police station in Brooklyn yesterday afternoon to protest an assault on two of their number on a neighborhood street the night before. The demonstrators demanded additional police protection.

title: Spending Levels of Nassau and Suffolk Schools Compared
Criminals At Large
description: In her recent titles, P. D. James has followed the exploits of Scotland Yard's Adam Dalgliesh, a major figure in the contemporary detective novel. In Mrs. James's latest, AN UNSUITABLE JOB FOR A WOMAN (Scribner's, $5.95), Dalgliesh does not appear until the final chapter. Yet he permeates the whole book.

title: Son of Glut Triumphs
description: BOSTON, April 21 (AP)Big Purchase, a 211 long shot, and favored Son of Glut won divisions of the $15,000 Paul Revere Handicap today at Suffolk Downs.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION AND POETRY

title: Watergate
description: WASHINGTONThe cool and faceless men of Richard M. Nixon's Washington, who had denied and ridiculed the threatening implications of Watergate for 10 months, became a group of sadly recognizable human beings last weekanxious men publicly struck with the simple fear of going to jail, of being treated as so many burglars and bagmen, of eating their meals off metal trays.

title: Energy Prices Up, Supplies Down
description: WASHINGTONPresident Nixon issued two energy messages last week. The formal one, addressed to Congress, outlined legislative proposals to increase production of fuels and electricity,

title: 3 SUE AUDUBON UNIT AND TIMES FOR LIBEL
description: The National Audubon Society and Tim New York Times have been named as defendants in a $12million libel suit filed by three science professors in Federal Court here.

title: CHRIS 11S, MICE IS SET FOR TODAY
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., April 21 (AP)  Chris Evert and Evonne Goolagong won semifinal matches in the $20,000 Masters tennis tournament today, setting up their third meeting in a final on the United States Lawn Tennis Association tour.

title: Pride and Sadness Evoked at a Seder Attended by 2,000
description: A combination of pride and mourning dominated the moods of 2,000 people who filled the ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel yesterday for a special third Passover seder to mark Israel's 25th anniversary as a nation and the 30th anniversary of the Warsaw Ghetto uprising.

title: U. S. Raids Continue
description: HONOLULU, April 21 (AP)American heavy bombers and tactical aircraft continued operations over Cambodia today at the request of the Cambodian Government, the United States Pacific Command here reported. The raids by the B52s have been conducted daily for more than six weeks, but command officials decline to give any details on the air operations.

title: Patricia A. Planer Plans Oct. 6 Bridal
description: SPRINGFIELD, N.J., April 21Mr. and Mrs. Robert G. Planer have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Ann Planer, to Roy Remmey Bumsted 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bumsted Jr. of Short Hills and Key Largo, Fla. An Oct. 6 wedding is planned.

title: Biaggi Crisis for A LawandOrder Man
description: From left to right, all the mayoral candidates in this year's New York election talk about law and order. But none has been able to speak with more authority than Mario Biaggi, a threeterm Congressman from the Bronx and a muchdecorated former policeman.

title: Yacht Race To Newport Set June 16
description: Not counting next Saturday's ocean race from Biloxi, Miss., to Cozumel, Mexico, the next major longdistance sailing event will be the AnnapolistoNewport Race, set to begin June 16. This one is sponsored by the New York Yacht Club in association with the Annapolis Y. C., the United States Naval Academy Sailing Squadron and the Ida Lewis Y.C. The 473nauticalmile biennial race had 91 entries in 1971, when Sorcery captured the honors in 77 hours 50 minutes, slowed by calm, current and fog.

title: Rogers Names ExReporter
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) Secretary of State William P. Rogers has appointed John M. Hightower, a former Associated Press diplomatic reporter, as a member of the State Department's Advisory Committee on Science and Foreign Affairs.

title: CITY SEEKS WORK FOR ITS. IDLE FUNDS
description: The city plans to introduce in the State Legislature this week a bill, submitted by the Finance Administration, to widen the potential market for investment of idle city funds.

title: Congress Striking a Bargain on The Elderly
description: WASHINGTON Congress and the President struck a rare bargain last week, perhaps setting a pattern for future compromises in their bitter struggle over spending. By a unanimous voice vote in the Senate and a swift 3480 roll call in the House on Wednesday, Congress approved a $543million, threeyear program of expanded aid for the nation's 21 million elderly.

title: Miss Malamed To Be a Bride
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., April 21Mr. and Mrs. Seymour Malamed have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margery Joan Malamed, to Mark Sanders Germain, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Germain of White Plains. A November wedding is planned.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Shoplifting By Students Is Exposed In Survey
description: MATAWAN  More than half of the 930member student body at Matawan Regional High School has admitted, in an unsignedquestionnaire poll, to having shoplifted in neighborhood stores. The figure was 53 per cent, and a surprising 81 per cent of those who confessed that they had stolen said they probably would do so again.

title: Mackell Ouster Threat For a D.A.
description: A Brooklyn District Attorney was removed from office in 1874. A Manhattan District Attorney was deposed in 1900. Queens had to wait threequarters of a century, but last week it appeared that borough's turn may have come: Governor Rockefeller announced he had begun proceedings to remove District Attorney Thomas V. Mackell.

title: Funds Vetoed for Mississippi Board That Fought Civil Rights
description: JACKSON, Miss., April 21The long, secrecyshrouded career of the State Sovereignty Commission that sought to frustrate the civil rights movement in Mississippi in the nineteenfifties and nineteensixties is apparently ending.

title: The World
description: PHNOM PENHIt looked last week as though Washington had finally prevailed on President Lon Nol to pull the Cambodian Government together for an 11thhour stand against Communist forces battering at the approaches to the capital.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For years our American Congressional practice of tacking riders on to legislative bills (and additions on to appropriation bills) has resulted in measures becoming law which would never be approved if standing alone.

title: Pascin's Bohemia
description: THE career of the painter who called himself Pascinhis real name was Julius Mordecai Pincusconstituted, for an earlier generation, the very model of what the artist's.life was expected to be: the life of a reprobate bohemian, debauched by an overindulgence in liquor and sex, untamed by convention and indifferent to the world's opinion, yet possessed of a fine natural talent that disclosed, in its purest expressions, the soul of a poet. In this scenario, once a favorite theme of dramatists and novelists, it was inevitable that the scourge of bourgeois morals would sooner or later meet a tragic end. With the artist safely dead, his suffering could then be upheld as a sacrifice to a new standard of beauty and his work comfortably assimilated to the traditions he once seemed to threaten.

title: 2 Council Committees Plan Public Meetings
description: Following are the City Council committee meetings this week open to the public. They will be held in the Council committee room.

title: Grand Prix Debut Listed for Ox Ridge Show
description: Mrs. Richard Hodgson and Bonnie Wright have been elected cochairmen of the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show for the second consecutive year.

title: Tight budget
description: Architect Richard Moger completed this twobedroom vacation house in Southampton, L. I., just year ago. It cost $35,000. And he paid another $4,000 for grading, site work and utility hookups. To build the same house today would cost $50,000, he estimates. Soaring lumber prices as well as the scarcity of some woods, such as the cedar planking that sheathes the house, account for most of the increase. To stay within his original budget, Moger had designed in many economical features and acted as his own general contractor. The house smaller than one thinks, only 1,500 square feet. The open plan, which eliminates most interior walls and circulation areas, and the generous deck reaching out from the living and dining areas give a sensation of space. The Mogers say that the expanse of windows at the back of the house makes nature's seasonal changes a part of our daily experience.

title: SHOP TALK
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD Couturiers pay a lot for the designing talent and skillful labor that goes into the textiles they use, a price that is often reflected in the finished product. Such fabrics can be found here at Brotman's, and you'll pay less for them than the designers do.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: POLLUTION LINKED TO ROAD SALTING
description: For at least 20 years, common rock salt has been increasingly relied on as one of the most effective ways to clear highways of ice and snow. But the salt has created problems of its own.

title: NICKLAUS CARDS 68208FOR LEAD
description: RANCHO LA COSTA, Calif., April 21Jack Nicklaus made a realistic attempt today to settle any dispute as to who might be the champion in the Tournament of Champions. Displacing the 36hole leader, Lee Trevino, Nicklaus scored 68 for a 54hole total of 208 and led by two strokes.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: PRO: By Christine E. Samurovich, housing consultant to the West Side Tenants Union, and a leader in a successful effort to defeat a cooperative conversion in her West End Avenue building.

title: A.I.A. Playoffs
description: EAST DIVISION FINAL Kentucky vs. Carolina

title: Durocher Is Feeling Fine, Anxious to Return to Astros
description: HOUSTON, April 21 (UPI)Manager Leo Durocher of the Houston Astros is recovering from intestinal inflamation and is anxious to leave the hospital and rejoin the team, the Astros' general manager, H. B. Richardson, said today.

title: QUESTIONS
description: I have a cutting from some type of jasmine. Although it is growing new leaves from the top, it has failed to produce roots in either vermiculite or water. How can root it? S. F., Brooklyn.

title: Scott Asserts Kleindienst Goes Too Far on Privilege
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (AP) The Senate Republican leader, Hugh Scott, said today that the position taken by Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst on executive privilege was extremely broad . . . too broad.

title: Marine Sergeant Cleared
description: PARRIS ISLAND, S.C., April 21 (UPI)S. Sgt. Samuel D. Carver has been found innocent of charges of dereliction of duty and maltreatment of Marine recruits that resulted from the death of a young trainee earlier this year.

title: MEDIA EXECUTIVES TO HEAR KISSINGER
description: More than 1,200 newspaper executives and broadcast industry leaders will gather tomorrow at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel to hear Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's assistant for national security affairs, at the start of the fourday American Newspaper Publishers Association's 87th annual meeting here.

title: Food: Sausages and Such
description: RIDGEFIELDAll that is missing, perhaps, is a German oompah band, but, then again, the customers that one is likely to find at Kocher's House of Quality Meats are hardly the kind who would prefer dancing in the aisles to placing their orders.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The anonymous author of the article No Need to Worry About the Tenants, the Brownstone Agent Said, which appeared March 18, has agreed to drop his anonymity in the following reply to letter writers who criticized him and brownstone buyers in general for forcing out tenants.

title: Lawyer Weds Deborah Cristman
description: FRANCESTOWN, N. H., April 21Miss Deborah Cristman, daughter of Mrs. Luis A. Gallop and the adopted daughter of Mr. Gallop, was married here this afternoon to Jeremy John McMullen, who is with the New York law firm of Kelley, Drye, Warren, Clark, Carr & Ellis. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John E. McMullen of Ashwicken, a town in Norfolk, England.

title: Author's Query
description: For a biography of Walter Hines Page (18551918), editor, publisher and ambassador to Great Britain, I should be interested in any letters or information, especially dealing with his early life or career as a book publisher.

title: Fire in Police Cruiser Doesn't Halt Cruising
description: BREWSTER, Ohio, April 21 (UPI)The police department has been using the same cruiser for over nine years in this community of 2,025. Sections of twobyfours have been placed on the car's floor to close gaps where the original steel had rusted away.

title: The Region
description: The political and personal feuding between Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay has become a routine feature of New York life that, by now, probably leaves as many people yawning as yearning for the truth in the charges of dereliction and incompetence that flash between Albany and City Hall.

title: Monzon in Title Bout June 2
description: MONTE CARLO, April 21 (Reuters)  Carlos Monzon of Argentina will defend his world middleweight boxing title against Emile Griffith at the Monaco Soccer Stadium here June 2. Monzon retained his title in the same ring against Nino Benvenuti of Italy in 1971.

title: Education
description: The strains on colleges and universities may be shifting away from finances to operating proceduresfor the time being, at least.

title: Clyde Lee: The Cleanup Man
description: Clyde Lee is not a flashy player. His name is the one people usually skip over in the Golden State Warrior box scores. He doesn't score a lot of points. The things he does are often noticed only by knowledgeable basketball people. For seven National Basketball Association seasons, he has earned his keep grabbing rebounds, playing defense, boxing out and setting picks.

title: Festival at C. W. Past Honors Early Works of O'Neill
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I. The milieu in which Eugene O'Neill wrote his first plays is being recreated during the sixth annual C. W. Post American Theatre Festival, which will run through Saturday.

title: Miss Enquist Sets Nuptials
description: MANHASSET, L.I., April 21 Dr. and Mrs. Irving Enquist have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kristine Marie Enquist, to Albert Cole Fach, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert W. Fach of Port Washington.

title: LEGISLATIVE NOTES
description: TRENTON  Some legislators have speculated that the controversy surrounding the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 campaign could erupt into New Jersey's own Watergate Affair. But, unlike Congress, the State Legislature wants no part of investigating the case.

title: Spring Shows, Tours
description: WEDNESDAY will be flower show day at the Horticultural Society of New York, 128 West 58th Street. Daffodils in all shapes and sizes will star among the spring flowers. There will also be competitive flower designs by society members. The show will be from noon to 4 P.M. Admission is $1.

title: Arthur Daley
description: When Paul Revere sounded the alarm throughout every Middlesex village and farm to notify his fellow Colonials that the British were coming, he did it deliberately. But when Carlton Fisk aroused a different segment of the Boston populace into bristling action last year, he did it accidentally. If it embarrassed him at the time, he no longer regrets it. He woke up the Red Sox. They bestirred themselves from their lethargy and finished with such furious drive that they barely missed winning their divisional championship. Considering the fact that the 24yearold Fisk was the thirdstring catcher when the Red Sox completed spring training that season, these are singular accomplishments. But his advance was unbelievably swift. He soon became the best catcher in the American League and was Boston's leading batter and home run hitter. He was named rookie of the year, the first unanimous choice in history. He even drew so heavy a vote in the election for most valuable player that he finished fourth.

title: Child power and potter power
description: The Dark Is Rising

title: Saigon Closes Large Bank and Accuses Its Director
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 21The largest private bank in South Vietnam was closed by the Government today and its managing director a proGovernment member of the National Assembly and the president of the chamber of commerce here  was charged with using vast amounts of depositors' funds for his own purposes.

title: Mrs. Burleigh Gets New Post
description: Mrs. Gladys H. Burleigh, who was coordinator of pupil programs with the New York City Board of Education, was named executive director of the New York Region of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, the organization announced yesterday. Mrs. Burleigh has held educational posts in Raleigh, N. C., Atlanta, Princess Anne, Md., and White Plains.

title: the traveler's world
description: DEARBORN, Mich.Is it possible to improve the driving habits of an experienced motorist so as to increase his chances of avoiding road situations that create accidents? Can such reeducation be quick and painless, interesting and challenging to the motorist, and cheap enough to make it profitable for the nation to retrain ordinary motorists rather than spend all its efforts and money on the small percentage of repeating accidentmakers?

title: Siege: An Angry Muckraker
description: JOURNALISM, most honorably, pursues truth through an inventory of available facts, while fiction seeks truth in essences. When journalism and fiction overlap, the result can be the utter foolishness we see in much of the New Journalism, including the New Television in which the personality of the reporter sits atop the story being covered like an elephant lounging on a toadstool. Or the result may be the more heady confusion of the fictional documentary.

title: Tough Luck
description: GREENDALE, Wis. (AP Four 300 games were rejected during an American Bowling Congress meeting of the A.B.C. awards review committee. Two of the games were rolled by Darold Meisel in Madison, Wis. The centers of the lanes on which Meisel rolled his perfect games were found to have an improper concentration of dressing.

title: Only Eight States File Antismog Plans
description: Many of the nation's big cities face the possibility of having the Federal Government move in on them soon in the role of traffic cop.

title: Down Memory Lane to a Dead End
description: ALL right. Everybody got born somehow, everybody had a dumb childhood, everybody had a boring or possibly indifferent father, everybody had a mother who didn't understand her husband, everybody played puberty games, everybody had a best friend from whom he somehow drifted away, everybody married a sexpot who shortly turned into a nag, everybody wound up in middle or later life enduring failed dreams while replaying the pop tunes of his youth. That's the way of it, and have we got it straight now?

title: FELTON JOHNSTON, SENATE SECRETARY
description: WASHINGTON, April 21Felton McLellan Johnston, former secretary of the Senate, died at his home here last night after a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

title: Messersmith Happy as Dodger
description: LOS ANGELES, April 21Andy Messersmith, the golden angel in last winter's big swap between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the California Angels, is making a swift impression on the National League.

title: St. Columba, $23, Wins
description: LINCOLN, R. I., April 21 (AP) St. Columba, an 111 outsider, led all the way today in winning the feature race before a crowd of 9,075 at Lincoln Downs, St. Columba sprinted five furlongs in 0:58 45, defeating Bancinto by 1 lengths. Ahira was third. St. Columba paid $23, $8.20 and $4, for $2 across the board.

title: Catherine Caro a Bride
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., April 21The marriage of Miss Catherine M. Caro, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Caro, to Calvin Sumner Bruce, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Jackson Martin Bruce of Milwaukee, took place here today at the home of the bride's parents. John Friedman, village justice, performed the ceremony. The bride teaches at the Cabot School in Newton, Mass. Her husband, a Harvard graduate, is a student at the Harvard Medical School.

title: Struggling through the sixties
description: Joyce Maynard is 20 years old. She goes to Yale. Perhaps the single most significant fact of her life is that 5,000 hours of it  by her reckoninghave been spent in front of the TV. (That's only four hours a day for three years, and from the way she describes the TVwatching habits of herself and her contemporaries  languid omnivores  it was probably a lot more than that.) The big events of her childhood were the televised public crises and accomplishments: J.F.K.'s assassination, civilrights marches, riots, space shots, the Vietnam war. She watched boring sitcoms for hypnotic relief and because they made the eventlessness of my own life . . . seem comfortingly acceptable, and Dr. Kildare for the morbid thrills of death and disease.

title: Mormon Seminarians Play Bible Games
description: NORTH CALDWELL  It was 6 o'clock on a blustery, bonechilling spring morning.

title: Dave Anderson Clyde Cool
description: His name is Walt Frazier, but that's an alias. He's really Clyde CoolClyde because he dresses like Clyde Barrow and steals basketballs the way Clyde robbed banks; cool because he is. When the New York Knicks resume their National Basketball Association playoff with the Boston Celtics today for a national TV audience, watch him float around the Madison Square Garden court. His body moves with the suppleness of maple syrup. Except for his flashing eyes, the expression on his bearded face usually is an austere blank. Occasionally he will make fist with his right hand and thrust into the air but that's the extent of his exhilaration. Occasionally he will snatch at a towel or stare at a referee but that is the only betrayal of his annoyance. Every so often he will wipe the perspiration from his face with his entire right hand, as if adjusting mask on his emotions. Good or bad, Clyde Cool tries not to let on. And like the actor, who plays a role so long that it becomes part of his personality, Walt Frazier has evolved into Clyde Cool in real life, too.

title: Tomorrow's Securities Market
description: Are stock exchanges obsolete?

title: 3d Avenue El Closes Saturday; Fleet of 60 Buses to Replace It
description: After having served the Bronx for 80 years, the Third Avenue El will cease passenger operations at midnight next Saturday and will be replaced by a fleet of 60 airconditioned buses.

title: Janis Michele Welaj Is Betrothed
description: MANVILLE, N. J., April 21 Mr. and Mrs. Louis F. Welaj of Manville and Denver have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Janis Michele Welaj, to Robert Keith von Rueden. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. von Rueden of East Troy, Wis.

title: Bridge Has 478th Suicide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 21 (UPIA 30yearold divorcee became the 478th known suicide from Golden Gate Bridge yesterday.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Highlights of Message
description: Our energy demands have grown so rapidly that they now outstrip our available supplies, and at our present rate of growth, our energy needs a dozen years from now will be nearly double what they were in 1970. In the years immediately ahead, we must face up to the possibility of occasional energy shortages and some increase in energy prices.

title: Swedish House Calls: Doctors in Radio Cars
description: STOCKHOLM, April 21Any sick person can get a doctor to make a house call at all hours by dialing the police and fire emergency number. A nurse screens the calls and dispatches one of the four physicians who cruise the city in chauffeurdriven cars.

title: Woman, 22, Shot During Robbery, Dies
description: A young woman visitor from South Carolina who had been shot and robbed by a mugger Friday on the Upper East Side died yesterday evening at Metropolitan Hospital while undergoing surgery for the second time.

title: Youth in Nepal: Sharing a Hill With the Monks and the Monkeys
description: THE hill of Swayambhunath rises about 300 feet near the western rim of the valley of Katmandu in Nepal. It overlooks the city of Katmandu with its tiered pagodas, decaying palaces and colorful medieval bazaars. The hill's base is encircled by rice fields, saladgreen, salted with egrets. From the top of the hill can be seen two giant Himalayan snowpeaks; Everest is a huiltdred miles uprange on the border with Tibet.

title: Linda's Chief, 15 Choice, Takes $100,000 California Derby With Easy Ern 2d
description: ALBANY, Calif., April 21 (AP)  Heavily favored Linda's Chief built up a 10length lead on the backstretch today and won the $100,000 added California Derby by threequarters of a length over Easy Ern at Golden Gate Fields.

title: CAMBODIANS MAN UNEVEN DEFENSES
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 21 (Reuters)Government forces manned an uneven defensive line just beyond Phnom Penh's outer suburbs today as political bargaining continued over the future of President Lon Nol's regime.

title: A truly native treat
description: In a golden runon passage praising American women, H. L. Mencken declared that they were fecund as the shad. This is a compliment minted by a true son of the Atlantic Coast in a time before zero population growth had turned ovulation into a guilty act. Female shad, however, sunk in their original low state of consciousness, still swim up local rivers in the spring to produce the teeming pockets of roe for which they are justly prized.

title: A. K. Sydnor Jr. to Wed Katharine Baker
description: FAR HILLS, N.J., April 21 Mr. and Mrs. Clifford M. Baker Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Katharine Myers Baker, to A. Kendall Sydnor Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Sydnor of Lynchburg, Va., where his father is president of the Virginia Dunbrik Company, Inc. manufacturers of concrete products and building supplies.

title: Faculty Members Of C. W. Post Give A Tasteful Concert
description: One would expect a tasteful, intelligent and intellectually stimulating program at an academic concert, and that is exactly what was offered in Tully Hall on Thursday night by, members of the C. W. Post College music faculty.

title: Nancy Louise Jacobs Is Betrothed
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., April 21  Associate Justice Nathan L. Jacobs of the Supreme Court of New Jersey, and Mrs. Jacobs have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Louise Jacobs, to Stanley Merrill Grossman of New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor Grossman of Forest Hills, Queens, New York.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Municipal Raises to Cost $3.5Million

title: Indochina CeaseFire Violations As Signal
description: WASHINGTONThe United States, which has been accusing the North Vietnamese with growing asperity of violating the Paris ceasefire agreement, did some violating of its own last weekas a signal to Hanoi.

title: CUBAN EXILES RELATE WASHINGTON TRIPS
description: MIAMI, April 21 (AP)Two Cuban exiles said today that they accompanied four of the Watergate conspirators to Washington two times last May on what they were told was a Central Intelligence Agency mission to disrupt antiwar demonstrations.

title: Parker Gets Victory as Mets Defeat Expos 50
description: Entering yesterday's game against Montreal, Harry Parker had only two concernsfinding an apartment and hoping the Mets would score some runs. When he left the game, he still hadn't located an apartment, but he found the Mets, indeed, could score runs.

title: Trees Drawing Thousands
description: BELLEVILLE  Thousands of residents of New Jersey and adjoining states are traveling to Branch Brook Park to view the singleblossom Oriental cherry trees that burst into bloom two weeks before the Cherry Blossom Festival parade scheduled for next Sunday.

title: ARAFAT ASSUMES FURTHER DUTIES
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 21Yasir Arafat has taken personal charge of the commando movement's political and governmental relations in the wake of the assassination of three guerrilla leaders in Beirut.

title: Bridge
description: Just as the Blackwood convention is probably the most misused device in bidding, the highlow signal is no doubt the most misused strategy in defensive play.

title: Rosemary A. Kent, Reporter, And Henry Meltzer to Marry
description: HOUSTON, April 21Mr. and Mrs. Lonnie Fox Kent of Houston and Baytown announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rosemary Armmia Kent, to Henry Lewis Meltzer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Meltzer of Great Neck, L. I., and Santiago, Chile, at an engagement party yesterday at the Goose Creek Country Club.

title: Rabat Due for $9Million
description: RABAT, Morocco, April 21 (UPI)The United States is to lend Morocco $9.3million, most of it to pay for the importation of 92,000 tons of corn, a Government spokesman said this week.

title: Wood, Field and Stream.
description: In his studio and pictureframing shop at 49 East 19th Street in Manhattan, William Cushner is creating what he hopes will be a permanent display of the fly tier's art.

title: Home Improvement
description: ACCORDING to the United States Bureau of Product Safety over 200,000 accidents  some resulting in fatal injuries occur every year because ordinary window glass is used in hazardous locations such as storm doors, shower doors, ground level basement windows, garage doors and other areas where people can fall into or get cut by shattered glass.

title: British Breeders Laud U.S. Dog Show Format
description: When Ch. Purston Pinmoney Pedlar, a West Highland white terrier was named best in show at the big International fixture in Chicago, it brought cheers on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Lefty Weinert, 72, Pitcher, Coached Villanova Baseball
description: ROCKLEDGE, Fla., April 21 (AP)  Philip W. (Lefty) Weinert, a former major and minor league pitcher who became baseball coach at Vinnanova University, died here Tuesday from injuries suffered in an automobile accident. He was 72 years old.

title: Swiss Plan Vietnam Aid
description: GENEVA, April 21  The Swiss Government has announced that it has budgeted $4.5million for relief and rehabilitation aid to North Vietnam and South Vietnam over the next two years.

title: A Guide to Better County Government
description: TRENTON  The varied governing structures of New Jersey's 21 counties, moribund in many instances and ineffectual in others, now have a set of instructions for revising and reasserting their roles in meeting the needs of their residents.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: Even as the smallest of the major service branches, the Marine Corps will need 50,000 new enlisted Volunteers this yearmany of whom must have aptitudes to learn such skills as computer operations, electronics and aircraft maintenance. And 2,000 college men will enter Marine officer programs, a third of them to become Marine aviators and flight officers.

title: Temple U. Names Aide
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 21 (AP)Dr. Gerhard Spiegler, acting president of Haverford College, was named vice president of academic affairs for Temple University yesterday.

title: Mrs. Carlyss Has Child
description: WHITE PLAINS, April 21 A daughter was born April 6 to Mr. and Mrs. Earl Carlyss at the White Plains Hospital. Mrs. Carlyss is a pianist known as Ann Schien, whose husband is the second violinist of the Juilliard String Quartet. The child has been named Pauline Evelyn.

title: Pentagon Papers Ellsberg Gives His Reasons
description: Daniel Ellsberg, on the 71st day of his trial, last Monday got to tell the jury why he had disclosed the Pentagon papers. The reason, he said, was to give Congress the confidence to act to end the Vietnam war.

title: Tower for the Mormon Church Is Being Erected at Lincoln Sq.
description: Construction has begun on $15million, 36story tower at Lincoln Square that will house facilities for the Mormon Church.

title: COLONELS TIE SERIES WITH COUGARS AT 33
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 21 (AP)With Rick Mount scoring 25 points, the Kentucky Colonels defeated the Carolina Cougars, 119100, tonight to send their American Basketball Association playoff series into a decisive seventh game.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: CON : By Donald S. MacDonald, member of the management and brokerage firm of Douglas GibbonsHollyday & Ives, and former president, Real Estate Board of New York.

title: Museum Offering Reward in Theft
description: The Brooklyn Museum has offered a $5,000 reward for information leading to the recovery of eight 17thand 18thcentury English silver candlesticks stolen from the museum between July, 1972, and last April 2.

title: ARIZONA LOSING CONSUMER CHIEF
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., April 21Arizona's consumer protection chief has been forced to re sign by the state's Attorney General, who accused the consumer chief of overzealous litigation.

title: Capt. Hale Irwin, Lieut. Suzan Cox Will Be Married
description: RAHWAY, N.J., April 21Mr. and Mrs. John William Cox have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lieut. Suzan Alyce Cox, U.S.M.C.R., to Capt. Thomas Hale H. Irwin, U.S.M.C., son of Dr. Henry Franklin Irwin Jr. of Lyndonville, Vt., and Mrs. Josephine Ham Irwin of Middlebury, Vt.

title: Palm Peter Takes Pace
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., April 21 (AP)Palm Peter won the Dilkesboro Pace by a nose at Freehold Raceway today, paying $4.60 for $2.

title: Homes for Visitors To Montclair Sought
description: MONTCLAIR  The Office of International Programs at Montclair State College is compiling a file of members of the college community and residents of nearby areas who would like to open their home to visitors from abroad.

title: Television
description: ON an unusually lively and provocative session of The Dick Cavett Show a few weeks ago, the subject for the evening was The Administration and the Media. Appearing for the Administration were Patrick Buchanan, special assistant to President Nixon, and Victor Gold, former press secretary for Vice President Agnew. On the media side were Benjamin Bradlee, managing editor of The Washington Post, Britt Hume, a former associate of political columnist Jack Anderson, and Edwin Newman, correspondent for NBC News.

title: Airbag in Police Car Gets Unexpected Test
description: WASHINGTON, April 21 (UPI)A United States Park Police cruiser equipped with an experimental airbag system gave it a field test today when the cruiser and a speeding car collided in Rock Creek Park.

title: Motorcycle Fatalities Up
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., April 21 (UPI)Auto fatalities declined slightly in California in recent years, but there was a sharp increase in fatal accidents involving bicycle and motorcycle riders. The Highway Patrol commissioner, Walter Pudinski, reported that there were 4,426 traffic victims in California last year, one fewer Clan in 1969. But the number of motorcycle riders killed increased from 394 to 596 during the fouryear period, and bicycle fatalities jumped from 66 to 129.

title: What Will Mr. Nixon Do Now?
description: WASHINGTON, April 21The problem for President Nixon now is that his Administration has been crippled at the Watergate, with almost four long years to go, and very little cushion of goodwill or affection to fall back on.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The ownership of the real estate management and brokerage firm of Brett, Wyckoff, Potter, Hamilton, Inc., has changed hands.

title: Panel Feels Press Can Beat Curbs
description: NEW HAVEN, April 21If Watergate proves nothing else, it proves what the press is all about, Peter Bridge, a former Newark News reporter who was jailed last fall for refusing to divulge his sources to a grand jury, said this week.

title: The Qualified Shield
description: WASHINGTONThe proposal for shield law to protect news reporters from forced disclosure of confidential sources by courts and grand juries is a tempting one for elected politicians. We all want to earn the gratitude of the men and women who report our activities.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: OUTLOOK ON RAILS CALLED BRIGHTER
description: WASHINGTON, April 21The time is fast approaching when rail costs will be less than those for shorthaul air and auto travel, according to an independent study sponsored by Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation.

title: The Tribes of Israel on Chagall's Windows
description: JEWELtoned, brilliant in color, six stamps reproducing half of Marc Chagall's 12 stained glass windows have been issued by Israel. The windows adorn the HadassahHebrew University Medical Center Synagogue at Ein Karem, Jerusalem.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: The Negotiator's Art
description: Despite the impact that collective bargaining has on our daily lives, the general publicand even the majority of businessmen  are only dimly aware of the negotiation process.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: ART

title: Celtics' Right Arm Ailing, So Knicks Have the Edge
description: Physical condition rather than strategic analysis has become the main question in the National Basketball Association playoff series between the New York Knicks and Boston Celtics, which resumes today at 2 P.M. at Madison Square Garden. (The game will be televised over Channel 7.)

title: VIETCONG TO ALLOW COPTER INSPECTION
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 21 (AP)A Vietcong official announced today that permission would be given to the international peace  keeping force to reexamine the wreckage of the helicopter that crashed on April 7, killing nine persons.

title: As the Trucks Roar On the Dollars Roll In
description: Trucks are among the most obvious of man's creations. Trucks are big, brawny, loud, menacing and polluting. Manufacturers love them, consumers couldn't consume without them, stock analysts swear by them and motorists swear at them.

title: Sutton Denies Blocking Mayoral Race by Gray
description: Percy E. Sutton, the Manhattan Borough President, denied last week charges by Assemblyman Jesse Gray that the Council of Black Elected Democrats, headed by Mr. Sutton, had blocked his aborted candidacy for Mayor.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: A Skirmish in the Drug War
description: Nothing has ever been done before that would so diminish the supply of drugs in New York, asserted Deputy Police Commissioner William P. McCarthy last week after a sweep by Federal, state and city agencies netted 65 reputedly major heroin traffickers and their underlings.

title: Man Slain in Playground
description: A 21yearold Brooklyn man was knifed to death yesterday in a playground next to Public School 258 in the BedfordStuyvesant section. The victim, Eugene Murphy of 1407 Fulton Street, was stabbed two times in the chest shortly before 6 P.M. The police are searching for his assailant, who fled from the playground, which is on Tompkins Avenue between Halsey and Macon Streets.

title: Laotians Report a Bridge Blown Up on Major Road
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 21 (Reuters)  Pathet Lao rebels have blown up a bridge and cut the road from Vientiane to the southern town of Paksane on the Mekong River, a military spokesman said today.

title: Chinoiserie
description: Perhaps the best traveled jetset envoy since the late John Foster Dulles, the leading pundit of the Harvard economics department (concurrently president of the American Economic Association), amidst a clutter of other urgent activities, fitted a trip to the Future into his September, 1972, schedule. The future, he reports, works tolerably well, at least in China and with the Chinese setting the ground rules.

title: Lanford Is One L Of a Playwright
description: ON opening night of The Hot Baltimore, its impetuous author got soused at the champagne and pizza party on the stage of the Circle  in  the  Square Theater, weaved his way across Greenwich Village, stumbled up the steps to his third floor pad, put the telephone in the icebox and lunged into bed.

title: Rockefeller Names an Aide To Prepare for 1974 Race
description: Eighteen months before the gubernatorial election, Governor Rockefeller signaled his candidacy for an unprecedented fifth term yesterday by appointing a director of precampaign activities.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: What's Opened Lately At the Movies?
description: STATE OF SIEGE, directed by CostaGavras from a screenplay by Franco Solinas and CostaGavras and starring Yves Montand, got 15 favorable reviews (Vincent Canby, Times; Kathleen Carroll, News; Archer Winsten, Post; Howard Kissel, Women's Wear; Rex Reed, News; Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Joseph Gelmis, Newsday; Bernard Drew, Gannett News Service; Leonard Harris, WCBSTV; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; Stanley Kauffmann, New Republic; PenelGilliatt, New Yorker; Judith Crist, New York; William Wolf, Cue; Robert Hatch, The Nation), 4 mixed (Andrew Sarris, Village Voice; Gene Shalit, NBC, John Simon, New Leader; Jay Cocks, Time) and 1 negative review (Paul D. Zimmerman, Newsweek). At the Beekman.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Smell in River Vale Not One of Success
description: RIVER VALE  Brook Avenue is a treelined, residential, deadend street in this surburban Bergen County communty. It lies south of an expansive golf course and north of a curve in the Pascack Brook.

title: Pacers Down Stars, 10798, And Take A. B. A. West Series
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 21 (AP) The defending American Basketball Association champions, the Indiana Pacers, led by George McGinnis with 23 points and Donnie Freeman with 21, won the Western Division playoff series, 42, with a 10798 victory over the Utah Stars today.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONLa Causa is in trouble. This nameThe Causeis used by Cesar Chavez and his United Farm Workers Union for their crusading campaign to organize the poor migratory farm workers of America.

title: Chess:
description: Although learning chess is not difficult, flawlessly solving the problems it poses is quite another matter, and collections of brilliant games create a false impression that can be corrected only by observing average games on an ordinary tournament day.

title: Fatal Blaze in England
description: BLACKBURN, England, April 21 (AP)Three children died today when fire swept through their home here. Sharon Knight, 23 months old, and her brother, Niel, 11 months, died in their bedroom. Their threeyearold brother, Christopher, was rescued by firemen but died on the way to a hospital. Their father, Gerrard Knight, 28, and his wife Dorothy, 29, tried in vain to rescue their children.

title: U.S BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: As Vance Packard observed in A Nation of Strangers, Americans are a nomadic lot, moving from time to time from one part of the country to another.

title: Joy Jackson Bride Of Alfred Bell 3d
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, April 21  In the Britton United Methodist Church here this afternoon, Miss Joy Ruth Jackson, daughter of James Denton Jackson and Mrs. Joseph David Lee, both of Oklahoma City, was married to Alfred Lee Loomis Bell 3d. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Bell Jr. of Tenafly, N. J.

title: Wars that had to be
description: To this version of the American Indian Warsa story which has been told many times before from the viewpoint of the United States Army  Brig. Gen. S. L. A. Marshall lends his usual salty style. Judging from occasional remarks he drops here and there in the text, his motive for writing another book on the subject was to refute what he terms a slanted interpretation of the struggle now in vogue in Hollywood and elsewhere. General Marshall's battle accounts of our 20thcentury wars are classics of military history. (He practically invented the technique of interviewing participants in smallunit actions.) Throughout this book, however, he grumbles about poor records and confused reports, and seems to resent the fact that there are no live survivors around to be interviewed.

title: Welfare Tough New Regulations
description: It had been a campaign cry, threat, promiseto clean up the welfare mess. And last week, the new Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Caspar W. Weinberger, announced in the Federal Register a set of new welfare regulations.

title: A French Pilgrimage To Honor d'Artagnan
description: AUCH, France, April 21 (Reuters)Several hundred Frenchmen, nostalgic for the swashbuckling exploits of King Louis XIII's musketeers, will make a pilgrimage this summer to the Dutch fortress where the legendary d'Artagnan fell in battle 300 years ago.

title: Save Wins at Arlington With 49YearOld Jockey
description: CHICAGO, April 21 (AP)Save caught the frontrunning Fussy Girl in the late stretch and went on to win the $27,100 Miss Chicago Stakes at Arlington Park today.

title: Forbes Not Idling Over Cyclist Ban
description: FAR HILLSTwo years ago, Malcolm S. Forbes, the millionaire publisher, was riding one of his nine motorcycles in Newark. To avoid traffic, he zipped onto the Garden State Parkway, only to zip right off again when a tell collector reminded him that the parkway banned motorcycles.

title: Dance
description: WASHINGTON THERE used to be a popular song which suggested that it ain't what you do but the way that you do it that contained the secret of success. At times it is also the place where you do it. Over the past two weekends I have watched the National Ballet of Washington at both the New York City Community College in Brooklyn and also at the Kennedy Center. There was quite a difference.

title: Problems of High Rises Straining Florida Resort
description: HALLANDALE, Fla., April 21 This resort community is a little checkerboard square of land4.8 square miles in all inserted in the Florida coast between Miami and Fort Lauderdale. Its recent history of high density development encapsulates all the vigor and vexation of south Florida's real estate boom.

title: Jacklin Takes Italian Open By a Shot With 71 for 284
description: ROME, April 21 (AP)Tony Jacklin of England, former British and United States Open champion, sank a fourfoot par putt on the final hole today and gained a onestroke victory over Valentin Barrios of Spain in the Italian open golf chainpionship.

title: BROWNSTEIN WANTS DATA COMPUTERIZED
description: State Supreme Court Justice Irwin Brownstein, a candidate for the Democratic nomination for chief judge of the State Court of Appeals, yesterday called for centralization and computerization of all court records.

title: Jill Weiss Fiancee Of Murray Flom
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., April 21Mr. and Mrs. Murray J. Weiss have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jill Abby Weiss, to Murray Gabriel Flom, son of Dr. and Mrs. Leonard Flom of Westport, Conn.

title: Miss Porter's School: Sheltered Life to Community Involvement
description: FARMINGTON, Conn.The girls were served by waitresses at all meals and were not supposed to wash their own hair (a woman came in once a week to do that). Another woman came in twice a month to teach etiquette (never cross the legs while seated). They were awakened by maids and could have breakfast in bed once a month (the first day of menstruation). And there was a good deal of stress on languages (especially French).

title: A New Gilded Age
description: On this 100th anniversary of the publication of their novel, The Gilded Age, Mark Twain and Charles Dudley Warner could find much familiar material in the America of today, Once again, White House aides, former Cabinet members and other Presidential appointees are parading in and out of grand jury rooms and Congressional hearings as major scandals erupt. A century ago it was Credit Mobilier, the whisky ring, railroad stock frauds and burn this letter! Today it is Watergate, the wheat windfall, the milk scandal, the fixing of antitrust suits and the shredding of documents.

title: NassauSuffolk Office Vacancies Are Detailed
description: Nassau County has a vacancy rate of 28 per cent in office buildings constructed since 1961, a private real estate consulting firm reported last week. The figure for Suffolk County is 60 per cent.

title: Criminal Courts Found Gaining; Millions Saved, Detentions Cut
description: By applying good basic management concepts to the judicial process, the city's Criminal Courts are saving more than $6.7million a year, according to a study made public yesterday.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: EQUITY FUNDING isn't Watergate. It does not implicate the White House, although there are other similarities. But the casual assertion some Wall Streeters that the Equity Funding affair has left them with egg on their faces is a shocking understatement. The matter is considerably more serious, and its ramifications are only beginning to be known.

title: RICHAR DDRUER OF PASSAIC PAPER
description: PASSAIC, N. J., April 22Richard Drukker, publisher of The HeraldNews and The Daily Advance of Dover, died Friday night on a visit to Tampa, Fla. He had been suffering from heart disease. He was 67 years old and lived at 66 Virginia Avenue in nearby Clifton.

title: 400 Evacuate Town in Michigan As Gas Leak Danger Continues
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Mich., April 22An odorless, potentially lethal and explosive gas continued today to seep through newly formed potholes in this deserted farming village, as state and local officials sought ways to curb the gas flow.

title: 100 at Willowbrook Are Shifted To New Quarters by the State
description: Governor Rockefeller announced yesterday that the State Department of Mental Hygiene had shifted 65 patients from the Willowbrook State School to the Sheridan unit of its Manhattan Developmental Services at 75 Morton Street.

title: Dance: Molina Company
description: The Jose Molina Baffles Espafioles, which appeared Saturday night at Carnegie Hall, is a flashy, mediumsized Spanish dance company. No one can accuse it of overrefinement, but then it would be unjust to charge it with any sort of refinement. Mr. Molina's approach is pure show business and, in this respect, a good time can be had by nearly all.

title: TWO CLASSES WON BY KUDITH'S PILOT
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., April 22, Kudith's Pilot, who spent, most of last summer recovering from an injured leg, captured the junior working hunter championship today at the concluding session of the threeday Boulder Brook horse show. The event annually signals the start of the spring equestrian season.

title: Centralized Care of Spinal Cord Injuries Urged
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., April 22The results of a federally financed pilot project begun here three years ago to set up a model for a centralized spinal cord injury treatment system have convinced officials that this new approach decreases the chances of serious permanent injury and effects large savings in rehabilitation expenses.

title: Acupuncture Used As an Anesthesia in Four Abortions
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 (UN)  Doctors at the Washington Hospital Center have successfully used acupuncture as anesthesia in four recent abortions and plan to use the ancient Chinese technique in other kinds of surgery.The women volunteered undergo acupuncture. Hospital officials said they suffered fewer aftereffects from the abortions than would have been expected if a conventional anesthetic had been used.

title: Two Angry Factions Clash in White Hause
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Experts on the White House now discern, in the new outburst of recriminations on the Watergate affair, a clear pattern of factional strife that threatens the top command of the executive branch.

title: Newark Landmark Church Badly Damaged in Fire
description: NEWARK, April 22 (UPI)Arsonsquad detectives sifted through a threefoot pile of rubble in the interior of a landmark church in downtown Newark today, searching for the cause of a blaze that had partially destroyed the interior.

title: Aaron's Back Is Ailing
description: CINCINNATI, April 22 (AP) Hank Aaron of the Atlanta Braves missed today's game with the Cincinnati Reds because of an ailing back.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Temperatures, across New Jersey soared to within degrees of record high yesterday with weathermen in Newark reporting the mercury only 2 degrees off the record mark.

title: Some Meat Prices Drop, But Most Remain Constant
description: More meat cuts showed small Price decreases last week as Meat items resisted consumer and Passover meals, but most shoppers stocked up for Easter pressure and cost the same.

title: 6 Newsmen Hurt Slightly. By Shrapnel in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 22 (AP)  Six newsmen, including one American, were superficially wounded by mortar shrapnel today as they accompanied Cambodian soldiers in a roadsweeping operation 11 miles south of Phnom Penh. All were taken to a hospital in the capital and released after being treated for wounds.

title: European Russia Wins Steel Complex
description: MOSCOW, April 22  A clash of regional interests between the European and Asian parts of the Soviet Union over the location of the nation's next big steelmaking complex appears to have been resolved in favor of European Russia after a long controversy.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EAST ORANGE, April 22Gale Fitzgerald is a patient young woman.

title: WINGO BELLE FIRST IN COAST HANDICAP
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., April 22 (AP)Wingo Belle, a 101 long shot, overtook the favorite, Convenience, in the final furlong today to win the $32,650 Sequoia Handicap by a head at Hollywood Park.

title: Passengers Leave the QE2 To Sightsee in Holy Land
description: TEL AVIV, April 22 (AP)Passengers on the British liner Queen Elizabeth 2 left the vessel today and went on excursion trips around the Holy Land.

title: Westie Takes Baltimore K.C. Prize
description: TIMONIUM, Md., April 22A stylish 5yearold West Highland White terrier, Ch. Pinmoney Puck, from Malibu, Calif., found the going to his liking at the Timonium Race Course today and romped off with the bestInshow award. He was picked from a field of 2,294 dogs In the Baltimore County Kennel Club show.

title: Paul Tascarella Weds Miss Mary Zawisza
description: HARRINGTON, PARK, N. J., April 22In Our Lady of Victories Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon Miss Mary Adela Zawisza, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leon Zawisza, was married to Paul Tascarella, son of Mr. and Mrs. Micherrio Tascarella of New York. The Rev. John Laskoski performed the ceremony.

title: Mets' Records
description: BATTING

title: Knicks Win in Two Overtimes
description: Without John Havlicek, the Boston Celtics made a fantastic effort before losing, 117110, in double overtime to the Knicks at Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CRUSADERS STOP WHALERS, 5 TO 2
description: CLEVELAND, April 22 (AP) Gary Jarrett scored three goals and Ron Buchanan two today in leading the Cleveland Crusaders to a 52 victory over the New England Whalers.

title: DEMOCRATS LACK VIRGINIA NOMINEE
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 The onceproud Democratic party of Virginia, which had regularly elected Governors since the days of Reconstruction until losing the office in 1969, will probably not even nominate a candidate for Governor in 1973.

title: DR. SIMON BEISLER, UROLOGIST, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Simon A. Beisler, former president of the medical board of Roosevelt Hospital and former chief of its urology department, died Friday at his home, 116 East 68th Street. His age was 73.

title: Knicks Win in Two Overtimes
description: Without John Havlicek, the Boston Celtics made a fantastic effort before losing, 117110, in double overtime to the Knicks at Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: GRAIN SURPLUSES ALMOST SOLD OUT
description: Ten weeks from now the Government will be out of the grain business for the first time in 25 years. The oncehuge surpluses of wheat, corn and other grains that cost the taxpayer billions of dollars to buy and store, or to give away, will be gone.

title: Havlicek Status Uncertain For Game on Wednesday
description: John Havlicek's availability for the fifth game of the Knicks. Celtics series in Boston Wednesday is uncertain. I had my shoulder Xrayed and there are no breaks, just torn muscles, the injured Celtics star said here yesterday. I have to be optimistic.

title: MANAGUANS PRAY FOR RAVAGED CITY
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, April 22Managuans gathered somberly in front of cracked and gutted churches today to pray for the resurrection of this dead city.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay paid a condolence call on Dr. William C. Marett of Columbia, S. C., who had flown here to identify the body of his 22yearold daughter, Jill, slain during an Easter visit to the city. Miss Marett, a friend of the basketball player Tom Riker, was fatally shot Friday by a man who followed her into Mr. Riker's apartment house less than a block from the Mayor's residence on the Upper East Side. The police said that before dying Saturday night she was able to describe her assailant as a black man in his early thirties and of medium build. They asked that information in the case be reported by calling 5959557.

title: Gift to Folger May Provide Clues About Shakespeare
description: WASHINGTON, April 22Just in time for the playwright's 409th birthday, the Folger Shakespeare Library has been given a homemade, handwritten personal diary that records the earliest known purchase of a work done by William Shakespeare.

title: Beame Relies on Experience to Win Race
description: City government is a $10billion corporation, says Controller Abraham D. Beame. Would you pick someone with no experience to manage it?

title: Katherine Adams Bride of Bob Smith
description: WASHINGTON, April 22St. John's Episcopal Church, Lafayette Square, was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Katherine Taylor Adams to Bob Lorin Smith. The Rev. Richard C. Martin performed the ceremony.

title: New Lebanese Premier Amin Hafez
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 21 Amin Hafez, who was named Premier of Lebanon this week, grew up in Palestine and enjoys the confidence of the guerrilla organizations, according to Palestinian sources here.

title: Leftist's Victory in Japan Is a Setback for Tanaka
description: TOKYO, April 22 (UPI)The conservative Government of Premier Kakuei Tanaka suffered a setback today when voter. n Nagoya, Japan's fourth largest city, elected a leftists mayot backed by the Socialist and Communist parties.

title: Pope Paul Expresses Concern on Indochina
description: ROME, April 22Pope Paul VI, in an Easter message, voiced concern today over the rough winds of an uncertain situation in Indochina that were jeopardizing hopes for an end to the long war there.

title: NIXON'S MINISTER TALKS ABOUT SIN
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., April 22President Nixon went to church this Easter Sunday and heard a sermon about sin and redemption, about the need to break off old friendships and make a clean, complete transformation.

title: Governor, in Court Plan, Asks to Appoint Judges
description: ALBANY, April 22Governor Rockefeller asked the Legislature today to restructure the state system by making it entirely statefinanced and providing that seats on the Court of Appeals and an expanded Supreme Court be appointive rather than elective. Court of Appeals and an expanded Supreme Court be appointive rather than elective.

title: Personal Finance
description: The meat boycott is a memory, but the high prices are still a fact. Many housewives are finding that they must change the way they allocate funds for such basic items as food, housing, savings, clothing and others.

title: 200 Americans End March in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 22Some 200 United States citizens celebrated an Easter sunrise service today at the Crusaders'9; Castle in the ancient port of Saida, 20 miles south of here; where they had spent the night after a twoday peace march along the coast from Beirut.

title: Ozaki Loses Golf Playoff
description: INZAI, Japan, April 22 (AP) Shigeru Uchida beat Masashi (Jumbo) Ozaki in a playoff today for the championship of the $50,000 Sobu Inernational open golf tournament. Both players had finished the regulation 72 holes with 279's.

title: Campus Activism Fades, Style of 1950's Prevails
description: Political activism is moribund at colleges and universities in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, and students have taken on the superficial appearance of their selfcentered, socially indifferent, AllAmerican campus counterparts of the nineteenfifties.

title: Lindsay Aides Found Advance Copy of Scott Panel Report Hard to Obtain and Hard to Like
description: The long open warfare between the Scott Commission and the Lindsay administration has developed a secret subplot of farce.

title: Jersey Airman Enjoys Easter at Home After 5 in Hanoi
description: ALLOWAY, N. J., April 22Maj. Joseph S. Abbott Jr., who spent the last five Easters in the Hanoi Hilton, decorated eggs with his wife and seven children this weekend and sat down with them today to a baked ham and a bunnycake with ears lined with pink coconut.

title: Suggestion of a Banana Republic
description: LONDONThere has not been a major scandal involving the American Presidency since the United States became a great power: not a scandal, that is, which could reasonably be taken to justify the nineteenthand early twentiethcentury European assumption that American politics were so inescapably corrupt and dirty as to preclude that country from ever playing a constructive and responsible role in world affairs. Now there is.

title: Rathbone to Get London Post
description: BOSTON, April 22 (AP) Perry Rathbone, former director of the Boston Museum of Fine Arts, will be named director of American operations for Christie, Manson and Woods, the Londonbased auction house, The Boston Globe reported yesterday. Mr. Rathbone, who is 62 years old, retired last July as director of the museum after 17 years of service.

title: EASTMAN KODAK LIFTS INCOME 38%
description: The Eastman Kodak Company realized a 38 per cent increase in net income in the 12 weeks ended March 25 on a sales gain of 19 per cent, both setting new records for the period, according to a report from Rochester headquarters.

title: A.P. TO INTRODUCE LASERPHOTO IN '74
description: The Associated Press announced yesterday that it would introduce next year a new system of facsimile photo transmission by wire, using laser beams.

title: Deteriorating Situation at Wounded Knee Is Described as Brother Against Brother, Sister Against Sister
description: PINE RIDGE, S.D., April 22 Assistant Attorney General J. Stanley Pottinger has compared the deteriorating situation at the occupied hamlet of Wounded Knee on the Oglala, Sioux reservation with that of Vietnam.

title: Cambodia at War, but Still at Ease
description: TAKHMAU, Cambodia, April 22An occasional mortar shell crashed through the simmering morning heat, but no one was hurt and no one seemed inclined to do much about the casual bombardment.

title: Energy Industry Profile: Giants Populate the World of Fuel
description: The production of energy is the world's second largest industry, exceeded only by agriculture in its essential importance to modern society.

title: JETS TOP AEROS, 20, IN W.H.A. PLAYOFF
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, April 22 (AP)Dunc Rousseau poked home a rebound at 15 minutes 29 seconds of the third period to break a scoreless tie and the Winnipeg Jets went on to 20 victory over the Houston Aeros tonight.

title: A New, Black Art Develops in Senegal
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Although better known for its poets President Leopold Seder Senghor being the most famous Senegal is nonetheless making a name for itself in much of black Africa as a training ground for some of the continent's most original young painters.

title: Mexico and China Sign Treaty On Trade and Seaport Facilities
description: PEKING, April 22 (UPI)President Luis Echeverria Alvarez signed a commercial trade treaty with China today that grants each nation facilities in the seaports of the other.

title: Seoul Weighs Turn To U.S. for Imports
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 22Under the pressures of protectionist moves in the United States and increased costs for imports from Japan, South Korea is considering shifting some of her purchases from Japan to America.

title: LIDDY SAID TO DEFY WHITE HOUSE PLEA TO TALK TO JURORS
description: WASHINGTON, April 22G. Gordon Liddy, the leader of the Watergate breakin, has turned down a White House request that he change his mind and begin telling all he knows about the bugging of the Democrats to the Federal grand jury, sources close to the case said today.

title: SHOP TALK Backgammon Boards To Suit Every Purpose
description: That executive hailing a taxi, attach case in hand, may not be taking work home. He may be on his way to Ms club to play backgammon. The ancient game of chance and skill is enjoying considerable popularity these days and the most Soughtafter boards are the practical folding ones resembling attach cases. They are so easy to carry and store.

title: EASTER SUNDAY IN NEW YORK
description: Easter Sunday dawned clear and sultry. By 10 A.M., the temperature reached 70 degrees. It was a day for churchgoing, for strolling along Fifth Avenue, for lounging in Central Park. People did all this, but hardly any of them wore a traditional bonnet with all those frills upon it. The one thing miss ing from the Easter parade was the fashions.

title: U.N.'s Moves Are Viewed in Egypt as a Major Diplomatic Victory
description: CAIRO, April. 22The United Nations Security Council's twin acts of condemning the Israeli military raid on Beirut and of deciding to undertake basic review of the entire Middle East question are regarded here as a major diplomatic success for Egypt.

title: 2 Robbers Get Money, Or What Passes for It
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., April 22 (UPI)The only profitable thing the two robbers can do with the loot they stole from a Uniondale movie theater manager this morning is sell it to a paperrecycling center.

title: French Washerwoman Becomes Star
description: BARNEVILLE, France, April 11Until two months ago the only people in France who knew La Mere Denis were her neighbors and the generations of summer and weekend visitors whose laundry she washed down at the River Tot.

title: HUSSIES CAPTURE DAVIS CUP SERIES
description: TOKYO, April 22 (UPI)Australia, led by John Newcombe, gained the Davis Cup Eastern zone final today with a victory over Japan in the doubles that lifted the Aussies to an unbeatable 30 lead in the threeoffivematch series.

title: A Threat to Free Hess Via Hijacking Reported
description: BONN, April 22 (AP)Officials last night reported a threat to hijack an airliner to Moscow as a means of freeing Hitler's deputy, Rudolf Hess, from Spandau Prison in West Berlin.

title: Lakers Rout Warriors For 3to0 Lead, 12670
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 22 (UPI)  Jim McMillian scored 28 points and Wilt Chamberlain grabbed 25 rebounds as the Los Angeles Lakers defeated the Golden State Warriors, 12670, and took a 30 lead in their fourofseven game National Basketball Association semifinal playoff series last night.

title: Green's 277 Wins Tallahassee Open; Simons RunnerUp
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 22 (AP)Hubert Green overcame some shaky finalround play today to shoot a oneunderpar 71 and take a onestroke victory in the $75,000 Tallahassee open golf tournament.

title: Sect Prays for the Judge Who Curbed Use of Poison
description: NEWPORT, Tenn., April 22 (UPI)Members of a fundsmentalist mountain sect prayed last night for the judge who ordered the congregation not to handle deadly snakes or distribute poison at their religion: services after two members died from drinking strychnine.

title: COL. GILBERT STUART, FOUGHT FOR CHINESE
description: WASHINGTON, April 22 Col. Gilbert Stuart, a former Officer in the Chinese Nationalist army and a mining consultant, died yesterday in the Georgetown University Hospital after a long illness. He was 61 years old.

title: YOUNG ARMY MEN RISING IN SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, April 22The Soviet Union has made major changes in its military high command in the last 18 months, motivated by a need for rejuvenation, according to military and civilian analysts.

title: Met Club Rugby
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: MISSING GIRL, 7, FOUND MURDERED
description: HILLSDALE, N.J., April 22 The body of 7yearold Joan D'Alessandro, whose disappearance from her home here on Thursday while delivering Girl Scout cookies had set off a wide search, was discovered today in a wooded area beside Route 210 in Harriman State Park, Rockland County, N.Y.

title: Shot Victory Is Achieved By Nicklaus
Soviet Military Continues Its Tough Line Toward West
description: MOSCOW, April 22While Soviet political leaders appear to be striving for a relaxation of tension with the West, Moscow's military establishment continues, to portray capitalist countries as motivated by aggressive designs.

title: The Horse Is Only Human, or Is He?
description: So Secretariat is only human after all, though the squeamish might insist he's only equine. Racing people and the racing public had begun to regard their newest folk hero as invincible, forgetting that in the very first start of his life he was vinced by three horses and in the seventh by three men (Francis P.
