description: NAPLES, Italy, April 25The gathering of tenors last night in Naples' opulent souvenir of Bourbon rule, the Teatro San Carlo, to honer Enrico Caruso in the centennial year of his birth is not likely to be equaled by any other opera house in the foreseeable future, even though some of the seven summoned failed to arrive.

title: Study Finds Crime Rates Far Higher Than Reports
description: WASHINGTON, April 26A pilot study of crime, sponsored by the Law Enforcement Assistance Administration, indicates that in some categories the number of crimes committed could run as high as five times the number officially reported by victims.

title: Tottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on April 26 were:

title: Capital Lawyer Emerging As Key Watergate Figure
description: WASHINGTON, April 26John J. Wilson, a 71yearold Washington lawyer with a cherubic face and a reputation for combativeness, has emerged as a central if enigmatic figure in the Watergate case.

title: CITY BAR CHIEF ASKS SPECIAL PROSECUTOR
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The president of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York called on President Nixon today to appoint a special prosecutor in the Watergate case.

title: Fed Pressed Policy of Monetary Restraint in Last 2 Weeks
description: The Federal Reserve System pressed its policy of monetary restraint during the last two weeks, data published yesterday by the central bank showed.

title: IRENE RYAN, 70, ACTRESS, IS DEAD
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., April 26 (UPI)Irene Ryan, whose 60year acting career reached climax when she became a television star In the Beverly Hillbillies series, died today at the age of 70.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: VIENNA, April 27 (UPI)American swimmers won all but one event at the opening of the Rumanian international swimming meet in Bucharest, the Austrian news agency Agerpross reported today. Tom Szuba won the 50meter freestyle in 25.7 seconds, beating the Rumanian champion, Marian Slavic. He then lost the 50meter butterfly to Ion Milcaus.

title: U.S. SUPPORTS PBW OVER INSTITUTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 The Department of Justice intervened on the side of they PBW Stock Exchange in its effort to have the third circuit Court of Appeals overturn a ruling of the Securities and Exchange Commission restricting institutional membership in national stock exchanges.

title: Red Smith
description: A lot of people think Henry Kissinger has it tough dealing with Le Duc Tho. There are fans who can't tell Norodom Sihanouk from Sisowath Sirik Matak without a scorecard, Use the word intrigue, and some people think you're talking about Golda Meir and Suleyman Franjieh, or maybe John Mitchell and John W. Dean. Nonsense. Compared with the Machiavellian machinations of the international fight mob, the games those other people play have the simple innocence of jacks.

title: Braziland Paraguay Sign Pact to Build Huge Power Plant
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 26Brazil and neighboring Paraguay signed a partnership agreement today to build what is expected to be the world's largest hydroelectric projects on the Parana River, despite the protests of downriver Argentina.

title: But Some Makers Say They Do Not Intend to Match Increases
description: Prices of color television sets appear to be moving upward, although several major manufacturers said they did not intend to match rises announced yesterday by the industry leader, the RCA Corporation.

title: Sears, Roebuck Plans New CarRental Service
description: CHICAGO, April 26 (AP)Sears, Roebuck & Co. announced today, it would introduce a nationwide car rental service May 1.

title: BRIBERY LAID TO 2 IN ROCKLAND G.O.P.
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., April 26A Rockland County Republican official and a Town Supervisor have been indicted on charges of soliciting and receiving $25,000 in bribes to advance the county's purchase of an office building.

title: WIDE STRIKE SNARLS JAPANESE RAILWAYS
description: TOKYO, Friday April 27 (AP) Three million railway employes and other workers began a spring labor offensive to. day with a 72hour walkout, plunging Japan into one of the worst transport snarls in its history.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Pavons' Peril
description: In recent years outdoor magazines have been praising the fighting qualities of the peacock bass, Cichla Ocellaris, a species reputed to be one of the best tasting and hardest fighting lighttackle fish in South America.

title: India Drops Murder Charge Again'st 2 C.B.S. Employes
description: NEW DELHI, April 26 (Reuters)The police today dropped, murder charges against a Columbia Broadcasting System camera team in connection with the immolation of a Hindu monk.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New Yorkers, who endured daylong rains many times during the winter, discovered yesterday that spring showers may also be prolonged. Steady rain, varying from fine sprinkles to heavy torrents, caused flooding on highways in several parts of the city, mostly along river fronts and other lowlying areas. It's hub cap stuff, said a Traffic Department spokesman, reporting that delays were experienced by motorists on scores of main thoroughfares in the morning and evening rush hours.

title: Remembering A Victim in Palestine
description: CHARLEVOIX, Mich.Kamal Nasser, public relations man, spokesman for the Palestinian Liberation Organic zation, assassinated in his Beirut apartment by Israeli commandos, was the top fedayeen accessible to the Western press.

title: Queens GetRich Schemer Pleads Guilty to Two Larceny Counts
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 26 Joseph Ferdinando, who allegedly ran a getrichquick scheme that involved $400million and almost 400 individuals, and that led to the indictment and resignation of District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell, of Queens, pleaded guilty today to two counts of thirddegree larceny.

title: DepartmentStore Sales Rise
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The Department of Commerce estimated today that department store sales last week were $994million, up 17 per cent from $847million a year ago. Total retail store sales were about $9.97billion, up 18 per cent from the yearearlier $8.45billion.

title: TV: Views of Israel, Prison and Housing Squeeze
description: Some television briefs: Wednesday evening, the National Broadcasting Company network carried a 90minute, lavishly produced curiosity called The Going Up of David Lev. The official synopsis: A boy from Tel Aviv (Brandon Cruz), trying to help his grieving, hospitalized mother (Claire Bloom) enlists the help of a taxi driver (Topol) as he seeks information about the death of his father, an American killed while aiding Israelis during the Six DayWar. cial synopsis: A boy from Tel Aviv (Brandon Cruz), trying to help his grieving, hospitalized mother (Claire Bloom) enlists the help of a taxi driver (Topol) as he seeks information about the death of his father, an American killed while aiding Is raelis during the Six DayWar.

title: Karen Kain Takes Role In Beauty
description: The role of Princess Aurora In The Sleeping Beauty is one of the most difficult in the classical ballet repertory. Wednesday night at the Metropolitan Opera House, the National Ballet of Canada presented the second of its four Auroras of the week, and if they are all as successful as the young Karen Kain, the Toronto company has an outstanding reserve of talent for the future.

title: Gallagher, Lefcort Advance
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., April 26Buddy Gallagher of Larchmont, N.Y., seeded first, defeated Joseph Arias of Queens, 62, 61, in today's opening round of the seventh annual Concord junior invitation tennis tournament. The secondseeded player, Larry Lefcort of Woodmere, L.I., eliminated Tony Yen of Brooklyn, 60, 62.

title: The Philippines in Midtown
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: Slain Art Dealer's Friend Cleared of Link to Killing
description: The young woman who once shared the apartment of Robert Dain, the East Side art dealer who was found stabbed to death Tuesday, had absolutely nothing to do with the homicide, a police sergeant investigating the case said yesterday. The sergeant, Sam Drexler, of the Fourth District homicide squad, said the woman, who was not identified, had appeared voluntarily.

title: Bengali Storm Toll at 1,000
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, April 26 (AP)Unofficial estimates today put the death toll in two weeks of storms in Bangladesh at 1,000 people, with 4,000 injured. Official Government figures so far give 240 dead.

title: 2 British Concerns Plan Big Private Bank Merger
description: LONDON, April 26  Slater Walker Securities, an aggressive investment firm, and Hill Samuel & Co., a merchant bank, today announced plans to merge, forming the biggest private banking complex in Britain.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Minnesota Twins, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 7:30 P.M.

title: Sweden Says U.S. Bombs Hit Cambodia's Civilian Population
description: STOCKHOLM, April 26The Swedish Government, long a critic of American involvement in Indochina, condemned the United States today for its bombing of Cambodia, charging that the raids indiscriminately hit the civilian population.

title: Trading in Options Opens On New Chicago Board
description: CHICAGO, April 26  A new form of trading in securities was initiated here today on the new Chicago Board Options Exchange with both a slap and a pat from the Federal Government.

title: Endorsement
description: There are some endorsements a man would rather not have. To mere outsiders, Vice President Agnew's words of praise for President Nixon in the Watergate case look very much as if they might fall in that dubious category.

title: Group of 26 Banks Agrees To Lend Peru $40Million
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 26 (UPI)  The Crocker National Bank said today it was leading a group of 26 banks that has agreed to lend $40million to the Republic of Peru.

title: People and Business
description: C. Lee Walton Jr., who became managing director of McKinsey & Co., Inc. four and a half years ago, is planning to step down in June. The 42 other directors of the big international consulting concern, whose annual volume is estimated at around $45million, were told earlier this month that Mr. Walton intends to give up the top post.

title: Istomin: Tasteful, Robust Music
description: EUGENE ISTOMIN, piano. At Carnegie Hall.

title: Watergate Reverberations
description: To the Editor: I am intrigued by Ronald Ziegler's use of the word operative in his explanation of the President's latest remarks on the Watergate scandal. According to the press secretary, the President's statement last week now constitutes operative fact regarding Watergate, notwithstanding a series of previous contradictory public statements by our Chief Executive.

title: Biaggi Case Is a Tangle of Politics and Law
description: It was standing room only in Judge Edmund L. Palmieri's courtroom yesterday, and if any of the goingson there had ever happened before, no one could recall it.

title: Baby Makes His Debut In Police Muster Room
description: A boy was born last night in the muster room of the 81st Precinct station on Ralph Avenue in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Says Nixon Will Visit Japan at Convenient Time
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) President Nixon will visit Japan when a convenient time for the trip can be worked out, a State Department spokesman said today.

title: Meyer Schapiro Receives Art Award
description: For his outstanding achievement in art history, Meyer Schapiro, the art scholar and critic, was given a bronze replica of an Alexander Calder stabile and a $3,000 check by the Art Dealers Association of America at a dinner on Wednesday evening at the Museum of Modern Art. Sherman Lee, the director of the Cleveland Museum of art, who was one of the speakers, called Mr. Schapiro a brilliant, humorous and mercurial man whose breath of mind is extraordinary.

title: Unruffled Judge in the Biaggi Case
description: The courtroom was hushed. For the newsmen and spectators, it was a hearing heavy with tension. For Mario Biaggi, mayoral candidate, it was a proceeding fraught with consequences crucial to his aspirations. But for Federal Judge Edmund L. Palmieri, the 65yearold jurist who listened to arguments and tentatively decided yesterday to disclose appropriate portions of Mr. Biaggi's controversial grandjury testimony, it was just another case.

title: Dr. Stanton, ExOfficial Of C.B.S., Is Honored
description: Dr. Frank Stanton, who retired as vice chairman of the Columbia Broadcasting System last month after 38 years with the company, received a tribute from Governor Rockefeller and the annual award of the Four Freedoms Foundation last night at a dinner at the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: 2 Police Indicted On Perjury Charge In a Bribery Case
description: A routine trafficaccident case in which an outoftown salesman struck several parked cars while allegedly intoxicated resulted yesterday in the indictment of two police officers in the Bronx on perjury charges.

title: The Energy Crisis and How One Urban Family Lives
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26 Without really noticing, Bob Alotta has come a long way from the brash days when he was a chubby kid growing up in South Philatelphia 20odd years ago.

title: Incredible String Band Serves Up Its Rock Softly
description: The Incredible String Band, which filled Philharmonic Hall with its admirers Easter night, is neither a band, insofar as that implies a big band, nor a string band, if one is thinking of swooning, massed violins. It is not even very incredible, unless one is a devotee. But it does provide for a good deal of unobjectionable, lowlevel charm, and its fans do love it in a way that seems appealing enough in this age of glitter and gore.

title: Earthquake in Hawaii Causes Minor Damage
description: HONOLULU, April 26The strongest earthquake to strike the island of Hawaii in 23 years damaged several buildings today and injured at least four persons.

title: Ham or Chicken Pilaf Mixed With Nuts
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Roundup: A Slam Beats
description: The Kansas City Royals, who had gone on a runscoring binge during the first two weeks of the season, fell victim to a big bat themselves last night, losing to the Milwaukee Brewers, 73, on a ninthinning grand slam by Dave May.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Van Doren's Friends Bestow Laurel
description: Mark Van Doren, the poet and longtime teacher at Columbia University who died last December, was warmly recalled by friends and former students last night at the 68d annual dinner of the Poetry Society of America in the Plaza Hotel.

title: Notes on People
description: James B. Irwin, the retired astronaut, left the Fitzsimmons Army Medical Center in Aurora, Colo., after three weeks of treatment for the heart attack he suffered while playing handball on April 4. The 43  year  old former Air Force colonel, who walked on the moon as a member of the Apollo 15 mission two years ago, is expected to convalesce at his home in Colorado Springs. A hospital spokesman said Mr. Irwin's ultimate recovery will be complete, but it will be a considerable time before he can return to full action. Since leaving the space program, Mr. Irwin has been employed by the Johns Manville Corporation and has started an evangelistic organization, High Flight Inc.

title: Energy Hearing Is Set
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI) Senator Henry M. Jackson, chairman of the Senate Interior Committee, said today that he would open a hearing May 1 on President Nixon's energy message to Congress. The message announced the end of crude oil import quotas and the start of a license fee system on imports. There is serious doubt that the program outlined in the President's energy message is adequate to deal with our growing energy problems, Senator Jacksaid in statement.

title: U.S. CUSTOMS UNIT IN CANADA TO END
description: OTTAWA, April 26Canada said today that she would end the 20yearold practice of letting United States Customs agents clear United Statesbound passengers at four large Canadian airports.

title: NIXON PLEA STIRS SMALL MAIL FLOW
description: If you are willing to pay the higher taxes or prices that will result if we increase the Federal spending over my bud?? get, as some in Congress have proposed, you should ash you. Senators and your Congress men to override my vetoes....

title: Screen: 'To Be Free'
description: "To Be Free" is a very bad, very self-indulgent first feature written, directed and produced by Ned Bosnick, a native of Pittsburgh who is reported to have studied film at the University of California at Los Angeles under the great Jean Renoir.It's a humorless psychological fantasy about a girl named Carole (Barbara Douglas), a sort of pretty Barbra Streisand type, who goes to see a psychiatrist because she can't enjoy sex with her fianc, Bruce, although Bruce has, in Carole's words, "unlocked my love balloon." Thinking that Carole may be afraid of pregnancy, the doctor suggests birth control. Says Carole primly, but with all of the conviction of Bea Lillie impersonating Goldilocks: "My religion doesn't permit me."The plot, such as it is, is not too different from that of "Deep Throat," but what didn't work very well in a porno comedy is even less effective as the basis of an apparently seriously intended drama. The movie obviously used up a good deal of money and while I was watching it, I was reminded of the difficulty that Mr. Renoir has had in recent years in trying to raise financing to make films. Such an awareness tends to transform boredom with Mr. Bosnick's lack of talent into militant impatience.

title: Excerpts From Court Statements on Release of Biaggi Testimony
description: Following are excerpts from statements made in Federal Court here by Whitney North Seymour Jr., the United States Attorney, and Arthur H. Christy, attorney for Mario Biaggi, and from the remarks of Judge Edmund L. Palmieri:

title: Bgride: L.I. Regionals Open Today In an Academic Atmosphere
description: If surroundings have an impact upon behavior, then gambling bids should be less in evidence at the Long Island Regional Championships this year than they were last year. The Nassau  Suffolk Bridge Association has abandoned the raffish atmosphere of Roosevelt Raceway in favor of the academic calm of Hofstra University, at Hempstead.

title: The Venezuelans Like the Politics and the Frills, So the Presidential Campaign Begins Far in Advance
description: BARINAS, Venezuela, April 17There was a joyous rush of cattlemen, farm workers and young people, and then it happened: The presidential candidate, his committee and the grandstand crashed to the ground.

title: 17th State Bars Rights Plan
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., April 26 (AP)  South Carolina today became the 17th state to refuse ratification of the proposed Equal Rights Amendment to the Constitution. A ratification proposal was tabled, ending at least for this year, any chance for adoption by the state. The amendment has been ratified by 30 of the required 38 states and is pending in the three other states.

title: Abraham Kavadlo, Educator And Reading Specialist, Dies
description: Abraham Kavadlo, a publicschool teacher who founded the Great Society Press, Inc., to provide remedial reading pamphlets for the culturally deprived, died Monday of a heart ailment at St. John's Hospital in Elmhurst, Queens. He was 59 years old and lived at 14001 69th Avenue in Kew Gardens, Queens.

title: FUTURE PROBLEM HINTED FOR ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI)A new study shows that volunteer soldiers are more likely to go AWOL than draftees and predicts that this may mean trouble for the allvolunteer Army.

title: More Oil Concerns Show Profit Gains For 3Month Period
description: The oil industry yesterdays continued on its way to one, of the best quarters in its history as four more major companies reported sharply higher earnings for the first three months of 1973.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: EAT FUTURES UP ON HORMONE BAN
description: The ban on the cattlefattening hormone, DES, announced by the Food and Drug Administration on Wednesday, sent prices of live cattle futures up sharply yesterday on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. The ban is expected to lengthen the time it takes to fatten cattle and probably will result in increased beef prices for the consumer.

title: Broiling New Delhi Sleeps Outdoors
description: NEW DELHI, April 26The temperature hovered around 108 today.

title: 900 Go to Funeral Mass For Joan D'Alessandro
description: HILLSDALE, N. J., April 26 About 900 relatives, friends and school mates attended a funeral mass today for 7yearold Joan D'Alessandro, who was slain last week while delivering Girl Scout cookies near her home here.

title: U.S. Flier Dies in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI)The Defense Department today identified the first American killed in Cambodia since the Vietnam ceasefire. He was First Lieut. Joseph Gambino Jr. of the Air Force, son of Joseph Gambino Sr. of the Bronx. Lieutenant Gambino was the pilot of an OV10 propellerdriven lookout plane shot down April 7.

title: Canada and China May Trade Doctors
description: PEKING, April 26A group of Canadian physicians were confirmed in their determination to press for a program of doctor exchanges with China after taking a firsthand look this week at the work the Chinese are doing in the reattachment of severed limbs, the treatment of severe burns and the refinement of the ancient practice of herbal medicine.

title: Jordan Tightening Security to Block Terrorists
description: AMMAN, Jordan, April 25Jordan has imposed severe security controls on travelers to keep out Arab terrorists, and the United States Embassy here is being fortified against rocket attack or assault.

title: New Orders for Durables Helped Push Composite Index Up in March
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP)The nation's composite index of leading business indicators advanced 1.4 per cent in March, although some indicators were down slightly, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Federal Study Indicates Crime Far Exceeds Reported Levels
description: WASHINGTON, April 26A pilot study of crime, sponsored by the Law Enforcement Assist. ance Administration, indicates that in some categories the number of crimes committed could run as high as five times the number officially reported by victims.

title: Knicks to Battle Celtics; Both to Battle Pressure
description: Madison Square Garden will pulsate with playoff pressure tonight as the Knicks and the Boston Celticsneither of whom can afford to losemeet in the sixth game of the fourofseven series for the championshp of the Natonal Basketball Association's Eastern Conference.

title: Aybar in a Latin Recital
description: Francisco Aybar obviously has the name and the heritage to suit the Latin program he chose for his recital at Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night: excerpts from Albeniz's Iberia, Granados's Goyescas and Ginastera's Sonata (1952). But more, he proved to have the sensitivity, rhythmic control and sheer dexterity necessary to make a success of works that few pianists play with either enough technical command or stylistic authority.

title: Integration in Pasadena
description: Federal attorneys went to the Supreme Court this week to help the state of Virginia fight the consolidation of the heavily black Richmond school district with those of two mostly white suburban counties. Meanwhile, in another major Sonthern city, blacks and whites have agreed upon a minimumbusing, minimumdesegregation plan for Atlanta's largely black schools.

title: New Brunswick Police Get Horses
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, April 26  Rutgers University's campus patrol and the New Brunswick Police Department started mounted police protection for the college and the city today with three horses on loan from the New York City Police Department.

title: Parents Foiled in Attempt To Take Children in Sect
description: A Connecticut couple tried yesterday to force their daughters to leave a religious group here and return home, but were foiled by neighbors who called the police.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: General agreement was reported by legislative sources in Albany on an offtrack betting compromise that would permit New York City to retain control of its present operations with no crimping of its daily double and other basic betting activities.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, APRIL 27, 1973

title: Intercity Truck Tonnage Reported for Latest Week
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The American Trucking Assoc. ations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 2.9 per cent above the corresponding week of last year Truck tonnage last week was 4.4 per cent below the immediately preceeding week.

title: Environmental Bills Defeated in Jersey
description: TRENTON, April 26 Democratic defections and halfhearted Republican support in the State Senate combined this evening to defeat a series of bills aimed at protecting New Jersey's coastline and the ecology of its offshore waters.

title: Penn Central to Cut Crews by June 9
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26The Penn Central Railroad today set a new deadline of June 9 to put into effect a reduction in train crew sizes that it said would ultimately save the bankrupt line $97.5million a year.

title: Council Body to V ote Today, Third Time, On Homosexual Bill
description: The City Council's General Welfare Committee will vote today on a twicedefeated bill to bar discrimination against homosexuals in housing, employment and public accommodations. The outcome this time is expected to be close.

title: Todd Suspends Dividend
description: Directors of the Todd Shipyards Corporation suspended the 20cent quarterly dividend payment yesterday after a 57year record of successive quarterly disbursements. John T. Gilbride, president, said the demand for huge supertankers to meet energy needs requires a costly expansion program and we are proceeding with the development of definitive financing arrangements.

title: CLEMENTE WITH .317 LED ACTIVE HITTERS
description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP)The National League Green Book of records shows that Roberto Clemente led baseball's active hitters at the end of last season with a .317 batting average for 2,433 games.

title: Big Board Is Said to Plan A Proposal to Raise Fees
description: The New York Stock Exchange, whose member firms are awash in red ink, is preparing a plan to raise commission rates, Wall Street sources disclosed yesterday.

title: Stocks Rise on Late Rally Sparked by Buying Surge
description: Speculation that the Nixon Administration was planning new initiatives on the economic front sparked a sudden and dramatic rally in the stock market yesterday on accelerating turnover

title: Two Pirate Shortstops Won League Batting Titles
description: PITTSBURGH (UPI)  Dick Groat, who won the National League batting title in 1960 with a .325 average, was the last shortstop to do the trick.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 950,000 common shares of Eli Lilly at $81.25 per share was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Morgan Stanley. All of the shares are being sold by Merchants National Bank & Trust Co., Indianapolis, as executor of the estate of the late Ruth Allison Lilly and proceeds will be used for Federal and state taxes. The company's stock was down  at 81 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: BIES CARDS A 65, LEADS BY 2 SHOTS
description: DALLAS, April 26Using a sawedoff putter, Don Bies of Seattle fashioned a twoshot lead with a fiveunderpar 65 today in the opening round of the $150,000 Byron Nelson Classic. Lee Trevino, the favorite, had a 79.

title: Mets Win From Astros, 21
description: HOUSTON, April 26George Theodore, a gangly 6foot4inch, 190pound rookie outfielder, helped the Mets score an earned run and an unearned run off Houston's lefthander, Jerry Reuss, in the sixth inning tonight and take the rubber game of their threegame series, 21.

title: Off Off Broadway Shows
description: It's advisable to telephone theaters for schedules and prices before going to the show. Most, if not all theaters, accept Theater Development Fund vouchers.

title: Attorney Says Magruder Has Quit Commerce Post
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 Jeb Stuart Magruder, the former White House and Nixon campaign official who reportedly accused two high Administration figures of complicity in the Watergate bugging case, has resigned as an Assistant Secretary of Commerce, his lawyer said tonight.

title: Oil Deal With China Set
description: TOKYO, April 26 (AP)The International Oil Company of Japan confirmed today a report it had signed a contract to purchase one million long tops of crude oil from China for shipment by the end of this year.

title: The Urban Losers
description: It is no accident that the Nixon Administration's bill to shut down urban renewal, Model Cities and other urban programs and substitute a share of Federal revenue is entitled the Better Communities Act. The objective is to shift Federal money and public attention away from the cities where the Administration's political support is weakest and transfer them to the suburbs where its support is greatest. To achieve that shift, the Administration has not only proclaimed an end to the crisis of the cities but has also stopped talking about cities altogether in favor of communities.

title: Stage: A Rare Streetcar
description: The difficulty when confronting a modern classic is that it is not exactly modern and not precisely classic. Tennessee Williams's A Streetcar Named Desire, which opened at the Vivian Beaumont Theater at Lincoln Center last night, is one of the most celebrated plays of the century. Twentyfive years ago it set the international seal upon Williams's career, and it still remains his most often produced play.

title: Watergate Impact Found Slowing Work in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 The trauma of the Watergate case appeared today to have slowed some operations of the Federal Government.

title: Baseball Transactions NATIONAL LEAGUE
description: ATLANTAPlaced on 21clay disabled list Norm Miller, outfielder, with back injury. Recalled Jack Pierce, first baseman, from 1 Richmond of the International League.

title: Caramanlis Solution
description: The bell may not yet be tolling for Greece's military rulers but they now unquestionably face the broadest, most united and most determined opposition they have encountered in the six years since their seizure of power. What makes the current threat far more formidable than any previous antijunta effort is its positive element: the coalescing of a wide spectrum of Greek leaders behind the Caramanlis Solution, intended to offer the country safe passage back to constitutional democracy.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Now the Lakers Root for Knicks
description: LOS ANGELES, April 26  Until proved otherwise, the Los Angeles Lakers remain champions of the National Basketball Association and they await with interest to learn whether the New York Knicks or the Boston Celtics will make the final challenge.

title: Matthew McCloskey, 80, Dies; Builder Was Envoy to Ireland
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26Matthew Henry McCloskey Jr., builder, Democratic party fundraiser and former Ambassador to Ireland, died today at the age of 80.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, April 26 (UPI)The International Coffee Coimcil failed to reach agreement today after two days of intensive debate on the speed of dismantling the operative controls of the 10yearold international agreement, delegates said.

title: U.P.I. Editor First Woman To Head Press Club Here
description: Patricia E. Davis of United Press International was elected president of the New York Press Club last night.

title: People in Sports: Giant Falls 90 Feet in Boat
description: I'm hurtin' all over, said John Mendenhall yesterday as the New York Giants' outstanding rookie defensive tackle of 1972 was recuperating in St. Joseph's Hospital in Houston following a boating accident Wednesday night. The seven other persons in the boat were also injured when Mendenhall drove it over a 90foot high spillway on Lake Houston. Charles Jones, Mendenhall's brotherinlaw, was the most critically injured. He suffered a fractured skull. Mendenhall was badly bruised in the fall and suffered injury to his ribs as the boat was demolished. Police said the boat was traveling at high speed and that fishermen below the dam pulled the injured pershore.

title: New Format at Jacob's Pillow Includes Fonteyn Performance
description: An international array of dance stars, from Dame Margot Fonteyn to Twyla Tharp, and an equally international teaching staff, from Maria Tallchief to Kirsten Ralov and Fred Bjornsson of the Royal Danish Ballet, will be part of a reorganized format at the Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival this summer.

title: FRANCE ASKS PROOF OF ISRAELI CHARGES
description: PARIS, April 26 (Reuters)France said today that Egypt and Libya had denied that Frenchbuilt Mirage jets sold to Libya were being transferred to Egypt, as charged by Israel.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Confidence Is Voiced at Annual Meetings
description: Large corporations holding annual meetings yesterday emphasized improvements in sales and earnings and plans to expand facilities. With few exceptions, management's reported improved figures for 1972 and the first quarter of 1973 and expressed confidence that business for the balance of the year would continue to rise.

title: EVIDENCE SNARLS ELLEN TRIAL
description: LOS ANGELES, April 26His face flushed with anger, the judge in the Pentagon papers trial sent the jury home today because the Government had again withheld evidence from the court and the defendants.

title: Brezhnev, at Party Conference, Delivers Talk on Foreign Policy
description: MOSCOW, April 26Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, made major foreign policy address today to a semiannual meeting of the party's Central Committee.

title: ACCORD REPORTED ON OTB WAGERING
description: ALBANY, April 26A general conceptual agreement, was reported today on an offtrack betting compromise that, according to legislative sources, would permit New York City to continue to run its OTB system with no immediate crimping of its daily double and other basic betting activities.

title: Communists Move Closer, But Phnom Penh Is Calm
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 26With Communist troops occupying a village within sight of Phnom Penh's royal palace and with the suburb of Pochentong mourning the score of civilians killed in this morning's Communist rocket attack, the Cambodian capital was uncomfortably aware today of the proximity of war.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: April 27, 1973

title: My Gallant Captures Blue Grass
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., April 26  My Gallant rallied to success in the $58,100 Blue Grass Stakes at Keeneland today, scoring by a head over Our Native. A field of nine participated in the 1mile event for 3yearolds, a race that has come to be accepted as a gauge for the Kentucky Derby.

title: Increases Posted In Revenue and Net By N.Y. Telephone
description: The New York Telephone Company reported yesterday gains in firstquarter operating revenues and net income. The quarterly report placed operating revenues at $680million compared with $622.8million a year earlier.

title: Would Reveal Whether Congressman Refused to Answer Queries
description: A Federal judge told a tense and crowded courtroom yesterday that he planned to disclose much of the grandjury testimony of Representative Mario Biaggi on Monday.

title: Milner of Mets Is Sidelined
description: HOUSTON, April 26Tom Seaver put his finger on one of the main fears of the Mets.

title: Delta to Buy 14 Aircraft
description: Directors of Delta Air Lines authorized yesterday the exercise of outstanding options for the purchase of 14 Boeing 727200 aircraft for delivery next year and in 1975.

title: GIANTS, ON 4 IN 3D, CONQUER CUBS, 73
description: CHICAGO, April 26 (UPI)The San Francisco Giants bunched six singles and a sacrifice fly for a fourrun third inning today and posted a 73 triumph over the Chicago Cubs. It was the Giants' fourth straight victory and ninth in the last 10 games.

title: ARMS SESSION ENDS ON A CRITICAL NOTE
description: GENEVA, April 26 The 25nation disarmament conference ended a nineweek session here today amid complaints about lack of progress toward a comprehensive ban on the testing of nuclear weapons and the outlawing of chemical arms.

title: SOCIAL CARE CUTS PARTLY SOFTENED
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The Nixon Administration softened today its final rules on eligibility and payments for social services such as day care that are designed to get or keep people off welfare.

title: HEUBLEIN AGREES TO ACQUIRE DAVIS
description: Heublein, Inc., a major producer of vodka and mixed cocktails, announced yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire Davis Foods Service, Inc., of Atlanta for about 790,000 common shares of Heublein.

title: U.S. TRADE DEFICIT IS CUT MARKEDLY AS EXPORTS GROW
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The United States balance of exportimport trade showed its best performance in March and in the, first quarter since late 1971, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Commuters Delayed by Crash Into Bridge Abutment
description: PERTH AMBOY, April 2GAn earlymorning crash of a tug and barge into the abutment of the Raritan River drawbridge delayed some 11,000 New Yorkbound railroad commuters for up to 90 minutes this morning and again this evening. Special to The New York Times

title: U.S. TRADE DEFICIT IS CUT MARKEDLY AS EXPORTS GROW
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The United States balance of exportimport trade showed its best performance in March and in the first quarter since late 1971, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: 11 PLAYERS PERFORM TERRY RILEY'S IN C
description: Terry Riley's In C was composed in 1964 and remains a vastly influential piece of music for that part of the American avantgarde fascinated with hypnotic repetition. Not only was it first, but also it is still one of the best works of its kind, and it is one of the few such pieces that can he played by performers not under the direct supervision of the composer.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP DESPITE A RALLY
description: News that President Nixon will meet with his top economic advisers on Saturday spurred a rally on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market yesterday afternoon.

title: MEANY CHARGES LIES ON ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, April 26George Meany, the president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, accused the Nixon Administration today of using the big lie technique to hide its economic failures and declining popular support.

title: Books of The Times
description: LETTERS OF ROGER FRY. Edited with an Introduction by Denys Sutton. 2 volumes, 787 pages. Illustrated. Random House. $30.

title: COURT CASELOAD WEIGHED IN BILL
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 With the approval of Chief Justice Warren E. Burger, Congress is considering a plan to include in legislation estimates of how its passage would increase the workload of the Federal court system.

title: Panther Gets Life Term In Attack on 2 Policemen
description: Richard Moore, a Black! Panther, was sentenced in State Supreme Court yesterday to life imprisonment for attempting to kill two policemen here with a machine gun in May, 1971.

title: Goodyear, McDonnell Douglas and IngersollRand Raise Earnings in the Quarter
GRAY SAYS HE DESTROYED FILES FROM HUNT GIVEN HIM WHEN HE MET EHRLICHMAN, DEAN
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 L. Patrick Gray 3d, acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, has told friends that he destroyed documents taken from a central figure in the Watergate case after it was suggested at a White House meeting that the papers should never see the light of day.

title: U.S. Intensifies Scrutiny Of Illinois Insurance Unit
description: The United States Justice Department has intensified an 11month investigation into charges of massive bribery in the Illinois Departement of Insurance in the wake of the Equity Funding scandal, according to Samuel K. Skinner, an Assistant United States Attorney and chief of the special investigations division in Chicago.

title: For Girl Scouts, A New President Takes Command
description: The 60,000 girls in green and brown, who perhaps still help old ladies across New York streets, have a new den mother this week.

title: Rockefeller Backs Marchi In Light of Developments
description: ALBANY, April 26Governor Rockefeller gave Senator John J. Marchi, Republican of Staten Island, a tepid endorsement today as the party's candidate for Mayor of New York City.

title: Ampex to Build Data Unit
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., April 26 (UPI)The Ampex Corporation announced today it had been chosen to build a huge system for storing computerized information for the United States Government. The company did not disclose what agency or department of the Federal Government was ordering the system or how much it would cost. The system will have the capacity to store the equivalent of 120,000 computer tape files.

title: Dubuffet Show Is Big and Rewarding
description: The best thing that can be said about a big exhibition is that it makes you wish it could have been even bigger. With 300 paintings, sculptures and graphics, not counting 47 large mobile figures that will be animated in the auditorium in performances of something called Coucou Bazaar, the Jean Dubuffet retrospective opening today at the Guggenheim Museum is the largest oneman show in its history. The entire main building is turned over to it, top to bottom. But this visitor, for one, could have taken as much again.

title: In Japan's Universities, Stress Is on Career Training
description: TOKYO, April 26April is a time of beginning in Japan. The cherry blossoms herald the coming of spring, the Government and businesses get their new budgets for the fiscal year, schools start their first semesters, and university graduates embark on their adult lives.

title: Chrysler Corp. Raises Its Quarterly Dividend
description: Directors of the Chrysler Corporation yesterday raised the quarterly dividend to 35 cents a share, payable June 11 to holders of record May 10.

title: The Decay Of Decency
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The capital is still buzzing with rumors about who is to blame for the Watergate fiasco, and who will take over after the inevitable housecleaning; but the main question still is not who was to blame but what was to blame.

title: Symington Tells Rogers U.S. Restricts Press in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) Senator Stuart Symington, Democrat of Missouri, protested to Secretary of State William, P. Rogers today against what he called a restrictive attitude on the part of the United States Embassy in Cambodia toward American reporters.

title: 75 INJURED IN RIOTS IN CHILE'S CAPITAL
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 26 (AP)Opponents and supporters of Chile's Marxistled Government battled each other and the police today in Santiago's streets.

title: U.S. GIVES PLEDGE TO SIOUX LEADERS
description: PINE RIDGE, S. a, April 26 In an effort to soothe the ruffled feelings of Oglala Sioux Indian leaders, the Justice Department agreed tonight to give the tribe a larger voice in handling the Wounded Knee insurrection.

title: I.B.M. Introduces Memory In a Typewriter at $11,800
description: The International Business Machines Corporation yesterday introduced a typewriter with an electronic memory that allows corrections and deletions in copy before it is finally recorded.

title: Panther Draws Life In Attack on Police
description: Richard Moore, a Black Panther, was sentenced in State Supreme Court yesterday to life imprisonment for attempting to kill two policemen here with machine gun in May, 1971.

title: Boston PublicTV Station Asks Policy on Role of Government
description: In expressing its concern about what it sees as signs that the Executive branch of the Federal Government might be trying to take over control of public television for its own ends, TV station WGBH in Boston yesterday called on the board of the Corporation of Public Broadcasting to declare publicly its rules for dealing with the White House.

title: President of the Silurians Dudley Martin Is Elected
description: Dudley B. Martin of the New York Times was elected president of the Society of the Silurians, an organization of veteran newsmen and newswomen at a meeting at the Players Club last night.

title: Simple Watergate Caper Sends Ripples Over U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 26Two days after the breakin at the Democratic headquarters in the Watergate complex, Ronald L. Ziegler, President Nixon's press secretary, called it a thirdrate burglary attempt.

title: At Lease 25 Die in Ecuador In an Avalanche of Mud
description: QUITO, Ecuador, April 26 (Reuters)  An avalanche of mud swept down a mountainside in southwestern Quito overnight leaving at least 25 dead and forcing 2,000 people to leave their homes.

title: Publishers Support Broad Shield Law
description: The American Newspaper Publishers Association called yesterday for Federal legislation to protect reporters from having to disclose their news sources.

title: FRANK MUM, 64, RING REFEREE, DIES
description: Frank Fullam, a former boxing referee and judge for many major fights, died Wednesday evening at his home, 4907 39th Avenue, Sunnyside, Queens. He was 64 years old.

title: REFORM ORDERED IN FIRE INSURANCE
description: TRENTON, April 26  The State Insurance Commissioner, Richard C. McDonough, ordered the fire insurance industry today to revise its procedures so that it could provide better and cheaper service.

title: Reporter Jailed Three Months For Bribing Newark Policeman
description: NEWARK, April 26 (UPI)Ron Porambo, an author and a reporter for WNETTV, was sentenced to three months in jail yesterday for bribing a policeman to get pictures of persons killed in the 1967 riots in Newark.

title: Losing at Bridge
description: The New York State Legislature, the legislative boards of Nassau and Westchester Counties, the Connecticut General Assembly, the Governor of Connecticut, the Department of the Interior and the Congress of the United Statesall are against the proposed RyeOyster Bay bridge across Long Island Sound. Governor Nelson Rockefeller is for it. So plans for the project proceed.

title: Legislation to Help Halt Erosion of Members and Control Urged
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, made an urgent appeal today for legislation requiring identical reserve requirements for both member and nonmember banks against demand deposits.

title: SIX IN YOUTH GANGS ARE HELD I NSLAYING
description: Six members of two youths gangs, the Savage Skulls of the South Bronx and the Satan Souls of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, were arrested on firstdegree murder charges last night in the slaying of an 18yearold youth last week.

title: MEANY CHARGES LIES ON ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, April 26George Meany, the president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, accused the Nixon Administration today of using the big lie technique to hide its economic failures and declining popular support.

title: A Biaggi Storefront Ransacked Downtown
description: Campaign workers for Representative Mario Biaggi reported to the police that their storefront center at 241 Canal Street, two blocks south of Police Headquarters, was broken into yesterday evening and ransacked.

title: 3 WOMEN GYMNASTS STAR AT A.A.U. MEET
description: BUFFALO, April 26 (AP)Three female members of the 1972 United States Olympic gymnastic team and three Japanese men dominated the opening day's competition of the senior national men's and women's Amateur Athletic Union gymnastics championships at Canisius College today.

title: Watergate Impact Found Slowing Work in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The trauma of the Watergate case appeared today to have slowed some operations of the Federal Government.

title: Mississippi Floods More Land; At a Record Height in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, April 26 (AP)The Mississippi River and its tributaries spread over more land today, and along its 1,500. mile length men and equipment fought the battle of the levees.

title: Strike at Skylab Station
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 26 (AP)About 125 workers who help operate a Skylab tracking station called a strike tonight against the Bendix Field Engineering Division and set up picket lines at Kennedy Space Center gates. The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said the strike should have no immediate effect on preparations for the launching of Skylab on May 14 and the Skylab 1 astronauts the next day.

title: Dual Prime Clarifications
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 The Administration's Committee on Interest and Dividends issued clarifications today of its new dual prime rate policy, in the form of 11 questions and answers. The clarification includes methods by which banks can calculate their costs for purposes of justifying increases in interest rates.

title: King of LSD and 7 Are Indicted by U.S. In DrugRing Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 26 (UPI)  Eight men, including the onetime king of LSD, have been indicted on Federal charges connected with an alleged widespread ring manufacturing and selling hallucinogenic drugs.

title: Peace Near in Women's Tennis
description: A peace agreement in women's tennis is expected to be announced here today that would allow Chris Evert to meet Mrs. Billie Jean King and Mrs. Margaret Court in major tournaments, perhaps this year.

title: Mrs. Booth and Beth Barry Reach Amateur Golf Final
description: PINEHURST, N. C., April 26 (AP)  Mrs. Jane Booth, last year's winner, and Beth Barry, last year's runnerup, won semifinalround matches today in the North and South amateur golf tournament and became the first finalists in 32 years to repeat.

title: RainDrenched and Chilled, 125 Get Union Work Permits
description: On the dot of 10 yesterday morning, the first of a chilled and sodden group of 300 men stepped out of the rain and into the offices of Local 46 of the Wood, Wire and Metal Lathers Union, at Third Avenue and 76th Street.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: TANNER DEFEATS ROSEWALL, 61, 62
description: DENVER, April 26 (AP) Roscoe Tanner, a hardhitting 21yearold from Lookout Mountain, Tenn., defeated favored Ken Rosewall in straight sets, 61, 62, tonight in the quarterfinals of the United Bank tournament, the last stop on the World Championship of Tennis Group B tour.

title: West Indies and Australia Draw Final Cricket Match
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, April 26 (Reuters)The West Indies and Australia played to a draw today in the fifth and final match of a cricket series the Australians already had won.

title: Lament for the Onion
description: WASHINGTONJust when one was getting used to life's minor irritations the bomb, strife in the Middle East, the price of beef, Watergate and Jane Fondasomething really serious had to happen. The Great Onion Crisis. Too much rain, too soon, wiped out a large chunk of America's current onion crop.

title: Times Wins Guild Page One Award for Crusading
description: The New York Times won this year's Page One Award for the best example of crusading newspaper, it was announced yesterday by the Newspaper Guild of New York. It was the fourth time since 1969 that The Times has won the award in this category.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MADE IN BRITTEN The English Chamber Orchestra was founded in 1948, an ensemble designed, it was said, for the use of Benjamin Britten, the composer. It is known for its Britten repertory. The group has no one conductor; either Mr. Britten or Raymond Leppard or Daniel Barenboim is usually at the helm. The 30 members of the London orchestra, are staples of the Aldeburgh Festival and put in a good deal of traveling time all over.

title: Pihl, Brigham Young, Wins Decathlon at Drake Relays
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, April 26 (AP)Raimo Pihl of Brigham Young set a personal record in the closing event, the 1,500meter run, and held off Carl Wood of the Florida Track Club to capture the decathlon today at the 64th Drake Relays. Pihl, a junior from Tullige, Sweden, led Wood by 70 points going into the final event. He was timed in 4 minutes 36.3 seconds and finished with 7,523 points to 7,518 for Wood.

title: In Italy, No Mail Can Mean No Money
description: ROME, April 26Businessmen are paying private couriers $5 to take a letter from Milan to Naples, and thousands of old people throughout Italy are asking their grocers for credit because they can't collect their pensions.

title: Coffee Quits Raceand Supports Byrne; Will Lead Judge's Drive for Governor
description: TRENTON, April 26 Brendan T. Byrne's 11thhour bid for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination picked up important support today as Richard J. Coffee, one of four major announced candidates, withdrew and agreed to serve as Mr. Byrne's campaign chairman.

title: Inquiry Continues in Killing Of Woman on the West Side
description: A team of 20 detectives continued their investigation of the murder Tuesday of Angela Catalano, the 30yearold welfare client who was stabbed with scissors in her room at the Riverside Studios Hotel, 342 West 71st Street.

title: 2 TRIALS SLATED FOR REALIZATION
description: WESTBURY, L. I., April 26  An overflow subscription of 16 owners paid the $1,500 starting fee today to enter horses in the rich Realization Pace on Saturday, May 5, at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Litter and Graffiti Spoiling the State's Natural Caves
description: BETHLEHEM, N. Y.It was black and damp and cool 60 feet down in the wild South Bethlehem cave. Flowstone stalactites draped the ceiling; stalagmite mounds protruded from the uneven floor. Silent brown. bats clung, like patches, to the walls. Crickets and spiders edged between crevices, skirting the water that drained languidly from hundreds of, calcite soda straws.

title: Graham Supports Nixon
description: RALEIGH, N. C., April 26 (UPI)Evangelist Billy Graharr said today he doubted that President Nixon knew anythini about the Watergate bugging affair.

title: EMERY L. FRAZIER
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 26Emery L. Frazier, who retired as Secretary of the United States Senate in 1966 after 33 years as a Senate officer, died here Tuesday. His age was 76.

title: Loughery Grabs a Plum: FiveYear Net Contract
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 26 Roy Boe, unburdened by the conservative behavior inherent in sports ownership, said today he had given Kevin Loughery a fiveyear contract to coach the New York Nets. That works out to one year for each victory Loughery has amassed in his brief coaching career.

title: Governor of Pennsylvania Proposes a Sweeping HealthCare Plan
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., April 26  Gov. Milton J. Shapp today unveiled the nation's most comprehensive statewide plan to regulate and administer health care in an effort to contain skyrocketing medical costs.

title: She Has Quintuplets On Her 28th Birthday
description: PORTLAND, Ore., April 26 A Brush Prairie, Wash., woman gave birth to quintuplets here today, her 28th birthday.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Friday, April 27, 1973

title: Sullivan in Paris to See Hanoi Aide
description: PARIS, April 26 (Reuters) A high State Department official, William H. Sullivan, arrived in Paris today to prepare the ground with the North Vietnamese for talks next month between the architects of the Vietnam peace agreement, Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho.

title: Light in South Asia
description: That elusive light at the end of so many dark tunnels flashed hopefully last week in South Asia when India and Bangladesh finally offered to release, conditionally, about 90,000 Pakistani prisoners of war.

title: Bond Prices Rise on Plans to Pay Off U.S. Issues
description: Bond prices registered selective advances again yesterday, spurred in part by the Treasury's announcement late Wednesday of plans to pay off securities coming due in midMay.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Agreeing with a doctor who says that learning to handle alcohol is vital to a man's education, the State Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control upheld the right of Seton Hall University to have a pub on campus.

title: Environment Bills Defeated in Jersey
description: TRENTON, April 26Democratic defections and halfhearted Republican support in the State Senate combined this evening to defeat a series of bills aimed at protecting New Jersey's coastline and the ecology of its offshore waters.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: EVANS REGISTERS DECATHLON UPSET
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26The National Collegiate decathlon champion, Ron Evans, from the University of Connecticut, upset the Olympian, Jeff Bennett, in the Penn Relays decathlon today. Evans to taled 7,821 points, a personal record and a Penn Relays mark.

title: Mets Win From Astros, 21
description: HOUSTON, April 26George Theodore, a gangly 6foot4inch, 190pound rookie outfielder, helped the Mets score an earned run and an unearned run off Houston's lefthander, Jerry Reuss, in the sixth inning tonight and take the rubber game of their threegame series, 21.

title: Gen. Giovanni de Lorenzo. Dies; Italian Counterintelligence Chief
description: ROME, April 26Gen. Giovanni de Lorenzo, Italy's embattled former counterintelligence chief, died of cancer in hospital here today. He was 65 years old.

title: Handicapped Infants Learn They're Not AloneSo Do the Parents
description: In one room: a group of toddlersboys, girls, black, white, Puerto Rican happily scrambling for toys, dunking in a plastic swimming pool, singing songs.

title: Soviet, Gingerly, Publicizing Meat Boycott Protests in the U.S.
description: MOSCOW, April 26Russians are reading their first reports on the American meat boycott, which has provided the controlled Soviet press with a new opportunity to depict economic problems in the United States.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on April 26 were:

title: A Special Aid Fund For Asia Proposed; U.S. Is Cool to Plan
description: MANILA, April 26Top officials of the Asian Development Bank recommended today that a special development fund be set up to which rich countries could regularly contribute. But the United States, instead of endorsing the proposal, sought a review of the bank's procedures.

title: One Store's Easter Chicks found to Have Salmonella
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI) Baby chicks sold in one store as Easter gifts have been found to be contaminated with dangerous bacteria, but there have been no reports yet of similar cases across the country, Federal officials said today.

title: Rockefeller Backs Marchi In Light of Developments
description: ALBANY, April 26Governor Rockefeller gave Senator John J. Marchi, Republican of Staten Island, a tepid endorsement today as the party's candidate for Mayor of New York City.

title: MUSEUM FEARFUL FOR ISRAELI SHOW
description: Fearful of sabotage, Douglas Dillon, president of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, has expressed reservations about the Metropolitan's plans to be host to a major Israelia archeological exhibition in connection with the city's commemoration of the 25th anniversary of Israel's independence.

title: POLITICIANS HAIL RULING ON BIAGGI
description: Top Democratic, Republican and Liberal politicians applauded a Federal Court decision yesterday to release substantial parts of the transcript of Representative Mario Biaggi's testimony before a grand jury.

title: SWEDEN CONDEMNS U.S. ON CAMBODIA
description: STOCKHOLM, April 26The Swedish Government, long a critic of American involvement in Indochina, condemned the United States today for its bombing of Cambodia, charging that the raids indiscriminately hit the civilian population.

title: Cairo's Daily Emergency War Measures Seek to Rally Egyptians
description: CAIRO, April 26President Anwar elSadat is pushing ahead with a campaign of psychological mobilization in the name of national unity and total confrontation with Isreal.

title: Milner of Mets Is Sidelined
description: Houston, April 26Tom Seaver put his finger on one of the main fears of the Mets.

title: Mrs. Love Is Wed To F. M. Graff Jr.
description: Mrs. Ret Synek Love was married here yesterday afternoon to F. Malcolm Graff Jr., a vice president of the Bankers Trust Company. The Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read performed the Presbyterian ceremony at the home of the bride.

title: EVIDENCE SNARLS ELLSBERG TRIAL
description: LOS ANGELES, April 26His face flushed with anger, the judge in the Pentagon papers trial sent the jury home today because the Government had again withheld evidence from the court and the defendants.

title: Whalers and Jets Reach W.H.A. Final
description: BOSTON, April 26 (UPI) Tom Earl snapped a 11 tie late in the second period tonight and Brad Selwood added a thirdperiod goal as the New England Whalers advanced to the final round of the World Hockey Association Playoffs. The Whalers defeated the Cleveland Crusaders, 31, and won the semifinal series, 4 games to 1.

title: Rockefeller Calls His DrugPusher Bill Most Important Issue for Legislature
description: ALBANY, April 26  Amid signs of continuing resistance to his proposals for stiffer penalties for drug pushers, Governor Rockefeller today described the legislation he had presented as the most important issue facing the Legislature.

title: Woodrow Gatehouse, President Of National Horse Show, Dead
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., April 26 Woodrow G. Gatehouse, president of the National Horse Show Association of America, Ltd., died last night in Community Hospital after a long illness. He was 46 years old and lived at High Farms Road, in Glen Head.

title: Bush Reportedly Sees Threat to Republicans
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP)The Republican party chairman, George Bush, reportedly had warned the White House that the handling of the Watergate case threatens to compromise the party organization.

title: CAMPORA MEETING PERON IN MADRID
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 26Dr. Hctor J. Cmpora, Presi dentelect of Argentina, flew to Madrid tonight to consult with former President Juan D. Pern amid growing signs of dissension within the Peronist coalition and a mounting guerrith campaign against the incumbent military Government.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: METUCHEN, April 26Reggie Blackshear of Metuchen High School takes another stride toward the 1976 Summer Olympic Games tomorrow when he competes againstbest high hurdlers in the East at the Penn Relays in Philadelphia.

title: Adm. Frank Jack Fletcher, 87, Commander at Midway, Is Dead
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) Adm. Frank Jack Fletcher, U.S.N. retired, a taskforce commander in the World War II battles of the Coral Sea and Midway, died yesterday at the Naval Hospital in Bethesda, Md. He was 87 years old.

title: GRAY SAYS HE DESTROYED FILES FROM HUNT GIVEN HIM AS HE MET EHRLICHMAN AND DEAN
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 L. Patrick Gray 3d, acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, has told friends that he destroyed documents taken from a central figure in the Watergate case after it was suggested at a White House meeting that the papers should never see the light of day.

title: Big Board Firm Censured In Disciplinary Proceeding
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that Bateman Eichler, Hill Richards, Inc., a member firm based in Los Angeles, has been censured in a disciplinary proceeding.

title: NIXON CAMPAIGN AIDE DISMISSED ON SPYING
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 Nixon campaign worker who fired and paid a college stuent $150 to spy on radical roups has been dismissed by he Department of the Interior.

title: Vietnam Now: Pact but No Peace
description: PARIS, April 25Three months after the Vietnam ceasefire, the fundamental issues of the Indochina conflict remain as sharp as ever and the firing has not ceased.

title: Reserve Membership Is Set
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yesterday that its directors have approved the membership in the Federal Reserve System of the Depository Trust Company. Depository Trust is a limited purpose trust company formed by representatives of the financial community, including the New York Stock Exchange to serve as a nationwide securities depository and provide clearing facilities using bookentry procedures for the financial community.

title: Advertising: Interpublic Net Up
description: The second annual meeting of the Interpublic Group of Companies, the world's largest adagency system, began with an excellent firstquarter statement, got into equal opportunity for women, took time out to see its collection of commercials and ended with a standing ovation for Robert E. Healy, the outgoing chairman.

title: Mudders Have Their Day at Aqueduct
description: ... Appear (1) won and Mortally (3), on rail, placed. They wore the caulks.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: Restaurants are rated, for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor four triangles to none).

title: Antiques: In Connecticut
description: WESTPORT, Conn.The move this year from a waterfront site to this community's rolling hills has netted the SouthportWestport Antiques Show more than birdsong from barn swallows in the rafters. Indeed, the indoor riding facilities of the Fairfield County Hunt Club chosen for the threeday show (which ends tonight, Saturday) are so large compared with the quarters on the Saugatuck River occupied for the last eight years, that the event has doubled in size from 38 to 75 dealers.

title: Dance: Sanasardo Group
description: The Paul Sanasardo Dance Company, which is givirig a brief season through Sunday night at the Exchange Theater, presented four works by Mr. Sanasardo, including two premieres, on Thursday night.

title: ALEXANDER UPSETS RICHEY BY 64, 63
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, April 27 (AP)John Alexander of Australia upset fourthseeded Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., 64, 63, today in a quarterfinal match of the $50,000 Swedish professional tennis championships.

title: Comsat Fills Key Post
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP)  The Communications Satellite Corporation said today its assistant general counsel, William D. English, had been elected vice president and general counsel of its subsidiary, the Comsat General Corporation. Comsat established Comsat General to provide services for all of its domestic satelite programs.

title: Return of Clams and Even Oysters Is Also Envisioned
description: EDGEWATER, N. J., April 27  There are two unofficial indicators here this week that the Hudson River really is getting cleaner.

title: CUTTER LABS HALTS DIVIDEND PAYMENTS
description: Cutter Laboratories, Inc. will suspend payment of dividends after the current quarterly of 11 cents a share, which was payable yesterday to holders of April 13, David L. Cutter, president, told shareholders in a letter mailed yesterday.

title: Ash and Muskie Clash on Budget Bill
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The Nixon Administration insisted today that Congress had no right to obtain budget requests from Government agencies until after the President submitted his annual budget message.

title: BRITISH FOOTBALL
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: SUIT CHARGES BIAS BY ATLANTA POLICE
description: ATLANTA, April 27 (UPI)A group of black policemen has filed a $20million damage suit in United States District Court here against Police Chief John Inman, Mayor Sam Massell and other city officials, accusing them of racial discrimination.

title: Business Briefs
description: HARTFORD, April 27The Connecticut General Assembly has approved a measure that would allow savings banks and building and loan associations to offer personal checking accounts.

title: ALEXANDER STOPS RICHEYY7 BY 64, 63
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, Aprl 27 (AP)John Alexander of Australia upset fourthseeded Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., 64, 63, today in a quarterfinal match of the $50,000 Swedish professional tennis championships.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Con Ed Granted Gas Rate Rise

title: News Summary and Index SATURDAY, APRIL 28, 1973
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: PAKISTAN ARRESTS 18 FOES OF BHUTTO
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, April 27 (AP)The Government arrested 18 more leaders of the National Awami party in Baluchistan Province today, official sources reported.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: GIAUOI AGAIN CITES NIXON FUND UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, April 27President Nixon's principal 1972 reelection committee was formally cited today for a fourth time for violations of the new campaign finance reform act that Mr. Nixon, in signing last year, had predicted would restore public confidence in the electoral process.

title: Getting Us All Together
description: I intend to write something of a plea for patriotism. That intention is so uncongenial to almost everybody who is likely to read the essay that I want to spell it out with some care. In doing this, I wish not to disarm the critics, but to help them find the right target.

title: The Canceled Visit and the Shaky Alliance With Tokyo
description: TOKYO, April 27The Japanese Government's decision this week to cancel Emperor Horohito's projected visit to the United States provides insights into the weakness of Premier Kakuei Tanaka's Government the lack of Japanese sophistication in international affairs and the decay of the American Japanese alliance. Con tributing to the decision was the fact that Japan has gradually attached less and less importance to her alliance with the United States despite the assertion by Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, in a speech Monday that Japan must be a principal partner in our common enterprise with Western Europe.

title: Guard Dies on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, April 27 (Reuters)The security guard who brought to an end the bloody shooting rampage of a young black gas station attendant here on Easter Sunday died today of bullet wounds received in the final shootout between the gunman and the police. The guard, Versell Bennett, 58 years old, drove his car in front of a stolen car in which William Bonner, 25, was trying to escape with a woman hostage and her two children after allegedly killing six persons and wounding 10 others.

title: McCrane Pleads the Fifth Amendment on Campaign FundRaising
description: NEWARK, April 27Former State Treasurer Joseph M. McCrane Jr. refused today to answer queations for a Federal grand jury investigating possible fraud in connection with fundraising activities in Governor Cahill's 1969 campaign.

title: Reprieve for Ft. Dix Saves 17Mile Railroad
description: FORT DIX, April. 27The Pentagon's decision to keep open the Army training center here for an indefinite extended time has saved from extinction one of the nation's few debtfree railroad lines.

title: WOMEN'S TENNIS NEARING A TRUCE
description: Officials of the United States Lawn Tennis Association and the Virginia Slims, women's professional circuit reached a peace agreemen yesterday that now must be approved by the playere.

title: Grand Jury Nears End of Investigation on Tangled Vesco Case
description: A Federal grand jury, which started out about two months ago trying to unravel a tangled securities case and then broadened its investigation to question two former Cabinet members who ran President Nixon's reelection campaign, appears to be nearing completion of its inquiry.

title: NURSE MURDERED AND HOUSE LOOTED
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., April 27 A 25yearold married nurse was shot to death as she lay on her bed alone in her home here while watching television last night or early this morning. Middlesex County Prosecutor's officers sai dthe house, in a quiet residential section, had been broken into and burglarized.

title: BRITISH WELCOME U.S. CHARTER PLAN
description: LONDON, April 27The British Government tonight described Henry A. Kissinger's proposals for a new Atlantic charter as realistic and timely but made it clear that Europe did not intend to link monetary, trade and defense issues in single negotiations.

title: GOVERNOR'S BILL ON DRUG TRAFFIC VOTED BY SENATE
description: ALBANY, April 27  After nearly five hours of debate, the Senate tonight passed by a vote of 41 to 14 Governor Rockefeller's modified legislation for dealing with traffickers in dangerous drugs.

title: GOVERNOR VETOES ADIRONDACK BILI
description: ALBANY, April 27  Gov ernor Rockefeller vetoed a bil today that would have delayed for one year consideration of a landuse plan for the 3.1 million acres of privately held land in the Adirondack Park.

title: A CHILEAN IS KILLED IN WORKERS' MARCH
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 27 (Reuters)One worker was killed and several others wounded here tonight when shots were fired outside the headquarters of the Opposition Christian Democratic party trade union sources said.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: About 360 soccer teams will play from Old Tappan to Cape May tomorrow in competitions that involve titles, promotions and demotions to lower divisions of their respective leagues.

title: Publisher of New Yorker Resigns in Split on Goals
description: David D. Michaels, who became publisher of The New Yorker magazine in 1969 when its advertising revenues were in a serious decline and saw it turn around, resigned yesterday. The official management reason was differences of views of the company's goals.

title: ARTHUR H. JAMES OF PENNSYLVANIA
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., April 27Arthur Horace James, who rose from a job as a mine worker to become Pennsylvania's 34th Governor, died today at his home in Plymouth, near here. He was 89 years old.

title: 4 States, Including New York, Submit Antipollution Plans
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI)New York and three other states have submitted proposals to impose traffic restrictions, inspection programs and improved exhaust devices for older cars, the Environmental Protection Agency announced today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Soviet Hoists Portraits, One Already Obsolete
description: MOSCOW, April 27It was up again, down again for members of the Soviet Union's ruling Politburo as communications apparently became snarled between the Kremlin and at least one work crew putting up the portraits of the nation's leaders on Moscow building fronts.

title: NEW MOVE URGED AGAINST RHODESIA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 27  A committee of the Security Council recommended today that all governments seize cargoes arriving from Rhodesia in violation of the Council's embargo of 1968 against trading with that whitegoverned country.

title: Clash Averted as Last 125 Get Union Permits
description: Andree Gilbert, a stocky black applicant for a lather's work permit, stood near the front of one of two minoritygroup lines on East 76th Street yesterday, his yellow foulweather gear dripping with the windwhipped rain.

title: Prints by 14 American Women
description: Cultural and social issues  women's liberation, museum policies, art smuggling  seem to agitate the art scene nowadays in the way that formal considerationsthe claims of pop art, op art, minimal artdominated the art of the nineteensixties. The most recent of the women's cause shows, 14 American Women Printmakers of the 30's and 40's, organized at Mount Holyoke College, where it was shown last month, and now on view at the Weyhe Gallery, 794 Lexington Avenue, is not likely to raise any controversy. It is largely an exercise in nostalgia, even while it demonstrates that the women artists of the period Peggy Bacon, Doris Lee, Isabel Bishop, Mabel Dwight and Helen Farr Sloan among themhad much the same abilities as their more famous male counterparts. Like Grant Wood, Thomas Hart Benton or Rockwell Kent, the women artists of the period cast a satirical eye, on social conditions or extolled the beauties of the American scene.

title: Indictments in Sale of Tiana Beach Are Dismissed
description: A Suffolk County Court judge in Riverhead dismissed all indictments yesterday against three present and former county officials and realestate brokers charged with land, manipulations in connection with the county's purchase of land at Tiana Beach in Hampton Bays.

title: DEMOCRATS MEET ON DELEGATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The Democratic party's Commission on Delegate Selection and Party Structure began its first meeting tonight, with the aim, according to its chairman, of having a 1976 national convention at which every Democrat watching on TV will feel like he or she, sees somebody like himself . . .

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Baseball Transactions AMERICAN LEAGUE
description: BOSTONRecalled Graig Skok, lefthanded pitcher, from Pawtucket of the International League to replace Roger Muret, pitcher, who was placed on 21day disabled list.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: Kentucky vs, Indiana

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Minnesota Twins, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 2 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 11, 2 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 2 P.M.)

title: Wage Moderation
description: Despite the runaway climb of food prices and other living costs, major wage settlements are still being negotiated without strikes at levels close to the antiinflation guidepost established by the nowdismantled Pay Board. The latest example of this moderation is the threeyear agreement between Goodyear and the United Rubber Workers, a union with a long tradition of militancy.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Saturday, April 28, 1973

title: 3 of Quintuplets Doing Well While 2 Require Oxygen
description: PORTLAND, Ore., April 27 (UPI)  Three of the Anderson quintuplets born here yesterday were reported doing well today.

title: Prices Climb in Canada
description: OTTAWA, April 27 (Reuters)  The Canadian general wholesale price index (based on 1935 to 1939 figures) rose 2 per cent in March to 350 from the revised February index of 342.2.

title: Court Orders a Special Council Election
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court yesterday ordered a special election for members of the City Council in November, 1975, and directed the Council to redraw its district lines in sufficient time for that election.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Soviet Union yesterday carried out its first major shakeup of the ruling Politburo since the ouster of Nikita S. Khrushchev in 1964 with a series of moves that confirmed theurrent policy of conciliation with the West accompanied by strong defense and firm security measures at horns. [Page Columns 23.]
